name: Quizz Pays basque
description:
Quizz Pays basque is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the department of the Landes.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Basque".

The themes are:

Culture and traditions
History
Gastronomy
Places / Heritage
Ocean and coast
sports

name: Unplanned Adventures
description:
Unplanned Adventures encapsulates the most action packed and fun parts of a roleplaying game with no prior planning, no apps, and no one stuck being the GM. The goal of the game is simple, to earn XP by entertaining your fellow players. What and Where cards quickly establish a game setting and throw you right into the action. Word cards help you develop your character and build the shared story world. You can do and create the impossible, but test the boundaries of probability too much and you will pay a terrible price as your own words are turned against you!

Wait, that sounds scary? You don’t think you have ideas for stories? Don’t worry, it turns out we all have enough shared reference points from books, movies, and myths to help create complex and vibrant worlds. We think you’ll be astonished to find the stories that are hiding within you and your friends’ minds. Have an Unplanned Adventure, you won’t regret it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Sicher zur Schule mit Quacks
description:
An exciting traffic game for 2-6 people from 6 years.
Everyone goes to school, but nobody goes alone!
Everyone has 2 figures that they have to bring quickly and safely to the school yard. Traffic questions need to be answered and roads need to be crossed safely. If you have collected enough points, Quacks will help you a lot further to your goal! A traffic game with colorfully illustrated instructions, exciting until the last minute. Not just for school beginners!

—user summary

name: PolitSABOTAGE
description:
PolitSABOTAGE is a role-playing business game, where players can practice communication, public speaking and bluff recognizing skills.
The Goal of the Game: Players are Members of the Parliament (MP).
Every player secretly receives a card with a role, resulting in 2 commands: Coalition and Opposition. Players have to communicate with each other, compete for the Chairman position and debate to ensure that their team wins.

The MPs without powers play until the end of the game.


Requires: 6-16 players (best 10) and a Game Master (GM).


The GM, players, teams, roles and goal of the Game.


The Game requires the GM, who does not have a playing role. They monitor the playing time, announce the beginning and the end of game actions, treat all players impartially and monitor compliance with the rules (see the sections «Forbidden in the Game» and «Sanctions»), settle conflicts between players and impose sanctions (if necessary). In case of a dispute on the correctness / fairness of the GM's actions, they must be supported by 3 players (at least).

The players (6-16 people) get the Role Cards. Then they are divided into two teams in a random manner:
- Coalition team (the players with the Coalition Supporter and Intelligence Agent Role Cards);
- Opposition team (the players with the Oppositionist and Head of the Opposition Role Cards).


The Goal of the Game is to ensure victory for your team.



The Game Ends with the victory of one of the teams:


- the Coalition team wins if all members of the Opposition team are deprived of their powers
- the Opposition team wins if the number of the Opposition players is equal to the number of the Coalition players
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fighting, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action Queue, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: MakerSpace
description:
In this 18 card Worker Placement game you play as teams of Makers sharing the same small workspace. You will need to share the limited machines while managing your Time and Materials to add completed projects to your Portfolio. Then Submit it to win awards, Prizes and prestige along the way!

You begin the game by making the board out of three Workspace cards and six prize cards,all cards are double sided with unique actions and abilities so each game is different!

Players take turns placing their workers into an action space and choosing to take one of the available actions such as; Gaining resources,upgrading resources or attempting to stake a claim on a prize.
Because your Workers are cards, this allows a twist on traditional worker placement. During the game your workers can be flipped; One side blocking your opponents from taking the same action as you, the other allowing your opponent to also take the same action at the cost of returning your worker to you,giving you an extra turn.

The first player to submit enough points to one of the available prize cards will get to claim it, gaining victory points and a powerful unique ability they may use for the rest of the game. Abilities such as; gaining an additional worker, being able to take multiple actions with one worker or even choosing where their opponent must place their worker.

The first player to claim three prizes wins. Or if the 4th/5th prize(depending on player count) is taken and a single player has yet to claim three prizes, then the player with the most victory points will win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Nord-Pas-de-Calais
description:
(Re)Discover the region Nord Pas-de-Calais in 1800 questions.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: L' Apéro Jeu Oléron
description:
Test your knowledge on the Ile d'Oléron for a drink with family or friends!

Share a funny and friendly moment while having fun.

With nearly 300 riddles and questions, you will learn a number of unexpected and quirky secrets on this multi-faceted island.

Play in team. One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Oh Gnome!: Lawn Warfare
description:
You and your neighbors are in competition to see who can have the most decked out and ridiculous lawn. Taking "Keeping up with the Joneses" to a level gnome one has ever seen before.

In this Cul-de-sac, anything goes! Steal your neighbor's gnomes if you must because the cops are gnomewhere to be found.
Set traps to protect your precious gnomes, and hoard away because the HOA isn't writing fines for cluttered lawns. Or at least try... let's face it, thieves will be thieves.
Let the War for Lawn Supremacy begin!

In Oh Gnome!, players will be playing three different card types: Gnomes, Traps, Abilities. Gnome and Trap cards each with their own values helping the player to achieve enough points to be crowned the victor. Each Gnome has a unique power that activates when they enter a lawn. These powers can be used strategically to create chain combos to devastate your opponents' lawns. Be careful though because if you don't protect your Gnomes, they can be stolen right back without regard. Players can arm traps which generally do something bad when they are tripped but some are simply caches to boost your lawn value and achieve a sly victory. To cap off the card types, there are ability cards which are one time use cards that have great effects. The deck runs out fast and there's no reshuffling so paying attention to how many are left can be used to achieve a spectacular game ending combo.

This is a quick play game where games generally last around 10 to 20 minutes and occasionally get up to 30 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Catch the Leader, Chaining, Hidden Victory Points, Take That, Trick-taking

name: The Catholic Card Game: Casting Stones Expansion
description:
The Casting Stones Expansion is a bag of 5 smooth(ish) stones that you get to throw at the sinners you are at table with!

Play the Catholic Card Game with the Casting Stones Expansion with one of the four new rule variations included in the bag and when the time is right, cast your stone!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Religious

name: ドッグフェローズ (Dog Fellows)
description:
Let's line up the dogs as there are times when it's good to line up!

In the card game ドッグフェローズ (Dog Fellows), players want to arrange dogs to create a large pack.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Armoured Corps
description:
Armoured Corps wargame rules allow players to command a combined-arms battlegroup fighting battles during the third world war.

Scope
These rules are designed to be quick to play with large forces from a single company to multiple battalions while still giving realistic results.

The rules are also designed to simulate the role of a formation commander so much of the minutiae of modern armoured combat is incorporated into generalised statistics or dice roles. For example, the formation commander will not be deciding on which type of ammunition (HEAT, APDS etc) each tank will be firing when engaging an enemy unit, this would be left up to the tank’s own crew. So many parts of the rules that may seem simple or “glossed-over” are simply below the player’s (acting as overall commander) level of command.

Sequence of Play
Various sequences and methods of unit activation were considered however it was decided to go back to the classic “I go, you go” sequence (albeit with interruptions form an opponent’s units on overwatch).

Morale
Morale has been heavily simplified to a single dice roll at the end of each turn for any units that have come under fire and been suppressed. This determines if they fall back, continue fighting or give up, surrendering or leaving the battle area.

Ground Scale
The approximate ground scale of 1” =100 metres was chosen as it would allow for realistic weapon ranges to be depicted on a reasonable sized table without being able to fire across the whole area, allowing more emphasis on manoeuvre and positioning of units.

—description from the publisher

name: Metamachy
description:
Metamachy is a chess-like game for two players played on a 12x12 game board. The game contains sixty pieces of twelve different types, thirty for each player: King, Queen, Eagle, Lion, Prince, Bishop, Knight, Camel, Rook, Cannon, Elephant and twelve Pawns.

The game presents players with twelve different starting set-ups, with Black choosing the set-up, then White making the first move.

name: GeoXpert
description:
GeoXpert is an original combined alignment and guessing game with collector cards to better know the countries of the World. The principle is simple. From a card which shows a flag, you first guess which country it is. Then you place the card in a line, ranking by area horizontally or by population vertically. If you loose, you get more cards to get rid off. The winner is the first to exhaust his/her stock.
With GeoXpert, learn all countries' flag, name, capital, and other facts and quiz your family and friends.
GeoXpert may be played with 2, 3, 4 or more players. It may be played alone too.
There is a card of each country. The verso has only the flag and the continent, the recto gives country's name (in English, French and the official languages of the country), capital, currency, area, population, flag and coat of arms.

—description from the designer

name: L' Apéro Jeu Rétais
description:
Share the time of an aperitif with family or friends, a funny and friendly moment while broadening your knowledge of the Ile de Ré.

In 250 questions, learn about the island and its secrets with this fun game, imbued with love for this charming island.

Play in teams.
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: L' Apéro Jeu Angevin
description:
In L'Apéro Jeu Angevin game discover Anjou while having fun!
In 170 questions, you will learn a number of secrets about the culture, sport, history, tourism, traditions and celebrities of Anjou.

Play in team.
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Share a funny and friendly moment by cultivating yourself.

With nearly 300 questions, you will take a tour of France of the coasts, beaches and islands.
The French coast will no longer hold any secrets for you!

Play in team. One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Play in team.
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

description:
Enjoy an aperitif with family or friends thanks to your knowledge of Lot-et-Garonne.

In 170 questions, take a tour of the department.

Play in team.
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: L' Apéro Jeu Poitevin
description:
L' Apéro Jeu Poitevin
For an aperitif with family or friends, share a funny and friendly moment while having fun with the expressions in patois (loval slang)!

8 types of games for adults and children.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: L' Apéro Jeu Vendéen
description:
L'Apéro Jeu vendéen
For an aperitif with family or friends, share a funny and friendly moment while having fun with the expressions in patois (local slang)!

8 types of games for adults and children.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: L' Apéro Jeu Berrichon
description:
L'apéro jeu Berrichon
Both a quiz game and a guide, this object is a must have for discovering Berry while having fun.

In 210 questions, you will learn all the secrets of Berry's heritage, history, traditions, daily life and personalities.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Dictator-y Little Bitch
description:
2-6 players, 30-60 minutes, fully co-op, and inspired by video game boss battles and co-op games like Pandemic. The longer you play, the harder the game becomes, until there's nothing left for you to do except watch as the world burns.

Each player has an open hand of cards which are played to categories around the central Octagon in the hopes of reducing the villain's HP to zero before HE reduces the World's HP to zero. But cards only score when played atop other cards, and every time a turn is taken, the villain (the game itself) has a chance to remove players' cards from the Octagon before points can be scored against him. Not only that, but interspersed throughout the villain's deck are cards that render categories unusable for the rest of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading

name: Oléron, Aix, Madame Cube
description:
270 Questions and answers on the islands of Oléron, Aix and Madame.
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Throw the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number, your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the color and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or a blue and 3 points for a purple or a red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back),
6 card colors representing the degree of difficulty,
1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3

name: Ré Cube
description:
Discover the island of Ré in a fun way, while learning about history, geography, various facts ...
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Roll the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number.
Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3.
Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 points for a purple or red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1, 2 and 3.

name: La Rochelle Cube
description:
La Rochelle Cube 288 questions and answers about La Rochelle'

Discover La Rochelle in a playful and entertaining way, learn about history, geography, various facts ...

Can be played alone, with others, as a team or with friends.

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 color and a number. Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 for a purple or red.

Content': 96 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors, and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3.

name: Paris Cube
description:
Paris Cube 288 questions and answers to discover PARIS.

Can be played alone or with others but the most fun is in a team!

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 number and 1 color. Your opponent chooses a card of the color drawn and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3 corresponding to the number of the other die.
Scoring: 1 point for the 1st question, 2 for the 2nd and 3 points for the 3rd.

Content:
96 card classified by colored themes: characters, monuments, squares and streets, arts, entertainment, the Seine, metro, neighborhoods, markets, cemeteries ...
A 6 colors die and a die numbered 1,2,3.

name: Bier poker game
description:
The most insane, immersive and drunken version of the world famous game that has captivated millions of people around the world.

Laughing DIY assignments, a delicious pot of beer, combined with the world-famous game of poker guarantee an incredibly pleasant evening.

Play a blood-curdling, strategic and downright drunken game for the big bucks or just for the sake of honor. Bluffing, gambling and hoping that luck is on your side… just prove that you are the king of beer poker!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Hvad er jeg?
description: Play Hvad er jeg?, a.k.a. What am I?, with up to four friends by placing cards on your forehead, then taking turns asking questions to discover what object you are.

name: Hvad er jeg?: Jobs
description: Play Hvad er jeg? Jobs, a.k.a. What am I? Jobs, with up to four friends by placing cards on your forehead, then taking turns asking questions to discover what profession you represent.

name: Wie is Wie
description:
Are you good at guessing famous people? Then this game is for you. Here it's all about the question: Which famous person is on the map

Play the game in teams and try to guess which celebrity is involved in three different rounds, always using the same cards.

In round 1 you do this by explaining the celebrity in words, in round 2 you have to find out from a word and in round 3 the same people are portrayed. Whoever guesses the most celebrities in three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Het beste brein
description:
Do you have the best brain in the Netherlands?

Congratulations… you are on your way to becoming "The Best Brain"! You grab that title in an exciting battle full of visual games and assignments based on the immensely popular TV quiz. And all this without even one knowledge question, because this fun board game is all about farmer smartness: a combination of common sense and good intuition. You absolutely do not need to have studied or to have a lot of knowledge ...


Everyone can participate and win!
With 8 rounds full of visual games and assignments like on TV now at home!


—description of the publisher (translated)

name: Party & Texaco
description: The players are divided into teams. Party & Taxaco has assignments in the following categories: 1 lip reading, 2 facial expressions, gestures and sounds, 3 answer a question correctly, 4 sketches and drawings, 5 forbidden words. Try to complete all mission hats and you are the winner. Complete with manual. Suitable for 3-20 players, ages 8 and up

name: Mañópolis
description:
In Manópolis you can build some of the most important monuments in the Zaragoza, such as the Basilica del Pilar, the Torre del Agua or the Palacio de la Aljafería, and conquer some of the ages of History that the city has lived by answering trivia questions about them.

It all depends on where the dice falls.

Immerse yourself in the history of Zaragoza and travel the board of Manópolis to live an exciting adventure.
Through the different spaces you can...
- Buy properties. Use those Cachirulos (the official currency of the game).
- Build properties.
Your investment can pay off when other players visit your properties.
- Conquer the different eras (Ancient/Middles Ages/ Modern) to become an expert of the city.
You must correctly answer at least 3 questions for each Age.

There are 2 ways to win the game.
One is to be the best property owner, the other, the best historian.

name: 無限回段 (Mugen Kaidan)
description:
In 無限回段 (Mugenkai Dan), players are climbing an "infinite" staircase; to create the staircase, the game has 2 boards showing six stairs each. One of the available actions in the game moves one of the boards to the other end, such that the stairs will go on.

To setup, each player takes a die of their color and a matching set of action tiles.

In each round, the players will perform two actions each. First, they take turns choosing action tiles from their hand and placing them face down in a queue. After the first tile is placed, future tiles are placed to the left or right, but once the 6 tiles have been placed, they will execute from left to right. The actions do such things as move your dice up the stairs; move an entire stair board; score points; and swap dice.

The first player to score 5 points will win.

name: Strapo: Straßenpolizeispiel
description:
There are three patrol cars (one player or team) who try to catch three traffic offenders (one player or team): a motorist, a pedestrian and a cyclist. The traffic offenders try to reach an individual destination. Movement is determined by a die. The players start on their starting places. If a player gets on a Z-Space he has to start anew. If a traffic offender gets on a M-space he gets a traffic rule card and has to pay a fine; cops have to go to space D (police station) before resuming the pursuit. If a traffic offender gets on the same space as another traffic offender he causes an accident and has to go to the police station before resuming his trip. Whenever a patrol car causes an accident with another patrol car it ist removed from the game. If a traffic offender and a patrol car get on the same space, the traffic offender is imprisoned for the rest of the game.

All fines go to the cops, but if a traffic offender reaches his destination, the cops have to pay him double the fines he has payed.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: History Heroes: Women
description:
History Heroes: WOMEN in history quiz games contains individual, beautifully illustrated cards of forty of the greatest women throughout history to the present day from Cleopatra to Angela Merkel.

Each card is illustrated to represent the individual Woman in history and shows her dates, her flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about her, including a joker fact about each character to surprise and/or entertain. The History Heroes: WOMEN in history quiz game represents a fantastic, diverse range of amazing women.

Many characters will be familiar to all – from Cleopatra to our present-day Elizabeth II; from Catherine the Great to Margaret Thatcher. There are female monarchs, political leaders, scientists, artists, writers and performers. There are explorers and campaigners too, many who have risked their lives for their causes. All are inspirational and all have contributed significantly to the shape of our world today.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Artists
description:
History Heroes ARTISTS is a fun game about forty of the most famous artists in art history.
The game contains fantastically illustrated cards, packed with facts about 40 of the greatest artists from 15th century Botticelli and Artemesia Gentileschi to today’s Yayoi Kusama and David Hockney. Read and enjoy all the facts and try to win the cards by guessing who the famous artist is from the facts read out on the cards. Do you know which artist is a great fan of Walt Disney and who changed their name at least 30 times during their lifetime? Do you know how Impressionism got its name? If you know the answers, you can win the cards. If not, discover these and learn SO many more facts about art by playing History Heroes: ARTISTS

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them! Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts about each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Children
description:
History Heroes: CHILDREN in history quiz card game Children includes individual cards of History Heroes’ forty children throughout history, who have helped change the world and the lives of those around them. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific Child Hero and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

History Heroes’ Children range from leaders, such as the ‘boy king’, Tutankhamun, Joan of Arc and the Dalai Lama to campaigners, such as Malala Yousafzai, the nineteenth century Match girls and America’s civil rights campaigner, Claudette Colvin, who, aged 15, led her own protest on a bus against segregation in Alabama nine months before Rosa Park’s famous stand for equal rights. Child prodigy performers and artists such as Mozart and Picasso rub shoulders with Shirley Temple and Stevie Wonder. Children, who led extraordinary lives, such as Laura Ingalls Wilder, Helen Keller, Victor of Aveyron & Mary Anning mingle with Child heroes, who simply ‘made’ history: Lady Jane Grey, the Princes in the Tower, Victor of Aveyron, Louise Brown…the game contains an extraordinary, inspirational range of boys and girls in history.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Explorers
description:
History Heroes’ Explorers are history quiz cards containing individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Explorers. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual Explorer Hero and shows the explorer’s dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each Explorer to surprise and/or entertain.

History Heroes’ Explorers stretch back in time to Pytheas in the first century BCE and cover land, marine, submarine and lunar exploration from then until the present day. Neil Armstrong ‘rubs shoulders’ with Roald Amundsen and Ibn Battuta; Ranulph Fiennes with Leif Erikson and Yuri Gagarin; Amelia Earhart with Sir Francis Drake and Sylvia Earle; James Cameron with Pedro Cabral and Christopher Columbus to name a few.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Inventors
description:
History Heroes INVENTORS fun history games include individual cards of 40 inventors, who have changed our world with inventions we see and use every day.
Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific Inventor and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

Did you know that Alexander Graham Bell, inventor of the telephone, received his well-known middle name as an 11th birthday gift from his father?

And, whilst most might know that Florence Nightingale was the founder of modern nursing, how many realise that she is also credited as the inventor of the mathematical pie chart? Test yourself with these facts and many more in the game.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Kings & Queens
description:
History Heroes: KINGS & QUEENS quiz card game contains individual, beautifully illustrated cards of Forty key British kings and queens from Alfred the Great to Elizabeth II.

Each card is illustrated to represent the individual monarch in history and shows their dates, her ‘house’ and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each character to surprise and/or entertain. Discover which monarch’s huge stomach exploded during his (oops, a bit of a clue there!) funeral, creating a terrible stench, and who was described by one Victorian historian as ‘the most perfect character in history’.

Bonus!
KINGS & QUEENS game also contains a card with the famous rhyme to help all players remember the order of all the kings and queens from 1066 to the present day.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: London
description:
History Heroes’ LONDON quiz card game contains fantastically illustrated, fact-packed, individual cards of forty of the greatest characters in the Capital’s impressive history.

The game contains the people, who helped make and shape London both physically and culturally. Characters, who built and, in some cases, destroyed London, such as Boudica, the Romans, Christopher Wren and Richard Rogers, rub shoulders with those who have given London its fantastic, rich cultural history too, such as Shakespeare, Laurence Olivier, David Bowie, Mo Farah and Vivienne Westwood.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Super Computer: Security Expansion
description:
This is the exciting first expansion to the fast-paced and addictive Super Computer card game. Hackers have handed you tools to sabotage your competition. As you're busy building your computer, drop a worm or a virus on to an opponent's build to slow them down. Desperate for a CPU, grab a buggy one and throw it into your rig. It works . . . most of the time. All the while you need to protect yourself by adding a shield and a UPS.

This expansion adds a whole new twist to the game, turning would be friends into rivals.

—description from the designer

name: History Heroes: Scientists
description:
History Heroes SCIENTISTS is a fun science game and a great way to discover the greatest scientists throughout history and the science they introduced to the world.

Our pack of Scientists contains individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Scientist heroes. Each science quiz card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual Scientist Hero and shows the scientist’s dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each scientist to surprise and/or entertain.

Our Scientist Heroes start with first century BCE scientists, who introduced scientific concepts that we still rely on today: Archimedes and Aristotle. The game includes scientists from so many subsequent centuries to the present day: great names, and their achievements, such as Copernicus, Galileo, Sir Isaac Newton, Robert Boyle and Bunsen. On past the likes of Huxley, Jenner, Darwin and Curie and on to our twentieth and twenty first century heroes, such as Rontgen, Rutherford, Joliot-Curie, Hodgkin, Franklin and Hawking.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes science quiz cards. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Super Computer: Retro Expansion
description:
Retro is in at Scrappy Computers, or at least that's what the management thinks. Companies are paying big for Super Computers with Retro-Style configurations. This expansion includes new parts and new builds to challenge the best techs. There are also some surprises.

Step back in time and customize your very own Super Computer complete with Floppy Disk Drive, Dot Matrix printers and the good old CRT display.

This expansion allows you to satisfy existing builds with more classic parts, or build some totally retro-builds for major bonus points. Whatever your goal, this expansion gives you new opportunities to construct the most powerful super computer possible out of scrap parts.

—description from the designer

name: History Heroes: Space
description:
History Heroes’ SPACE is a fun quiz card game containing individual cards of forty of the most significant characters in Space’s history.

In this era of renewed fascination and ever-increasing hunger for space exploration, History Heroes’ SPACE quiz card game gives a fantastic overview of 40 characters and objects that have made space exploration possible.

It looks at the scientists who developed our understanding of our Universe from Aristotle to Einstein. It includes novelists, such as HG Wells and Jules Vernes, who both foretold so much of our world, and who inspired the Space engineers to dream. Characters, such as JFK, Walt Disney and Elon Musk have helped push the dream. And let’s not forget the objects and characters, such as Sputnik 1, Katherine Johnson, Neil Armstrong, Laika and Tim Peake, who have actually made Space exploration happen.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: Sport
description:
History Heroes’ Sports Heroes quiz card game, contains individual cards of History Heroes’ forty greatest Sports Heroes. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the individual sportsperson and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven gripping facts about them, including a joker fact about each Sports Hero to surprise and/or entertain

Sports Heroes start with the first century BCE Athenian, Pheidippides, said to be the first person to run the marathon. Then charge forwards with heroes like Captain Webb, WG Grace, de Coubertin, who helped devise the modern Olympics, Suzanne Lenglen, Jesse Owens, Sonia Henie, Don Bradman, Juan Fangio, Tanni Grey-Thompson and many more. Heroes in Sports come from a range of sports, such as athletics, boxing, football, golf, F1 racing, tennis, rugby, baseball, cricket, basketball, gymnastics, ice skating and squash.

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: History Heroes: World War I
description:
History Heroes: WORLD WAR 1 is just one of our educational card games.
This pack contains individual cards of history’s forty greatest World War I Heroes. Each card is fantastically illustrated to represent the specific World War One Hero and shows their dates, their flag of birthplace and seven memorable and often moving facts about them.

World War 1 Heroes start with the great unsung heroes: all the animals who served in World War 1 – they all share one card, otherwise there wouldn’t be room for anyone else in the game!
World War I History Heroes covers military figures like ‘Black Jack’ Pershing, Marshal Joffre and Field-Marshal Haig. King George and his cousins, Kaiser Wilhelm II and Tsar Nicholas II feature along with political leaders like Lloyd George and Woodrow Wilson.
Heroes who shaped and influenced World War 1 from Edith Cavell to Winston Churchill, from Flora Sandes to Siegfried Sasson and from Walter Tull to the Tunnelling Companies. You’ll find these and many more in World War 1 History Heroes

How to Play
There are many ways of playing History Heroes quiz card games. Each pack gives suggestions on how to play, or you can make up your own rules if everyone playing agrees to them!

Win the game by winning the character cards, and you win the cards by guessing/knowing the facts ab out each History Hero. You can use the images as clues and you can use the different levels of facts to make it as easy or as hard as you want to play the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, World War I

name: The Magicians: Battle the Beast
description:
The Magicians: Battle the Beast is a limited edition board game based on Season 2 of the TV show The Magicians. The board game was sent to reviewers as a press kit in 2016.

Travel from Brakebills to Fillory as you attempt to stop the Beast. You might get turned into a goose and fly to Brakebills South or get lost in the Neitherlands. Every time something goes wrong, you must drink...just like your favorite characters on The Magicians TV show!

The game comes with six shot glasses (each bearing the initial of a The Magicians character), a board, cards, dice, and tokens.
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Create your Dictator
description:
In chaotic times people call for a strong leader. But the question is: who will be this strong leader? In Create Your Dictator you aren’t one of the leaders, but you are the puppeteer behind the potential dictator, their "right hand man". You control them by using smart moves, intelligent timing and by using secret missions to sabotage others.

But even if the potential dictator of your choice becomes the dictator of the world, you are not alone. You will battle other puppeteers, who will try to overthrow you. Will you prevail to rule them all?

Play your cards right, overturn the race with hidden conspiracies and always make sure you control the winning candidate by saving all the cards you have on them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Deduction, Negotiation, Race, Take That

name: Bang! Bang!
description:
Bang! Bang! is a two player strategy skirmish game where you go head to head as commanders leading your squad of soldiers onto a battlefield in an attempt to eliminate each other. The only tools at your disposal are the Combat Card, your wits, and the roll of the dice.

The game is split into three phases. You begin in the Spawn Phase, placing your squad onto the map, choosing carefully where to set them along the orange spawn clicks. Clicks are the spots on the board used to determine movement. Once both players finish the Spawn Phase, you then enter the first Move Phase. Start by taking your units using a limited number of moves out of their spawn while attempting to establish line of sight so you can take shots at the enemy. Both players go through one Move phase without firing shots. After your second Move Phase is finished, you enter the Kill Phase and get to take any shots you have available by rolling the dice. Once your Kill phase is over, the turn goes to your opponent, and he gets to do the same by Moving then Killing.

Each class of soldier is unique and has an ideal range for engagement. The Sniper and Light Machine Gun are best from a distance, the Shotgun and Sub-Machine Gun are great up close, and the Assault Rifle has a sweet spot in the middle.

The Combat Card details every soldier's stats, and will show you what you need to roll to land a killshot. After you've taken your shots, any soldiers you hit get the chance to roll for cover, and if they make it, will stay alive and get to keep fighting!

Bang! Bang! uses a classic Deathmatch win condition, so the first person to fully eliminate the enemy squad wins. It comes with three maps of varying difficulty, giving players a fresh battle experience as they improve.

-description from designer
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Real-Time

name: Movie Plotz: Bonus Features
description:
An expansion game (bonus cards) that is played after you create the movie.

These cards are shuffled and one is taken randomly, or in competitive play - the first person voted thumbs down gets to take their pick.

After the film is complete, each player gets their chance to add their version of the bonus features. There will be lots of callbacks to the movie, and in some cases, a little revenge by the players that were down voted by their screenwriting peers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Movie Plotz: Behind the Scenes
description:
In a world... where players make their own movies, using just 12 cards and their wild imaginations. Starring [insert actor here] and written by [insert your name here], the games you play will leave you laughing, crying, and forever changed. It's time to make some movies!

A book featuring 20+ ways to play the game. Some great team building and competitive variants in there.

Alex has been hard at work making LOTS of variations on Movie Plotz. There's a 2 player "Gotcha Game" where players must force cards on their opponent, a team "Combo Pitch" where teams huddle up and hone their pitch before presenting it in a head-to-head battle of scripts, a "Classroom Edition" where a student starts the movie and passes it on, and many more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play

name: The Stalking Terror
description:
It was supposed to be a fun day at the haunted corn maze. However, little did you know the corn maze was actually haunted. Not only that, but a strange small town cult who worships the corn is trying to summon a demon scarecrow from the netherworld--and they have plans to sacrifice you. Now, separated from your friends, can you escape the maze?

The Stalking Terror is a single page Roll + Write RPG using the Delve12 system.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Triathlon: The Card Game
description:
Triathlon is a game for 3 to 9 players that has more gameplay options than your typical run-based card game. These options include the ability to play Injury Cards on your opponents to slow them down, playing Adrenaline Rush Cards to take a card even when it is not your turn, and, due to the fact that every player has their own discard pile, players are given more options for selecting a card at the beginning of their turn.

The three stages (runs) needed to win the game are:
• Stage One: A run of five cards that can be a mixture of colors and suits
• Stage Two: A run of five cards in a single suit or all the same color
• Stage Three: A run of five cards all being of the same suit and color

To help in accomplishing the stages, Triathlon has three suits; swimmers, cyclists, and runners, and three colors; red, blue, and golden. This gives Triathlon 9 unique sets of cards. Each set has eight cards, 7 numbered cards, and a Pro Card. Pro Cards are wild in number but cannot change their color or suit.

In addition to the cards mentioned above, the deck also contains three Super Pro Cards that are wild in number and color, but cannot change their suit.
-description from designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Take That

name: Medieval Mayhem
description:
In Medieval Mayhem, a co-op game for 2-4 players, play the role of 4 heroes: Rogre, Emera, Gallandor, and Kijam as they attempt to rescue all 24 villagers from the dragon Malevol. Actions include moving, rescuing, transferring, and dropping off villagers. Work together and utilize cards from the deck as well as hero effects!

Contents include 24 Meeples, 8 Player Tokens, 4 Hero Cards, 16 Location Cards, 16 Action Cards, and 1 Rulebook.

INTRODUCTION
Malevol, the fabled wicked dragon, has emerged and has his eyes set on villagers. Four brave heroes: Rogre, Emera, Kijam, and Gallandor, must rescue the villagers and drop them off in Farlorn Village. However, if Malevol emerges, and the heroes aren’t on Safe Haven spaces while rescuing villagers, the villagers will die! An orc, a mage, a knight, and an elf must team up to save the villagers from Malevol’s wrath!

OBJECTIVE
Your team must rescue 16 of the 24 villagers. Use action cards and hero effects to help make the objective easier!

GAMEPLAY
Select a player to go first, then play proceeds to the left. A player may perform (3) actions in any order of their choosing. Actions:

Move: Move your token one space vertically or horizontally (diagonal is not allowed). Your piece must move onto a Location Card your first turn and may never leave the game area again.

Transfer: When two players’ tokens occupy the same Location Card, a transfer may occur. You may give one Villager that has been rescued to the other player. Each transfer costs one Action.

Rescue: A player’s token must occupy the same space as the villager being rescued. When moving, be sure to move the villager next to your token.

Drop-Off: When you get to the Village, perform a Drop-Off action to ensure the villager is same from harm.

Each player has one turn each round. After the round ends, reveal a card from the Action Deck. If it is an Action Card, any player may add it to their hand and play it on any of their next turns at no extra action cost. Action cards are discarded after use. However, if it is Malevol, anyone who does not occupy a Safe Haven Location Card will lose 1 villager, then shuffle Malevol back into the Action Card deck. Lost villagers are removed from the game. Each player has an effect that may be used during the game; this does not cost an action to use and can be used any time when applicable. NOTE: Unless otherwise stated, only 1 villager can be rescued per Hero card before drop-off.

GAME END
The game ends when 16 villagers have been rescued and dropped off at the village; in this case, your team wins! The game will also end if 9 villagers die from Malevol; in this case, your team loses.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Resource to Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: El juego de Donostia
description:
El juego de Donostia is a fun family game that reproduces the day-to-day life of the city of San Sebastian. Players interact trying to acquire unique San Sebastian businesses.

The game of Donastia familiarizes players with the main streets, shops, historical sites and monuments of the city. An extremely fun game that helps enhance spatial ability and sense of orientation. It is a cross between Monopoly and the game of Goose.

It features the city's commerce with the 42 most unique businesses in Donostia, as well as the city's heritage. 15 of them are over 100 years old and are the lifeblood of the game.

The winner is the first player to acquire 7 businesses and exit the city.
mechanics: Events, Income, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Desperately Seeking Quigley
description:
This game is based on the classic "knights and knaves" puzzles in which all knights always tell the truth and all knaves lie, but here it's a bit more complicated: there are four types of people. Some always tell the truth, some always lie, some always do what they're told, and some always do the opposite of what they're told.

16 of each of four colors of pieces are placed on the 64 spaces of the board, which has the property that any two spaces have a unique shortest path between them. Each round someone decides which color of piece represents which type of person and also picks one of the liars to be Quigley. The other players have to find Quigley.

On a turn a player may move their piece up to three spaces and then asks the person there how to reach Quigley. A die is rolled to determine if they are told to lie or not, but how they actually answer of course also depends on what type of person they are. The controller for the round places an arrow pointing along the shortest path to Quigley - or not. The arrow is white if the die said to tell the truth and black otherwise.

Alternatively a player may ask a person if they are Quigley, in which case they always receive a truthful answer. The player finding Quigley scores 20 points. An incorrect accusation costs 5 points. The controller scores a point every time a player takes a turn.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Fürstentum Liechtenstein
description:
Test your knowledge of the Principality of Liechtenstein with this exclusive travel edition.

A game with 330 questions and answers some of which will amaze you.

How well do you know the Principality?
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bandit Chase Across London
description:
Bandit Chasse Across London is a car chase across London where a player becomes a bandit that is pursued by Police cars. The Bandit car starts at a designated starting point determined by the dice and his objective is to reach home to win by the throw and move of a dice.

All other players are Police cars trying to catch or overtake the Bandit car before it reaches home. They also move after rolling the dice. If any capture the Bandit car they win.

The playing board displays a map of London Streets where the pursuit takes place. Road Signs delay or divert traffic.

The game is similar to the later Geographia Game called 'Motor Chase Across London'.

name: Fever Chill: Bacteriophage
description:
4th player expansion cards for Fever Chill.

It's the Bacteriophage!

With 4 players, you will still target the player to your left or right as normal, but the 4th player is out of reach. Your neighbors must think carefully about their targets.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Print & Play

name: Trivial Pursuit: Real Madrid – Bite Size
description:
Trivial Pursuit: Real Madrid – Bite Size
Founded more than 100 years ago, it is the best team in Spain.
From its humble beginnings, through its recognition by King Alfonso XII and until today, you will vibrate with its rich and glorious history.

This version allows you to play quickly and its 600 questions will satisfy the most demanding fans.
Fascinating, puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory.
Set includes colored dice, cards and a convenient easy-to-carry box. No board required to play.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
publishers: Eleven Force, Hasbro, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Potion Commotion
description:
Potion Commotion is a party game designed for 3-8 players. In this game players take on the role of potion makers trying to strike it rich in the industry. There are four specialty potions for any player to complete on their turn out at a time. The competition is fierce, so be ruthless! The richest player at the end of the game is the winner.

Players beware! Becoming rich will not be easy, and it may come with another cost. While making potions, players may be sabotaged, or worse! If they get the ingredients wrong the contents of their cauldron must be disposed of, and the only safe way of doing this is drinking it. Players will then draw from the "Drink it!" deck to perform hilarious acts in order to progress.

Potion Commotion is a game of strategy, disaster, and hilarity. Steal from and sabotage your friends, earn money by completing potions, and become the greatest potion maker the kingdom has ever seen!

—description from the designer

name: One To Three
description:
A word game where you make three-letter words.

Add a single letter to a two-letter fragment (bigram) to make a word.

54 one-inch lasercut wooden tiles.
Connect and stack tiles.
Score words.
Uses the most common bigrams in the English language that are found as the last two letters of three-letter words.

—description from the designer

name: Cosmopolitan: The Game
description: Based on the sort of quizzes typically found in Cosmopolitan magazine. Multiple-choice questions (chosen by a spinner) are asked and all players choose their preferred answers on their erasable boards. At the end the players score their answers to produce personality types, and then boards are shuffled and players try to guess who got whioh personality.

name: Rumble Planet
description:
Rumble Planet is a wacky, chaotic take on the battle royal genre with no player elimination. Land on the planet, loot weapons and armor, and duke it out on the battlefield!

Each player takes control of a single contestant in this deadly popularity contest. During their turn, they can move around the hex grid of the battlefield, open “loot boxes” to receive new equipment and attack their opponents with the weapon and action cards they found. However, all items are hit with planned obsolescence, and will quickly be discarded over the turns.

Each action can earn them Prestige Points, and the first player to reach 20 points wins the game. Being KO’d doesn’t remove the player from the game but will give their assassin a big bonus in Prestige Points.

Rumble Planet is inspired by the French audio-series La Légende de Xantah and was developed by their authors, but doesn’t require any knowledge of this series to be enjoyed!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: Billionaires Money
description:
A simple and fun game you play with the objective to become the first one to accumulate one billions dollars and hence become a Billionaire. Collect money by landing on the right slots while avoiding pitfalls that will rob you of your money.

The pitfalls include locations such as “Donation,” “Robbery”, "You Didn't Build That", "Wealth Redistribution", and "Tax The Rich".

Billionaires Money is for 2-10 players ages 14 and up.

It comes with 6 denominations of money up to $1 billion.

The Monopoly-esque board game comes with features such as “Property,” cards that award players with items like a yacht, island, helicopter, luxury car, or fine art, and “Business,” cards that equip players with revenue-generating operations such as a global coffee chain, burger franchise, or beauty supplies store.

name: Bibellinjen
description:
Bibellinjen (Bible line) is a simple game which focuses on learning the order of the books of the Bible. It is fast paced, simple to learn and fun for all ages. The game comes with four different variants makes it a suitable match for different age groups and will work well with Sunday schools, youth groups and other Bible oriented contexts.

The first edition is published in Swedish in November 2020. If there is interest it may be translated in to other languages as well.

Bibellinjen is inspired by the game Time line by Frédéric Henry.

Gameplay (standard rules):
Players try to collect points by gaining cards. When it is your turn you deal five cards and place them face up in front of you. You should then try to rearrange the cards so they are placed in the same order that they appear in the Bible. Each card has the name of a Bible book on one side and on the other side there is a number that indicates what order that book has in the Bible. By flipping the cards you can see if the order you settled for is correct or not. If all cards are not in the right order you must remove cards from the sequence until a correct sequence remains. Once that is done you may keep any cards still in front of you. The other cards are discarded to a discard pile which is shuffled into the draw deck when it runs out. The game ends when there are not enough cards in the draw pile to finish the round. The player who collected the most cards is the winner.

—description from the designer

Bibellinjen är ett enkelt spel som går ut på att lära sig ordningen på Bibelns böcker. Det går snabbt att spela, är lätt att lära sig och är roligt för alla åldrar. Med fyra olika varianter för olika åldersgrupper passar det utmärkt till såväl ­konfirmandgrupper som söndagsskolor och andra bibelorienterade sammanhang.

—description from the designer (Swedish)

name: Dossier
description:
Dossier is a head to head spy game of stealth and deduction
Dossier (daa·see·ei) is a head to head game where you play as a spy trying to collect intel. The first player to collect 3 case of intel or successfully assassinate the enemy spy to win.

There are 16 spy cards laid out face up (in a 4x4 grid), there are 5 intel brief cases spread out between them. Each player is given a card (facedown) that matches one of the 16 cards in front of both players. These are their spies for this game. Each player takes turns moving through the crowd, collecting intel briefcases and trying to deduce who their counterpart's spy is. The first player to either collect 3 briefcases or successfully assassinate their opponent wins.

This is a mint tin game, with simple to teach rules, quick games, where the more you play, the deeper the strategy gets.

On your turn, you can complete 1 of 3 actions.

1. Switch ANY two adjacent spy cards on the grid. Your spy does not have to be either of the two spies that are switched.

2. Pick Up Intel: If your spy is next to an intel briefcase, you can pick it up & place it in front of you. Be aware that now the other player can deduce that you are 1 of the 4 spies next to the Intel Briefcase.

3. Assassinate: If you are confident that you know who the enemy player’s spy is, you can attempt to assassinate them. To do this, you simply announce that you want to attempt to assassinate a spy. Pull the card from the grid you want to assassinate. The enemy player then reveals their facedown Green Falcon Card. If it is a match you win! If it is not a match, your assassination failed and you lose the game. So be sure that you know who they are before assassinating them!

name: El Joc de Valencià
description:
El Joc de Valencià is a board game in which the city of Valencia, its most emblematic monuments and shops are the protagonists.

El Joc de Valencià is a game for the whole family with rules between Monopoly and The Game of the Goose .

With El Joc de Valencià you can buy monuments such as Micalet, Mercat Central or shops like Alvaro Moliner, Espai Ripalda, Trufas Martínez, Casa Montaña ... or become the master of the city by acquiring the Oceanogràfic or the Bioparc.

A nice way to get to know the city of Valencia.
mechanics: Events, Income, Roll / Spin and Move

name: カメレオンの定義 (Definition of a Chameleon)
description:
カメレオンの定義 (Kamereon no teigi) Definition of a Chameleon is a free PnP game from Japan.

It was a dark and stormy night. We had gathered at the pub in South End Station and held a welcome party for Harris, my best friend. Olivia, who up until now was only into drinking her scotch, called out, "Hey everyone, how about playing a card game?".

I wondered whether or not we'd be able to keep up with the ever changing rules of the game -- like a Chameleon.

At the beginning of the game, the way points are scored is undefined. But as the game goes on, you will gradually find out how to score points through the cards you play. Because of this, each game will play out differently.
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Party Game, Print & Play
publishers: Syoppai Games (しょっぱいゲームズ)

name: Wild Cats: Bonus Cats
description:
More cats = more fun! The Fat Cat is the boss who steals all of the credit. The Cool Cat is too cool to play along. And the Smarty Cat knows more than anyone else!

A set of 3 extra roles for Wild Cats, to diversify and play up to 6 players: Fat Cat, Cool Cat and Smarty Cat.


This expansion is included in the Deluxe editions of the base game.


RULES

Fat Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
Reveal yourself before the vote.
You don't vote, but you still point. You steal the win if you point to the winning player.

Cool Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
You can't ask questions.
You do not vote. You win if no other player wins.

Smarty Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie. At any time, reveal yourself, choose a player and look at their card.
You do not vote. You tie for a win if the player you chose loses.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Match Attax: UEFA Champions League – Season 2019/20
description:
This is a 2019/2020 UEFA Champions League Match Attax card game, sealed display box contains 50 packs of 6 cards, for a total of 300 cards !
Become part of the biggest football competition in the world with this sensational card game from Topps, official 2019-20 UEFA Champions League. This product is loaded with the best stars of the UEFA Champions League.
Try cards from global superstars and childhood heroes like Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, Christian Pulisic, Neymar, Harry Kane, Robert Lewandowski, and many others.
One of the most popular soccer items every year, it makes a great gift and addition to every card collection.

Gameplay
Build your team - 11 players (1 goalie, 3 attackers etc...)
In 11 rounds you then have to beat your opponent by comparing the attack vs defense value of the 2 players selected.

name: Soldatenspiel
description:
The blue army (50 infantry and 12 cavalry) are positioned on 62 spaces near the mill, while the red army occupies 62 spaces near the farm on the other side of the river.

Movement in any direction is 6 spaces for the infantry or 10 spaces for the cavalry per turn. The player has to decide if he moves his infantry or cavalry.

The players try to take enemy pieces by enclose them so that they can't move. Enclosed troops are removed from the game.

The first player to take 10 enemy pieces wins the game

The 1933 edition of the game includes two expansions for advanced players: "Zeppelin and airplanes" and "Trenches".

—user summary

name: The Suits: Ladies
description:
Medieval knights clashed to prove their bravery, courage and to impress rich and (sometimes) beautiful women. The Middle Ages are a relict of the past, but men are still men afterall and they still want to prove their superiority. So, what is the most reliable and effective way to distinguish a nobleman from a peasant? Oh yes! Duel! Instead of wearing full plate armor they wear equally charming elegant suits. Instead of fighting on the tournament arena, they meet in the underground of secret club called The Suits. Join this elite society and fight for your prestige and ...........*

*) Enter your deepest and darkest desire that you want to fight for (or die for, but it wasn't in the agreement)

And remember that the first and last rule of The Suits Club is - you do not talk about The Suits Club.

This season is different. Why? Because this time female characters are entering to the club.

Each player controls one of five available characters. Each character has his own unique deck of cards. By using your wits, tactics, strategies and of course, a little bit of luck you can show your enemies who is the real gentleman. The Suits is a fast-paced, two-person card game steaming with atmosphere and tactical depth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 昆虫ゲッチュ！ (Catch the Bug!)
description:
昆虫ゲッチュ！ (Catch the Bug!) is a game from Japan about kids out on a bug hunt.

Players place square cards on the table, building up a grid of bug cards and squads of kids hunting the bugs. When the tableau is complete, players score for the bugs they have secured.

Players try to get their kids to form intersects around some bugs. This means that only one squad can catch each bug.

The kids are ranked by their skills 1-3 with the older kids better more able, and the bugs are also valued 1-4 and -3. Kids can only catch insects if their individual or combined skills are equal or better than the wisdom of the elusive critters. Catching a risky insect like a hornet scores negative points. If multiple squads are competing, the squad with higher skills in total wins the insect.

As the grid develops, players can place good catches at their own kids, and bad catches onto their opponents. The game is quick and easy to play.

At the finish, the highest total score wins.
user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Grid Coverage, Take That, Tile Placement

name: ムーチョ de チョーショ (Mucho de Chosho)
description:
ムーチョ de チョーショ (Mucho de Chosho) is a party game from Japan.

One player ('parent') lays out four cards showing different themes or ideas about the person, and states how many of them are lies. The other players may ask questions, and after some deduction, they try to pick which card is a lie. If they get it correct, they score, but if they choose wrong, the parent scores a point.

The game is meant as a communication game, which is a very popular form of social game in Japan. The game works as an ice-breaker, and helps people talk about themselves.

The card text is all in Japanese.
user summary

name: Ma Bell
description: Dubbed as the "New Monopoly", Ma Bell is a Monopoly clone with few major differences. The game features cardboard counters depicting telephones as homage to the name (a nickname for Bell Telephone Co.) used as movers and property markers. The property spaces are named after spoofed titles of real stores and businesses of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

name: Stop Gap
description: A checkers-like game featured in the Quick Winner Family Fun Games line by Hasbro in the 1970s. The game features 48 checkers in orange and yellow. Players take turns filling in the board except for the center circle to set up. An extra checker is used to stack on one of your players to make an "officer". The ultimate goal of the game is to eliminate all of your opponents officers, or force them to be unable to take a move. Single checkers, or "guards" move one space and can either jump checkers to remove them, or move onto a friendly piece to form a new officer. Officers can move any number of spaces in a single direction, but can only remove other officers.

name: Top the Top
description: Players take turns trying to get 120 points to win the round or game. Featuring 3 different sized tops, 2 stands, a transfer arm, and 3 small crowns. On their turn, players spin the largest top on the scoring base and then must cap the top with a crown before spinning the next sized top on the spinning platform. Then, using the magnet in the transfer arm, players must get the top to spin on the crown of the previous top and repeat with the third top and final crown before the largest top stops spinning and dumps all of the pieces off. Each top and crown has a point value for the highest level the player achieves on their turn.

name: Dutch Days
description: A simple flip/roll and move game featuring a map of central/south Pennsylvania Dutch country. Produced in Glen Rock PA by Avalon Hill and sponsored by Heidi House. The game utilizes a deck of cards telling you how many spaces to move or roll after you read the fact or quote about the people and places of PA Dutch Country. Also included is a booklet of information and a recipe book that when referenced by a card allows special movement.

name: 密林サーチ (Jungle Search)
description:
密林サーチ (Jungle Search) is a party game from Japan, with players searching online densely forested retailers (Amaz*n) to find items, and then guessing the most expensive.

Players draw cards with various themes, and players use the internet to search for items fitting the starting letters. Players work out which one costs the most to score points.

The game does require internet connection (not provided), but you do get a whiteboard and marker with eraser, and 45 theme cards.
user summary

name: Cross Numbers Game
description: Volume IV in one of the Russell little books card game sets. The game features a deck of cards split into four colored triangles with different numbers on them. The goal is to score enough points to win the game, and play your cards to end the round. On their turn players match the colored sides of the cards so that the numbers add to a multiple of 5 to score points, while matching multiple sides can give a bonus as in other domino-style games like Contack.

name: Wild West Game
description: Volume V in one of the Russell little books card game sets. A simple matching game using cards featuring various motifs of the old American "wild" west. Players take turns drawing cards in the aim to match pairs of cards and law down for points or hold for a gin-style hand. Players have an odd number of cards in their hands so that when all but 1 card is used in a pair that player can use the single card to end the round by calling "cowboy round-up" where hands are scored.

name: Dragon Quest Trading Card Game
description: A 2 player battling card game in the same vein as Pokemon or Magic the Gathering. A collectible trading card game published in Japan featuring many different sets of booster packs, starter decks, and collector's series of cards. The cards themselves depict monsters, bosses, and characters from the Dragon Quest/Dragon Warrior series of games split into 5 different color groups. Players use a deck of monsters and heroes to control the playing field with the help of item, event, and specialty cards as well.

name: Rise N Fly
description:
A trivia game where players try to score 7 points or avoid having 7 negative points. Players open each round by betting how many of 7 questions they can answer. The highest bidder wins or loses points based on their score. Featuring 4 categories, zinger cards for added gameplay, and features predominantly questions on African-American culture and history.

Can be played in teams.

Marked Olds Ogden & Johnson, Wilmington DE

name: Snow White Game
description: A simple roll and move children's game based on the Disney adaptation of Snow White & the Seven Dwarves. Players spin the spinner and move their Prince Charming token trying to meet up with the sleeping Snow White. The spinner also feature a magic mirror space, where players must use a small reflective space on the board to read the instructions on the backwards mirror cards.

name: Dome Basketball Game
description: Now you can play the excitement of the domed sports arcade games at home. Much like the more famous and popular domed rod/stick hockey, some arcades had push button domed sports like soccer, football, and basketball. This smaller tabletop version features 8 keys per side to pass, dribble, and shoot the ball down the court. Similar in play style to older sports games such as Bas-Kat by Cadaco. Different sports versions exist by a number of small companies, but the most prevalent seems to be by Hong Kong Toys made from the late 70s to early 90s.

name: 2 in 1 Game Flipperz
description: Produced by Majik Toys and East Point Sports, Game Flipperz is a double sided game board featuring action based sports games. One side features Pitch & Play Baseball which utilizes ringed marbles as in Rebound as baseballs and a pinball style bat to swing downfield. Players have plastic gates to simulate fielders to prevent the batting player from hitting into the slight wells to score runs. The other side of the board features Fling Football, a traditional paper football style game where players can block out 5 or 10 yard sections of the field with their defense tokens to make it more difficult for the offensive player to make it downfield. It also features a plastic catapult and foam football for kick-offs and field goals.

name: Pods
description:
Pods is an electronic tabletop game produced by Sega. The game features a three-piece console with dual-level light-up sensors and a central sensor with speakers and additional lights.

Pods feature rules for seven different games at three different skill levels, most of which deal primarily with speed or memory. The three sensors detect when a player puts their hand over them and responds by lighting up either the bottom half at a six-inch range or the top half around twelve inches. Each of the games utilized the lights or speakers in the central piece to direct players when and where to activate the sensors.

name: Region
description:
The war of the kings is almost over, and few are left alive to win it for the them. The last hope for each side is on the way, but each of them has to hold their ground until their fierce commander arrives. Who can conquer this ever-shifting terrain and not fall victim to their own moves?

In Region, players maneuver their king on the grid to claim free spaces and take back the enemy-occupied spaces by surrounding them, while trying not to be encircled by the enemy. After placing their fifth conquest tile, players can enter their commander into the game. While more powerful, commanders are more restricted in their movement, yet they can turn the tide of the game.

The first player to place all of their tiles wins.

name: Elementra: Dragon Academy
description:
Welcome to the world of Elementra. In this fast-paced game, players take on the roles of Elementra students in their first year of training - learning how their powers work in combination with their dragon companions.

Use your abilities, strategy, and luck to create the most powerful duo of dragon and rider you can to defeat all other challengers.

name: Temples
description:
An unavoidable calamity has fallen upon earth, and there is no place to take shelter from the wrath of gods. It's been ages since the last temple was seen. You are summoned as the most adept sorcerers in the world to try building the last temple while competing for the favor of gods — but this is no easy task. You have to build it block by block, infusing each block with magic and hoping that it can withstand what is yet to come.

In Temples, the layout of the game consists of a variable arrangement of block cards in the form of a temple, with each block having a number. You try to play cards with a total equal to the number of each block to either:


Add blocks with larger numbers to your hand, or
Claim the building blocks of the temple and increase your score.


The game ends once every block of the temple has been claimed. Whoever has the most claimed blocks is the most renowned sorcerer and wins.

name: Trading Places
description:
Trading Places is a trivia game with a theme of traveling around the world attempting to complete business contracts. Money is awarded for this and the winner is the first player to accumulate a million pounds.

Movement is controlled by three dice which determine mode of travel (air, sea, etc.) and other details. While traveling players may answer "En Route" questions to continue. Entering cities requires answering more difficult "Visa Entry" questions and the "Contract Completion" questions are the most difficult.

Some travel spaces have limited capacity so players may have to answer "Challenge" questions to bump other players out.

The En Route and Challenge questions are general knowledge; the Visa Entry questions are more travel-oriented and the Contract Completion questions more business-oriented.

name: Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
description:
Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
A combination of card and dice game containing 244 questions and 976 answers, in 6 difficulty levels.

Rules:
The youngest player begins. if he rolls a 2, the player to his left read out question 2 and the four possible answers on the back. If his answer is correct, he receives 2 victory points.
If he threw a 3, he would be asked the question 3. For the correct answer he would receive 3 victory points. And so on.

Each player only answers one question.
Then it is the turn of the next player.
