The winner is the first player to reach 50 points (or whatever victory conditions players agree upon)

name: Cu-Bo
description:
The players have to move their 3 tokens from their 3 starting spaces to his destination space 7 in the center of the game board. Each player moves on his own track. Movement is determined by 3 dice. On certain results the players may move one ore more tokens and roll again. If a player rolls a result, that does mot allow him to move, the next player takes his turn. A space may be occupied by more than one token. On the roll of 1-1-1 or 1-2-4 (Jule) all 3 tokens are moved back to the starting spaces.

The first player to get all 3 tokens on space 7 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nantes: Un jeu de questions et d'humour sur Nantes et sa metropople
description:
Nantes: Un jeu de questions et d'humour sur Nantes et sa metropople is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Travel the board representing Nantes and its metropolis and answer questions and riddles.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with themes such as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked Nantes and its metropolis.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pen & Paper Baseball
description:
Pen & Paper Baseball is baseball you can play in the comfort of your own home. Get some pencils, some paper and a couple dice, gather around the table with a friend or two, and play ball! Ballpark hotdogs and draught beer not included.

P&PB has all the rules you need to play a whole season of baseball - pitching, hitting, fielding and running, with rules for simulating long seasons without playing over 100 games and rules for team development. Several sample teams are included, or roll up your own.

And since baseball fans have been denied Opening Day this year ... P&PB is free until the baseball season begins ... even if takes until 2021.

—description from the publisher

name: Battledigm Core Set
description: Two players compete as they battle champions to earn medals. Medals are used to buy more champions. Once all champions have been purchased, the players sum the value of their champions to determine the winner.

name: Contarlos
description:
Contarlos ("Count Them") is a print and play game based on a deck of UNO cards. The objective is to collect high valued cards by matching the color and using lower valued cards to add up to at least the high value card's number. After 4 rounds, count the total value of the large numbered cards. Whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Herobane
description:
Purchase rooms to improve your dungeon, collect more and more resources to hire exquisite minions, and challenge daring heroes to grow your infamy in this competitive PVE game.

Each turn, the roll of dice determines what resources you receive. Rooms will make your rolls more lucrative, allowing you to purchase better rooms, hire better minions, and use better skills.

Lure in heroes, rolling dice to pit your minions against them. Once you defeat enough, you can lean on your renown to challenge elite heroes for victory points.

-description from publisher

name: Onetop Baseball
description:
It is a baseball card game that anyone can easily enjoy.

- Various tactical cards reflecting baseball elements
- Easy game rules
Hits or home runs if the pitcher and batter numbers match
- Player stats
Game management using each player's stats

How to play
① They are divided into home team and away team.
② Select the first hit.
③ The attacking player mixes 16 batter cards and the defending player mixes 16 pitcher cards and arranges them as shown in the picture.
④ Each player draws 5 cards from the top of the deck and holds them invisible to the other side.

Game progress
① Each player turns one player card over and puts it in front.
② The player playing the batter card shouts “hit” or “home run”.
③ The player cards are turned over and compared.

When you shout “hit”
If there is a match between the batter card and the pitcher card being compared, it is a hit. (2 numbers match double, 3 numbers match triple) If there is no match, the batter is out.

When you shout “home run”
If the number in the circle of the batter card being compared and the number of the pitcher card match even one, it becomes a home run. If there are no matching numbers, the batter is out.

④ The used cards are stacked on the used card pile, and the number of cards used from the new card pile is taken from the top to continue playing while maintaining 5 cards.
⑤ At 3 outs, they change their karate and play with the same rules.
⑥ The player who attacked immediately before writes the points earned in the inning on the scoreboard.
⑦ If you run out of cards while playing, shuffle the cards you used and reuse them.
⑧ You can use only one tactical card. (Tactic cards used with player cards are turned over so that the opponent cannot see them and placed next to the player cards being compared.)
⑨ The player with the most points wins at the end of the set inning.

name: Rocks Off
description:
Rocks Off is a trivia game about Rock and Metal music, spanning more than five decades, brought to life with the combined knowledge of the staff of the German webmagazine www.powermetal.de.

The game reduces trivia to the core: questions, answers, victory points. Each card contains three questions in three different levels of difficulty, sometimes plus a bonus question about song lyrics. The questions on a card always are about three different bands, musicians or events, so players being confronted with a question about a band they don’t like won’t be punished thrice.

In the two-player-variant, players get a four cards each. The first player asks the questions of his first card starting with the lowest difficulty. If answered correctly, the second question is also read and the same for the third question. The answering player is awarded victory point cards for each question answered correctly based on the difficulty level, then the opponent reads his card. The game continues until all eight cards have been played. The player with the most victory points after these eight to twenty-four question have been asked wins the game.

In the multiplayer variant each player gets one trivia card. Questions are read and tried to answer in turn, first the easiest level of difficulty, then the second and finally the third. Whoever answers a question correctly first receives a victory point card according to the difficulty level of the question. After all questions have been read and victory points have been awarded, the player with the most victory points is declared winner. In case of a tie, all song lyrics questions are asked providing a bonus round after which the winner is determined.

—description from the designer

name: Treacherous Haven
description:
A solitaire microgame about trying to escape a treacherous island filled with villainous pirates, tigers, and a raging volcano. The game starts with a small deck, and as the volcano consumes the island, the deck gets smaller and smaller. Press your luck. Keep the necessary cards, while trying to shed the worst. Find food and water to keep your health up. Build a raft or signal a merchant ship, and escape before time runs out.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Feelinks: Peur Promo Cards
description: Three cards "Fear"(in French language) for the game "Feelinks" that brings another feeling to the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Dans les cordes: Hyper cute card
description:
A promo card released for Valentine's day in 2020 for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
There is French text on the card but the icons make it understandable.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Worldwide Football: Coup du sombrero
description:
2 cards (one blue, one red) for Worldwide football.
These two additional action cards have to be mixed with the others to be played.

The text means : Take one action card in the hand of your opponent.

Published with the crowdfunding campaign of the first expansion but later made available.

name: Worldwide Football: Sauvetage sur la ligne
description:
2 promotional cards released together during the crowdfunding campaign of the second expansion, but later made available together.

"Sauvetage sur la ligne" can be used on opponent shoots.

Instead of throwing one dice to stop the shoot, play "paper-rock-scissors" with your opponent.

If you win, the shoot is stopped. If not, your opponent scored the goal.

name: The Winchester House
description:
In 1884, under advice from her spiritual advisor, Sarah Winchester began work on a house in California. Starting with an eight room farmhouse, she continued adding and renovating until she died in 1922. She believed she was haunted by the spirits of those killed by Winchester-brand rifles and that by constantly renovating the house she could keep the spirits at bay...

In The Winchester House, you start with a small farmhouse and add tiles to build out your house. Matching colors can give bluffs or debuffs, special rooms will help you keep the ghosts contained. Your goal is to place all your tiles without letting any ghosts escape or having the terror meter cap out.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Pays De Saint-Malo: Le Jeu !
description:
Pays De Saint-Malo Le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Travel the board representing Saint-Malo and its countryside and answer questions and riddles.
Nearly 750 written questions and 150 photos questions with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with themes such as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked Saint-Malo and its country.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Victory at Sea: Royal Navy Submarines & MTB sections
description:
Victory at Sea: Royal Navy Submarines & MTB sections

Submarines: Designed for use in North European and Mediterranean waters, the S-class was manoeuvrable with a noted ability to crash dive extremely quickly. Combined with a large salvo of torpedoes, this was a successful design of pre-war years that was soon updated and put back into production.

MTBs: The Fairmile A was designed from the outset to use prefabricated components that could be produced by small businesses such as furniture manufacturers, which would then be assembled at shipyards. Capable of 25 knots, it mounted a 3-pounder gun and a pair of .303 machine guns, as well as Depth Charge.

Designed with the form of a destroyer’s hull, the Fairmile B (like its predecessor, the Fairmile A) was intended primarily as a submarine-chaser, and so was fitted with Depth Charge. Manufactured in large numbers, the Fairmile B was also famously used on the raid on St. Nazaire.

Capable of 26 knots, the Fairmile C was a motor gun boat, mounting two 2-pounders and eight machine guns of various calibres. It was mainly used for close escort duties and some clandestine missions.

Nicknamed ‘Dog Boat,’ the Fairmile D was highly adaptable and could be fitted with a range of armament that meant it could act as both motor gun and torpedo boat. Some were used by the Royal Air Force for long range rescue of downed airmen.

Contents:
3 S-Class Submarines
4 Fairmile MTB Sections (A,B,C & D)
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: The Walking Dead: Something to Fear – Shiva Promo Card
description:
Promo card originally available from the 2020 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
On your turn: You may destroy this card to move one wound to the mob OR to steal up to one Savior and one Walker from another player.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies

name: クロスウォーズ (CROSS WARS)
description:
クロスウォーズ (CROSS WARS) is a competitive game based on the crossword puzzle. The players each have the cards with the answer words for their opponents.

On your turn, choose to:
- ask to reveal the letter in a square,
- ask for a clue to guess a certain word, or
- announce the word you have guessed.

If you guess incorrectly, you cannot fill the squares. On the other hand, if you guess correctly, you can take an additional turn. The first player who fills all the squares on their sheet wins.

クロスワードパズルを元にした対戦ゲームです。
答えとなるクロスワードが決まっており、お互いに相手の答えとなるクロスワードが書かれたカードを持ちます。
手番では、特定の１マスの文字を教えてもらうか、特定のワードのヒント（キー）を教えてもらうか、
特定のワードを答えるかの３種類の行動ができます。
特定のワードを答えた場合、間違っていたらマスを埋めることはできませんが、合っていた場合はもう一度手番を行えます。
クロス面をすべて埋めたプレイヤーの勝利です。
publisher's summary

name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Eye Karamba
description:
A new character, Eye Karamba, for SuperP.L.E.X.!

If you haven't played SuperPLEX, it's our 2016 nod to M.U.S.C.L.E. style wrestling. Over the top characters that are slightly out-of-this-world, fighting with extra special unique moves. The game came with 2 characters and we've released a few since (to change it up, or to play as tag teams). Eye Karamba is a massive 4 armed beast that feels like the characters I loved as a kid in the 80's and 90's.

—description from the publisher


Released in the April 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Tag Team Mode Bonus Pack
description:
Six additional cards for SuperP.L.E.X. to play longer or 4P games. With one base game and a tag team bonus pack, 2 players can play an intense head-to-head Tag Team game. If players have two sets of the game then they can use the bonus pack to play up to 4 players.

Includes 2 new characters for Tag Team action:

Volcanessa
C'Food Lou


The bonus pack also includes their finishing moves and 2 tag cards to switch wrestlers.

name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Nerdman
description:
A 2-card set promo featuring a new character, Nerdman.

Nerdman is based on designer Ryan Cowler's actual wrestling character, P.O.N.G. Ryan is part of Oakland, CA's Hoodslam league.

name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Cage Match Ring Playmat
description:
A huge playmat that will make your table presence 100% more awesome.

The playmat also includes a unique Cage Match Ring that deals damage to characters that are pushed beyond the turnbuckle spaces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Wild Cats: Hitcat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Hitcat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club January 2016 package.

January 2016 games were inspired by Pulp Fiction. This should add a little cult film twist to Wild Cats.

You can add the Hitcat to your game for a little taste of being a secret hitman. You want to assess the group and vote with the crowd to tie for the win. If you mess up, you'll make multiple other players win, which is never good.


RULES
You MAY lie.
The player you vote for is eliminated. This may cause multiple eliminations and multiple winners. You tie for the win if only one player is eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Dude Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, The Dude Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

It breaks the rules of the game a little, but is thematic perfection. It's also a fun twist on the game when you can mess with people without any worries of messing up yourself.

Here we decided to go with Dude Cat, the cat that has alredy won when the game starts. He doesn't have a worry because he knows that it'll all work out in the end.


RULES
You must LIE.
You're the Dude Cat, so you've already won.
Have some fun with it.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Scissorpaws
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Scissorpaws, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club March 2016 package.

Edward Scissorhands. This movie is extremely iconic due to the main character and the clashing 1950's household perfect that he is placed in. It's one of Tim Burton's most well known (and one of 2 Tim Burton films that made 2016's list).

Scissorpaws is a new Wild Cat that votes with 2 fingers (like scissors!). They can point at 1 player or 2. He is trying to eliminate Bad Cat, but could fuel a Wild Cat win if he presses his luck too far.


RULES
You must LIE.
You vote with two fingers. You can point to multiple players or to one player twice. Votes for you do not count.
You win if Bad Cat is eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Cat Pack
description:
An Oceans 11 inspired Wild Cats card, the Cat Pack, that allows a player to look at and redistribute the roles as they'd like, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club April 2016 package.

This new character stops the game right after it starts, takes all of the cards and distributes them as he/she pleases. Then picks a role to align with. It's fun heady stuff for a fun little headgame.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
IMMEDIATELY REVEAL YOURSELF.
Gather all roles, look, & redistribute as you like. Declare a partner role without revealing the player. You tie for the win if your partner wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Loompa Cat
description:
A Wonka inspired Wild Cats card, the Loompa Cat that forces a player to rhyme and get rid of any bad eggs, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club May 2016 package.

In the spirit of the film, with the Loompa Cat you need to ask questions in rhymes and you want the bad egg, I mean cat, out of the game. If you are too obvious, the bad cat might turn things around on you and start to rhyme as well. Gotta watch those bad cats.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH.
The last word of all of your questions must rhyme.
You tie for the win if Bad Cat is eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus: Alternate Play Rules – Co-op
description:
A Board Game of the Month Club promo for January 2017 was a new Cooperative Alternate Play Rules set for Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus.

While it's winter-ish here in New Jersey, we still have plenty of long car rides. And instead of everyone fighting, we're going to work together and try to find some tough items (unless you pull the Santa Claus card in the next two weeks, that is).

This new rules card lets players join together and look for items as a group. More eyes should mean more points, but every 15 minutes you need to remove a card from play. When you find an item, it is scored and can not be scored again. As a reward, you may take a card that was removed from play back, and restart your 15 minute timer.


We're hitting the road again in Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus with the Co-Op rules card. This was a planned stretch goal that didn't make it. Instead of competing to be the first to find all three items, you are working as a group to get as many as possible before the clock resets your items.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Set Collection

name: Wild Cats: Alley Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Alley Cat, a charity card with all proceeds going to the Animal Welfare Association.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH and LIE.
You win if you are eliminated.

(From the publisher’s Discord, regarding how to tell the truth and lie: “Over the course of the game you must do both“)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Office Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Office Cat, inspired in Office Space, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club June 2016 package.

What is better that quitting your terrible office job? Well on this card, it's sticking it out and getting fired. The unemployment kicks in and is technically better. But Office Cat allows you to stick it to the main and quit mid-game. If you do, you are a winner, and the game continues. If you stick around until the end, you can be the only winner.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie.
You can quit. If you do, you tie for the win. If you stay and are eliminated, you are the only winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Horror Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Horror Cat, inspired in Dr. Frank-N-Furter from The Rocky Horror Picture Show, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club July 2016 package.

Sticking with audience participation, Horror Cat involves a non-player. Yes, you need to find someone who is not in the game and get them to vote along with you to tie for the win. You can tell them "at the count of three, point to this person" and they may or may not go along with it. If it's the non-players at my game nights, they definitely will not go along with it. So there is an extra level to reading them, just like trying to read other players. At least with other players, the cards guide their intentions. Here, it's wide open.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie.
Before the vote, reveal yourself and ask a non-player to also vote. If you both vote the same, you tie for the win.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Baseball Furry
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Baseball Furry, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2016 package.

The Baseball Furry (a pun that was unavoidable), is all about voting with the group. No single player can be a gang on their own, so you need to watch for cues and follow along. OR better yet, you can lead the group. Both are completely valid and depend on your play style or surroundings.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you vote alone, your vote doesn't count. If you vote with majority, you tie for the win.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Cats: Tabby Wiseau
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Tabby Wiseau, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club September 2016 package, inspired on the cult film The Room.

This one is likely our deepest cut in the Cult Film Wild Cats series. But Tabby Wiseau just hates himself. He can vote himself out and actually eek out a win if others join along. You could really deep down try to imitate the most obvious target or take a meta route and just annoy people to see if they vote for you.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You must vote for yourself.
You win if somebody else also votes for you.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wild Cats: Rabbit Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Rabbit Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club October 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Donnie Darko.

Sticking with the theme, but bringing in the tangential universe, we have a Rabbit/Cat that makes players take back their votes and vote again.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You do not vote. Reveal yourself after the vote. Count to three and players vote again. If the eliminated player changes, you tie for the win.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wild Cats: Drummer Cat
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Drummer Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club November 2016 package, inspired on the cult film This Is Spinal Tap.

We wanted to have fun and feel the effects of spontaneous combustion. So of you lost last round, lose again.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you were eliminited last game, you are immediately eliminated.
You tie for the win if you are not eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wild Cats: Lydia Catz
description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Lydia Catz, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club December 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Beetlejuice.

Of course this is a card about speaking 3 times. With Beetlejuice as the main theme, we had to go there. It's required. Also a fun sneaky card!


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you ask the same question three times without anyone identifying you, the game ends immediately and you win.
Otherwise, you do not vote.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wonky Words
description:
Wonky Words is a Scrabble-like word game where you form words inside polyomino word holders before placing them.

Grab a shape, insert letters, play your word(s).

No individual turns. Simultaneous game play for fast action.

—description from the publisher

name: Zine Game
description:
Will your zines be the best ones on the shelf? Will you be caught stealing copies?

In Zine Game, players earn points based on supplies, durable bindings, and other issues that zine publishers struggle with. Will you have the next great idea — or will your rivals destroy your hard work before it ever sees the light of day?

name: Duell der Sterneköche
description:
Who is the best cook on board? Will you be faster than your colleagues in providing the crew with tasty food? All without wasting precious ingredients?

Card game with Set collection.

name: Di-Li-Do
description:
Di-Li-Do is an IDEAL GAME TO PLAY ALONE. After your eyes are tired from any computer / mobilephone / TV / smartphone etc - screen - it is great to spend time playing just with a piece of paper, pencil and 2 (d6) dice. Also you can organize a tournament for any amount of players and for any amount of time. To start you need to download a score sheet and it is the score sheet for one player.

Goal of the game: To get as much as possible points.
To get points you must make as many continuous Lines as possible with Dots along the vertical, horizontally and diagonally. The more Dots in the line, the more points you get. You must have at least 3 Dots in a Line to get any points. First it looks like a very simple game but more you play more hints and tactics you will find.

ROLL DICE and you get two numbers from two ordinary 6-sided dice. The numbers on the Dice are the coordinates where you need to put a Dot on a gaming board.
If the coordinates are occupied and the player cannot place a Dot, then he receives a penalty point (draw a cross in the low left of the gaming board). Each GAME lasts up to 3 penalty points. After getting the third penalty point - GAME ends – start to count the lines.

​

—description from the designer

name: DiCroNo
description:
DiCroNo is a variation of Tic-Tac-Toe / Noughts and crosses / Xs and Os, and to play, you need two d6 normal dice, two pens/pencils, and a print-and-play score sheet.

Players compete to create rows of three symbols — either Xs or Os — in a shared 6x6 grid. On a turn, you roll the dice, then mark an empty space in the grid that matches the numbers rolled, e.g., if you roll 2-4, then you can place a symbol in the second space of the fourth column or the fourth space of the second column. If you can't place a symbol, you receive a penalty.

If you receive three penalties or create three lines of your symbols — with overlapping lines being permitted — then the game ends.

name: Top 3
description:
It is a simple game to score as much as possible points by rolling the dice. It is a game of luck and tactic. You can play it alone or with friends. You can download a score sheet for 2 players. But it’s also up to you if you want to do it different way and add the scores in the way you use to do it in any other game.

Basic game is played with 5 (d6) regular dice.
Determine a starting player by rolling 1-2 dice.
How to play:

On first roll every player must roll all 5 dice and keep the dice with the lowest number of dots (points)

Every roll player can keep only 1 dice and this dice should be higher than the previous dice that was left

If there are NO dice higher than the dice that was left before – attempt stops - stop rolling dice and count the score.

There could be maximum 5 rolls in attempt – that means every roll there was a higher dice left – for example: 1 > 3 > 4 > 5 > 6

First dice will give 1 point if it will be the only dice player could keep (doesn’t matter how many dots are there on it)

If player could keep 2 dice it gives him 2 points - doesn’t matter how many dots are there on the dice

If player kept 3 dice – he gets the same amount of points that has the third dice

If player kept 4 dice his points are the sum of 3rd and 4th dice

If player kept 5 dice his points are the sum of 3rd, 4th and 5th dice

name: Anche gli orchi hanno paura
description:
A family of cowardly ogres, a journey to overcome their fears and the awareness that they must do it together.

These are just some of the elements of this cooperative game.
The children will have to move on the board and - by drawing "Courage" and "Talk about it" cards - overcome and beat the fears of the group: let's help each other and neutralize the different fears by telling and finding shared solutions.

Only by talking, interacting and collaborating the whole De Orchis family will reach the finish line and defeat the small and big daily fears that affect each of us.

Narration and cooperative play allow adults to gently approach the emotional world of the little ones and help them to express themselves by offering a lot of ideas on how many times it is possible to overcome their fears with ease, especially if you decide to share them.

The active player rolls the die and moves his token clockwise by as many squares as the result. Depending on the square where the movement ends, he draws a "Courage" card, a "Talk about it" card, a Fear card or immediately plays another turn. After moving the token, you can decide to use either a "Talk about it" or a "Courage" card to remove a Fear card in play. The turn passes to the next player.

You win all together only if you have removed all the Fear cards in play. If the players decide to stop the game, surrender, resign or run out of cards, the game is lost.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: 居酒屋オブザデッド～ゾンビ探しは注文のあとで～ (Izakaya of the Dead: Zombie Sagashi wa Chuumon no Ato de -)
description:
居酒屋オブザデッド～ゾンビ探しは注文のあとで～ (Izakaya of the Dead - Zombie Sagashi wa Chuumon no Ato de -) is a Japanese game about zombies at a bar. The title means 'Izakaya of the Dead - We'll Find Zombies after Making
Orders -'.

In the midst of a zombie panic, drunkards still want to drink. A zombie has slipped into the drunkards' drinking party. We must find the zombie or we'll be in danger! But making orders comes first. Let's start off with beer!

This is a social deduction game of a zombie and drunkards. Make orders from the menu with a growl and gesture with one hand. If they find the zombie or manage to make orders successfully, the drunkards win!

ゾンビパニック発生！ しかし、それでも酒を飲みたい酔っ払いたち。
酔っ払いの飲み会の中に１体、ゾンビが紛れ込んでしまった。ゾンビを見つけないと危険だ！
でも注文が先だ。とりあえず生！

ゾンビとよっぱらいの正体隠匿パーティーゲーム
唸り声と片腕ジェスチャーでメニューを注文
ゾンビを見つけるか注文成功でよっぱらいの勝利
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Traitor Game

name: Trick or treat
description:
Put on your spookiest costume and go trick-or-treating in your street. Try to get the best candy while avoiding the disappointing treats. But don’t worry, once you get home you will have an opportunity to swap. Make sure you keep quiet though, you only have until mom and dad notice you’re home and send you to bed!

Trick or treat is a light-weight push your luck card game. You will be going door-to-door drawing candy cards at each house, aiming to get your favorite candy while avoiding those you have ranked the lowest. While you have some information about what is at the house, you can never be 100% sure what the next draw will turn up.

Careful though, as it isn't just bad candy you are risking by continuing to draw, but also the good will of your neighbors; drawing a matching event card will trigger a unique event at each house. You just took a chocolate bar, your favorite! Do you go back in for another and risk dropping the chocolate back into the bucket? The Grinch at the next house has told you to only take two. Do you listen, or keep drawing and hope he doesn't notice?

Once home you have until someone draws the parents card to trade your undesirable candy or tales of the evenings adventures for better candy. Whoever manages to get the best haul of candy (according to their personal ranking) wins.

—description from the designer

name: Imalya
description:
Imalya is a push your luck dice game for 2-4 players.
Each player takes on the role of one of 3 rival Factions participating in the fight against the Black Queen E’Dyrha: Assassins, Thieves and the Resistance. The players roll the dice and try to make combinations in order to be the first to reach 100 points.

Players start with 8 coins (called Tales). In turn, a player rolls the 6 (or 7) dice. They can decide to re-roll all or part of the dice as many times as they want, following the rules. When the player has decided to stop rolling the dice (or cannot anymore), they pay the Tribute for that turn: each E’Dyrha die in Prison and each Faction at the Lair other than the player's Faction cost 1 Tale. A player who cannot pay the Tribute is eliminated but keeps their score.

The player then proceeds to scoring his turn, calculating the number of the player's Faction dice multiplied by the total number of Faction dice in the Lair.

The games comes with 2 variants:

The Cursed One: 1 more die is added to the roll, with new special effects on 3 of its sides.
The Spells: players use a deck of 40 cards to spice up the game by getting new temporary abilities.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Push Your Luck

name: True Bid
description:
Take a side and win the perfection game using Biden and Trump nesting dolls depicting the Republicans and the Democrats. This limited-edition game set marks an important event 2020 in US history!
The aim of the game is to go through each stage using playing cards or dice. The winner of each stage puts nesting doll into the one next in size until reaches nesting doll with the White House
Fun, dynamic, and unpredictable board games for adults and family are already waiting for you. Players: 2. Ages: 8. Duration of the game: 10-20 minutes with playing cards or 5-10 minutes with dice
51 playing cards have been developed to simulate the U.S. electoral system for great gameplay in the card games for adults and families. Each card has 2 attributes: the number of points and the color
True Bid game will turn the political debate into real fun. When you play True Bid with friends and family, there is only one question posed – who will win the political battle and become president?

True Bid - 2020 Political Battle: fun board game with depicting Donald Trump and Joe Biden nesting dolls.

Who will occupy the Oval Office? The game will turn any political debate into real fun.

Features:

Dynamic and unpredictable game;
True Bid be appreciated by collectors;
True Bid is a great keepsake;
True Bid is also a great piece of decor.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Phantom Doctrine: Espionage Board Game
description:
Phantom Doctrine is a co-operation espionage stealth board game that will let players take charge and manage a Spy Agency. Players will have to build a base, sneak around the enemy territory and steal information, rescue hostages and many more. To spice things up, Agents can turn out to be double agents that will cross you in the least expected moment. In downtime when preparing for missions players will upgrade their base and gear up Agents. Better base locations will let them buy better guns, train agents in the deadly art of killing and many more. Players will also send them on global missions that are necessary to push the storyline forward.

—description from the publisher

name: Vaccine lab
description:
Because people around the world are at risk from the virus, researchers turn to vaccine laboratories to develop vaccines.

Vaccine Lab is a dice, luck, risk, reasoning and co-op game for 2 to 4 players. Your goal is to show the actions of all players working together to develop a given vaccine. When luck comes, the pace of development gradually increases, and when bad luck comes, the goal cannot be achieved. When the turn comes, roll the dice to walk between luck and misfortune. Then he plays 1 card that affects all players.

You can draw or take a card depending on where you place it. This choice is watched by all players.

Can you develop a vaccine in an urgent situation where time is tight?

<Purpose of the game>
1. You need to develop a vaccine within the number of players +1 round.

<Game ready>
1. After shuffling the cards, all players draw 2 cards. The remaining cards are placed in a pile in the center of the table.
2. Starting with the first player, take 3 antivirus chips out of their pockets and cover them with their hands so that others cannot see them. If all players have their anti-virus chips side-by-side, put their hands away at the same time and reveal them to everyone. It is both a viral particle and a vaccine to be developed.
3. The cards in the pile are used to make 2 sectors. The sector puts 4 cards next to the pile. This place is called a laboratory.

Even if the order of the vaccine chips and cards is the same during the game preparation process, the vaccine was not developed, and it is successful only when the new card placed by the player has the same order of the cards in the lab.


4. Place the round chips next to the pile.
(Round Chip = Number of Players +1)

<Game play>
1. On your turn, roll the dice.
2. If the scale of the rolled dice is on the nearest card in the pile, turn it over.
3. Select 1 card from your hand and place 1 card at the end of the desired sector.
4. Make sure a vaccine has been developed.
5. If the order of the vaccine to be developed and the potion card between team members are the same, the vaccine for virus treatment has been successfully developed. Store successfully developed vaccines aside.
6. Place a card and draw a card from the front of the sector or from the pile. In this way, it preserves 4 cards per sector.
(Please push the cards toward the pile so the next player can place them.)

If you place a card and the card in front of the sector is turned over, remove the card and unconditionally draw a card from the pile.


7. At the end of the turn, the next player proceeds.

<Game ends>
1. Researcher wins if everyone succeeds in developing a vaccine after a +1 player number round. But if even one person fails to develop a vaccine, researchers are defeated.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Medical, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Victory at Sea: IJN Submarines & MTB sections
description:
Submarines: The Kaidai-7-class, or KD-7, was developed in the late 1930s, following on from the preceding KD-6 class. With a surface range of 8,000nm at 16kts, and a submerged endurance of 50nm at 5kts, they possessed a slightly better underwater performance to the late-model KD-6s and better surface speed (though not range) than the earlier members of that class. All members of the class were lost by mid-1944. Another ocean-going submersible using 533mm forward and aft torpedo tubes, it served in the South Pacific as well as the waters off Australia. I-177 sunk the hospital ship AHS Centaur off Stradbroke Island. It was presumed lost with all hands on 18 November 1944, while the I-176 was lost six months earlier off of the Solomon’s. There were 10 KD-7 submarines built overall.

MTBs: Designed as a suicide craft, the Shin’yō either carried a powerful explosive or two depth charges. The depth charges were intended to be planted by the pilot of the boat, after which he would then make his escape. Although nearly 10,000 were built, they accounted for the sinking of only 5 ships, mainly landing craft.

The Imperial Japanese Navy fielded a number of variants on a standard torpedo boat design, differing mainly in machinery fit which affected displacement, giving the illusion of more variety than existed in practice. 238 boats were built within these designations, all armed with two 18-inch torpedoes and 25mm or 13.2mm guns.

Contents:
3 Kaidai-7-class Submarine
2 Shin'yo Kamikaze boat sections
2 T-14 MTB sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: US Navy Submarines & MTB sections
description:
Submarines: The Gato-class of submarine was the first mass production US submarine class of the Second World War, forming the majority of the United States Navy’s submarine fleet of the war. It was the Gato-class, and the successors of her design that were largely responsible for the disruption of the Japanese merchant fleet. Individual Gato-class vessels were given names of marine creatures, with the lead of her class named for a type of small catshark.

MTBs: The Elco mounted four torpedo tubes which, combined with its speed, made it a serious threat to larger ships. The largest PT boat used by the US Navy, the Elco is also notable for future President Kennedy commanding one. Crews of these boats relied on their smaller size, speed and manoeuvrability – and darkness – to survive.

Contents:
3 Gato-Class Submarines
2 Elco ‘77 PT Boat Sections
2 Elco ‘80 PT Boat Sections
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Collection
description:
Did you know that there are rules about garbage disposal?
Collections are board games that connect natural flows while saving value and money by choosing and giving up opportunities in the process of exchange, collection, sale and resource conversion.

<Purpose of the game>
1. Let's collect recycling, separate collection, and save money.

<Game ready>
1. After shuffling the cards evenly, each player takes 5 cards and 3 tokens.
The remaining cards are placed in a deck in the middle of the table.

When it's your turn, you take 4 actions in turn. The choice of each situation has a great influence on future variables.

<Game play>
1. Card exchange (1 to 2 cards) or separate collection vehicle operation
Choose a player and trade cards. (1 or 2)
If no one wants to exchange, proceed to the next action.
Separate collection vehicles must be operated with the cards they are collecting.
When the car runs, everyone else discards the card from the collected cards.

2. Collection Card Resource Exchange
Cards collected in the previous round can be exchanged for tokens.
(Cards played in this round can be sold after 1 turn.)

3. Card collection (up to 3 types)
You can collect up to 3 types of sorting bins.
What you collect can be sold in the next round.
If you have a disposable recycling bin card, you can collect up to 4 cards.

4. Card replenishment (5 sheets stored)
Fill in the cards used in the deck.
When your turn is over, you must have 5 cards in your hand.

5. If you have executed the actions in order, the turn is passed to the next person.

-When you want to discard a card you are collecting, you pay 2 tokens to the bank for a penalty of unauthorized speculation and discard 1 type of card you choose.
(Cards in your hand cannot be discarded.)

-If you are holding a disposable bin, you can collect additional cards of different types.
After the collection is over, when you sell the cards you are collecting in this bin, you will also discard the disposable recycling bin card.

<Game ends>
1. When someone draws the last card of the deck in the center of the table, the game ends by progressing one by one starting with the next player. Collect all the cards in your hand by type and exchange 3 or more cards for tokens. If you have a garbage truck, you can get 1 token per card. The player with the highest total token score wins.

name: The Ballad of Heroes
description:
The ballads of heroism are being told.

As narrators of this story in The Ballad of Heroes, we can constantly change the story so that the greatness and glory go to the hero that our tribe wants. In this way, we do not neglect hand-to-hand combat.

name: The Dark Mansion
description:
Ahriman warriors stand in front of an old mansion that has been hidden underground for centuries. According to legend, they know that the mansion is protected by the Ahriman. They enter through the main entrance, but when the last of them has entered, they notice that the trap doors begin to slide shut. A voice in the mansion shouts, "You are buried here forever."

When you find yourself inside The Dark Mansion, a one-vs-all game, you might consider it a grave, but as one of the fighters, you have tools on hand that can help you survive. Can you defeat the devil and get out of the mansion?
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: 500 Miles
description:
Walk 500 miles without also walking 500 more.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) by The Proclaimers.

It's John du Bois month here, and we start with a game about traveling on a map, kind of. :) You will be flicking pennies along the edge of the postcard to walk 500 miles before your opponent. I also have to mention that this was our first time working with Maricica Cârstiuc and her art is wonderful! It really captured the whimsical tone we were hoping for, and I'd love to work with her again!

—description from the publisher


A postcard dexterity game, where players race flickering pennies.

The first player, on their first turn, uses a finger to flick or push their penny so that it touches or crosses the first line - but not the second line. On each player's subsequent turns, the player flicks their penny so that it is closer to the right of the card that the other player's penny but does not completely cross two different lines on the same flick. If unsuccessful, the get one chance to retry.

If a player is unable to successfully complete their turn on a retry, they lose the game. If a player is able to flick their penny past the 500 mark without breaking the other rules for their turn, they win the game.


Released in the May 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Spin Me Right Round!
description:
Shake out your arms and get loosened up!

Remember Dead or Alive? Maybe not, but you´ll definitely know the song. We first saw this game being played at a variety of conventions (PAX, Unpub, etc), where a bunch of people were standing around a table, spinning the postcard, hugging each other, wagging their hands around and snapping their fingers. This game has you playing each line of the song, and laughing the whole way through.

—description from the publisher


Spin Me Right Round! is a moving and action game played in real time, so be ready!

The DJ will toss the postcard onto the table by spinning it in the air. The action for that round is determined by whichever corner is pointing at the DJ when the postcard stops spinning. Once the DJ calls out the action, all Dancers must perform that action as fast as they can, then slap the postcard.

The first Dancer to slap the postcard will be the DJ for the next round, and the last one is eliminated from the game.

Once down to only 2 players, whoever slaps first, wins!


Released in the April 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play

name: One Night In Dead West
description:
Oliva and her husband Paul are visiting a newly acquired mine late one day when they are attacked by a deranged man who is slobbering and incoherent. Paul is killed in the ensuing fight. Oliva escapes to a nearby Saloon. There she runs into a group of people who have no idea what’s going on, except that they heard the dead have risen and are attacking the living. However, a telegram arrived earlier in the day saying a posse is on the way to help rescue survivors but the bad news they won't arrive till morning as they are going town to town to find survivors. All they have to do is survive the night!
It won’t be easy as this is the One Night in Dead West...

You and a group of survivors are held up at a Saloon. The zombies will spawn at the tip of each hour on the game track at random locations determined by 6x D10s. If the zombies are already on the map before spawning new ones, you would check if they break any Barricades, enter the saloon, Move, or attack any players.

Then all the player characters will take their turns in any order they want. They can take a 30-minute action or an hour as long as they haven't taken a 30-minute action already during that hour. Once they are they decide which duration they want to take they move their player pawn on the time track and can only take another 30 minutes or another turn once all the players passed or are on the same space as their pawn.

During a turn, they can choose Rest, Barricade, search for items (if available), or fight zombies. Fighting and barricading costs energy while resting and search requires the player to draw events.

If you survive till 8 am the next day the Posse arrives to whip out the remaining zombies and you must figure out if they mistaken you for a zombie or not based on how many hit points you have left and roll of a D16.

Alternatively, you can win by finding the key to the bar with the wagon and successfully remove the nitroglycerine from it or it could be game over early.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Auction, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Forces of History
description:
Forces of History is a game that simulates world history, using an original combination of game mechanics inspired by games as diverse as Terraforming Mars, Twilight Struggle, Innovation, and Reiner Knizia's Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation. Instead of controlling a particular historical leader or empire, players take on the roles of celestial beings who are pulling the strings of history from behind the curtains. The celestials must help each other to make the divine plan for the world unfold, but beneath the thin veneer of cooperation there is fierce rivalry... for the Lord of Time, as ancient as creation itself, will give a rich reward to the celestial who shows the most skill at influencing world events. This is why all actions in the game—recruiting agents, collecting coins, claiming forces, playing cards and more—are ultimately aimed at just one thing: to gain as many Influence Points (IP) as possible. At the end of the game, the player with the most IP wins.

Forces of History is a complex strategy game that combines the best of several different worlds. It simulates world history, yet every playthrough is different from the one before; it offers rich historical lore to the hobby-historian, but you don't need to know or care about history to play it.

The game offers several different game variants: Classical-Medieval Age game (standard), Classical Age game, Medieval Age game, and team play (2v2) in any of the above settings. The playing time can vary from 2 hours up to 6-7 hours, depending on the variant chosen (and on player familiarity). NOTE: The Modern Age is not yet available, but if the game is released and becomes as successful as we hope, it will be released in the upcoming expansion.

This is a game that doesn't easily fit into any established category.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Connections, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Take That

name: Play the Naval Battle of Lepanto 1571
description:
Volume 8 in the Paper Battles and Dioramas series.
With little effort, build ships to create the scenes of Battle of Lepanto.
Tricks and advices for a good assembly of the pieces are provided, as well as the official rules for playing wargame.

The ships shown in the book can be photocopied and then cut out in order to put together an army from the time of the sea battle at Lepanto for a tabletop strategy game or for display.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Trivial Pursuit: Rot Weiss Essen
description:
Trivial Pursuit Rot Weiss Essen Edition

A game board, 100 cards with questions and answers
1 die, 6 knowledge stores and 36 colored knowledge corners
600 questions and answers about Rot-Weiss Essen
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mahabharata
description:
The god Arjuna has instructed the architect Maya to build a palace for king Yudishthira. The object of the game is to score as many points as possible through the construction of this palace.

Each turn workers can be moved from the city to various locations where they collect resources. Resources can be traded with kings for other resources or ornaments for the palace. After a trade is done, the king involved leaves the palace. At the end of the game, any kings left in the palace award points based on its construction.

This is a cooperative game that can be played solo. It is based on chapter 20 of the Mahabharata.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Zero Quest
description:
Zero Quest is a cooperative game in which players will work together to explore a series of dungeons and defeat the infernal entity Zolzotha, trying not to succumb to his insanity-inducing madness in the process.

There’s a catch though: players may not communicate other than by playing cards.

Players may play a card at any time in any order. Navigation is by playing numbered cards, or a spell can be cast instead. Players start with the mighty 0 card, which must be carried to the final confrontation. Use it to destroy Zolzotha and win the game, or perish in the attempt.

The principle is similar to The Mind, but cards are played with the goal of completing a game rather than just being a disembodied mechanic.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Move Through Deck

name: El Juego de Pamplona
description:
El Juego de Pamplona is a fun family game that reproduces the day-to-day life of the city of Pamplona.
Players will have fun trying to acquire places in Pamplona.

El Juego de Pamplona game familiarizes players with the main streets and monuments of the city.
An extremely fun game that helps to enhance spatial ability and sense of orientation.

—description from the publisher (translated)

To win: acquire businesses and leave the city.

name: Tri-Chess
description:
Tri-Chess is played on a hexagonal board made up of 217 hexes in three colors. Each side has an additional bishop and two extra pawns, with the baseline being RNBKBQBNR. The King moves to any adjacent hex; the Queen and Bishop cannot pass between two occupied hexes; a Pawn moves one step as a Bishop (with an opening two-step being permitted) and captures with a two-step Rook move.

When a player is checkmated, their forces are immobilized; the first player to capture the king then takes over the immobilized forces. The capture can be made by either of the remaining players.

Note that despite the identical name and designer, this game is not identical to Tri-Chess.

name: Bundesliga Quartett
description:
Bundesliga Quartett 2019/2020


The classic card game for football fans of all ages.
With the Bundesliga Edition of Topps, fans and football enthusiasts will now receive the latest version of popular classic game with the stars of the Bundesliga!
Many different categories, including youngstars, storms and captains!
In addition to the classic quartet, playing cards can also be played the equally popular card game Trumpf!
Matching football categories, such as goals, games and assist ensure a lot of fun and a surprise!


Contents:
36 playing cards and rules of play

name: Bite: The Vampire Card Game
description:
Bite is a pick and pass social deduction game where players take on secret roles as Humans or Vampires. Players will pass cards to each other then secretly play them on others. It is vital for players to figure out who is on their team and who needs to be eliminated.

But be careful, a player who used to be a Human might now be a Vampire!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Unity: Elite Army Builder for Renegade Scout 2nd Edition
description:
This expansion for Renegade Scout takes the rulebook army builder and integrates each expansion, giving you a single comprehensive Army Builder to avoid excessive page flipping.

Currently it incorporates the points values and options from:

Anti-tank weapons of Unified Space
Veteran infantry of Unified Space


You still require the relevant expansion pack for any rules and profiles. This simply integrates the expansions into the army builder.
The army builder has also been reorganized a little to make it easier to use at a glance.

As future expansions are released, the Elite army builder will be updated to factor them in.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tiki Taka: Il calcio è il nostro gioco
description:
Take to the pitch and challenge your friends with this exciting quiz game about the world of football.

Will you be able to answer more than 600 questions and earn the title of TikiTaka Champion?

Players will have to answer the questions and "bet" on the presumed correct answer.
The winner is the one who completes their championship first.

The game is a table version based on the television broadcast: TikiTaka - Il calcio è il nostro gioco (Football is Our Game), a Quiz for football lovers.

name: Onder de Hamer
description:
Onder de Hamer ("Under the Hammer") is an auction game. The goal of the game is to develop a project as cheap and fast as possible. The projects are famous buildings in Rotterdam, including the Cubic Houses, the Euromast, the Kuip, Erasmus bridge, and the Erasmus University.

The projects require different types of investments, like raw materials and employees. The investments can be obtained by bidding in an auction. There are six different auction types/systems in the game.

The game has to be played with four or five players, or can be played in teams. The first player who develops his project is the winner of the game.

—description from the rulebook

name: Toadstool Game
description: This delightful and exciting game is played amidst the fairytale world of dwarves. The toadstools should be brought over to the opposite side of the board, and this looks easier than it is. While playing children learn numbers from 1-6.

name: Hoppytop
description: How exciting! Right close by is a flowerbed with delicious flowers that look good enough to eat. Jump right over the fence and you are a lot closer to the goal! The first one to reach the flowerbed can enjoy!

name: Belle & Boo: Möhrchen mopsen
description: Boo loves carots. On a field nearby, there are many of them. Boo eats some, but runs away as fast as possible so that nobody recognizes him.

name: The Los Alamos Conspiracy
description:
A race between powers to develop the world's first atomic bomb is feverishly taking place. Without the public's knowledge, the United States is just months from this becoming a reality.

In Los Alamos, an extensive, embedded network of spies have been biding their time, waiting for the right moment to carry out their orders to steal the top secret information. Unfortunately, they catch word that the entire network is exposed and you must act now. Can you steal all of the documents and get out of Los Alamos before getting caught?

The Los Alamos Conspiracy is a tile laying game where you are trying to match certain tile patterns to "steal" files. With each turn you will place a tile and flip a tile (representing the Military Police). If you can exhaust the entire stack of tiles with all four resources, you win! If the Military Police catch up with you or you cannot get out of town with all four files, you lose the game.

—description from the designer

name: Die Olchis: Müffelige Tümpelhüpfer
description: Every play gets a frog and flips it into the pond.

name: Das Ägypten der Pharaonen
description: The players run through a labyrinth full of obstacles to find the treasure chamber of Tutanchamun.

name: The Great Northern Trading Company, 1670
description:
Great Northwest Territories is an exciting, commodity driven worker placement game set in the Hudson Bay area in 1670s. The player's small trading companies will compete to build up the settlement, explore the wilderness, trade manufactured resources from Europe amongst themselves and the indigenous tribes in the region, to gain furs and other locally produced commodities, such as maple syrup and artwork. There is a market where the price of goods rises and falls according to supply and demand. Players will have to fulfil contracts with the ships at port and the indigenous tribes. Doing so to gains a player victory points, as do building new key buildings in the community. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, City Building, Economic, Educational, Exploration
mechanics: Contracts, Income, Market, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Das römische Reich
description: The players train hard to become better and better and finally fight in the collosseum.

name: The Airplane Game
description: This is simple game from the 1960s with the goal of racing around the race course. Players must spin the game's spinner and advance their plane based on the number of spaces scored. If they land on a space already occupied by another player's plane, this causes an "air interference" and the player must land his plane for repairs (i.e. they would get sent back to the starting space, but does not lose any already completed laps). First one to complete 5 laps around the course is the winner! Plus, the game board, spinner, and box have that great 1960's art style.

name: Le Jeu du Sud Manche
description:
Le Jeu du Sud Manche

is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written and visual questions including "junior" questions dealing with subjects as varied as History or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the southern Manche region, country of the Bay of Mont-Saint-Michel, including the towns of Avranches, Granville, Mortain, Pontorson, Villedieu-les-Poêles, Saint-Hilaire-du-Harcouët.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dicey Curves: Road Rally
description:
Team racing on the open road!

Dicey Curves: Road Rally, a racing game for 1 to 4 players, is an updated take on the Dicey Curves series.

Use Fuel and Control tokens to move your 2-car racing team down the randomized, curving rally course, and then roll dice to gain more tokens for your next turn.

Score more points than your opponents by getting your cars through the checkpoints before theirs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Resource to Move, Track Movement

name: ワカサギ (Ice Fishing Hokkaido)
description:
A card game for family fishing fun.

Go ice fishing in Hokkaido and discover the best fishing spots, water depths, and bait options! Draw different event cards and see who can catch the most Wakasagi (Japanese pond smelt)!

In this game, one "boss" player draws three fishing information cards without showing the other players. These other "fishermen" players, in turn, try to predict the fishing information by placing pieces of ice on the cards. Depending on how many of their predictions are correct, the boss will call out the sound "Kon!". If the boss calls out more than two "Kon"s, it means a fish has been hooked. However, if the fisherman fails to call out "Hit!" before the boss finishes saying a total of 10 "Kon"s, the fish will get away!

In the case that the fishermen calls out "Hit" in time, he or she will get to take a card from the Wakasagi fish pile. If not, the Boss will receive a card instead.

After either player draws a fish card, he or she will also need to draw an event card. An event card can be either positive or negative (for example, get an extra 2 fish...or a fox steals one of your wakasagi cards). There's even an event card that forces a player to caw like a crow for his or her next turn.

name: Waroong Wars (Second Edition): Character Expansion 1
description:
This promo consists of 4 cards addition to the main game:


Mas Shala


Character card
Start the game with a "Secret Spice" card. "Secret Spice" card count as "Go Boy!" card. You can have 2 "Go Boy!" card max.


Mrs Van Meijden


Character Card
Before shopping phase, choose 1 displayed menu card by placing "Madam Choice" card above it. When you cook it this round, take an extra point token.


2 Pempek


Menu Card (6 VP)
Need 3 "Unique" and 1 "Spice" cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: SUPER©©STACCS
description:
SUPER©©STACCS is a creative matching and stacking card game played in three dimensions... it expands the world of flat cards into a multi-dimensional playing experience, creating a visually beautiful and imaginative game. While the rules are super simple, no two games look alike.

Each hexagonal card is designed to look like a cube with three visible surfaces to make matches on. Players are dealt 7 cards each and take turns matching and placing cards onto the STACC until their hands are empty.

Certain cards have attack and special effects that add to the strategy and unpredictability of the game. Use court cards to force other players to take on more cards, or play a wild card to reboot and reorient the game in a different direction.

The first player to get rid of all their cards wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Aethermon
description:
Humanity was already on the brink when The Darkness fell, the light of man all but extinguished. Then the Aethermon appeared - creatures from the AetherRealm, a world already lost to The Darkness.

The Aethermon would make their final stand in defense of humanity. The spirit of the Aethermon remained unbroken, but ultimately their numbers were too few.

Sparked by the valor of the Aethermon, it was a child who rose up first. Standing beside her new allies this child became the first AetherRen.

United the AetherRen and the Aethermon forced The Darkness back into the night as it vowed to one day return.

For generations Aethermon and AetherRen would train, preparing for the day The Darkness would return. But over time The Darkness was forgotten, and the training of Aethermon became sport.

In Aethermon, 2-8 players take the role of young AetherRen competing to claim the Junior Aethermon Championship.

Each player bonds with an Aethermon with their own elemental affinity (Moonlit, Sunstruck, Sky, Earth, Fire, Water, Nature and Thunder) granting them unique abilities and element specific combat moves.

Players explore the world of Aethermon by playing Energy Cards (movement cards) to move around the board. Landing on special locations will trigger story driven events via decksploration mechanics. Landing on mundane squares will trigger battles or encounters.

Battles are resolved by Battle Card mechanics. Success in battle will earn the player XG (experience-gold) a unified currency that can be exchanged for items, increases in stats or new Battle Cards (moves).

As players complete quests and continue on their journey to become the Junior Aethermon Champion they will accrue fans - the player with the most fans at the end of Chapter 1 is the winner of Chapter 1.

In Chapter 2 players must put aside old rivalries to face a greater threat. Victory can only be achieved by working together, recruiting new allies and ultimately pushing back The Darkness one more time.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Virtue
description:
Virtue is a co-operative game for 2-4 players that pits your team against the spiritual forces of good and evil. You will strive to live a good life and balance the pursuits that give it meaning. You will quest for internal tranquillity and life-long peace. You will struggle with existential conflict as your angels and demons battle to shape your soul and define your character. You and your fellow man are in this together. Don't let them down.

Each round represents a decade of the players' lives and consists of three phases: Actions, Existential Conflict, and Spiritual Warfare. In the action phase, players move their focus on various vices and virtues, cleanse their soul of the demons that plague them, enhance life pursuits that will unlock new abilities, and increase their tranquility, which will aid them in removing demons. The action phase prepares the team for what is about to come.

After the action phase, each player draws from a deck that will (among other things) swarm their souls with angels and demons. Then, they check for existential conflict, i.e., an abundance of uncontested demons with no angels to stand in opposition. For each existential crisis that occurs, the player has new challenges to overcome.

Finally, the spiritual warfare phase ensues in which the forces of good and evil battle, and the dominating force is left standing for the next decade of their lives.

—description from the designer

name: Das große Bundesliga-Quiz
description:
Das große Bundesliga-Quiz, The big Bundesliga quiz contains 900 questions on current and historical events in the 50-year Bundesliga history.
It is a knowledge quiz for young and old.
With different levels of difficulty, children can play against adults or against each other.
Four different game variants from training to tournaments, test your knowledge of the Bundesliga and stay exciting until the end.
The talking pen holds the points and cheers the players on.
Questions about the ewigen Tabelle, about current events (2013), club colors, club anthems, players etc...

name: NAT 1
description:
NAT 1 is RPG themed party game. Players react to wacky and unique situations of RPG's with their equally wacky and unique response. A judge plays a situation cards and the players submit their best response. The judge then chooses a winner of the round based on the accuracy or hilarity of the card. The judge then changes to the person on your left, and so on until one player wins five situations and is deemed the winner of the game. Enjoy this hysterical game that gives people an insight into the wonderful world of roleplaying and its endless possibilities.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Player Judge, Turn Order: Progressive, Voting

name: Oxi Day
description:
In the wee hours of the morning of October 28th, 1940 Benito Mussolini, representing the Fascist party that had overthrown the Italian government, offered an ultimatum to Greece to submit to their authority. This demand contained a long list of capitulations including allowing Axis forces to enter and occupy fundamentally any "strategic location" they felt was appropriate.
Summoning his inner Leonidas, Prime Minister Ioannis Metaxas' apocryphal response to the litany of demands was simply "Οχι" ... No.

The scenario is designed to represent the battle as a skirmish at 1 figure:1,000 men, for QILS rules using 25mm or 28mm figures on 1” bases. Fifteen millimeter figures on 3/4” bases can be used by using centimeters instead of inches.
And of course, instead of skirmish figures you could use 6mm or 3mm figures on 1" bases.
The scenario makes a small board that is nice for games in more restricted environs, while still capturing the top level command challenge.
The troops are specified for our free QILS skirmish rules. Guidelines are provided to convert to other systems.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Signal: Unplugged
description:
'Rinko', the best engineer in Folder Building.

'Rinko' assembles puzzle parts to create the ultimate robot.

To complete the robot, you need to find the parts in the folder room.

Let's take part in the algorithmic parade of the computer city.


How do computers work? 'Signal'


means conveying or commanding information about specific content through signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, etc.

Collect puzzle pieces by executing commands sequentially.
Or, if necessary, repeat and program to fix the problem.

<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to quickly match the puzzle by finding the puzzle piece that fits in the blank space of the puzzle.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board plate and do not let the parts pieces face down.

<Game play>
1. You have to find the puzzle pieces that match your own color. To get the pieces of the puzzle like this, you need to use a special icon drawn on the dice.
2. Use the (Go straight), (Rotate left), (Rotate right), and (Repeat) icons to move your robot to find the piece.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one of the players completes the puzzle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Induction, Movement Points, Resource to Move

name: Yowon12: Unplugged
description:
Clever mentor'Jolly' With the help of Mir, Jolie deploys agents and checks computer functions to stabilize the computer city.
Let's explore computer terms and functions with Jolie.


What terms do you need to know to get acquainted with computers?


When using computers we come across a lot of terms.
There are also many interesting stories from the origins of computer terms.
Let's get acquainted with the computer terminology while playing a fun unplugged game with 12 agents.


cookie-It is derived from the fairy tale of Hansel and Gretel, and helps to keep the information of the sites you visited and came out of, as if you had sprinkled a piece of cookie and followed it to the house.



bug-An error occurred in the computer, and when we analyzed the cause, it was caused by a moth that entered the computer.


<Purpose of the game>
1. You have to store a lot of your cards in the storage.

<Game ready>
1. Prepare 2 board plates (memory plates).
2. On the back of each card draw 12 cards of the same color.
3. Shuffle the cards you have, place them on the front deck, and draw 3 to check.

<Game play>
1. The first player chooses 1 out of 3 cards and boards it on 1 slot (memory).
2. The next player is also placed on the board (memory) he wishes to place on his turn.
3. While placing an agent card, try executing the abilities written on the card.
4. If the board (memory) is full like this, the cards in the blue box are backed up, and the cards in the yellow box are discarded.

<Game ends>
1. The game is over when all 12 agents have completed their role. Those with a lot of backed up data win.
(If the number of data is the same, the person who dumps less in the trash wins.)
mechanics: Action/Event, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Le Jeu du Centre Manche
description:
Le Jeu du Centre Manche is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of the Center Manche region, country of Saint-Lô, Coutances, Torigni...
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Fleet Battles: Tholian Master Starship Book
description:
Cadets, if a collar is added to the Neo-Tholian dreadnought, how do we identify the ship? No one knows except Cadet Granger? Very well, Cadet Granger.
If a Neo-Tholian dreadnought has a collar, then it is a Neo-Tholian heavy dreadnought.
Quite correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, study up on the collars by reading your copy of the Tholian Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The ninth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available.
It includes every Tholian and Neo-Tholian ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Tholian Holdfast. There is also information about the Tholians during the Early Years period when they first arrived in the Milky Way Galaxy.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Fleet Battles: Hydran Master Starship Book
description:
Sir! What is that? It looks like a bug-eyed monster and I don’t recognize its ship!
Cadet, after this simulation is over, you will return to your quarters and review the Hydran Master Starship Book. You will be tested on the ships tomorrow. And never, ever refer to the Hydrans as BEMs. Dismissed!

The second volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Hydran ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Hydran Kingdom. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Fleet Battles: Klingon Master Starship Book
description:
Cadet, there’s a Klingon ship approaching. What is it?
Sir, it is a D7 battlecruiser. Arming phasers on your command!
Cadet, that is the Overlord, a D7N diplomatic cruiser. Diplomats take a dim view of having phasers pointed at them or their ships. After this simulation is over, you will return to your quarters and review the Klingon Master Starship Book. Dismissed!

The third volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series is now available.
