It includes every Klingon ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Klingon Empire. Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Rus̄tiKo!!!
description:
Rus̄tiKo!!! is a game inspired by RisiKo!, with an Abruzzo theme.

Your farm vehicles must conquer your opponent's territories (exactly like RisiKo!'s tanks).

Cards portray typical items from Abruzzo, such as arrosticini (sheep-meat skewers), trabocchi (fishing machines), olive trees, the warrior of Capestrano, and so on.

There are 43 territories.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Star Fleet Battles: Romulan Master Starship Book
description:
Cadet, identify that Romulan ship which just uncloaked off our front shield!
Sir, that is a King Condor battleship. My copy of the Romulan Master Starship Book notes that it is conjectural. Should we try to escape to warn the Federation that it is not conjectural?
Well done, Cadet! Were this not a simulation, we would indeed do exactly that. However, since this is a simulation, let’s see if we can still carry out our mission.

The fourth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Romulan ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Romulan Star Empire. Romulans are especially challenging because of the history of the various great houses insisting on a particular design, the various stages of early versions of what would become the cloaking device, and the addition to their fleet of converted Klingon ships.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Fleet Battles: Lyran Master Starship Book
description:
Cadets, how did the Lyrans produce their Lion dreadnought? Anyone beside Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger.
Sir, it involved cutting a Tiger-class heavy cruiser in half and installing a new center section.
As usual, Cadet Granger is correct. The rest of you, study your Lyran Master Starship Book. It isn’t a paperweight, you know.

The fifth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Lyran ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and R1 units that are specific to the Lyran Star Empire. Lyrans are interesting because some ships were assigned to particular duchies. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Democratic Republic; those will be in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Go and Stop
description:
Agents scouting the computer city want to do a final system check before returning.

It detects the treasure signal, finds the error, and decides to come to the control room for debugging so that the system can operate normally.


How do you get your computer to work?


When we have the information we are curious about or want, the computer shows the results as we command them.
Computers do not do things based on their own judgment, but do things in order by human commands.
If the value of the path is wrong, it can be modified again.


The programmer gives the computer the correct command to do the job.



The computer (programmer) listens to the programmer's instructions and does the same.



Debugging corrects misuse or reprogramming.


<Purpose of the game>
1. Build teamwork and get 3 treasures quickly, starting with the enemy team.

<Game ready>
1. Spread the board and place the treasure tiles in your pocket and mix well.
2. Team up in pairs and pick up a pen.

Two-player play: One player plays the program and the other plays the programmer role.
4 player: 2vs2 team member structure, one player in the team takes on the role of the program and the other is the programmer.


<Game play>
1. The player in charge of the program holds the pen in the starting position (pear) and closes his eyes.
The programmer takes the treasure out of his pocket and checks his location.
2. The programmer gives instructions, and the program follows the instructions and draws a path with a pen. You can command up to 3 times, and you can only shout direction and Go, Stop.
3. Put a clockwise direction in front of Go to tell the computer the direction.
ex) Direction (★ Hour) + Go + Stop
4. If the computer is hit by an island, whale, or shark while running, the programmer stops the command and clears the path.

Correcting errors due to errors is called debugging.


5. When you find a clue, you switch roles.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when one team gets 3 clues, and the team that gets 3 first wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Pop Corn: Unplugged
description:
Agent 'Dogberg', preparing for a computer city reconnaissance, goes to the computer city, prepares popcorn to eat, and then contacts the routine. 'Dogbug' can't understand me. Let's help 'Dogbug' to help you understand the language.


How do computers represent information?


How can a computer know a person's language?
Computers use computer language to express data such as numbers and letters, or images such as photos and pictures.
1 on power on, 0 on power off, 1 for high dial tone, 0 for low dial tone. Like this, the computer can solve everything with two numbers, 0 and 1.

<Purpose of the game>
1. The sum of the numbers written on the popcorn must be greater than the other players.

<Game ready>
1. Save the information (popcorn) to your computer (pocket).
(Put the popcorn tiles in the pocket and shake to mix well.)
2. The cards are flipped over with the 0s visible and placed in ascending order from right to left.

<Game play>
1. The first player must take one less than the number of players from their pockets to fry them in the center of the table.
ex) If 4 players play, only 3 popcorn will be fried.
2. If it's fried in popcorn, flip the card over and make the number written on the popcorn first. Once you have made the number you see, you can shout "POP", then take the popcorn and place it in front of the card and wait a while.
3. If all the popcorn (information) is gone, make sure the popcorn you brought together and the binary card match. If it is right at this time, stack it next to it. If it is wrong, return the tile you brought, and return it from the number of tiles you have acquired.
4. When a new round begins, the player to the left in a clockwise direction starts the round with popcorn.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when there are no more popcorns to bounce, and a lot of people win by adding the number written to the total popcorn earned.

name: Star Fleet Battles: LDR Master Starship Book
description:
Sir! Lyran ship approaching!
Load photon torpedoes. Fire all phasers!
End simulation. Congratulations, cadets. You just started a war with the Lyran Democratic Republic, a neutral power. Go study your LDR Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The sixth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Lyran Democratic Republic ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships and general units that are specific to the Lyran Democratic Republic. The LDR has very specific information because it was such a small empire. There are no Y-ships as the LDR didn’t exist in that timeframe. (This book does not focus on ships from the Lyran Star Empire; those are in their own book.)

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Fleet Battles: Kzinti Master Starship Book
description:
Cadets, how do we know the Kzintis considered building a battleship? Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
They attempted and failed to build the large warp engines it would require. Simulations showed that the proximity of the engines would require extra shielding and the engines would be more vulnerable to damage.
You are correct, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Kzinti Master Starship Book. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The seventh volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Kzinti ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Kzinti Hegemony.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Star Fleet Battles: Gorn Master Starship Book
description:
Cadets, why do the Gorns have so many of what we consider to be “hybrid ships” such as the destroyer-battlecruiser? Anyone other than Cadet Granger? Yes, Cadet Granger?
The Gorn legislature is notoriously stingy so the Gorn Admiralty plans ahead and finds ways to make larger ships from smaller ones.
You are correct as always, Cadet Granger. The rest of you, go study your Gorn Master Starship Books. Quiz tomorrow. Dismissed!

The eighth volume in the long-anticipated Master Starship Book series. It includes every Gorn ship in Star Fleet Battles, including X-ships, Y-ships, and general units that are specific to the Gorn Confederation.

Every ship is illustrated. All updates, corrections, and errata have been added. The ships are in order (regardless of the product they came from) with the enhanced format listing detailed information in a consistent manner.

This book contains the descriptions of the ships, but no SSDs.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Zip
description:
'Jeep' checking the luggage of agents preparing to leave for computer city

Take a look at the size and weight of your luggage on the space board.
You are trying to pack it in the shape of a gear, but the luggage is too big to be packed.
Find the same pattern and reduce or compress it to pack a lot of capacity.


How to free up computer storage space?


If the amount of information is large compared to the limited storage space of the computer, the computer slows down and takes a long time to deliver.
In an efficient way, patterns can be simplified by coding when the same letter, number, etc. are repetitive.
Compression increases the storage space and speeds up the Internet.


Compression means removing empty spaces between data stored on your computer and coding it to simplify repetitive data.
Decompression means returning data to its original state.


<Purpose of the game>
1. The pile of tiles piled up by compression should be many and high.

<Game ready>
1. Arrange all the pattern tiles (data) in line with the board (computer capacity).
2. Each of them draws one mission tile (key keyword), checks it, and puts it face down so that it's hidden from opponents.

<Game play>
1. Select the pattern tile (data) you want to compress.
Ex: If there is more than one condition, information can be compressed. Shape, number, color, etc. It cannot be compressed diagonally.
2. A tile can only be moved once in a straight line in a horizontal or vertical direction if the conditions are met.
3. When compressing, you can compress by placing a pile on the tile, and you can compress by placing a tile on the pile.

<Game ends>
1. The game will end when compression is no longer possible.
The player with the most files on the mission card wins.

name: Le Jeu du Cotentin
description:
Le Jeu du Cotentin is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Cotentin.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Blocky Mountains: Schneller Aufstieg / Zeittraining Promo
description:
Promo-Card for Blocky Mountains, handed out by Noris Spiele at Spiel in Essen 2018.

One side has the track "Zeittraining" (German, "time training") with an exclusive route.

The other side contains the small expansion "Schneller Aufstieg" (German "fast ascent")

name: Stories
description:
Stories is a family-friendly game that is designed for 2-6 players, takes about 30 minutes per game, and ages 8 and older keep things flowing the smoothest. Be the first to assemble your stories into a winning combination while building connection and trust along the way.

To begin, shuffle the cards and randomly deal 5 cards to each player. The first player draws one card from the deck. They give one card to a player of their choice and read the story prompt. That player gives them one card back and reads the story prompt. Two stories are shared on each turn. Get rid of the stories that don't help you while searching for the stories you need. Play proceeds to the next player until someone wins by having a winning combination of cards. A winning combination may only contain one Wild Card.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition de Paris
description:
How well do you know Paris?
This edition is a way to know.
The questions are very specific and you have to have a good knowledge of the city.

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she/he can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Family Quizz: Football
description:
Family Quizz Foot is a trivia game about football: history, football techniques, supporters...


60 cards / 720 questions
6 difficulty levels
3 game modes
36 tokens
1 die


The winner is the first player to score 30 points

name: Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame
description:
Schneeballschlacht: Einsteiger-Wargame Snowball fight - entry-level wargame.

Schneeballschlacht - Snowball Fight is a simple tabletop wargame without a “war” and is therefore ideally suited for young wargamers to get their feet wet.

3-10 minis per player - 25-40mm

name: History of Quidditch
description:
Quidditch is played by children on broomsticks in the back apple orchard, by teams of students at wizarding schools, and by professional athletes whose exploits are followed avidly al over the world. Amazing, right?

Well, now anyone (even Muggles!) can play Quidditch at home with History of Quidditch - The Miniatures Game, which is a card and miniatures game played by 2 or more opposing coaches that replicates the speed and danger of Quidditch on a pitch (board/mat) that plays in a little over an hour.

So grab a pint of butterbeer and shake hands with your opponent. Take a seat and meet your team. Get ready to experience Quidditch like never before!

—description from the designer

name: Fútbol Base
description:
Fútbol Base is the board game with which you can experience football as a coach and a player at the same time.

Choose the Football 11 or Football 8 board for your games and design the best formation against your opponent.
Improve your technique and aim on the practise field and enjoy your evolution as a player.

With Football Base live all the passion of football without leaving home.

Rules:

Place the players with the formation of your choice (4-3-3 / 5-3-2 / 4-4-2, etc.).
Put the ball in play...
The side in possession of the ball is the one closest to the ball. (or whoever the referee says so)
A player can only have two consecutive touches of the ball. And the maximum number of touches of the ball per area is 4.
Shooting at goal is allowed only in the shooting area
When the player in possession prepares to pass or shoot, the defender can only move 1 player to try hinder her/him
The player formation can only be altered when the game is stopped (ball out of play)
If a player shoots and knocks down an opponent it is a foul; On a forward, a penalty is given.
Shooting or passing is only valid if hit with your hand on the player.
There can be three changes plus the goalkeeper.
Games last 40 minutes. Plus extra time or penalty shootout if needed.

name: Dung: Unplugged
description:
Agents browse folders to find information.

Searching sequentially from problem 1, sometimes splitting into sections, sometimes using a hash table...
But... I don't see the dunk.


Computer Science Principles-Explore/Search


Computers store a lot of data. When it is necessary to find the information you want, it searches, but the computer outputs it according to various condition search methods. This requires command and judgment, and uses effective methods to quickly find data while classifying or selecting data. Alternatively, you can use search keys such as words, numbers, names, addresses, barcodes, and QR codes to let the computer find the information you are looking for.

<Purpose of the game>
1. Match the number of cards on your head strap and collect 3 cards.

<Game ready>
1. Each player tie a headband to his forehead.
2. Each player attaches 1 card to the headband. At this time, you should not know the contents of the card. Then take the recording paper.

<Game play>
1. You can ask questions once at a time.
Ex) card (17)
Question: Is it less than 20?
Answer: yes
2. The player who hears this answer writes.
Ex) card (17)
-The number of cards is less than "20". So my card is above the number "20".
3. Ask questions one by one, and when the correct answer comes up, place the card in front of you and insert a new card into your forehead.
4. If the answer is not correct, place the card without checking it and attach a new card to the headband without checking it yourself.

<Game ends>
- If someone collects 3 cards, the game ends and that person wins.

name: War of the Realms
description:
War of the Realms is an asymmetric, tactical card game for two players that embraces RTS and TBS games from the past with nostalgic pixel art!

In the game, cards can be played by discarding required number of other cards from hand. Units can be sent to attack enemy realm or defend the player's own realm. The player can also build structures, play events or play upgrade cards. The player can also upgrade their realm, if required cards for next level are in play.

The combat is resolved with dice rolls. After dice result and modifiers are added, the result is compared to an enemy’s armor values. Then the corresponding damage is inflicted.

The game ends if a player destroys an opponent's realm. Alternatively, the game can be won if a realm is upgraded to level 3.

—description from the designer

name: That's it!: Which do you like?
description:
Everyone likes different things, sees things differently.
Can you pick a theme, then split everyone evenly?
Get them to choose exactly 50/50 to score points!
Let’s find out what they really like!
You can play at Online, and you can play with the listeners with the Streaming site.

Each player has one Voting card.
You can see A and B at face-up.

The turn player reads the top of the Topic card.
For example, the Italian food.

The turn player makes two selection.
A: Arrabbiata
B: Seafood pizza

Each player included in the turn player votes A or B secretly, and open all at once. *You cannot take a lie.

If 50/50, the turn player takes the Topic card as a score point.

At the end of the game, the winner is the player with the highest points.

You will know the secret liking of the players.

—description from the designer

name: That's it!: Deep – Which do you like?
description:
Everyone likes different things, sees things differently.
Can you pick a theme, then split everyone evenly?
Get them to choose exactly 50/50 to score points!
Let’s find out what they really like!

You can play online, or with listeners on the streaming site.

This game is only for Japanese OTAKU. Because of many Japanese idioms and similar in the game, this edition will not be translated into English, and is only available in Japanese.

Each player has one Voting card, with an A on one side, and B on the other.

The lead player reads the top of the topic card for example, Animation. They then make two selections, for example A: Dragon Ball or B: One Piece.

Each player included in the round then votes A or B secretly, and all votes are revealed at once. Players may not lie about their selections.

If the votes are 50/50, the lead player takes the topic card and scores a point.

At the end of the game, the winner is the player with the most points.

You will all learn what the secret likings of the players are!

name: Pota Star
description:
Potato Country has a lot of nice and unique potatoes, but they all dream of becoming the best star Potato.

Known to rise and fall in value with the weather, potatoes can grow into the best star potatoes by carefully managing them as the weather changes throughout the week.

Could your potato be the best star?

<Purpose of the game>
1. Out of the 7 character potatoes, the player who gets the most points by devising a strategy to reach the highest score for the potato he supports wins.

<Game play>
1. Place each potato character in position 0 on the board.
2. All players take 7 Weather Cards per color.
3. Shuffle the'Porta Star' candidate registration card and divide it into two. At this time, the character card taken once cannot be replac
4. Check the character card and turn it over.
5. Declare one, two, three and place the weather card face down.
6. Play the cards laid out in order of play.
7. Move the character according to the weather indicated on the card. At this time, you need to move the number of cards and the number of moving spaces at once.
8. When all players finish applying the effect according to the card, turn clockwise to play the game.

<Game ends>
1. The game ends when all weather cards are used. Reveal the character card and calculate the score. If there are 2 same characters, the score is doubled. However, if there are 2 in the minus, it is minus 2 times. The player with the highest score wins by adding up the scores of each character he has.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Variable Set-up

name: BEASTORY
description:
Be a story.
BEASTORY.

Your are a party of beasts who much travel deep into the Emerald Forest to defeat the unknown. Can you survive? If you risk too much by going too far into the forest you can lose your life. Search for items and upgrade your skills along the way.

This is a cooperative RPG style board game, where players play beast character like a monkey who wields a short sword, a bear with an axe.

In the game there is a :
Preparation phase
Event phase
- In the Event phase there will be either an: Action phase & Chance phase
OR a Battle phase
Standby phase
Boss phase which occurs on your 5th day in the forest
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Role Playing

name: Visitor In Blackwood Grove: Promo Pack
description:
Five card promotional card pack. No instructions included.

The cards have illustrations of:
- a gold ring
- a police box (the T.A.R.D.I.S.?)
- a light saber
- a winged octopus
- two young women
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Pretty Little Liars: Untold Secrets Game
description: Everyone has secrets, even you! Players travel the board, answer questions about the show, and unravel secrets about each other! Over 500 questions will keep you guessing, but the most fun is when you look in the secrets box and find and reveal secrets about other players!

name: Flummox your Zombies
description:
Your house is being overrun with zombies. They will come after you one after the other. Defend yourself with whatever is in arm’s reach. It could be a bowling ball or dinner or your own booger. Help each other or play every person for themselves. Defend yourself or be overrun.

Flummox your Zombies takes some strategy that might be difficult for younger players, but adults and players 10+ may help younger players. You may play as teams or as individuals. You may trade weapon cards to help each other or keep the weapons for yourself. Zombie Flummox is a card game with 6 different types of zombie cards and 10 different types of weapon cards.
Each round a player will draw 1 zombie card and 1 weapon card. Use the weapon cards to kill or delay the advancing zombies. The use of each weapon and which zombie it effects is described on the weapon card. Tracking sheets will be included to help you keep track of the number of rounds until a zombie reaches you.

The zombie cards vary in strengths and the zombies have a certain amount of rounds before they reach you. You are out of the game when they reach you.

—description from the designer

name: Kingdom of Cards
description:
The year is 630 AD, Medieval times. You need to attack other kingdoms and have the kneel before you while defending your own from enemy attacks. Recruit brave knights and assassins to crush your enemies. Get priests and peasants into your kingdom to expand faster. But don't lose your king or your kingdom will crumble before your very eyes.

At the start of the game, each player starts with a king card in their hand. If you lose your king card you are out of the game. You have to play cards to force others to lose their king. Some cards may help you to gain cards and other cards may be used to deplete your opponents cards.

Certain types of cards can be used to battle against other people. You can use Horsemen, Knights, Guards, Squires and even Peasants to attack and defend your kingdom. If you play enough cards, your opponent will have to discard 3 cards. Other players can join in the battle by playing their battle cards during a battle onto either player's side.

Envoy cards like the assassin, thief, imposter, baron and strategist have effects that involve taking a random card from an opponent’s hand. If you choose the right card you get a good effect. Barons and strategists have good effects for both players. assassins, thieves and imposters have negative effects for the other player. Your opponent won't know what card you used until you take one of their cards. But they can chose the guard against you if you want to play and envoy card. By playing guards, they can check cards in your hand for assassins, thieves and imposters. But if they check your barons or strategists, they will have to discard their guards.

You have to convince your opponent not to guard against you in order to play assassins, thieves and imposters or you can trick them into guarding against your barons or strategists to make them lose their guards.

By having power points, you can expand your kingdoms even faster. For every 5 power points you have at the start of your turn, you can draw an extra card. Power points allow you to gain cards faster quickly turning you into a dominating force. Cards like Peasants, Priests, Princesses and Princes will give you power points.

When all the players have lost their king cards the last player left is the winner!

—description from the designer

name: おかしなおちゃかい (Okashina Ochakai)
description:
In おかしなおちゃかい (Okashina Ochakai), players compete in two teams of 2 players each. It is a trick-taking game in which players are not dealt a hand of cards, but will draw them one at a time from an initial hand. The cards show the expected suit and rank on the front, and some cards also show a point value (positive or negative.) All cards show their suit on the back, and if a card is worth points, that is indicated with a symbol.

When a player picks up a card to add it to their eventual hand for the round, they can choose to have it face themselves or the other players. If it faces the other players, the card drawer's team earns a resource which may later allow that team to play cards from each others hands.

Points are scored by the presence of certain cards in tricks and the first team to 30 points wins.

name: Artifacts on Track
description:
''Artifacts on Track is a conceptual scavenger hunt.

Build a track from interlocking letter tiles. Reveal five artifacts. Roll one die. Move your meeple to a letter that matches any one of those artifacts’ attributes’ first letter. Collect the artifact. For example, [SUN] matches S(un) R(ound) H(ot) Y(ellow) U(niverse). Collect the most artifacts to win the game. Simultaneous game play means no waiting for other players. Fast-paced fun. Conceptual symbol interpretation for all ages.

—description from the designer

name: Victory at Sea: Regia Marina Fleet
description:
At the time of Italy’s entry into World War Two, she possessed a modern and – on paper at least – highly effective fleet. Four battleships and eight heavy cruisers were available, with three more battleships being fitted out. However, there were no aircraft carriers (initially), not least because the Regia Marina was intended to operate near to friendly air bases in Italy and Africa.

As might be expected from a force operating among the islands of the Mediterranean, light forces were quite numerous, including 14 light cruisers, 128 destroyers and 62 motor torpedo boats, which was a weapon favoured by the Italians and well suited to local conditions. No less than 115 submarines were available. The main Italian naval base was at Taranto, home of the battleship force. Lighter groups were based out of ports on the Italian mainland, Sicily and the Red Sea.

The Regia Marina was primarily tasked with interrupting British logistics and trade through the Mediterranean, and with keeping the Axis nations’ links to North Africa open. Major actions with the Royal Navy were not desirable nor really necessary for this mission to be carried out.

Contents:
1 Aquila-class Carrier - Aquila
1 Conte di Cavour-class Battleship - Conte di Cavour 1940
1 Etna-class cruiser - Etna 1942
1 Zara-class cruiser - Pola 1940
1 Luigi Cadorna-class cruiser - Luigi Cadorna 1940
3 Navigatori-class Destroyers
4 Torpedo-Bomber Aircraft - Reggiane RE.2001 Falco II
Ship Cards & Damage Sliders
Assembly Instructions

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Vittorio Veneto
description:
The Littorio class was the first new Italian battleship class for nearly a decade when design work began in 1930. Initially designed to remain within the 35,000-ton Washington Treaty limit, the final displacement was just over 40,000 tons. As well as being good-looking ships, the Littorio-class included a number of new features including high-velocity guns. They were probably the first of the ‘fast battleships’ that would come to dominate capital ship design in the late 1930s and onward.

Vittorio Veneto saw extensive service in World War Two, participating in the Battles of Cape Spartivento in November 1940 and Cape Matapan in March 1941. Though struck by a torpedo at this latter engagement and again later courtesy of a British submarine, she would escape unscathed from the British raid on Taranto of November 1940. 1941 and early 1942 was spent attempting to attack British convoys en route to Malta, until fuel shortages forced the end of such activity. In the armistice of 1943, she was surrendered to the Allies after Italy withdrew from the war, spending the next three years under British control in Egypt. Thereafter she was allocated to Britain as a war prize and was scrapped.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Regia Marina Submarines & MTB sections
description:
Submarines: Compared to a German Type VII C submarine, the Marcello-class were much larger, displacing 1,060 tons versus 769. Speed and range between the two classes were almost similar, but the Marcello-class had more torpedo tubes than the famous U-Boat. The Marcello-class should be considered one of the most successful produced by the Italian shipyards and showed very good qualities – being fast, structurally robust and relatively manoeuvrable.

MTBs: Capable of 45 knots, the Italian Motoscafo Armato Silurante (Armed Torpedo Boat) or MAS Boats were extremely active in the Mediterranean theatre. Though they were not well suited to rougher seas, they still achieved a great deal of note, including the torpedoing of HMS Capetown and an attack on the harbour of Malta, though the latter was a failure that cost two MAS Boats.

Based on German S1 class S-Boats the Italians found in the port of Cattaro in Yugoslavia, the MS Boat was larger and far more seaworthy than the MAS designs. Though not as fast, it was far better suited to long range patrols in the Mediterranean being more stable and more comfortable. It was an MS Boat that sank the largest vessel of any MTB in the war, HMS Manchester, in 1942.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Unity: Battlefield Medics of Unified Space for Renegade Scout 2nd Edition
description:
The third supplement for Renegade Scout 2nd edition focuses on battlefield medical personnel, allowing you to both add a specialist medic to your squads, as well as employ medical personalities.

As always, a bit of background information is provided as well as new army list entries and two new Skills.

The "..of Unified Space" series is intending to be a series of small, bite-sized expansions for Renegade Scout 2nd edition', adding new content and options to the game system, expanding the universe and generally increasing the amount of fun to be had.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ユリゲラ (Uri Geller)
description: In ユリゲラ (Uri Geller), player compete in a world tournament to demonstrate their supernatural powers by bending spoons with their psychic abilities. Aim for the championship, while being careful not to bend the spoon too much and be suspected of being nothing more than a magician!

name: USA Xpert
description:
USA-Xpert is a combined alignment and guessing game with collector cards to better know each state of the USA. The principle is simple. From a card which shows a flag, you have first to guess either its capital or main city. Then you place the card in a line, ranking by area or population (your choice). If you loose, you get more cards to get rid off. With USA-Xpert, learn all states' capital, largest city, motto, nickname, abbreviation, great seal and flag and quiz your family and friends.

—description from the designer

name: Monsterkantine
description:
It's feeding time in the monster canteen!

In this fast-paced logic game, only the one who gets fed up with all the monsters wins - faster than the other players. That sounds easier than it is. Because every monster has its own preferences - and intolerances!

Every turn each player reveals the top card of their pile and puts it in the middle of the table. Now they have to think fast and put their plate on the card that shows the monster or item that will be left over after everybody has been eating. To decide on who will be left over there are 5 eating rules the players have to know. Who can keep track of everything and tell who will be left over? Often the strongest monster consumes the weaker ones, but sometimes even a hungry umbrella will use its chance to consume a monster...

The player that was the fastest to choose the right monster or food wins the round and collects the revealed cards as victory points. The game ends when you played through the whole card deck.

-description from designer

name: Four Tribes: Upgrade Kit
description:
The Four Tribes: Upgrade Kit allows those who own the original Game Crafter version of Four Tribes to upgrade to the Library Edition of the game. This includes the following:


A redesigned box that is twice as big, much sturdier than the original and skinned in new artwork
A 16 page full-color instruction booklet replacing the original folded instruction sheet
Adds 6 all-new winter village cards that add about 5-10 minutes to game time
Adds the Fire mini expansion (6 new cards)
Adds the Flood mini expansion (6 new cards)
Adds 2 additional Long House cards (one for each player to house influenced village elders)



NOTE: This kit upgrades the Four Tribes (English second edition) to the Four Tribes: Library Edition.

name: Magic Creatures
description:
Magic Creatures is a card game designed for up to 7 players, age 6 and older. The deck consists of 70 cards. 20 of these cards are “Magic Cards”. The other 50 cards are gameplay cards.

The magic cards either have a creature and value on one side that gives the card bearer a Skeleton with a “Damage Boost” point value, or a Ghost with a “Health Boost” point value. The gameplay cards consist of five distinct “suits”, with ten cards in each suit. Each card within each suit displays the suit type, signified by a “Magic Creature” and a point value for “Damage”, as well as a point value for “Health”. The point values for damage and health vary from one card to the next, even within the same suit.

The Magic Cards are shuffled and placed face down in a stack on the table. The gameplay cards are shuffled and dealt to the players. Each player is dealt one card at a time, face down, for a maximum of ten cards per player. The youngest player goes first and gameplay continues rotating from one player to the next in a clockwise direction.

Players take turns using the gameplay cards in their hands and the Magic Cards on the table to "attack" other players. The damage and health values on the cards are used to determine the winner. The loser of an attempted attack loses his/her gameplay card. The last player with gameplay cards remaining in their hand wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Math, Mythology, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Kill Steal, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Civilizations Collide: The Wars of the Aztecs, the Inca, the Maya, and the Conquistadores – A Supplement for Feudal Patrol
description:
Civilizations Collide supplement roughly covers the period of the Spanish Conquest of the 16th Century.

This supplement is designed to allow the players to recreate battles both during the Conquest –and in the centuries before it happened.

Optional and special rules are covered first, then weapons, figure and unit characteristics, and a couple of suggested scenarios.

- description from rules supplement

name: And Then Monsters
description:
You and your crew are on a mission manning an experimental ship to prove that alternate realities exist. The ship malfunctions and crashes on an unknown planet in an unknown galaxy in an unknown reality full of ferocious monsters.
Each player takes control of a hero trying to defend against an endless swarm of monsters, all while repairing the downed ship. Players each roll 5 dice at the start of every round that can be spent to perform actions such as moving, searching, gaining XP, and attacking. They also have a unique starting ability that changes gameplay for that player from the very beginning.

The face of a die only affects searching and attacking, though there are many ways to manipulate the dice keeping randomness at a minimum. There are also several free actions that do not require spending dice, giving players a large variety of choice and wildly-varying turns.

Along with the 6 unique heroes to choose from, each hero also has their own 6-card deck of Level Up cards. Only 3 of these cards are used each game, providing a unique experience even when playing as the same hero multiple times.

Monsters spawn onto the board and are trying to get to the ship to destroy it once and for all. Monsters are on cards which have die faces on them acting as their HP. To attack these creatures, players spend the matching dice to damage or defeat the monster. At the beginning of the game, the monsters only have 2 HP. However, as the game progresses the monsters get increasingly difficult with more HP for each beast. Players may want to gain XP and level up their heroes to combat these stronger baddies.

The monsters are attracted to the smell of leaking oil coming from the ship. To prevent more monsters from spawning, players will want to contribute scrap metal to the middle of the board each round to plug the leak. Although, while searching for more metal, heroes may uncover a boss monster who is the fiercest of them all.

The ship has 4 damaged rooms that must be repaired. Players will find ship parts for each room by searching different locations. Once a ship part is brought back to the ship, players choose what section of the matching room they wish to repair, providing a one-time ability and giving more freedom of choice. Each room also an alternative side of one-time abilities which can be chosen or selected at random during setup, offering more replayability.

Once the heroes have repaired the ship, cleared the area of monsters, and everyone is on board, they can take-off and return home. Dice manipulation, as well as most actions not requiring specific dice, leaves players with the difficult decision of whether to attack, search, repair, gain XP, etc. rather than focusing on getting the best roll. The many different strategies to victory, along with the unique heroes and setup, provides a one-of-a-kind experience with each play.

It was all going so well… and then monsters showed up.

-description from designer

name: もっとも桃太郎なのはもちろん俺！(Mottomo Momotaro nanowa Mochiron Ore)
description:
"Mottomo Momotarō nanowa Mochiron Ore!" translates roughly to “Make no Mistake, I’m the Most Momotaro!”.
 
Momotarō is a famous hero from Japanese legend but recently there’s been an influx in Momotarō imposters.

  In order to prove he is the real Momotarō, Momotarō needs to gather up his old traveling buddies. Just who really is the genuine Momotarō?   

A light set collection game featuring 14 cute characters and easy-to-grasp rules. The first player to gather dog, monkey and pheasant wins the game!

There are two types of cards: items and friends. Each card has a Momotarō-ness score in the top left corner, as well an effect.

During each turn of the game, a player may chose to either (A) draw & play a card, (B) use a Kibidango chip, or (C) pass.

 If the player chooses A:
 After drawing a card from the stack they will proceed to place one card face up from his or her hand. This card will belong to the player unless another player takes it using (B). In addition, the effect of the card can be used.

  If the player chooses B: 
The player should declare their use of the Kibidango chip and put the chip into the disposal pile. He or she can then chose one friend card from a single opponent’s exposed cards. In addition, the effect of the stolen card may be used.  

Note: You may not choose action B if the player in front of you has just used a chip on his or her turn. Chips also cannot be used if the card stack is empty.  

If the player chooses C:
 Nothing happens.

  The first player to collect the friend cards of dog, monkey, and pheasant wins. Alternatively, there is also a wild card that can be used to replace one of these three animals to win.

  When all players have empty hands and no one has been able to collect dog, monkey, and pheasant, use the total Momotarō-ness score of all the cards that belong to a player (placed in front of them) to determine the winner. If there is a tie, the player with the most friend cards wins. If there is still a tie, both players are the winners.

name: Be The Greatest Soccer Board Game
description:
You start as a raw talent, a soccer player of unspecified club, gender, race or nation.

Live the footballer's lifestyle and build form by winning matches, gain ability on the training pitch, accumulate wealth and seek fame in the media.

Get help from in-game friends, train hard and stay injury free, meet the press, use tactics to win matches and take some time out to relax before advancing your career.

Use your gravitas to gain promotion to higher reputation levels and be a star player.

Become the G.O.A.T. The Greatest Of All Time.'

—description from the designer

name: Manen Tur-Retur
description:
Manen Tur-Retur is a large Swedish space race game to the moon and back. The winner is the first to return to Earth.

Playing pieces move by roll of a dice and proceed first to a space station before reaching the moon. Players trek across the moon surface before returning to Earth via the Space station.

Along the path players can take detours, be delayed or struck by meteors.

—user summary

name: パズールレーン (Pazur Lane)
description:
パズールレーン (Pazur Lane) is a card game from Japan based on fanfic of the mobile game Azure Lane.

The players compete to become the best commander. Play Warship cards from your hand to add team members and perform various actions.

Line up the cards you play in front of you in the order of playing them. The cards of the same color (faction) or number will be combined when placed adjacent to each other. When the 3 cards are combined, the 2 cards on top are dispatched. Contribute to the battle in this way by sending your ships into the battlefield.

At the end of the game, the players receive medals based on the ranking of the different color forces dispatched into the battlefields. The player who collects the most medals wins.

※アズールレーン（スマホゲーム）の二次創作ゲームです。
最高の指揮官を目指して競いましょう。
艦(カード)を手札から自分の前に出すことで新たな仲間を増やしたり、特定のアクションを実行できます。自分の前に出したカードは使った順に並べていきますが、色(陣営)か数字が同じカードは隣接すると合体します。３枚合体すると上の２枚が出撃します。こうして戦場に艦を送り込むことで戦いに貢献しましょう。ゲーム終了時、色別で見て、戦場に送り込んだ戦力の順位に応じた勲章を受け取ります。最も勲章を集めたプレイヤーが勝利します。
publisher's summary

name: Family Treedition
description:
Description from Washington Post, January 21, 1982:

My mother's sister is my aunt--20 points; my autn's neice is me--30 points; but then again, she could be my sister or my cousin, and my grandmother's cousin is my . . . what?

Weaving through the genealogy of who begat whom on the family tree has become a new card game called "Family Treedition," created by Mildred Davidson Austin Smith, an active community volunteer and former opera singer from Northwest.

Smith said she designed the game as a "way to get back in touch with the family," and as an inexpensive form of family entertainment.

The object of the genealogy game is to earn points by placing on a board three cards from your hand that represent a correct relationship between blood relatives. For example, "my father's first cousin is my second cousin."

The deck's 64 cards represent everyone from great-grandmother to third cousin. Of course, there are a few wild cards, to get you out of tight spots. The figures on the cards have what Smith calls Egyptian-like, angular features. These, she said, are universal faces.
Smith said she started working on the game in 1975, "even before Roots came on television." It seemed simple, she said, until she realized there are hundreds of possible combinations of relatives.

Smith obtained a patent on "Family Treedition" two years ago. She paid a printer to produce 100 copies of the game last October and has sold them all, many as Christmas gifts. Another 500 copies are on the way for $14.95 each. The game can be purchased from Smith, or through Stanley 5 & 10 Cent Stores in Brookland.

name: Battleships Armada: Unity Edition
description:
Captain, that ship is huge!
Steady on! While the Klingon B10 Invincible is huge, we have enough ships to bring her down.

The most powerful ships in the galaxy have been unleashed and are now free to rain havoc upon their enemies.

The Klingons have set loose the B10 battleship Invincible upon Federation colonies. The Invincible is supported by C5 light dreadnoughts and C10 heavy super-dreadnoughts. The Federation has sent in its fleet with the battleship USS Mars at the head. It is also supported by dreadnoughts. These titans of war will clash, and who knows what will happen when they do.

There are over 60 starships, adding battleships, dreadnoughts, transports, and tugs to your fleets. There are also nine starbases to add more defenses to your systems. These are for the Federation, Gorn, Hydran, Klingon, Kzinti, Lyran, Romulan, Seltorian, and Tholian empires. The WYNs are not neglected as they get their light tactical transport with and without cargo pods.

This book is an expansion. You must have Klingon Armada Unity or Romulan Armada Unity. Play will be enhanced with the Starmada Unity Rulebook.

This edition unifies the previous Nova and Admiralty editions, so there will no longer be Starmada fans who cannot game together. The new rules preserve the best of both previous systems and add dynamic seeking weapons rules that do what seeking weapons are supposed to do: force the enemy to move out of key areas or shoot his way through a swarm of them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Super Bluff
description:
The aim of the game is not only to play the cards cleverly, but also to bluff so that the bars bend. Whoever can lay down all his cards first, wins.

—user summary

name: Super Zock
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first to discard all cards. For this purpose, each player whose turn it is may play one or more matching cards, i.e. discard a card that comes next in the sequence of numbers on one or more of the 4 discard piles: on a 3, the 4, etc. After the 13 comes again the one, etc.

—user summary

name: Alien Armada: Unity Edition
description:
Dangerous New Enemies on Scanners!

New factions meet as Starmada joins the Star Fleet Universe. Alien Armada was done as a joint venture between Amarillo Design Bureau and Majestic Twelve Games. This 84-page rulebook includes the Tholians (with their deadly webs), the Neo-Tholians (you thought the Tholians were bad?), the Seltorians (the faction that threw the Tholians out of the M81 Galaxy and now they are here on a holy crusade of extermination of the Tholians), and many more ships for the Orion Pirates.

There are over 40 starships including the Tholian dreadnought, war cruiser, web tender, command cruiser, and heavy webcruiser; the Neo-Tholian dreadnought, heavy cruiser, light cruiser, destroyer, and frigate; the Seltorian dreadnought, heavy battlecruiser, heavy cruiser, destroyer, frigate, new heavy cruiser, and light dreadnought; the Orion Battle Raider, war destroyer, battlecruiser, heavy battlecruiser, Double Raider, Slaver, Free Traitor, heavy cruiser, dreadnought, and OK6; police ships for the Gorns, Romulans, and Kzintis; and many other ships.

But it isn’t just about the ships. There are terrain rules for asteroids, planets, black holes, dust clouds and nebulas. And of course there are new weapons: web casters, webs, web breakers, and shield crackers.

This book is an expansion. You must have Klingon Armada Unity or Romulan Armada Unity. Play will be enhanced with the Starmada Core Rules.

This edition unifies the previous Nova and Admiralty editions, so there will no longer be Starmada fans who cannot game together. The new rules preserve the best of both previous systems, and add dynamic seeking weapons rules that do what seeking weapons are supposed to do: force the enemy to move out of key areas or shoot his way through a swarm of drones.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Distant Armada: Unity Edition
description:
Captain, what's that strange sphere?
I don't know, but all hands brace for impact!

On the far side of the Klingon Empire are more kingdoms and empires with strange and deadly new technologies.

New factions meet as Starmada joins the Star Fleet Universe. Distant Armada Unity was done as a joint venture between Amarillo Design Bureau and Majestic Twelve Games. This 84-page rulebook includes the Lyrans (allies of the Klingons), the Hydrans (how many fighters did they just launch?), the WYNs (safely hidden behind a shield of intense energy), and the Lyran Democratic Republic (a breakaway county of the Lyrans).

There are over 50 starships. There are five new weapons: fusion beam, hellbore cannon, expanding sphere generator, Stinger fighter, and Gatling phaser. Pass through the WYN Radiation Zone … if you dare!

This book is an expansion. You must have Klingon Armada Unity or Romulan Armada Unity. Play will be enhanced with the Starmada Core Rules.

This edition unifies the previous Nova and Admiralty editions, so there will no longer be Starmada fans who cannot game together. The new rules preserve the best of both previous systems, and add dynamic seeking weapons rules that do what seeking weapons are supposed to do: force the enemy to move out of key areas or shoot his way through a swarm of them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: HERO: Quest For the Most Heroic
description:
HERO: Quest for the most heroic.

In HERO, players take the roles of adventurers who embarked on a quest to become a hero of The Land of Lacuna. Lacuna is a rugged land filled with opportunity, a brave adventurer can prove themselves by completing quests, defeating foes, from goblins to fearsome ogres, farming cattle, fishing, trading, sinking pirate ships and more. Each player assembles and equips their own army, hiring various warriors from archers to knights to the powerful wizard. All of them have one goal in mind: to become the most heroic!

HERO is a deck-building board game. Each player starts with the same combination of cards – this is your deck. You then use the cards to move your army, fight battles, complete tasks and to purchase new and better cards. These new cards are added to your deck to improve it, allowing you to adventure further, and face tougher foes.

The game ends when the last 'Event' card has been completed, all players add up their acquired tokens to find out who is the most heroic.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: サメマン (Same-man)
description:
サメマン (Same-man), meaning Shark-Man, is a hidden identity card game from Japan.

Using multiple-choice questions with 3 choices, try to deduce the identity of the Dolphins disguised as humans to smuggle themselves into our society. Presumably, there is no way for dolphins to know how we think and reach the right answer determined by majority vote! However,
if the Dolphins manages to guess the answer correctly, the human race is to be wiped out. If that happens, pray to our shark hero Same-man. They should be able to fight off the Dolphins.

人間の皮を被り社会に入り込んだイルカを三択問題で炙り出しましょう。イルカに人の心、つまり多数決の正解が分かるはずがないのです！しかし正解をイルカに当てられてしまった時には人類は全滅です。そんな時はサメのヒーローサメマンに祈りましょう。イルカを撃退してくれるはずです
publisher's summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles, Voting

name: NomadSed
description:
NomadSed is a strategic board game where players assume the role of nomadic herders and try to increase their livestock capital. They have to make decisions that do not only depend on the state of the pastures, but also on daily challenges related to life in the steppe. At times, it makes sense to invest money and buy extra fodder; at others, sheep have to be sold at the market; and sometimes, cooperating with your neighbours is the best choice.

The players’ goal is to obtain as many animals and as much cash as possible. In the end, it will be seen whether this is best achieved by exploiting the lands or through considerate resource utilisation.

The players possess livestock herds, monetary resources, rangelands, and their own labour force which is expressed in action points. Not all pastures on the board are equally productive: fertile grasslands, as well as barren steppes, provide the dietary staples for the animals, and both are easily exhausted. Herd mobility is therefore vital.
Moreover, the players have various options for action so they can persist in the face of external adversities and prevail against the others. At the market, they may buy fodder, sell part of their livestock, or purchase additional animals. Development cards open up new options and alternative income sources.

The challenges faced by nomads are considerable. Year after year, they have to cope with different types of unexpected events. Recurrent external influences, whether local (drought, snowstorms, illness, legislation) or global in nature (price increases in animal fodder), determine their scopes of action. Only those who are flexible enough will prevail in the world of NomadSed.

NomadSed is entertaining and instructive all at once. Current problems that are faced by nomadic societies across the globe have been adapted into a game which offers insights into a unique subject matter. It has successfully been used in schools and universities to delve into the complex social-ecological conditions of land use in drylands.
The board game can be borrowed for educational purposes in an easily transportable version whose design has been registered.
The game was jointly developed in the context of the DFG-funded Collaborative Research Centre 586 ‘Difference and Integration’ in cooperation between the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research – UFZ Leipzig, the University of Leipzig, and the Berlin University of the Arts.

name: Supertall: Wrecktar Returns
description:
Wrecktar is breaking free of Sprawlopolis and making its way UP the buildings of Supertall. This one card expansion puts some monster-sized pressure on your opponents.

Scoring: If this tower matches the City Hall plan type, score 5 points. Otherwise, score none for this tower.


Released in the November 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: 果実の収穫 (The Fruit Harvest)
description:
There is a mysterious apple orchard.
And the time for harvesting has once again arrived.  

Protect your orchard from insects and birds while taking care of your trees and harvesting your apples. Let’s gather as many apples as we can.

Each player tends to their own orchard and collects apples by strategically placing trees and apples.

On each turn, a player should lay down two cards (face up) from their hand to build their personal orchard. There are two types of cards: apples and trees. An orchard is made up a tree column and an apple column. Tree cards are played into the tree column to form a trunk. When the total value of the trunk is greater than or equal to 100, harvesting begins. If the trunk’s value is exactly 100, it is an abundant harvest and therefore the player may harvest all apples that they have placed into their apple column. If the value is greater than 100, the player may only harvest a single apple (the uppermost card aka the most recently placed card).

After harvesting, all tree cards are disposed and the player must work to grow another tree.

In addition, a player may also place down cards horizontally to achieve different effects.  

An apple card of the same number can be placed horizontally to create a “cluster” of fruit. If, for example, this cluster is at the top of the apple column and a player begins harvesting after going over 100 in value, the player will be able to collect all the apples in the cluster (instead of just a single apple). However, if a player harvests their apples upon fulfilling the exactly 100 value requirement, they will only be able to harvest up till the first cluster and not the whole column.  

A tree card of the same number as another tree card can also be placed horizontally to create a branch. After harvesting, the non-trunk cards of this branch do not need to be disposed and instead can be rearranged to form a new column as the new trunk.  

In addition, branches give the player the option to include or exclude the cards forming the branch in their total tree value count (towards 100).

Branches and clusters can only be continuously built on the uppermost card (aka most recently placed card) for the column.

In this game, you can also chose to help tend your neighbor’s orchard. You may play any card into their orchard instead of your own. If by doing this you fulfill the 100 value requirement for harvest, you will receive half of your neighbor’s apple cards (you chose which half). If you fulfill the over 100 value requirement instead, you will battle with your neighbor over the single apple/cluster card(s).

  Battling consists of playing a “war”-esque game where both players simultaneously reveal a card from their hand. The player with the higher value tree card will win the apple Card. (Except for in the case that the highest card is 50, which will then allow for a 5 card to win instead.)

  At the end of the game (when the drawing deck is empty), this battling comes back into play to decide who gets the remaining unharvested apples in everyone’s orchards.

There are also some special cards including a pigeon card, a woodpecker card, and a bug card which have different effects. Like apple and tree cards, players can choose to play them into their opponents’ orchards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Tile Placement
publishers: GALLERY OUCHI (ギャラリーおうち)

name: Twisted Fate: Cowboys vs. Aliens Ironclad Expansion
description: Give your Twisted Fate: Cowboys vs Aliens game play a new twist with the Ironclad expansion! Eight new cowboys add even more personality to your posse, with all new strengths and weaknesses to explore. Sixteen extra Resource cards offer crafty new strategies and tough decisions to make. And of course, four new Aliens pose a greater threat than ever before (yes, that means they’re pretty tough).
categories: American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: ラスボス。 (Last Boss)
description:
ラスボス。 (Last Boss) is a large-scale co-operative game from Japan. The expression ラスボス。 means the final big boss you must defeat, such as at the end of a video game.

This is a co-operative board game in which the players, as adventurers, aim to strengthen themselves in order to eventually defeat the boss enemy.

The boss enemy keeps moving to reach the goal called the "Fountain of Angels". The players will win if they strengthen themselves and defeat the boss enemy before they reach the goal. On the other hand, if the boss enemy reaches the Fountain of Angels, the players all lose.

The game has a large amount of attractive components, such as the A2 size game board, 227 cards and 70 tokens.

このゲームは、プレイヤーが冒険者となって自分たちを強化し、最終的にラスボスを倒すことを目的とした協力ボードゲームです。
ラスボスは移動を繰り返し、「天使の泉」というゴールを目指します。皆さんはラスボスがゴールするまでに自分を強くしラスボスを倒すとこのゲームに勝利します。逆に、ラスボスが「天使の泉」に到達すると敗北です。
A2サイズの大きなゲームボード、合計227枚のカード、70枚のチップなど、大ボリュームの魅力的な内容物があります。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Карты Правды
description:
Truth cards are a new board game from the developers of the Conflict Card. In this game, you will learn the whole truth about yourself from your friends, as well as reveal the truth about other players in the game. Be ready to learn a lot of new things about yourself, sometimes even unpleasant. Laughter will accompany you all game. Vote, who jokes don't reach the first time, and who needs to tie with food pics. Whose snoring can be tortured by prisoners of war, and who is the most accessible girl in the company. Who looks much older than their age, and who would agree to marry for the sake of EU citizenship. Who has the most disgusting voice, and who is already sick of everyone with their dumb jokes. All this is funny, and in some places, you should open the hard truth by playing the Truth cards.

The rules are simple. In the beginning of the game players choose their avatars and also receive voting cards with avatars of other players. On each turn players read questions from the card. Players are voting for other players by placing voting cards which is best describe some other player by this question. The winner of voting receives question card (1 point) and players receive their voting cards back. Player who receive the most points is the winner.

name: Le tour d'Afrique
description:
Le tour d’Afrique is a game that highlights the great cultural riches of the African continent through 5 thematic universes: Arts, Sports, Nature, History and Geography.

By virtually touring Africa, you are invited to answer multiple-choice questions on the arts, nature, geography, sport and history of the continent (1200 questions)

content:
A game board
A six-sided dice
Six pawns
300 question cards (1200 questions)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 1963 World Map Conversion Kit for the Game of Acquire
description:
The ACQUIRE 1963 World Map Conversion Kit allows players to adapt their versions of ACQUIRE to the rules used in the 1963 original concept edition of the game of ACQUIRE. This kit includes 29 stock certificates, 6 information cards, rules booklet & Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE. This kit allows the players to play their ACQUIRE game with the original Sid Sackson rules that were found in the first test market games of ACQUIRE.

The original edition of ACQUIRE used varying amounts of stocks and the ACQUIRE 1963 World Map Conversion Kit will allow players to use that same concept to play with the following stock amounts: (Variety of Stocks Certificates used in these kits depends on inventory on hand)

(22) Continental Stock Certificates
(24) Tower Stock Certificates
(26) Luxor Stock Certificates
(29) American Stock Certificates
(31) Worldwide Stock Certificates
(33) Imperial Stock Certificates
(35) Festival Stock Certificates

The ACQUIRE 1963 World Map Conversion Kit consists of the following items to allow you to convert your version of ACQUIRE:

1963 Style Instruction Booklet
(6) 1963 Style Information Cards
(1) Luxor Stock Certificate
(4) American Stock Certificates
(6) Worldwide Stock Certificates
(8) Imperial Stock Certificates
(10) Festival Stock certificates

The ACQUIRE 1963 World Map Conversion Kit allows a quantity of 60 stocks to be shuffled and randomly dealt out to the players before the beginning of game play. The amount of each company stock to be distributed is listed on the information cards. The rest of the certificates are kept in the bank for purchase during the game. Players can only buy one stock certificate per turn. All stocks begin at the same price level.

This concept allows mystery during the entire game as to the holdings of all players. It is harder to establish strategy for gaining majority when the available amounts vary and the knowledge of other players holdings are unknown. The decision of choosing a company when opening is predicated on the hand that is held from the original dealing of stock.

Since players are only allowed to purchase one stock certificate per turn, their money supply will usually last longer. Most players never run out of money throughout the entire game. The other benefit derived from the lower amount of stock purchases is that the player's ability to make quicker decisions for purchases is enhanced. Therefore, the rest of the players are not waiting as long for other players to finish their turns.

Play your game of ACQUIRE in a manner that allows mystery and a little bit of nostalgia. With the ACQUIRE 1963 World Map Conversion Kit your ACQUIRE board game can go back in time to the way it was first played 50 years ago.
categories: Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Investment, Ownership, Square Grid, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: How to get your Pink Card
description:
Light roll and move humoristic game about being gay for 3 to 8 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first to score 500 pink points and be on the Nirvana path.

It includes trivia questions, attitude cards, and truth or dare cards. Various spaces make you move forward or backwards.

name: Roma Victrix: Campaigns of the Roman World
description:
Roma Victrix is a grand strategic, moderate complexity wargame for 1 to 6 players, covering a time period ranging from 218 BC to 533 AD in twenty separate historical and hypothetical scenarios.

We find that the Romans owed the conquest of the world to no other cause than continual military training, exact observance of discipline in their camps, and unwearied cultivation of the other arts of war. - Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus, De Re Militari

City. Republic. Empire. Roma Victrix – “Rome Victorious”. Rome was forged in war. Even the story of its legendary founding was rooted in a fratricidal conflict. From her humble origins to her ultimate fall, Rome was either in a constant state of war, or preparing for it.
Beginning with the Punic Wars until the deposition of the last emperor in the West, Rome was the dominant force in the Mediterranean basin.

Roma Victrix is a game which endeavors to re-create the conflicts between Rome and her neighbors to achieve and maintain that dominance. A simple interactive sequence of play guides each player through the process of revenue collection, recruiting and maintaining military forces, conducting land and naval operations, diplomacy, field battles and sieges. Special rules are included to emphasize the importance and effects of leadership, cavalry superiority, mobility and attrition. Random events are also represented, adding an element of unpredictability to even the best laid plans and the likelihood that no scenario will ever play the same.

Seventeen historical scenarios range from the 2nd Punic War through the attempted reconquest of the lost Western territories by Justinian in the mid-6th century A.D. The rivalries of the later Republic, the Year of the Four Emperors, Imperial expansion and civil war, the Parthian and Persian frontier, the upheaval of the third century and the Germanic invasions are all represented. Three hypothetical scenarios are also included in which players can create their own history. Of the twenty scenarios in Roma Victrix, two are ideally suited for solitaire play.

Product Information:
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: 1 year per turn
Area Movement Map
Unit Scale: Legions, Legionary Equivalents, Barbarian Warbands
Players: one to six
Playing Time: 3-8 hours depending upon scenario

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Another Drop Of Madness In Wonderland
description:
The tea party has been going on since forever and the place is in a lot of mess by now. The Red Queen has just announced that she is bored and she would attend the tea party shortly.

Help your odd friends to clean up the place by collecting and creating sets of cards. At the end of the game the player with the most victory points wins.

With a mix of set collection and wacky mechanic to gather the items this game is a perfect filler for a family evening or with friends.

name: Dice Petanque
description:
A dice-throwing game for up to four players. In each round the diamond is thrown into the field, and each player gets to throw their two dice, hoping to land closest to the diamond.
Positive points are scored for having the die closest to the diamond or for having both one's dice show the same number. In either case the player scores the sum of their dice.
Negative points are scored for throwing one's die outside of the field (the die's value) or for throwing or knocking the diamond out of the field (five points).

—user summary

name: Terra Lìbera
description:
Terra Lìbera is a board game inspired by the ancient history of Sardinia. It wants to convey, through a game experience, the social transformations of the peoples who inhabited Sardinia through Nuragic, Phoenician, Punic and Roman times. Players go through history by living it in a game, looking for resources and being careful not to get enslaved.

The players assume the role of different populations in Sardinia. They are represented by nuraghes (ancient megalithic edifices) of different colours, that must collect resources (minerals, grape, oil, wheat, livestock, wood, brick). Depending on the number of nuraghes built in a territory, they will be considered free, masters, or slaves, and in the latter case, they will have to deliver the harvest to the master. During the turn, the players can increase their nuraghes population, move the nuraghes on the map, fight the opposing nuraghes to hunt them or to rebel against the masters, plunder the enemy's harvest. They also use the accumulated resources to improve production (mine, vineyard, quarry, field), transport, or start trading.

The aim is to solve more objective cards than the other players, trying not to hold unresolved objective cards on hand at the end of the game.
The most skilled players will be those who will be able to adapt to what history asks them.
categories: Ancient, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Prehistoric, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Negotiation, Worker Placement

name: Croc'Attack
description:
Croc'Attack is a board game born in Crocodile Land (a.k.a Australia!) featuring Crocodiles eating people and Treasure Hunters crossing narrow bridges to find treasures on an island.
This game is adapted for 8+ yo, for 3 to 5 players.

Each player gets a pawn. One player should play the Crocodile, the rest of the players are treasure hunters.

Crocodiles:

Prevent Hunters from accessing the island,
Protect your treasures,
And eat as many hunters as possible!


Treasure hunter:

Access the island and steal as many treasures as possible,
Avoid being eaten by the crocodile,
Get more treasures than the other hunters.


The Treasure Hunters can move anywhere on the Land tiles / Bridges tiles or on the Island. The crocodile cannot reach them when they are on the Land tiles or Island, but the crocodile can access the Bridge tiles.

The games stops when all the Treasure Hunters are dead, or when there is no more Treasures to steal on the island. Points are then calculated to determine the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: 麻雀拡張カード (Mahjong Expansion Cards)
description:
麻雀拡張カード (Mahjong Expansion Cards) is an expansion for the classic game of Mahjong.

This game does not affect the normal rules of Mahjong except that before each game, you should draw a single card from the deck and follow the directions written on the card.

If the drawn card instructs Individual Special Power cards should be distributed to all players, then give each player one Individual Special Power card. That card may only be used by that player alone. Every player should keep their card hidden until they chose to use it.

name: PucelOca: el juego de Valladolid
description:
PucelOca: el juego de Valladolid is an entertaining board game to investigate the history and the most hidden corners of the capital
The 63-square board combines the dynamics of the game of goose and Trivial Pursuit with 1,200 questions.
Discover what makes Valladolid, may it be artistic, geographical, cultural, religious, political, historical, architectural or environment of the capital.

The game offers 2 game modes:

the players establish a time to play or
advance through the track until reaching the last space 63.


Content:

rules,
cards with 1,200 questions / answers,
4 pawns,
1 dice
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Spin-A-Word: A Fun Word Game
description:
A small clear plastic cylinder contains six tiny letter cubes. Players spin the cylinder and attempt to form words with the letters that appear. Points are awarded based on the length of the word. First person with the highest score over 200 points is declared the winner.

The game is entirely self-contained with the cylinder permanently mounted inside the box to create a cardboard tray. A smooth green space for writing words and keeping score with chalk is also inside the box.

name: モン研！！(Monken)
description:
In モン研！！(Monken), the players are working at a research institute in a forest filled with monsters. They explore the forest, respond to requests from the Monster Exploration Association, and breed new types of monsters.

The game is a worker placement game where you must feed your workers, but rather than knowing what action spaces your workers will occupy, to simulate the forest exploration aspect, each location begins the game face down and will return face down after each round, so there is a memory element.

name: I.Q. 2000 Plus
description:
This expansion offered 2000 new questions for the I.Q. 2000 base game. Can be played with or without an IQ2000 base game.

2 skill levels / 7 categories / plus 6 additional passports

name: 1st Battle of El Alamein
description:
1st El Alamein is a simplified simulation of the mid 1942 battle in the desert of Egypt that marks the high tide of the Afrika Korps in the desert.
