Although the later battles of Alam Halfa and especially 2nd El Alemein are more famous, it was the Commonwealth’s survival in this July battle that stopped the Afrika Korps and saved Egypt.

Advanced and optional rules based on historical events are included for more experienced players looking for a deeper and more complicated game.

Sequence of play:
Step 1 -Allocate support units
Step 2 –Move any or all Axis units
Step 3 –Axis declare Combats
Step 4– Allies side Movement
Step 5– Allied side declare Combat
Step 6– Move Axis armour units
Step 7- Move Allied armour units
Step 8– Axis armour declare combats
Step 9– Reinforcements
Step 10- Administration
Step 11– Victory Determination

name: WAXAK
description: “Waxak” means eight in Maya, in this abstract game the goal of each player is to make a group of 8 chips of his color. At his turn the player can choose to play a chip or a pyramid, the pyramids will flip the adjacent chips of the same color in the 4 orthogonal directions.

name: Páirc
description:
Páirc: A thrilling Gaelic board game is a Hurling and Gaelic Football game.

The objective of the game is to move players around the board and maneuver the ball to score points (1 point) and goals (3 points).
The team with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner.

Content

1 board
1 green dice - for player movements and ball challenges resolution
1 white dice - for ball movement
2 teams of 15 hurlers
2 teams of 15 footballers
32 referee cards - cards are taken when a blank face on a dice is rolled
32 break of the ball cards
1 set of scoresheet
1 small ball for hurling
1 large ball for football
30 player bases
2 sets of goal posts
1 ruleset

name: People Vs Pandemic
description:
Get all the "Human" players to the center of the game board before the Virus beats them to it. If even one Human is left behind, the Virus wins! The Virus can be ruthless by using "exposure spots" and attack cards to slow the Humans' pace... but if the Humans play their cards right, they might just be able to defend themselves. If not, they risk going into quarantine. Both the Virus and Humans can progress forward by using action cards. But beware, not all actions have positive outcomes! Players can also trade and stock up on the three sacred resources of 2020:  Toilet paper (AKA, 2020 Gold), hand sanitizer (AKA Liquid Life), and groceries (AKA Bare Necessities). Family-friendly. Print-from-home.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Al'Taire: The Alchemy Wars
description:
In Al'Taire The object of the game is to be the first
player to reach 6 Ascension Points on
your turn, which ends the game with a
successful claim to the throne.
Ascension Points are gained through
Alchemy Cards, Fate Cards, and even
through some Reagent Cards.
How many players can play Al'Taire?
2 to 4 players
How long does a game generally last?
Depending how menacing and cutthroat players are it can range from 30 minutes to 1 1/2 hours.
What is included in the game?
The game box, instruction manual, 50 Alchemy cards and 50 Reagent cards.
How do I play?
In Al'Taire players need reagent cards to put alchemy cards into play. Some alchemy cards grant you alchemy points, additional cards, etc, or they can destroy your opponent(s) through causing of discarded cards, loss of alchemy points to even switching hands entirely.
Al'Taire uses the "one person's trash is another person's treasure." mechanic. If a player pitches a discard that you need you may draw from the top of the discard pile.

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Stormcast Eternals
description:
Each Stormcast Eternal was once a mortal warrior who sought to defy the dominion of Chaos, no matter the cost. Taken into the heavens by Sigmar himself and reforged into a living embodiment of the God-King's might, these warriors have the power of the storm in their blood. Thundering down in meteoric blasts of celestial energy, the indomitable Stormhosts take their bloody revenge on the hordes of the Dark Gods.

This book will teach you about the glory of the God-King's heroes. You will gain great insights into high Azyr and the brotherhoods striking like thunderbolts across the Mortal Realms.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Our Cartoon President
description:
Let’s face it — nothing simulates the chaos of the current administration like a combination of rotten vegetables and confetti being dropped on a high-speed fan, but this game is the next best thing!

In this fast-moving card game, each player takes control of a group of government staffers and wins loyalty for their people while stealing it from others, all while trying to avoid the wrath of the president. People will be fired, transferred, and otherwise totally embarrassed, but there can be only one winner! And it sure won't be the nation!


Based on Stephen Colbert’s animated show Our Cartoon President.
Provides much needed laugh-out-loud outlet in regards to American Politics!
Blank Character cards allow you to keep up with political events!


—description from the back of the box

name: Raja Ampat: The Four Kings Islands
description:
A little semi-abstract style game, where you are initially building the map of islands, then placing your wildlife tokens according to the following conditions: you cannot place an animal in a row, column or island that already contains that type of animal.


Released in the June 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Mountaineering: The Race to the Summit
description:
The game is unbranded

The image on the box with coloured scene of climbers and a tent flying the British flag suggests that it was probably published in England after Sir Edmund Percival Hillary and Sherpa mountaineer Tenzing Norgay became the first climbers confirmed to have reached the summit of Mount Everest, on 29 May 1953.

Contents:

collapsible pyramid with mountain scenes printed in colours;
printed base with slots for the mountain;
four coloured, round headed playing pins;
one wooden dice;
one dice shaker;


The rules of the game are printed on the underside of the box lid.

name: ArchiWrecks
description:
ArchiWrecks is a card and dice game for 2 players: the architect that builds the city, and a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

ArchiWrecks is an asymmetric 2-player only dexterity game. One of the players takes on the role of architect constructing buildings out of dice, the other player takes on the role of a giant monster that is attempting to smash the city.

Each card has the Architect constructing a specific building with dice, the card also offers a way for the Monster player to attempt to wreck the building. After each round, the card is flipped and either shows the city making progress or the rubble of the city as the Monster smashed past.
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost & Found: New Harvest
description:
Build your community, support your family, back your neighbors, and stave off disasters. Any or all can win – or lose.

In medieval North Africa, towns are built by families like yours. Show your strategic and collaborative skills in Lost & Found: New Harvest, a historical strategy game of balance between community and family needs.

Take on one of five roles in a struggle to address dilemmas, overcome crises, and avert disasters that threaten to destroy everything you know and love.

Look out for your family, but be sure to collaborate with your neighbors as well. Any number of players can win, but if anyone goes destitute, everyone loses.

This, the first standalone expansion to Lost & Found, explores how lost and found possessions were addressed under Islamic jurisprudence, as informed by Al-Hidayah and The Distinguished Jurist's Primer. These texts were written in the 12th century by great Islamic scholar and jurists Burhan al-Din al-Marghinani and the polymath Ibn Rushd (Averroes). They provide guideposts for behavior, but it’s up to you to decide how to solve dilemmas.

Explore the ways in which these medieval religious legal systems helped to hold society together and helped to keep neighbors cooperating with one another. Optionally, when you pair Lost & Found: New Harvest with the original, players can take on both Jewish and Muslim roles, and explore how these laws play out for these two communities living in Fustat (Old Cairo) in the 12th century.

Will you follow the laws of lost and found possessions? Will you break them? Will you go above and beyond the law?

Find out in Lost & Found: New Harvest!

name: Do It Yourself Alias
description:
You get to create the classic game Alias yourself! Choose the words of your liking and write them on the cards. The game itself plays like a regular Alias, a word explanation game where you explain words without reveiling the word itself (or a part of it): whether they are synonyms, antonyms or whatever works best in the situation, this party game sure makes it fun to play with words - and now with the new DIY cards!

In D.I.Y. Alias players come up with their own words based on the topics in the cards. Once you have a word in mind, write it on the card, start explaining and let the other players guess. The first player to reach the finish wins the game!

Content: Double-sided game board, 300 cards, sand timer, rules.

name: Donostiarrok harriz harri
description:
Donostiarrok harriz harri is a cooperative game about the reconstruction of Donostia / San Sebastian after its burning in 1813 by Wellington troops.
The players, representing witnesses of the massacre and inhabitants of the city - Juana Francisca Arsuaga (servant), José Antonio Aguirrebarrena (carpenter), María D. Miloy "La naipera", Vda. de Barbot (maker of cards) and Manuel Joaquín de Alcain Baraibar (merchant and mayor) must rebuild the city, they all win or lose together.

gameplay:
The board represents the burned intramural city, with a grid of paths that the characters must travel.
At start of game the four characters are in the Plaza Nueva among the remains of the city.
The 4 players must rebuild the city. For that they must help each other to figure out where to start the reconstruction and to get the seven parts of the facade of a typical reconstruction building.
To advance, some brick tiles are used and as many bricks as the number of steps you want to advance will be used.
But the reconstruction was not easy and that is why the game also has adversity events (discouragement, illnesses, wars, lack of money).

name: Enemy Engaged
description:
While this is not meant to be the be all and end all of space combat systems, and it will most definitely not be the most complicated of them, it is and will be what we envisioned it to be oh those many years ago when we put together a one page set of rules so that we could play with our miniature toys in the kitchen and in the garage on the weekends.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: トランプ再集計!! (Trump Recount!!)
description:
The game トランプ再集計!! (Trump Recount!!) consists of a board which shows a map of the United States, with some "battleground" states in white, and other states colored red or blue, to represent their political leanings in the 2020 United States' presidential election. The game board lists 13 battleground states, and places to play cards for each state along the edge. (Players must provide their own cards.) The map has a scale showing the progress of J.BIDEN and D.TRUMP towards an electoral college victory.

One player takes the red cards (diamonds and hearts) from a deck of cards, and the other player takes the remaining suits (clubs and spades). First the players gather their heart and spade cards, and, beginning with the red player, alternate placing cards at the 13 battleground states. Then, the players do the same with the other suits.

Afterwards, the "counting" phase begins, and players have several options, such as to privately count a state and either declare victory or announce that the counting is still in progress; recount a state where your opponent has declared victory; ask for a public recount; or pass.

If any player declares defeat, the opponent's side wins. If neither player declares defeat, the game will never end.

name: Summon Skate
description:
In Summon Skate you play a Figure Skater. No, not the kind you’re thinking. Instead you are a summoner who skates out complex magical diagrams to summon Figures - mythical gods and creatures - to fight giant monsters of chaos in high-speed, tactical battles.

The gameplay of Summon Skate is divided between puzzle solving/investigation and tactical combat. Players will check out strange happenings in their city to piece together the true nature of the chaos manifesting there. These investigations generally involve making checks using the simple 3 Attribute, 2D6 roll-under resolution system. Once the mystery is solved, the chaos gathers and takes on a physical form born from human nightmares - a Chaos Figure, the main enemies of this game.

Once combat with the Chaos Figure begins, the players are teleported to a magical stage represented by a 12 x 12 grid. Each turn, players must use their limited movements points to draw out summoning diagrams on the grid. Once a diagram is completed, players can summon the Figure tied to the diagram. Summoned Figures are the primary means of fighting, guarding, healing and supporting in the game. Meanwhile the enemy Chaos Figure will spend its turns trying to either kill the player characters directly or shatter the stage by creating cracks that extend from one side to the other. If all the players run out of HP or the stage is completely shattered, it’s game over and the world falls to chaos. You’ll need cooperation and planning to make it through these battles alive.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Storytelling

name: カリフ(Caliph)
description:
An Islamic roll and move game like Monopoly. Players try to become the Caliph in 10th century Abbasid Baghdad.
Japanese ulamā Prof. Dr. Hassan Ko Nakata supervised the game.

In Caliph, cards are arranged in a circle to form a sugoroku board, and the green-framed cards inside are cards that offer advice on life. Players who stop here will use their imagination and Islamic skills to the best of their ability to answer this question, and other players will judge whether the answer is good or bad. A guidebook written by Mr. Nakata for this purpose is included as a reference book. This guidebook can be used as a guideline for judgment, but it does not contain absolute correct answers. In the end, you will have to make a decision based on your own reason and conscience.

The player with the highest total Virtue and Fame at the end of the game is the winner. The game ends if:
-When the caliph was elected. The game ends with the player taking a turn up to the one before the player who became the caliph.
-When the deck runs out. The game ends immediately when the last deck is drawn.

At the end of the game, each player may receive additional points or conceded points depending on the situation.
mechanics: Income, Modular Board, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Doubloons
description:
Doubloons is a 2-6 player card game of pillage and plunder. Take the helm of a pirate ship in a race for 7 doubloons. Along the way, hire the help from history's most prolific pirates like Samuel Bellamy, Anne Bonny, Ching Shih, and more.

It takes less than 5 minutes to learn. There are two types of cards in the game: action cards and pirate cards. Each player receives 5 action cards to start. On your turn, you draw an action card and then can play up to 3 action cards. Action cards allow you to do things like collect doubloons, draw cards, and steal from other players.

You can choose to spend doubloons in order to recruit pirates onto your crew. These pirates give you effects that can be used once on every turn. Different combinations of action cards and pirates allow you to accelerate your path to victory and decelerate your opponents.

—description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Flip the Bottle
description:
Flip the Bottle is a 2 player game that uses three cards: a rules and score tracking card, a table card, and a bottle card. Players take turns flipping the bottle card and trying to land it bottle-side-up on the table card to score a point. The first player to five points wins the game.


Released in the September 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Noche de Juerga
description:
In Noche de Juerga ("Binge Night") you have to get 6 cards that are obtained by visiting different places in a city (squares) and do some challenges that are proposed in these.
Once achieved, you must reach the central square.

The first to get it wins

The fun of the game are in challenges proposed during its progress.

—user summary

En el juego hay que conseguir 6 tarjetas que se obtienen visitando distintos lugares de una ciudad (casillas) y hacer algunas pruebas y retos que se proponen en éstas.
Una vez conseguidas se debe llegar a la casilla central.

El primero en conseguirlo, gana

Lo divertido del juego son las pruebas y retos propuestos durante el desarrollo de éste.

—user summary (Spanish)

name: Scissorcards
description:
A bush sculpting game for 3-5 players.

Inspired on the cult film Edward Scissorhands.


Scissorcards is a realtime dexterity game where you have to form a shrub using playing cards BUT you have to use playing cards instead of your fingers. You setup cards in-between each finger and that's all you get to work with.

The dealer announces start and all players must use their card hands to flip the cards in the center pool and manipulate them to create their bush.

When the dealer decides that a player has built a bush that matches the example bush, the dealer will announce that person as the winner.

The winner scores 1 point. Play continues so that all players have been the dealer. The player with the highest score after that is the winner.


Postcard released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: プログラム言語神経衰弱 (Programming Language Memory)
description:
There has been a communication breakdown. Players need to find the correct programming language and match them together.
There are ten programming languages and four cards in each language.

The game ends when all the cards have all been taken. Whoever has the most cards wins. If there is more than one person with the most cards, they share in the victory.

This educational game allows players to learn about coding, and to recognize the different languages. Even though some of the programming functions look very similar, there are subtle differences. Each card has a barcode pattern at the top to help those learning about programming languages.

'How to play'
Place all the cards face down on the table. When it's your turn, you can turn over two cards from the table, and if they are in the same language, you get them and can take another turn. If they are in a different language, turn them back face down, and it's the turn of the person next to you on the left.

name: Bollwerk 178
description:
Bollwerk 178 is a Chess-like complex strategy game for two players.

Each player has 20 strong pieces and 25 supplementary stones at their disposal. The game is played on a board with 178 squares. The game board is in a constant state of change due to the supplementary stones.

The goal of the game is, occupying the opponent’s end field with a piece or a bomb. Whoever captures all his opponent’s pieces or immobilizes their opponent also wins.

On the board there is enormous potential for attacks, sheer unlimited possibilities for various positions, countless options for the next move, as well as an incredibly wide range of defense strategies.

—description from the designer

name: Dragon Line: Fade and Flow
description:
Dragon Line is a simultaneous-turns card battle with neat dragon art. The rules are very easy, and games go fast, but there is a lot of complexity to uncover, especially in understanding the ability combos.

Each player builds a small army of dragons with which to face their opponent, chooses in which order the dragons approach the enemy lines, and attempts to be the player with dragons remaining in hand at the end.

This expansion adds two new dragon types to the original Dragon Line deck. If you've bought the second edition of Dragon Line, you already have these cards!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Hot Sauce
description:
Hot Sauce by Kenneth Thompson. Ken always has a bag of tricks and this one was in the form of about 20 Taco Bell hot sauce packets. He had a neat domino feel tile laying abstract game in which Ben and Jason tightened a wee bit. In the end it's two things: 1) a full game made out of 7 cards or 2) a rule card that you can take with you to your favorite taco restaurant. Both have their perks.

—description from the publisher


A 2-4 player game that is played with sauce packets.

Shuffle the packets and place them into a pile of face-up and face-down packets. TAke the top 2 packets off the pile and place them in the center of the table, face-down next to each other.

Players will take turns drawing a packet from the top of the pile(any one that isn't covered by another packet) and then either 1) placing it in front of them for final scoring, or 2) placing it onto the center of the table so that it connects to a minimum of two other packets. After placing it, the player must flip over a packet that is touching it.

The game ends when the last packet is placed. Players score points for the packets in front of them. Each packet is worth 1 point for each face-up matching packet on the center. If there are no matching packets in the center, packets are -1 each.

Nuclear Packets do not score for players, but are wild in the center. They count as the type of any face-up packet that they are touching.


Released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: ¡Aúpa Racing! Real Racing Club Santander
description:
¡Aúpa Racing! the first board game about the Racing Santander from Cantabria.

The board represents a map of Spain with 23 soccer fields. The objective of the game is to reach several of these stadiums, through a corridor that will be crossed by throwing a dice.
It contains 195 questions on the history of the Racing.
3 categories:

Matches - Protagonistas (75),
Games - Partidazos (65) and
Club (55).


Each question comes with 3 answers and a photograph is used as a clue to facilitate the correct answer.

name: Poco Pinata
description:
Poco Pinata is a micro-game that features only a handful of cards that has players take on one of two roles. One player closes their eyes and spins like it was there turn with the bat at a kids’ birthday party. Then they try to smack their token (they suggest coins) on one of the pinata cards on the table. Other players get a chance to move a card while the active player’s eyes are closed to try and stop them from hitting it and getting the candy. It’s a fun little game that is light for all audiences and it’s always fun to see people spinning around like fools and shouting.


Ryan Cowler's Poco Pinata (originally named A Lotta Piñata) is a dizzy dexterity game where you slap coins onto piñatas, trying to burst them for the candy inside.


Released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Scrumdiddlyumptious
description:
A yummy deduction game that will fill your belly.

In May, we went with a candy theme. The film was one of the cultiest of the cult films, yet also a family film based on a non-cult book... Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

Matthew O' Malley (Diner, Between Two Cities, Knot Dice) and Peter O' Malley designed Scrumdiddlyumptious, a deduction game that uses candy as its pieces! It's pure confection. I mean pure perfection. Or pure imagination? Anyway, it's so good, especially when you can eat the candy. :)

The art was completed by my daughter Beatrix Tagmire and son Leon Tagmire. It felt too fitting to not have kids do the artwork.

—description from the publisher


You actually play with real candy. Players grab handfuls of candy with different types (different colors, different brands, etc), and hide their stash from the other players. They then take turns using powers described on the card trying to get another player to eat pieces from their stash. The last person with candy still in their stash wins. But is losing really so terrible when it means you get to eat all that candy?


Postcard released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Mediterralien
description:
A merchant in the Mediterranean is just trying to buy low and sell high, but an alien from another world is making that difficult by destroying everything in sight.

In this asymmetrical 2 player game, one player takes the role of a merchant in a worker placement / action point game, while the other player takes the role of alien with swingy die rolls and special powers.


An asymmetric clash of board game styles. One player is a merchant shipping goods through the Mediterranean Sea (worker placement, action selection). The other player is an alien bent on destruction (die rolls / special powers).


Released in the January 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Time Warp
description:
A drafting game about sharing things up.

Cult Film Postcard Game: The Time Warp, inspired by the cult classic The Rocky Horror Picture Show. It was designed by Dead of Winter’s Jonathan Gilmour and Curtis E. Clark.


Postcard released in the July 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Make the best 5 card poker hand out of your six cards after 3 rounds.

SETUP
Shuffle the deck and deal 3 cards to each player. Place the remaining deck in the center within reach of all players.

GAMEPLAY
Perform the following steps in order (each step consist in a specific way of drafting, drawing or playing cards):

It's just a jump to the left
Then a step to the riiiiiiight
With your hands to your hips
You bring your knees in tiiiiight
But it's the pelvic trust
That really drives you insaaaane
Let's do the Time Warp again


GAME END
After three rounds, players will reveal their hands, comparing to see who has made the best 5 card poker hand.
They have Time Warped the best.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Miri
description:
STRANGE STUFF IS HAPPENING ALL AROUND US, LET THE CARDS BE OUR GUIDE!
The Miri is a cooperative storytelling game where players contribute image cards to a storyteller to interpret. Players roleplay through those interpretations, using their own cards and rolling a 12-sided die to influence what happens in the story.

Players begin the game choosing one of the 18 Aspect Cards, becoming that character in story. Do you want to use muscle like The Warrior, or perhaps your intellect, like The Scientist. Are you more in tune with something spiritual, like The Shaman? There are many ways to play it!

Card by card, the story unfolds...

Each round, the storyteller lays contributed cards, as well as a few unknown cards, in a face-down spread. The reading of the images is performed similar to how a fortune teller would read Tarot, with images deriving meaning, and the orientation of the cards mattering. "Ordered" cards (correctly viewed) add positive events to the story, and perilous events happen when cards are "Mirrored" (upside-down).

During the reading of a spread, players are given the opportunity to say what they would like their character to do, and roll the die to see if their actions were successful. If players are successful, they may begin to turn cards in the spread to become ordered. A spread containing an Ordered Mind (blue), Body (red), and Spirit (green) card is considered a success for The Miri, and flips the next of five Suspense tiles in favor of The Miri.

However… Being unsuccessful in Ordering the cards allows the dark forces known as Ichor to get its clutches on the story! If all three Clutches of Ichor tokens are placed on the cards in the spread, you flip the next of five Suspense tiles back over in favor of Ichor.

If all five Suspense tiles show "The Miri", you WIN and conclude the story with a victory for the players! ...Unless the story was lost to the Clutches of Ichor!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Diaspora Skirmish: Basic Rules
description:
Diaspora is a miniatures skirmish game, where two to four players can compete in narrative scenarios between the stars of the Second Middle Ages. Recruit your team from one of the exotic factions of the great Diaspora, and accomplish goals on the table by combining strategy and boldness.

The rules of the game are available for free, and with each faction comes its 3D printable figures.

Simple and quick to learn, Diaspora is a fluid system that is sure to make you rack your brains during tactical and colorful actions.

The basic rules contain everything you need to play your first games.
Both novices and experienced wargames will find a fluid system and 4 scenarios.
Along with these free rules also come two unit profiles from two different factions.
The other profiles will be available in the Faction Compendiums.
These rules may be updated in the future.

—description (translated) from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Endangered World
description:
Endangered World is strategic, family-friendly board game designed for 2-4 people ages 8+.

Players take turns drawing number cards, which denote spaces on the 10x10 grid on the gameboard. On the board are 15 adorable animal figures of different sizes, as well as 20 "Twists & Turns" cards that can really throw the game for a loop.

On each turn, the player decides how to use their resources. How much do they want to invest in a certain animal? Do they want to play a Defender token to protect their surrounding resources? Or maybe a Bomb token to destroy their opponent's resources? The person with the most resources on an animal saves it, and the person who saves the most animals in the end is the winner!

name: Viscera
description:
Viscera is a fast paced tabletop game made by Chris Robert and Cole Basaraba where two to six people buy items, roll dice, and hunt monsters of varying mythologies to become the land's greatest hero.

Player can acquire cards and gems to prepare for a monster hunt. Players will roll and reroll dice as they try to inflict enough damage to defeat the monsters. The monsters are kept as trophies for Victory points.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Curmudgeon: Promo Card Pack
description:
These 30 cards are yours to customize your Curmudgeon experience. The pack includes:
1 new Curmudgeon Card
8 Blank Insult Cards (write your own cards: four 1-point and four 2-point)
4 new Insult Cards
5 new Life Cards
12 Blank Life Cards (write your own cards: three each of 1, 2, 4, & 4-points)

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pale Blue Dot
description:
Discover your Origin - Create your Destiny, in this game of planetary balance by Arch & Gravity, blending coop and vs play with real science and fun sci-fi. Erupt as a Volcano, destroy with a Meteor, or travel the world as a Super Typhoon, using the innovative E3 gameplay system - Energy, Entropy & Evolution. Make tactical decisions as you build your area of control on the 3D, stackable board, Evolve as you customize your deck, and influence the Atmosphere to encourage the growth of Life - or to keep it's exponential dangers in check. In Pale Blue Dot, the fate of this fragile world is in your hands, and winning is not just about dominance, because the odds of surviving as a habitable world are simply, powerfully against you every time. So while there can be just one winner in the end, even surviving will take everyone working together in balance.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Lose a Turn, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Can You Survive 2020?
description:
"Can You Survive 2020?" is a silly game for serious gamers. There is some strategy involved, and also a ton of chaos. Written by Gen Z parents living the COVID life 24/7 with Gen Z kids, the game exudes its own version of twisted humor.

Players initially race around the board, buying up stock before the value collapses. While doing that, you are spreading a virus wherever you go, drawing notification cards (made from the insane things that have happened in 2020), and collecting toilet paper and homeopathy pills. Eventually, as spaces get quarantined, players are forced into the Bunker for the Lockdown Round.

At any point in the game if any one player dies from too much virus the game ends. You have to work together to stay alive, while also trying to get the most resources. Once the game ends players count their resources to win "Trophies." Trophies can be won for things like holding the most stock, the most toilet paper, AND (of course) a "Participation Trophy" for the individual who loses so - trophies for everyone!

The player with the most trophies wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Resource to Move, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Semi-Cooperative Game, Stock Holding

name: Boxing the Noble Art
description:
A semi-statistical replay game allowing gamers to replay entire tournaments or individual bouts.

Historical fighters are rated for Boxing Quality, Knock Outs For and Knock Outs Against, and Fight Quality.

With just a couple of dice rolls players can determine a KO or points victory with the Basic Game. Or they can go round by round, blow by blow, the dice and charts telling a compelling story of control, ascendancy and power.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Grand Magus of Ibaur
description:
The legion is coming upon the Land of Ibaur. You - The Grand Magus - are the last hope of the people. Use the arcane elements to craft and cast magic spells upon the
enemy before they do the same to you.

The player rolls dice to gather elements (Fire, Air, Water).
These can combined in different ways to cast different offensive and defensive spells.

The design was mainly inspired the Warcraft 3 custom map - SpellCraft.

—description from the designer

name: Riddle Island: 1895
description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1895A.D. year of the goat. Taiwan is under war. The Japanese army has already conquered northern Taiwan and keep pushing south. In order to make the offence smoothly, they send you, a Japanese agent, to infiltrate into Tainan, where the government is. Are you be able to complete the mission before the attack begin?

—description from the publisher

name: Riddle Island: 1943
description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1943A.D. Returning back to Takao, where you born and grow up, but this time is to find your missing lover. A letter, a notebook and a strange puzzle wheel, you receive these before your lover went missing.
Follow the clues and the track of your memories, can you find out where he is and the reason he left?

—description from the publisher

name: Riddle Island: 1974
description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1974A.D. Your boss signs a new mission to you, this time you have to investigate a rebel activity, but the only clue you have is a riddle wheel that the rebels use to send messages. As you dig deeper and deeper, you start to realize that the truth is not like what you’ve thought.

—description from the publisher

name: Big Boy Throwdown
description:
- What is Big Boy Throwdown?? -

Big Boy Throwdown is an award-winning card and dice game about a bunch of weirdos fighting each other.Play your cards, roll the dice, get even more cards and play your way to the top!

Set in the world between dimensions known as the Between-Zone, the first deck of BBT features 100 unique cards and over 80 characters, including Angry Eggs, Strange Salesmen, Cosmic Clowns, Friendly Frogs, Chicken Champions, Noble Knights, Sentient Squares, a giant green cat named 'Dr. Uncle' and more.

BBT is all the fun and variety of classic trading card games, easy to learn and straight out of the box!

- The Game -

Gameplay runs in a slick & quick combination of strategy & chance, with players using the cards in their possession to attack their opponents' cards.If a player destroys an opponent's card, they roll to draw a random card from the Deck. This is the only reliable way to keep getting cards.

All cards have their own unique stats and a variety of Effects, which twist the rules and vary wildly in power & utility.

Because of the sheer number of cards in this first Deck, you may very well play half a dozen games of BBT before you see all of the unique, comical, and wonderfully surreal characters that we've packed into this first installment.

- The Details -

Recommended game size: 2-6 players
BBT is really designed for groups of 3 or more players, but does work with two players. More than 6 players can play BBT at a time, but game time will be longer as a result.

Avg. Game Length: 5-20 minutes

Ages 12+

- The Makers -

BBT is a labor-of-love project by Clown Car Entertainment, a small group of artists and creators centered in Pittsburgh, PA.

The game was first created in fall of 2016 when the makers were in college, and quickly won the hearts of their peers who played it between classes and during get-togethers. We're eternally grateful for all of the support they gave us; it helped us turn sketches on index cards into a fully fledged game project that anyone can play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Stat Check Resolution

name: The Treasure Cave of Dragon
description:
Holding an ancient treasure map, you keep going deeper and deeper into the dragon’s cave, hoping to find the treasure that you’ve been dreaming for. In front of you, there are three caves, on of them lies the treasure, but be ware, if choosing wrong, you might awake the dragon and bring trouble to the team… The map doesn’t show you which is the correct cave, but there’s a hint in the room, now is time to you your most powerful weapon-mathematic and probability!

The Treasure Cave of Dragon is a exciting game with dice rolling and push your luck mechanic, there are three times of dice rolling to reveal the correct cave of the treasures in each round, the earlier the players decide which cave they go in, the bigger chance they will be wrong but more treasures they might find…
Are you brave enough to rush in recklessly? Or wait until the situation becomes clearer…?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Number, Party Game

name: Zazz
description:
One of the first games to use a set of different polyhedral dice.

This is a decision-less game where players take turns rolling dice, and tallying their score. The first player past a point threshold wins.

The rules as published:

The Game is called ZAZZ and it is played with the 5 Natural Solids (Polyspheres).

TETRAHEDRON - has 4 Triangular Faces
CUBE - has 6 Square Faces
OCTAHEDRON - has 8 Triangular Faces
DODECAHEDRON - has 12 Pentagonal Faces
ICOSAHEDRON - has 20 Triangular Faces

Instructions: Each player throws all 5 solids at once as he takes his turn. Player inspects top faces, particularly all 3 showing faces of the TETRAHEDRON. He then adds all pairs or matching numbers plus any number over 12 that appears on the ICOSAHEDRON.

Example: Throw shows TETRAHEDRON 1, 3, 4; CUBE 6; OCTAHEDRON 3; DODECAHEDRON 8; ICOSAHEDRON 14

Add 3 on the TETRAHEDRON to matching 3 on OCTAHEDRON to 14 on ICOSAHEDRON. Score is 20 points.

Bonus of 20 Points for a 3-of-a-kind
Bonus of 50 Points for a 4-of-a-kind
Bonus of 100 Points for BLAST OFF

BLAST OFF occurs when the same throw shows no pairs, 3's, or 4's-of-a-kind and the number appearing on the ICOSAHEDRON is under 12.

A cumulative score of 100 points or a BLAST OFF wins the game.

name: GVE
description:
Themed based on Gods, Immortals and Celestials battling one another until the strongest remains.

Game can be played up from 2 to 4 players with the goal of eliminating your opponent's active warriors to seize victory. The game mainly revolves around rolling the dice in order to decide your move and your cards to decide your strength or weakness.

—user summary

name: Ｄｒ．野口っち (Dr. Nogucchi)
description:
Ｄｒ．野口っち (Dr. Nogucchi) どくたーのぐっち (Dokuta no Guchi) is a game from Japan which includes a model microscope. Players use the fake microscope to study specimens, looking for the cure, the silver bullet to cure a terrible disease (the game was first published in 2017!).

Players look through the microscope to identify different viruses. If a player is confident that they have the cure, they declare and gain 2 points if correct, or lose 1 pt if wrong. Other players can still find the cure and gain a point. The first to get to 5 points is the winner.

The specimens are card hexes with different combinations of microbes showing in each part. When a player peeks into the microscope, the card is rotated, so they only see a section at a time. Remember what you have seen in the scope is important to the game.

There are tokens for the microbes and for coloured test tubes of drugs. Players build up a collection of drugs and bugs behind their laboratory screen. When a player is confident they have the right combo to complete the cure, they can declare.
user summary
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: 化けドラ～化け物對化け物ドラフトゲーム～ (BAKEDORA- The Monster War Draft Game)
description:
化けドラ～化け物對化け物ドラフトゲーム～ (Bakedora ~ Bakemonotaibakemono Dorahutogemu) (BAKEDORA- The Monster War Draft Game) is a 2 player card-drafting, deck-building game from Japan, themed on the battle between monsters.

Effectively play the cards with odd effects, such as a card that you make you lose if you play it, and a card that provides you 1000 additional turns! Try to find the best combinations!

魑魅魍魎をドラフト＆デッキ構築！
奇妙な効果を巧みに使いこなそう！
最高の組み合わせを見つけ出せ！
publisher's summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: 二つの罪と三人の死者 ～二人用脱出ミステリー～ (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery)
description:
二つの罪と三人の死者 ～二人用脱出ミステリー～ (Futatsu no Tsumi to San'nin no Shisha) (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery) is a game from Japan.

This is a mystery game to move the story forward through conversation. At a friend's house at night, there is a suspicious person under the bed... What are the consequences for A and B, who both have their secrets?

会話で物語を進めるミステリー
友人宅の夜、ベッドの下に不審者が……
それぞれの秘密を抱えるAとBが迎える結末とは？
publisher's summary

In this 2 player game, the player's adopt the roles of persons 'A' and 'B'. B is visiting A and stays in A's university room. But at night, they realise there is a suspicious figure under A's bed. B is alarmed, even more so by A's calm response.

During the game, the players converse, trying to get information to undercover the truth. The game has three main endings that can be reached, but the players each have secrets (hidden through QR codes), so the players cannot be sure how the game will end. This gives the game much replay ability, even if they do reach an ending.

Players get information from cards in the game, dependent on where they are in the room, or from keywords appearing in the talking. The players are allowed to reveal information, or hide, or even lie if they wish. The game may unfold as the players wish, or they be disturbed by the secrets revealed (the game is aimed at older players). Playing out the roles in different ways may make the endings change too.

Players will need access to some digital device to examine the QR codes in the game.
user summary
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing

name: Tangier to Tehran: a Wargamer guide to Middle Eastern Armies of the Napoleonic & Pre-colonial era c1780-1830
description:
Tangier to Tehran
Basic set of wargaming rules for 6mm and a guide about the armies of the middle east during the 1780-1830 period.

It cover the armies, navies and potted history of the Arab states of the period (Morocco, Algeria, Tunis, Tripoli, Egypt, Syria, Palestine, Lebanon, Persia, Hejaz, Iraq, Wahhabis of the Nejd, Yemen, Oman), as well as foreign interventionists (Turkey, Great Britain, France, Russia, USA, Sweden).
It includes drawings of uniforms, maps and flags

Published in 1994, updated in 2012.

name: Small Ball
description:
Small Ball is a two-player, push-your-luck dice game that celebrates the highly strategic style of baseball known as "small ball", which places an emphasis on manufacturing runs by way of single-base advancements and aggressive base running.

Teams are made up of nine unique dice that each reflect the typical characteristics of batters in a lineup, including the lead-off hitter who gets on base, the clean-up hitter who is capable of powerful extra-base hits, and the pitcher who can sacrifice a runner over.

​Small Ball challenges teams to score runs by making tough, strategic decisions - when to steal a base, when to lay down a sacrifice, when to call the hit-and-run, and when to go to the bench for a pinch hitter - and implements a major rule change that makes decisions even more grueling.

—description from the designer

name: －天動説－ (Geocentric Theory)
description:
－天動説－ (Tendōsetsu) (Geocentric Theory) is a game from Japan, with players sailing ships on a Flat Earth. The game title translates more literally as Theory Of The Moving Heavens. Geocentric Theory (often simplified as Ptolemaic Theory) puts the Earth at the centre of the Universe.

The players sail their ships on the oceans, searching for the treasure island of the Pirate King. But if they sail too close to the edge of the world, over they go!

The game includes an Armillary sphere to help the players navigate. There is a day phase and a night phase. During the day, the navigator reads the winds and the waves, and at night, the stars. When an undiscovered island is found, players can search for clues to the location of the gold and silver treasures.

As well as the 20cm tall sphere, the game also has the sea in a box. When it is not their turn, a player moves the box around to bring the sound of the sea alive.
user summary
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Oddia
description:
Oddia is a contraction for "Odd and Diagonal." It means that when a player gets an odd number, they should move their token diagonally (except when the token in in a corner square.)

The object of Oddia is to gain the highest points by moving the tokens to reach the Target. Each token reaching the target will get one point.

Game Setup
The game board consists of 36 squares along the sides of the board making up the game zone. The middle part of the board with diagonal lines (squares) only function as a passage and tokens cannot stop on it. Start is on one corner and 19 which is the Target is on the opposite corner.

Players take multiple sets of 10 tokens in their color depending on how many players are playing (2 players = 6 sets, 3 players = 4 sets, 4 players 3 sets.) The tokens are numbered 1-10 in each set.

The game starts with setting up the board for the first 12 turns. Players take turns putting their "1" tokens on start, rolling one die (for the 1st 6 turns, 2 dice after that) and moving forward. Play moves counter-clockwise around the board. When moving diagonal, play moves clockwise.

If they land on another player the player sitting on that square is bumped diagonally across the board. If a player lands on a player in corner square, the player sitting in that corner square is bumped on backward. As more tokens are placed on the board multiple chain-reactions can take place, bumping multiple players to new spaces. After 12 "1" tokens have been played on the board the game is ready to start.

Game Play
During game play only 12 tokens are allowed on the board. Tokens can be replaced with higher numbered tokens.

During game play you choose which one token you wish to move. Once a token reaches the Target (19 space) they replace their token with the next higher number token which gets placed on start and if the dice number is higher than the number needed to reach the Target then the upgraded token moves the additional spaces from the Start space.

The game continues until on person reaches the target with their number 10 token. Their points for that token will be 11. All players then count the number of all their tokens on the board and the player with the highest point total wins.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Pays de Loire
description:
Trivial Pursuit: Pays de Loire
Discover or rediscover the French Loire country in 3000 questions from the following 6 categories:

Geography,
Entertainment,
History,
Art and Literature,
Science and Nature,
Sports and Leisure.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot International, Winning Moves France

name: MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge
description: If you love Major League Baseball and think you know baseball better than anyone else, here’s your chance to prove it with the new MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge board game. To win, you’ll need more than baseball knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique trivia game from the pack. With 1,000 questions, every baseball player will have to be up to the challenge. For MLB fans who think they've got game, it's time to put on your cap, grab your bat, and knock it out of the park in the new Baseball Trivia Challenge.

name: Boereplaas: Uitbreidingstel 1
description:
Boereplaas Uitbreidingstel 1 expands the original Boereplaas with 72 new cards.

These new cards promises more interaction between players as well as more powerful bonus cards.

The rules for three different game modes are also included: Original, Strategic and Blitz.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Simulation, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Chakan Board Game
description:
Join Chakan the Forever Man as he traverses the “Journey of 100 Candles” spell with the fate of the world hanging in the balance. Can the greatest warrior of "The Before" time finally rematch Death himself and free himself
from the “Immortality Curse”? Play on!!!!

To play the game: roll a d6 to move your token, follow the directions on the space you land on (e.g., draw a Fate Card, Battle another player, draw an Encounter Card). You earn points by collecting various Encounter Cards, saving Energy points, and triggering the end of the game. The player with the most total points wins!

name: Beach Slap!
description:
Compete to snapshot beach photo assignments for your editor! Up to six people can race to find and arrange hidden objects called out by your impatient editor. This party game contains 48 Snapshot cards and 12 Assignment cards. Fast-paced and silly, this game is full of charming illustrations of a cornucopia of characters!

—description from the publisher

name: Bettor Horse
description:
Can you read your opponent and emerge the better bettor? Are your horses the faster or slower runners versus your opponent's? Successfully bet on horse races to beat your opponent in a game that requires no shuffling and gives you access to your deck the entire game. Find out who the real thoroughbred is in this equestrian, mind-reading competition.

—description from the publisher

name: Cuboingo: 2x2
description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 2x2 version is the fastest-paced and easiest to learn.

—description from the publisher

name: Cuboingo: 3x3
description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 3x3 version exercises tactical thinking.

—description from the publisher

name: Combate Cartas
description: To win, players will have to devise a strategy and choose the correct cards each round in order to eliminate the enemy's army.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Cuboingo: 4x4
description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 4x4 version exercises strategic thinking.

—description from the publisher

name: War of Waves
description:
Wield mighty waves and crushing sand to build your gateway to Atlantis before your opponent! Heavy strategy is required to outwit your opponent - choose to attack, fortify, or build - or combine different actions, and every choice determines what cards you draw; populate each bridge section with a war card to allow attacking your opponent's gate or to build your own; build abiding by the rules or fix any mistakes before you claim victory!

Build your bridge and your army while thwarting your opponent's. Learn some Greek to go along with some mythology as you march your army victorious through the gate to the fabled undersea kingdom!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Open Drafting, Ownership, Zone of Control

name: Diecast Derby
description:
Using only Diecast Toy Cars and 9 Print and Play cards, Drivers attempt to position their cars first place by the end of the race. Play occurs over an extremely limited number of card plays (less than 4 per lap/race) so each individual card play requires strategy and tactics.

Solo puzzle mode and three variant play modes are included in the original rules.

—description from the designer

name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Bouches-du-Rhône
description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Bouches-du-Rhône

From Marseille to Aubagne, via Aix-en-Provence, La Ciotat, Arles etc ... 36 municipalities of the "13" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bon Appetit
description:
Bon Appetit is a simple word game. Each alphabet has turned into a delicious cuisine, by using them to form a word, you will have a grant feast.
Bon Appetit!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: 動文字
description:
動文字 is a Chinese word game, or should I say, “character game”.
Using radicals and components to puzzle a Chinese character and spell it. Learning Chinese in a exciting competition!
Can you master this ancient and elegant language? 動文字 will show you a whole new world of Chinese learning!

—description from the publisher

name: Proyecto S
description: Construct your deck in an initial phase of secret bidding combined with drafting. Use your new cards and their special powers in a second round of secret biding to win victory points, but make sure not to use all your tricks before the final round because if you lose it your victory points will not count.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Malign Portents
description:
It began with unsettling dreams, and unnatural lights in the sky. Tempers frayed, families fractured and rulers became irate as their subjects fell to distraction and gossip. There was something in the air, they said; some malediction that threatened to turn the disquiet into dread. Waking nightmares spread across every land, promising a deathly face or the terror of oblivion. Traders and explorers carried ominous accounts through Realmgates only to find those on the other side bore disturbing stories of their own. This period became known as the Time of Tribulation, and it was well-named.

Malign Portents is an 80-page hardback book containing background and rules which catapult the mortal realms into a time of grim uncertainty, as Nagash begins an aeons-long grand plan to assert his power over the dead, spreading the necrotic influence of Shyish over every realm. Of course, the visions of disaster this plan is causing have not gone unnoticed – Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch, Slaanesh, the Horned Rat and Sigmar himself are affected by these portents, and every faction in the mortal realms is moving against the undead hordes of Nagash.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Changemakers Adventure
description:
The goal of Adventure is to help to grow a changemaker that is in yourself and to develop world changing teams. Throughout the game you develop your performing courage, listening skill and lot more.

To be the first one to reach the top of the mountain you have to do a variety of tasks. For example you can share about your childhood, make a speech, compete with fellow players, give promises or guess other people's personality types.

After each activity/question you will get point based on your performance.
Who's the first on top of the mountain, has changed the world for the better, like a changemaker.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Landsknecht: Renaissance Wargame Rules
description:
Landsknecht is a set of rules for the Renaissance period, allowing players to recreate the battles of the Renaissance wars in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Between the heavy armour of the gendarmes and the structure of the early pike and shot formation, players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with cunning and bloody stubbornness.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Landsknecht aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments and an option to wear over the top fashion was nether missed. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Kämpfe in Reihen: Lace Wars Wargames Rules
description:
Kämpfe in Reihen is a set of rules for the Lace Wars period, allowing players to recreate the linear style battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Kämpfe in Reihen aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Good Old Hook Nose: Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Wars
description:
'Good Old Hook Nose is a set of rules for the Napoleonic period, allowing players to recreate Napoleonic battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger. The name comes from the affectionate nickname given to Wellington by his troops.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Good Old Hook Nose aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where uniform, discipline and control were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

name: I'm No Spartacus: Simple Gladiator Wargaming Rules
description:
I’m No Spartacus is a set of simple wargames rules for teams of three gladiators to fight to the death in the Arena in Ancient Rome’s games. Players control a small group of gladiators with the intent of gaining the Emperor’s favour.

The rules are played with cards and dice, using a simple mechanism to allow a free flowing and fast game, taking seconds to learn and years to master. A typical game will last around an hour, allowing for several games to be played on a normal club evening.

Up to four teams can enter the arena but only one will be the winner.

—description from the publisher's webpage

name: An Uncivil Affair: Wargame Rules for the English Civil Wars
description:
An Uncivil Affair is a set of rules for the English Civil wars period, allowing players to recreate the ebb and flow of the battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period.

Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger, recreating the lines of pike and shot, as well as the sweeping cavalry popular in this period, with little or no control of the outcome.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

An Uncivil Affair aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and religious piety were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

name: Flames in the South: Wargames Rules for the American Civil War
description:
Flames in the South is a set of rules for the American Civil War, allowing players to recreate the open warfare and firepower of the ACW in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Officers of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with sweat and tears, as brother fights brother.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Flames in the South aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the war, where loyalty to your state and family were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

name: Genetix
description:
Strategy card-laying game where players send their small blob army through a high-tech genetics lab, gathering mutations and slowly evolving into higher forms of life. Mutants race through the lab and battle opponents on the way to the Cloning Center!

In Genetix, players take turns laying unique multipurpose 'tile cards' to create a growing labyrinth of electric fences, energy barriers, acid pools and steel walls. In doing so, they also activate mutation abilities with which the creatures can exploit in battle.

Special helixes evolve the blobs into higher life-forms with very different mods of behavior.

As the mutants race through the lab and do battle, the first to reach the Cloning Center wins the round and his/her species gets to increases its ranks!

Genetix is played in multiple rounds (three suggested). After the final round, the player controlling the greatest number of mutants wins!

-description from designer

name: アルバ・シビタスのあるきかた (Alba Civitas no Arukikata)
description:
アルバ・シビタスのあるきかた (Aruba Shibitasu no Arukikata) (How to walk Alba Civitas) is a game from Japan. Players are travelling around the city of Aruba at night, seeking hidden treasures. They meet local residents, find tools and clues that help them unearth the treasures.

A mixture of memo and actions, the city is a layout of face-down cards. On their turn, a player may move around and flip two cards, and memorise them. The cards have various conditions, and if a player satisfies the conditions, they get to keep the card or cards. These then help them further in their quest. By memorising the locations as all players reveal them, players race to complete the tasks and catch the most treasure to win.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Matching, Memory, Square Grid

name: Inn Keeper
description:
Compete as Inn Keepers working to fill your Inn with the most guests by winning tricks and placing cards in sequential order on to your board. Earn extra points by offering amenities customers want. Split points for referring guests when you don’t have what they want and for fulfilling your bonus card goals. The Inn Keeper with the most points at the end is the winner!

-description from designer

name: 愛のてんびん (Aino tenbin)
description:
愛のてんびん (Aino tenbin) (Love balance) is a party game from Japan.

The deck has a variety of confessions of love, such as gifts, flowers, chocolates, a ring and so on. Players try to shed their hand down to zero first, by playing a card to match another player's.

The lead player offers a card, such as a ring, to another player. If they have the same card in hand, they discard it too. If they do not have the matching card, they say they acknowledge the feelings but cannot reciprocate, so they accept the gift card into their hand. The giver is now heart-broken and draws another card from the deck as solace.

Players can block a romance by playing other cards from their hand, such as "I'm sorry", or "wait a minute!" to steal a gift, or "I'm watching you" to block a confessor.

The first player to empty their hand wins.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: DirtSlingers
description:
DirtSlingers is a dirt-track, Sprint Car themed racing game for 2 to 8 players. Using 3 different card decks to move pawns around the oval track, many movements will not only move your pawns but other player's pawns as well.

Complete with 4 different modes of play, DirtSlingers has something for any racing fan. Play as 305 or 410 Sprint Cars and use either Rookie or Veteran gameplay. A small change in the decks of cards can make all the difference.

Like any other racing game, the goal is to get across the finish first, but the game doesn't stop there. Not only are there four different races to finish, but play multiple times and record your progresses to compete in a Season game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Race, Track Movement

name: Deadletterz
description:
Spell like you and your friend's lives depended on it! Action verbs can hurt or escape the zombie, can help your friends... or not! Pick up a shotgun and spell "shoot" to blow the zombie's head off! Strengthen your spelling skills while exercising strategic thinking in this cooperative and competitive game of survival. Can you make it out alive?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Track Movement, Trick-taking

name: Dog's Breath
description:
This card game is perfect for ye olde tavern complete with good ale and a warm fire. Quench your thirst for trick-taking in this fast-paced game of huffing and hoarding. Eat the worst food and choose which end from which to expel your rotten doggy hotness! Silly and fast-paced, strategize what to collect and what to discard and when, and how to arrange/hide your hand.

—description from the publisher

name: Dogonauts: Starflea Territories
description:
The stop-motion short film Dogonauts: Enemy Line introduces the Dogonauts universe. The card game Dogonauts: Starflea Territories continues from the film and pits players against one another to see who can repair their space ship first. Area control is the name of this game! Two versions of Dober the space dog and Fester the space flea can be chosen to deploy your battlefield tactics.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Map Reduction, Pattern Building

name: Gem Runner: Starring Bit Boy
description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Bit Boy battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gem Runner: Starring Cache Cat
description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Cache Cat battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gem Runner: Starring Data Dog
description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Data Dog battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gem Runner: Starring Giga Girl
description:
Retro 8-bit video game-like adventure with Giga Girl battling enemies, bosses, and classic video game hazards to earn and steal Gems! The fight for justice to rid the world of evil begins with you and your friends! Join our hero. Conquer the hazards. Defeat the enemies. Obliterate the bosses. Get the Gems!

Take turns presenting each other with classic video game challenges, always putting a Gem as a reward at the end. Play with or against your friends, or even the 'computer!' Learn the depth of the subtle strategies in Gem Runner, and emerge victorious!

Presenting a challenge involves chaining elements together and trying to make the most difficult obstacles to overcome. Playing against a challenge involves matching an element or a game mechanic (e.g. punch, jump, etc.) with what is required for each challenge.

There are 4 heroes, each with their own deck (sold separately) that include all unique hazards, enemies, and bosses. Decks can be played together to expand the number of gems collectable per player, and add some unique gameplay.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Itty Kitty
description:
Introducing Nooki, the Itty Kitty with a penchant for adorable, feline mischief. Use memory and matching to satisfy Itty-Kitty and your desire for laughter and facepalms. Challenge your memory and a bit of strategy to prevail. No kitties (Itty or otherwise) were harmed in the making of this game.

Each turn consists of uncovering 2 face-down cards and either matching them to each other, or matching 1 or more cards from your hand. Matching connects a kitty card (which depicts Nooki desiring something) with a desire card (which depicts a desire). The player with the most cards in their kitty "bed" wins!

—description from the publisher

name: My Secret Garden: Game & Puzzle
description:
Cooperate to create a secret garden together, or compete to earn the most points in this double-sided adventure that includes a game and a puzzle. This experience is designed to be relaxing while you enjoy the simple act of putting puzzle pieces together, or lining up elements of a garden for more points. Play cooperatively or competitively with friends and family as peaceful calm surrounds you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Map Deformation, Pattern Recognition

name: Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug
description:
Based on the adorable children's book of rhyming tales of the same name, our Peas, Pirates, and a Potato Bug card game (nicknamed "P3") allows kids and parents to construct pictures from the book like jigsaw puzzle pieces. This is a quick and easy game for children and families to play together in a fun, relaxed environment.

P3 can be played cooperatively or competitively. Competing requires each player to finish one of the many pictures that can be constructed to collect the picture's cards. The player with the most cards at the end wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Polar Rails
description:
Polar Rails is a Christmas-themed game that uses the gameplay from Empire Builder with players creating rail networks that are centered on the North Pole.

Use your initial investment to build track, then pick up commodities where they are grown, mined, or manufactured and deliver them to a lucrative place of demand. Complete a delivery and make the money you need to buy larger, faster trains and expand your railroad empire. Win the game by building the most effective railroad empire!

In more detail, players use washable crayons to draw their train routes over a map of the North Pole, including North America, Greenland, Asia, and Europe. Players start with an initial sum of money which they use to build short lengths of track during their first couple of turns. For the rest of the game, players operate their trains over the track network drawn on the board to pick up and deliver loads to various cities, then have the opportunity to add to their track network or improve their train. The game uses demand cards which list three demands, each of a commodity to be delivered to a specified city for a given payoff. Each player has three demand cards to provide opportunities for income.

Each turn consists of an operations phase and a building phase. During the operations phase, trains are moved to cities where commodities are picked up at no cost and moved to one of the cities on that player's demand cards. When the commodity is delivered, the player receives the payoff and trades that demand card for a new one. Event cards are mixed in the deck with the demand cards. When an event card is drawn the instructions are followed. During the building phase, a player may pay to build more track or upgrade their train.
