A player wins by being the first to connect their track network to six of the seven major cities on the board and acquire $250,000,000 in cash on hand.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Racket Roll: Tennis
description:
Become a tennis champion by being the first to empty your deck through card-matching and rolling dice! Set in the late 70s and early 80s, up to 4 competitors engage one another to win. Includes archrivals Bjorn vs. John and Chris vs. Martina. Each is a master of a court type - grass, clay, indoor, and synthetic. Play any combination and serve yourself a winning cup with this ace!

On your turn, you either match a card with your hand with a card on the board (domino style), or roll your colored die and then place it in an empty square. The next player can match to your die, or any other die or dots printed on the minicards. The first player to place the last card of their hand wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Pattern Recognition

name: Sport Jockeys: American Football
description:
Play the visceral, moment-to-moment game of American Football as a card game! Captures the essence of what it’s like to play Gridiron, without statistics, players, etc. You are the team and make the calls every play as you battle it out with the opposing team. Choose to be the home team or the visitor and it’s game on! Includes 56 cards depicting offensive and defensive actions (Run, Pass, Kick, Fake, Dive, Hail Mary, Hand-Off, Kickoff, Tackle, Fumble, etc.), 1 Offense card, 2 Score cards, 1 Reference card, and 3 Indicator cubes.

After the kickoff, the player assuming the role of offense will place a "Snap" card. The opponent can then place a card that counters or follows the snap card, such as "Tackle." Offense can counter with a "Pass." Cards can be played as combinations to increase your side's points. The goal is to get more points than your opponent every play to advance your marker on the score card. After 4 plays, offense will either score points (simulating a field goal all the way to a touchdown with a 2-point conversion) or defense will score 2 points for a safety. Play continues with the opponent assuming the role of offense.

All of this can be interrupted or changed if an opponent intercepts the ball, recovers a fumble, etc. And every action played has counters. Winning players have a little luck but play their cards strategically to maximize when to play combos, which cards to play vs. keep, and how to predict their opponent's plays. To add further depth, each card has an Offense and a Defense side to it, providing for many more play possibilities.

The deck represents either a full game, a half, or a quarter of a game. Once a full game is complete, whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Matching, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Trick-taking

name: Waste Knights: Witness Me! Promo Card
description:
One Luck card to add to the game, distributed during Essen Spiel 2015.

After combat, if you defeat your opponent in combat, you additional game +1 reputation. If you end this combat with 2 or 1 health, you additionally gain +1 reputation.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: 3 Mädchen und 3 Jungen
description:
Four big pawns represent the parents, the family dog and the house keeper, while the six small pawns represent the kids (the Brady Bunch). The goal of the game is for the adults and the dog to find the kids and take them home to score points.

If up to 4 players are playing the players represent the adults and the dog, while the kids are moved only according to the game rules. If more than 4 players are playing, the kids are also moved by players.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Locked Adventures: Der Fall – Berlin
description: Your team accepted the invitation of a renowned journalism school to Berlin, where a student turned to you for help: Her friend Christopher suddenly went into hiding because he had got wind of a suspicious matter. Christopher was in the utmost panic and said that it was a matter of life and death, but the police must not be called on under any circumstances! Your investigative talent is more in demand than ever in the new city. You make your way through unknown Berlin to help Christopher. Are you late or can you still provide last-minute help?

name: Citytrip Paris
description:
Citytrip Paris is the third game in the 'Citytrip series' featuring new gameplay elements.

As a tour guide you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting famous buildings and musea, events, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Paris is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 23 starting points and 44 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest satisfaction score wins Citytrip Paris.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Finger Guns at High Noon: Lasso Promo Cards
description:
A set of three cards to add to the base game:

KEEPER Promo - Pauleen "Powderkeg" Guthrie
KEEPER Promo - Sampson "Second Life" Stinton
INSTANT Promo - The Scuggins Gang
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Crowded Cave Adventures
description:
Crowded Cave Adventures is a Dungeon Crawler, Roguelike RPG Card Game within layers of narrative chapters. You manage your heroes, filling up their backpack with artifacts, fairies and scrolls, completing quests and defeating pixel art monsters and bosses.

It's an open world board game in which you'll be exploring up to 15 "Cave Worlds", all connected together. There are more than 1700 cards to discover and an infinity amount of power combinations depending on the hero's class, Guild and the rarity of the legendary treasures found inside the Caves...

Up to 4 players can either team up or compete in order to be the richest, the most powerful adventurer or the one who discovers the true nature of this amazing universe. When the main boss is defeated, the Run ends!

Draw a card, interact with it, explore more, fight monsters and stay wise in order to save your hero's life. Should'nt you come back to your camp now before it's too late?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Finale Ending, Ladder Climbing, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Network and Route Building, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1244: The Fall of Montsegur
description:
1244: The Fall of Montsegur is a strategic board game inspired by the historical event. One player takes on the role of commanding the crusading army. The other player takes on the role of commanding the defense of Montsegur. In a series of turns the players fight to gain control of the area around Montsegur and the souls of the Cathars trapped inside the castle. At the end of the siege, victory points are scored to determine if the Cathar faith survives the fall.

The goal in 1244: The Fall of Montsegur is to claim the majority of the souls of the Cathar perfects trapped inside the castle. The inquisitors of the Crusaders try to get the misguided to repent, while the Cathars perfects try to escape or to have faith to make the final sacrifice: Burn for their belief.

The religious struggle takes place on the background of a military campaign, where each side strives to gain control of the battlefield and to endure the hardships of the long siege.

In a number of turns each representing roughly one month of the siege, each player in turn plays cards to advance his goals and to sabotage his opponent. Each card can either be played for the point value on the card to take one of the standard actions or be played for the event on the card. Some events benefit solely the Cathars, others the Crusaders, and some can benefit both depending on who plays it and what the position on the board is. In every turn one card from each player's hand is not played but is kept for the final scoring.

-description from publisher's website

name: Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write – Contest Sheet #1 2020
description: This promo sheet was created by a fan and released as a free Print and Play via the Portal Games website.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Prêt Feu Go!
description:
Prêt Feu Go is a friendly and festive game for your evenings with friends. The game is in French only.

Small format, very simple rules, unlimited number of players and lasting from 5 minutes to hours, it will adapt to all your events: dinners with friends, aperitifs on the terrace, WE in the countryside, team-buildings, rave-party, birthdays, weddings and bachelor(ette) parties!

The Chief asks 1 question to another player, who needs to give 3 answers within 5 seconds. If the player manages to give 3 or more correct answers during these 5 seconds: IT'S WON, he wins the question card which represents 1 point, and the next player is to answer.

Please note: the Chief is all-powerful and it is up to him to decide whether the answers given are accepted (especially for subjective questions!). Once all the players have been interviewed, the Chief chooses the player who will become the new Chief, and off you go for another round!

The winner is the first to get 6 points… or the player with the most points when you decide to end the game.

You will find six categories: Culture, Non censured, Your life-your point of view, France, unclassifiable, things.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Wrath of the Everchosen
description:
The Great Necromancer, Nagash, initiates an all-out war to end all life in the Mortal Realms, but in order to complete his monumental task he needs access to them. And so he turns his gaze to the Eightpoints, ruled over by none other than Archaon Everchosen, Exalted Grand Marshall of the Apocalypse.

The vast armies of the dead, led by Nagash’s chief lieutenant, Katakros, march for the nigh-impenetrable fortress of Chaos – the Varanspire. Archaon does not take this challenge lightly, and seeks aid from a powerful force, long believed to be lost… But will it be enough to halt the legions of the dead?

Wrath of the Everchosen advances the story of Warhammer Age of Sigmar with Realm-shaking events that will have far-reaching consequences for many factions. You'll learn why Nagash needs to conquer the region to complete his infernal work, and watch the ebb and flow of the invasion as it progresses.

On top of the action-packed story, this book includes a painting guide, and enhanced rules for your Chaos Grand Alliance armies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoch hinaus
description:
Each player, if no more than 5, gets a red wooden disc. On your turn, place a white disc on the table if it is the first one. If not, stack it on the disc tower. When you think the tower will crash before it's your turn again, place a red disc. If it's your turn again, pay a chip. When the tower crashes, the player who caused it pays 4 chips, other players with still their red disc in possession pay 2. If you are out of chips, you're out of the game. The last player with chips wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Predictive Bid, Stacking and Balancing

name: LEO (400-800km)
description:
Low Earth Orbit (LEO) is the most crowed area of space. 1000s of spacecraft pass overhead and orbit slots are hotly contested. Take control of your LEO spacecraft, manage its resources to deliver the maximum data back to the ground.

In LEO (400-800km) players take control of a spacecraft in Low Earth Orbit. Each turn they move their spacecraft to the next orbit card and resolve the events on that card (discharge battery, damage memory, use thrusters to maintain orbit, place new orbit card).

After the events, the player can then take one of the following actions:

Adjust orbit (either moving up to a higher orbit, or down to a lower orbit),
Recharge battery,
Activate instruments (storing science or image data in their memory area)
Downlink data (remove science & image data from the memory area and score points on the science and image track)


As the game progresses players will be eliminated as they run out of fuel and can no longer maintain their orbit.
Once all players have been eliminated, the player with highest, lowest scoring track is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Tick Tack Bumm Vibrations
description: This is a guessing game for adults. The challenge is that you get a red bomb which can explode at any time.

name: Die Stinkies: Rette sich, wer kann!
description: Roll the dice as fast as you can and move your tokens accordingly. If you are too slow, the car wash will wet you and you loose.

name: Stolpersteig
description: Stumbling blocks are all over the place! Every player has 8 tokens to find his way to the castle. But since there are many obstacles, such as stones, water or canyons, it's a real challenge to be the first one in the castle...

name: Cars Angelspiel
description: Fishing game with the famous cars from the movie! Help Hook to tow away the corresponding cars.

name: Wasser marsch!
description: Willy Water, the friendly fire hydrant, is very busy: There is fire threatening the zoo, the cinema, the theme parc and the toys store. All children blow as much as they can to save the city.

name: Das grosse Musikquiz
description: The quiz game from Abba to ZZ Top, from rock to pop! The game is based on Germany's famous music show and features 528 music questions.

name: Galileo Wissens-Quiz
description: Quiz game based on the famous TV show Galileo. Test your knowledge and win!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Hexerei
description:
"I am the strongest", shouts the witch and chases away the dog. But she didn't count on the mouse - in order to get away from the mouse she has to take to her heels!
The spinning dice swirl around until all players have decided on a figure. But who is chasing away whom? As a reward for guessing right, you get tidbit cards. A guessing game.
—description from the back of the box

The mechanism is similar to rock-paper-scissors. The children must guess what the others might take and take the better one.
—user summary

name: Waldfreunde
description: Friends of the forest: On your marks, ready, steady, go! The quirrel, hare, deer and bear are having an exciting competition. They whizz along the bushes and trees as as fast as the wind. But what is happening there? A bush is moving! Which animal doesn't get confused and wins the race?

name: Pizza-Pizza
description: Pineapple, cheese, tomatoes and many other delicious ingredients are to be put onto the pizza. But one kid has hidden the ingredients carefully: The tomatoes in the bookshelf, the mushroom behind a plant, the salami below the table... The others must rush to find all the items. The first one wins.

name: Ratz Fatz Weltreise: Mau Mau
description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers around the world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

name: Ratz Fatz Piraten: Mau Mau.
description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers within the pirates world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

name: Ratz Fatz Pferde: Mau Mau
description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers who love horses.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

name: Tri-Memo
description:
The game is played like a classic memo, in which each player tries to collect as many pairs as possible by revealing them. Only with TRI-MEMO there are other variations that also require concentration and strategy, but also bring fun, excitement and - yes, also malicious joy.

Instead of finding two identical cards, you need to find a pair of two cards that are two halves of one picture.

name: Vermot: le grand tournoi
description:
Vermot: le grand tournoi for the fan of the Vermot and passionate about French popular culture.

The Vermot is now available in the form of a board game.

Roll the dice and test your knowledge of the Vermot universe in a course strewn with pitfalls.
320 cards containing more than 600 questions divided into 6 sections: History, Sport, Humor, Leisure, Science and health, Society.

Game play:
roll the dice and advance your pawn on a 30-day calendar board dotted with bonus spaces. Whoever fills their calendar first wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Last Species
description:
A triangle board contains 121 tiles, you control 3 rescuers of the WWF association. You will have to move, explore the jungle and the oceans in order to find the 7 last endangered species before your opponent. You will have to use cleverly all objects you pick up when you move upon tiles to put all chances to your side.

—user summary

name: Survivor Challenge
description:
Survivor Challenge is a card game in which you can playfully get fit! Challenge yourself and others with 70 playing cards for a varied training program and intensive group fun. If you fail a challenge, you're out of the game — and if everyone else has dropped out, then you win.

•••

Survivor Challenge ist das erste Fitnessspiel, mit du spielerisch fit wirst! Fordere dich und andere heraus: mit 70 Spielkarten, abwechslungsreichem Trainingsprogramm und intensivem Gruppenspaß. Überall und jederzeit. Ganz ohne Geräte. Mit nur einem Ziel: Am längsten durchzuhalten und der Survivor zu werden!

name: Captain Kangaroo TV Lotto
description:
Here are your child's favorite television characters in a game he can play all by himself, or with as many as three friends. Good practice in recognizing and completing picture - and lots of fun, too.

One Child Alone: can play Captain Kangaroo TV Lotto by spreading all 4 Master cards on table or floor and matching the Lotto pieces to the cards by putting each piece in its proper place. Older children may like to match up the pieces by checking the numbers in the corners of the picture pieces with the corresponding numbers on the Master cards.

For Group Play: each player selects a Master card and puts it face up in front of him.

The Lotto pieces are mixed and placed face down, in a pile in the middle of the playing area. The first player in turn lifts a Lotto piece from the pile and holds it up for all to see. If the Lotto piece matches a section of his Master card, he places it over the matching section and has the opportunity to pick the next card from the pile. The player continues picking from the pile until he selects a Lotto piece that does not match his Master card.

The player on whose master card the Lotto piece belongs, calls "here!" and takes it. He places it on the right spot on his Master card and continues picking Lotto pieces until he cannot use it.

Unclaimed picture pieces are returned to the bottom of the pile and called out again at the end of the game.

The first player to complete a picture by covering his Master card with all 6 pieces is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Antilles
description:
Trivial Pursuit Édition Antilles
2000 questions in different fields related to the Antilles:

the geography of the West Indies,
the history of the Caribbean,
the Creole cuisine,
tropical nature,
great sportsmen from the Antilles,
local music...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Penis Camouflage
description:
The goal of the game is to disguise an offensive image as a harmless drawing. Create a challenge by combining one of the penis stamps with a theme.

Select one player to begin as the judge. The judge stamps everyone's pad of paper, declares a theme for the round and starts the sand timer.

The players must draw quickly to transform the image before the time runs out. The judge selects a winner and a new judge is chosen. Play continues until everyone has had their fill of penises and hilarity.

—user summary

name: Wargame Scenarios: The Peninsular War 1808-1814
description:
The enjoyment of wargaming is greatly enhanced if the battles (games) are played within well thought-out scenarios. Instead of simply lining up evenly-matched armies and fighting to the death, the players can have realistic objectives (such as the capture of a vital piece of terrain or delaying a superior enemy to cover a retreat) and be confronted with more challenging tactical decisions. Devising such scenarios can take a lot of effort, and more critically, time, which is always in short supply. This book is designed to take the time and effort out of organising fascinating and challenging wargames set in the Peninsular War.

In addition to 20 carefully devised scenarios of varying size and complexity, this book contains a concise introduction to the theatre of operations and an integrated chronology of battles and campaigns, showing where the scenarios fit into the wider events. The scenarios and orders of battle are intended for use with Pen & Sword's own Napoleonic wargame rules, Grand Battery, but they are easily adaptable for use with other leading systems.

• Briefing notes on the context of the battle and the dilemmas and objectives facing each commander. Orders of battle for each side and any other information required to set up.

Contents
• Concise introduction to the Peninsular War with chronology to place the scenarios in context.
• 20 carefully devised scenarios of varying size and complexity.
• a wargamer-friendly map, showing players where to place terrain, buildings and other features that had an impact on the battlefield. It will also show initial dispositions (historical) and mark the point of entrance (or exit) of units during the battle.
• Clear win/lose/draw conditions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Drakkarmada
description:
Drakkarmada is the world of longship raids, Viking clan rivalries, alliances and betrayals.
Drakkarmada is also an epic adventure amidst mighty nature, facing raging elements and terrible sea monsters.
Drakkarmada, the game of conquerors!

Goal: create the most important Armada of Drakkars, thanks to boarding parties, to alliances between Viking clans and despite, the betrayals, the losses caused by the formidable storms, the attacks of the opposing clans or those of the kraken, the terrible sea monster.

Gameplay:
Each player receive a clan and 1 alliance card.
Each player starts with a level 1 Drakkar then chooses what cards to play in order to get the longer line of Drakkars.
Events (Alliance / Kraken / betrayal of alliance...) will interfere with their plans.
Once the deck of cards is gone, the player / team with the most Drakkars win.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Medieval, Nautical

name: Wesołe Niedźwiadki
description: Simple race, dice movement game from the 60s,70s? for preschool kids with nice for its time plastic tokens of bears, and events fields on the board. Nice, climatic, artistic graphics on the board. Dice is showing not the number, but colours, which shows to which field bear travels.
publishers: Przedsiębiorstwo Papierniczo Poligraficzne  Prodryn w Będzinie

name: Siege: Alexander at Tyre
description: Siege: Alexander at Tyre is a simple wargame on the 7 months siege of the fortified city of Tyre, the city-state of Phoenicia in 332 BC by the Greco-Macedonians.

name: Trigon
description:
Trigon is a tile placement game by Wilhelm Kienzle from 1951 and was published by Naef in 1958.
Each player gets a set of 9 similar right triangles (5 different sizes) that form a geometric sequence.
All 9 tiles together form a square with a square hole in which a cube (the die) lies.
A triangle is made up of two smaller ones in the sequence.
The side lengths of the triangle are based on the golden section.

You can find more in the book "Kurt Naef: Der Spielzeugmacher".
All tiles and the box are made of wood in high quality.

The game: A player rolls the die that dertemines a specific size, 6 meaning any choice. The player places the triangle on the table. In turn order, the other players place one of their triangles adjacent to the last played triangle with the same length (similar to the principle of domino). A player who cannot do so must pass. The player who gets rid of all his triangles wins.

In addition, mathematical facts are presented about the Golden section, the theorem of Pythagoras and about parallelograms. There a puzzles presented to be solved as well.

—user summary

name: Napoleon's Wars: Wargame Rules 1792 - 1815
description:
Napoleon's Wars is an exciting and well designed set of wargame rules for the Napoleonic period.

They allow you to take the role of Generals and re-fight battles in miniature using any scale figures from 2mm to 28mm.
Most importantly, they do not require the use of dice.
The mechanisms used to control your armies encourage you to use the tactics of the period.
The rules pit you very much against your opponent in the combat process.
Everything you need in one book to refight your battles and campaigns including army lists, scenarios and campaign rules.
A Divisional sized battle can be completed within two hours and a Corps level battle within three hours.
The rules are flexible enough to allow players to fight solo, two-player as well as multi-player battles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monster's Coffee: Lumberjack
description:
A single promo card.

Rule:
You have to choose the 5 family you'll be playing with, then add the Lumberjack to the deck, shuffle the cards and distribute 10 to each player.
When you choose this card, place it in the monster family of your choice which already has ate least one monster, in the middle of the table.
This family won't worth any coffee token at the end of the round.
If the lumberjack is in your frontline or your backline at the end of the round, it doesn't count for the coffee token distribution.

name: Monster's Coffee: Poulpomoka
description:
When you choose this card, play it on any card located in the frontline of your choice.
Immediatly, you have to use the power of the covered monster.
The covered card can't be chosen anymore and won't count during the cofee distribution.
A covered card remains under the Poulpomoka all along the round, even if this one moves. Thus, sometimes you'll have to move the covered card with the Poupomoka.
When you distribute the coffee tokens at the end of the round, the player who has the most number of Poulpomoka cards will win a number of points that corresponds to the number of covered cards under his Poulpomokas.
Note: If you play with the SNOUT, when a coffee token is placed on the card you want to cover, just take it.

name: Number Wonderful
description:
In Number Wonderful, a.k.a. ナンバーワンダフル, players face all sorts of strange challenges, with each challenge being carried out by the game's current champ and one challenger.

The only way to score points is to be the champ — but the challenger gets to decide which challenge takes place. Will you be competing to see who can name the dish that other players most want to eat right now? Will you each pretend to be sick to see whose illness looks the most real? If the players vote for the champ, the champ scores points, but they keep those points only if they voluntarily step down from their position. If the challenger wins, then the champ loses all of their banked points.

How bold are you feeling, champ?

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Astra Militarum Ground Assets
description:
The Astra Militarum are rightly feared by the enemies of the Imperium for the quantity of their ground troops, and the quality of their ordnance. Where aircraft are set to operate, static ground-based weapons batteries will often be deployed in advance to protect vital assets and add to the fleet’s firepower.

Hydra flak batteries are common across Imperial war zones. The version used by the Astra Militarum can be erected quickly, and then dismantled and sent to the advancing front as needed. Their quad-barrelled cannons fill the skies with a storm of lethal shrapnel.

Basilisk Anti-aircraft Emplacements hurl massive Earthshaker shells to saturate the air with clouds of burning debris, tearing apart airframes and smashing engines to bits. When deployed in clusters, an entire section of the sky becomes a near-impenetrable wall of deadly flak.

This finely-detailed resin kit allows you to build one of each type of ground weapon, including two heavily-armoured bunkers in which to house them, plus a fuel depot to be used as an objective during your games. All three of these resin kits feature the rough-and-ready aesthetics of the Imperial Guard, visually distinct from the ground assets of the Imperial Navy.

The set includes:
- 1 resin Hydra flak battery
- 1 resin Basilisk Anti-aircraft emplacement
- 1 resin fuel depot

Profiles (stat cards) for the two weapon emplacements are included. The full rules for using these miniatures in games of Aeronautica Imperialis can be found in the Taros Air War Campaign Book.

-description from publisher's website

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: T'au Air Caste Ground Assets
description:
The advanced technology of the T’au race extends to all levels of the war effort, including ground-to-air gun batteries.

KV 129 Stormfury Platforms utilise drones to calculate the velocity and vector of enemy aircraft. Once a firing solution has been acquired, the twin rail gun array fires just once, more often than not smashing through the hull of a distant target with devastating effect.

KV 216 Skyfire Platforms also paint potential marks with roving bands of drones. Once a lock is sent back to the weapon emplacement, twin burst cannons saturate the area with deadly-accurate firepower.

This finely detailed resin kit allows you to build one of each type of ground weapon, including two round armoured bastions in which to house them, plus a T’au Air Caste Emplacement communications tower to be used as an objective during your games. All three of these resin kits feature the sleek aesthetics that characterise T’au technology.

The set includes:
- 1 resin KV 129 Stormfury Platform
- 1 resin KV 126 Skyfire Platform
- 1 resin T’au Air Caste Emplacement

Profiles (stat cards) for the two weapon emplacements are included. The full rules for using these miniatures in games of Aeronautica Imperialis can be found in the Taros Air War Campaign Book.

-description from publisher's website

name: The Timewatch
description:
In the future, scientists on Earth have opened a portal to a land outside of time. That land outside of time is full of various forces attempting to take control of other times and places. Scientists from various Earth futures were ready and waiting with gear and information so that Earth could defend itself. The 88th Company, "The Timewatch", was formed. They are the ones who step into There to protect us all.

This is a tactical battle that involves the use of the present and the past. Units have a piece representing their current position, plus a piece representing a previous position. Both pieces can be moved (altering the present and the past). Time can jump backwards to the past positions.

The objective of the game is to control spaces on the game board to gain victory points. The winner is
the player with the most victory points after each player has spent 180 action points.

-description from designer

name: The Ultimate Burger
description:
The Ultimate Burger is a simple and fast card game. The goal you ask? As mentioned earlier, simple.
You just need to make The Ultimate Burger.

You don´t knowhow? Let me help you. You need four things - bun, meat, cheese and Jalapeño.

The thing is, everyone wants to make the ultimate burger, but there are not enough ingredients. Sure, there are enough buns and cheese for everyone, but there are only two meat slices and only one Jalapeño!

Players are taking turns. Each turn, you can do two actions - draw a card and play card or any combination of the two. Playing a card means playing an action card or placing an Ingredient card in front of you. The player who has one of each ingredient before him at the end of his turn, wins.

The Ingredients are scattered throughout the deck along with the action cards. It is your job to find them, either by drawing them from the deck or stealing them from another player.

name: Cycling Manager
description:
Cycling Manager is a unique cycling race game based on relative movement (the cyclists are represented based on their relative position from each other). Players will not have to move their cyclists at each step to make it move forward through the race, they will only have to make them move when they want to !

In Cycling Manager, players take the control of a team of 4 cyclists trying to finish the race in the first position. The race will be composed of a succession of 4 different stage profiles (flat, hills, mountain climb and descent).

The cyclists will be placed in groups all along the race. At the beginning, all cyclists are in the same group (the peloton). At each stage step (each step having its own stage profile), cyclists will be able to:

Not doing anything (they will stay in their current position), this is what will happen most of time for most of the cyclists
Change their position in their group (they may want to take the lead in their group or go at the back to rest)
Attack: Move forward from one group to another. The new group they reach depends on how much energy they spend on the attack (attack can be small, medium or high).
Move back: move to another group backward, it will allow them to get back some energy/


Cyclists will go through the stage step by step (a typical stage is composed of each 12 stage profiles). At each step, cyclists will be able to perform one action. Actions can be attacking (small, medium or big attack) or move back. An attack will cost energy to cyclist, a move back will give back some. Cyclists will manage their own energies through the stage based on the following :

Stage profile: cyclists can be more or less comfortable in different profiles (flat, hills, mountain climb and descent) and will spend energy accordingly
their position in their group: cyclist will spend less energy if they're protected by other cyclists
their group's speed: if a group is moving fast (trying to catch another group for instance), they will spend more energy.


At the end of the race, the cyclists in the leading group can compete in the final sprint to get the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Lincoln's Invasion 1861-1865
description:
The year is 1861. Tensions between the industrial north and agrarian south have been strained for years. Immoral as it may be, slavery is an institution in the south and, like it or not, its major asset. As new states are added to the union, slavery there will likely be prohibited. The south will thus eventually lose federal political power while the north gains it. Additionally, burdensome tariffs which mainly affect the south have been doubled, hurting its economy. Abraham Lincoln, a northern lawyer and railroad man, is sworn in as the new President of the United States. During his inaugural address, Lincoln promises not to invade the south or curtail slavery as long as tariffs are collected there and handed over to the federal government. The south secedes nonetheless. Lincoln won’t let it go, and attempts to reinforce Fort Sumter in South Carolina, hoping to provoke the south into firing the first shots, and it does, leveling the fort. With war fever in the north at its zenith, the stage is set – for Lincoln’s invasion of the south!

Lincoln's Invasion 1861-1865 is a highly playable card game of light complexity, with a small rules set. Over the course of 17 or 18 battles the USA and CSA will duke it out over the fate of the union. Event cards generally play out to the advantage of CSA in the beginning and USA toward the end, while diceless combat reduces the luck factor. There are tough decisions to be made, a bit of "look-ahead" and just the right amount of bluff. This is the perfect "lunchtime" ACW game for players who want to relive the conflict in less than an hour.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: All Hell Let Loose
description:
All Hell Let Loose is a set of WW2 late war wargaming rules designed and playtested to encourage real-life tactics. Although created specifically for 6mm (or 1/285th scale) miniatures the rules can be used for larger sized miniatures like 10mm with minimal changes.

The rules allow you to play at the scale you choose - either 1 model or stand of infantry represents 1 vehicle or squad/section of infantry or each model or stand can represent a platoon.

Optional rules let you dial up the detail and zoom in on the minutia of combat or skip them to play really big games more quickly.

Simple and adaptable late war European theatre army lists with each of the four major powers for that theatre included: British, American, Soviet and German.

A two-page quick reference sheet allows you to play without needing to reference the core rules and the rules include a photocopy ready counter sheet that provides counters for hidden movement, ambush and target markers for indirect fire and aircraft attacks.


Fast play, simple rules that encourage real-life tactics
All the rules you need to get started in one book
Simple army lists for late war European eastern and western front
Flexible figure scale and basing system
Rules for the fog of war and for hidden movement
Suitable for solo play all the way up to multiplayer club sized games
No record-keeping or order writing necessary
Optional rules for weather, darkness, engineers and high ground
Photocopy ready counter sheet
Photocopy ready quick reference sheet


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fallen Knight: Tallista
description:
Tallista is an expansion for the Fallen Knight board game.

Plot
Tallista, the 9 tailed beast, a symbol of perfection. She seeks knowledge in order to transform into a beautiful woman, this will allow her to learn mankind’s nature and culture. She is the only one who holds massive physical and magical powers.

Gameplay
If you take our game monsters and bosses lightly, you are likely to get killed mercilessly. Exploit their weaknesses as this will help you win. At the beginning of the game, each player names their Knight and chooses 5 starting abilities. Before entering battle, select 3 of the 5 ability cards and utilize them to transform your Damned Sword. With up to 20+ sub-action cards, you can flexibly tailor your attacks to deal with your immediate foes!. Explore our dark fantasy world and encounter different types of enemies, each with different behaviors. Killing monsters grants you the game's currency, Karma. Karma can be used to record abilities, purchase items, and level up characters. Leveling up your characters gives them more capacity to record abilities and create more synergies with your ability cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: 2020 Retroz
description:
2020 Retroz is a humorous card game in which you can bluff to gain an advantage. This game revolves around 2020 headline news, events and other topics. Players get to choose description cards from their hand that would relate to a given topic. The judge player then selects the best submission according to their personality. Each round consists of four phases where players can wager, judge, calculate points and replenish the cards in their hand. The rounds continue until a player reaches one of three winning conditions.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Player Judge, Predictive Bid, Variable Phase Order, Voting

name: SOSPETTO-胡散臭い調剤師- (SOSPETTO)
description:
SOSPETTO-胡散臭い調剤師- (SOSPETTO -Smell Dispenser-) is a card game from Japan. Players are competing shop owners, chemists trying to craft the best medicines. The final winner is the one with the best ingredients with the highest values. Sospetto is Italian for suspect, shady.

Each player can present themselves as different roles, vampires, doctors, assassins, clowns, and so on. In the preparation phase each round, the players improve their hand cards and interfere with their opponents. In the rights phase, the players compete for the ingredients using a butting mechanism, with equal values cancelling out.

The game uses dice and cards, with characters having different powers. The cards can be used in different ways, so a player doesn't know how the opponent will respond, even if they think they know their hand.

The game includes solitaire rules.
user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Fantasy, Medical
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: ACT Create (アクトクリエイト)

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Broken Realms – Morathi
description:
Morathi, High Oracle of Khaine, sets her sights upon the greatest prize of all – the power of a goddess! As furious war consumes the Mortal Realms, the shadow-wreathed empire of Hagg Nar makes its ambitious play for power. The cruel and boundlessly cunning Morathi, ruler of the Daughters of Khaine, desires to claim her rightful place as a goddess – but to do so she must sacrifice her past, forge bitter new foes, and spill the blood of rivals and allies alike!

The Mortal Realms will never be the same again. In Broken Realms: Morathi, a new era begins for Warhammer Age of Sigmar, bringing with it seismic shifts in the status quo, epic stories, and new rules for your army however you prefer to play. Part narrative supplement, part rulebook, this first Broken Realms book allows you to immerse yourself in the Mortal Realms fiercest conflict yet.

Inside this 120-page hardback book, you'll find:

• The epic story of Morathi's rise to godhood.

• New rules for Morathi herself, representing her new-found power, as well as a new Daughters of Khaine subfaction.

• Two new sets of allegiance abilities for the Cities of Sigmar, representing the newly-annexed Anvilgard - now known as Har Kuron - and the shadowy domain of Misthåvn.

• Rules for Stormkeep armies.

• Significant updates to the Idoneth Deepkin.

• A suite of warscroll battalions to enhance your Cities of Sigmar, Stormcast Eternals, Daughters of Khaine, Slaves to Darkness, and Idoneth Deepkin armies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Batalla de Calama
description:
Batalla de Calama (The Battle of Calama) reenacts the first battle in the War of the Pacific. A larger force of Chilean troops defeated a group of Bolivian soldiers and civilians near the town of Calama on March 23, 1879.

The game is a wargame for two players, one in control of the Chilean troops and one commanding the Bolivian forces. Depending on the difficulty level, the Chilean side can outnumber the Bolivian side by nearly two to one.

Battle of Calama is a simple dice game. There are dice in various colors which determine the amount of troops that can be moved, whether a change of direction is possible, and the outcome of the battles. The troop strength serves as a modifier in battle. The goal is to occupy the entire town.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: デモンズネーム (THE DEMON'S NAME)
description:
デモンズネーム (THE DEMONS'S NAME) is a deduction game from Japan that combines logic puzzles and identity concealment. Exorcists deduce the true name of a demon, the name being a hidden four-digit number.

One player is the demon king, and chooses its secret name from four digits in order. The other players are the exorcists, and must deduce the demon's name. If they do, it loses all its power and they win.

The demon also possesses one of the exorcists in secret at the start of the game (they don't know it) and can lie when answering this exorcist, thus sowing lies in their midst.

The exorcists start the game knowing one of the digits each. They can discuss their ideas for a few minutes, and then in turn, each exorcist makes a claim of the four digit number. The demon answers in such a way that they might deduce which numbers are correct, and in the correct place.

If the exorcists discover the true name within the time limit, they win (and lose if they fail so), but only if they also can conceal who knows which number. For if they land on the correct sequence, the demon king and its possessed aide can now discuss which exorcist had which digit. If they get this correct, the demon king escapes victorious with the assistant.

The game includes rules for playing online. The game is published in Japanese and English.
user summary
publishers: (Self-Published), AaAaAaGames (アーアーアーゲームズ)

name: Uptown Delivery
description:
In this one to two player game you construct a city with cards, complete with roads, bike paths and subways. Once your city is constructed you equip your driver by spending points you earned building your city, then race around delivering food.

In the solo game with a definite win lose condition. You need to deliver a certain number of orders in the number of turns defined by your city score.

In the two player game you are trying to outscore your opponent.

-description from designer
mechanics: Connections, Map Addition, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Victory Points as a Resource

name: PopSavvy: Founder's Edition
description:
PopSavvy is a game that challenges each player's social awareness. It is played by a couple sharing a bottle of wine, by friends and family groups at a dinner table, by classrooms of kids getting to know each other, and by pub crowds demonstrating their social savvy.

Players win the game by being the best at predicting how individuals or groups of people will answer thought-provoking, fun, and/or revealing YES/NO questions. The goal is to "know the crowd" better than your opponents.

Gameplay is very simple. A player selects a PopSavvy card and chooses one question from five categories - SELF, LIFE, lOVE, HOME, or WORLD. Eg. "Does drunkenness reveal the true character of a person"? Each player votes YES or NO on a scoresheet, predicts how many players will vote YES, discovers how many actually voted YES, and earns a score based on how accurate their prediction was. After several questions, the most socially savvy person will reveal themselves.

—description from the publisher

name: Impetus Warbook 1: 3000 BC to 44 BC
description:
Impetus Warbook 1 includes 97 army lists for Impetus second edition

VOLUME 1: AGE OF BRONZE
Early Sumerian (3000-2250 BC), Old and Middle Kingdom Egyptian (3000-1543 BC), Nubian (3000-2250 BC), Early Elamites (3000-800 BC), Early Libyans (3000-665 BC), Akkadian Empire (2300-2193 BC), Old Assyrian and Babylonian (1900-1600 BC), Early Hittite (1680-1380 BC), Hyksos (1645-1537 BC), Minoan and Early Mycenean (1600-1250 BC), Mitanni (1600-1274 BC), Syro-Canaanite and Ugaritic (1600-1100 BC), Kassite and Later Babylonian (1600-750 BC), New Kingdom Egyptian (1543-1069 BC), Hittite Empire (1380-1180 BC), Middle Assyrian (1365-911 BC), Achaians (1250-1190 BC), Trojans (1250-1190 BC), Early Hebrew (1250-1000 BC)

VOLUME 2: AGE OF CHARIOTS
Sea People (1200-1176 BC), Early Philistines (1166-1100 BC), Later Philistines (1100-600 BC),
Later Aramean and Neo Hittite (1100-710 BC), Later Hebrew (1000-587 BC), Phoenician (1000-332 BC), Libyan Egyptians (946-712 BC), Early Neo Assyrian (911-745 BC), Urartian (858-585 BC), Neo-Elamites (800-639 BC), Neo-Babylonian Empire (746-539 BC), Neo-Assyrian (746-679 BC), Kushite Egyptians (745-583 BC), Sargonid Assyrian (680-609 BC), Saitic Egyptian (664-525 BC), Meroitic Kushite (529 BC-350 AD)

VOLUME 3: AGE OF HOPLITES
Early Athens (700-450 BC), Thebes (700-287 BC), Spartans (700-192 BC), Minor Greek Cities (700-275 BC), Ionian Greeks (700-275 BC), Thessaly (700-358 BC), Magna Graecia (700-235 BC), Thracians (700 BC-46 AD), Illyrians (700 BC-10 AD), Early Achaemenid Persians (550-420 BC), Later Athens (450-225 BC)

VOLUME 4: ALEXANDER THE GREAT AND SUCCESSORS
Early Macedonians (600-355 BC), Scythians (750 BC-50 AD), Classical Indians (500-321 BC), Later Achaemenid Persians (419-329 BC), Alexander Macedonians (356-331 BC), Aetolian League (340-189 BC), Alexander Empire (330-323 BC), Alcetas and Minor Successors (323-300 BC), Early Macedonian Successors (322-276 BC), Eumenes (322-316 BC), Antigonus Monophthalmus (322-301 BC), Lysimachos (322-281 BC), Maurya Empire (321-180 BC), Early Ptolemaic (320-276 BC), Early Seleucids (320-205 BC), Demetrius (294-285 BC), Achaean League (280-146 BC), Middle Ptolemaic (276-168 BC), Attalid Pergamene (263-129 BC), Graeco-Bactrian Kingdom (250-130 BC), Galatians (250 BC-25 AD), Early Parthian (247-209 BC), Indo Greek Kingdom (180-10 BC)

VOLUME 5: ROME AND ITALY
Early Etruscan League (600-400 BC), Early Romans (578-400 BC), Campanian (500-203 BC), Apulian, Lucan, Bruttian (500-203 BC), Syracuse (410-210 BC), Later Etruscan League (400-280 BC), Early Republican Romans (400-275 BC), Samnites (355-272 BC), Pyrrhic (300-262 BC)

VOLUME 6: ROMAN EXPANSION
Early Carthaginians (550-241 BC), Gauls (400-50 BC), Bithynia (376-74 BC), Early Armenians (331 BC-251 AD), Later Macedonians (276-168 BC), Middle Republican Romans (264-146 BC), Celtiberians (240-20 BC), Iberian and Lusitanians (240-20 BC), Later Carthaginians (221-146 BC), Numidians (215-148 BC), Middle Parthian (209-53 BC), Later Seleucids (205-83 BC), Later Ptolemaic (169-30 BC), Later Numidians (148-25 BC), Spartacus and Slave Revolts (135-71 BC), Cimbri and Teutoni (113-102 BC), Late Republican Roman (105-25 BC), Pontic (110-47 BC), Sertorius’s Lusitanians (80-72 BC)

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Puppy Park: Secret Mission
description:
Secret Mission is the reimplementation of Hexdominimum for the Puppy Park set, by the same designer, released as a bonus game.

Up to 4 players can play. It can be played with or without the expansion, although the dog houses and tree-poop tiles are not used.

To set up, shuffle the tiles face-down on the table. Each player then draws a tile without showing it to the other players, looks at it, then keeps it before them facing down so the other players can’t see it. If both dogs are the same (i.e. it is a double tile) then discard the tile to the supply and re-draw until you get a tile with two different dogs; then reshuffle the supply. This is your "mission tile". Each player then draws a second tile; this is your "playing tile".

The first player places her playing tile on the table face-up. Then, starting with the second player, players take turns in anticlockwise order, placing their playing tile on the table adjacent to at least one placed tile so that the tiles fit into an imaginary hexagonal grid, then drawing a new playing tile from the supply (if possible). The dogs of adjacent tiles don’t need to match.

The game ends when the last tile has been placed on the table, and each player then calculates her score. For each of the two dogs on your mission tile, find the largest contiguous, connected group of that dog. Count the number of dogs in that group. Once you have counted the largest group for each of your two dogs, multiply these two values to determine your score.

The player with the lowest score wins. In case of a tie, the tied player who played her final tile first wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Snip Rössel-Sprung / Snip-Jagd
description:
Snip Rössel-Sprung (2 players)
Each player has 9 snips in 9 different colors. The snips of the players differ in their size. The goal of the game is to reach the opponents' 9 starting spaces with the snips of the same color (like in Salta). Movement is in knight-move forward and backwards on the grey and red spaces. Double moves are possible by jumping over friendly snips. If a snip has passed the red spaces into the opponents half of the game board, it can't return to its own half.

Snip-Jagd (2-4 Players)
Each player has 2 hunters, which start on the spaces marked with a "J" and a runner starting on the spaces marked with a "L". The players have to move their runner around the game board till it reaches its starting space again. Movement is determined by 2 dice. When a runner moves through an enemy's circle, he risks being caught by the two enemy hunters, which can't leave the circle. A runner may be caught by other runners, too. A caught runner returns to his starting space to begin anew. If a runner manages to catch a hunter, the hunter is out of the game permanently. The first runner to reach his starting space, after completing the track around the game board, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Victory at Sea: Kongo
description:
Kongō (金剛, “Indestructible Diamond”), named for the mountain, was the first battleship of her class, serving in both the first and second world wars. At the time of construction in the early 1910s she was a capital ship (the last Japanese Capital ship to be built outside of Japan) and was among the most heavily armed ships in any Navy. She received two major reconstructions throughout her life, the first being in 1929, she was rebuilt as a battleship, then later in 1935, along with her sister vessels, her superstructure was completely rebuilt, resulting in an increased rate of knots that would allow her to keep pace with the developing carrier groups – thus reclassifying her a s a fast-battleship.

Kongō’s World War II service history includes covering the Japanese amphibious landings in British Malaya and the Dutch East Indies in 1942, shortly before engaging American forces and Midway and during the Guadalcanal campaign. 1943 saw her almost entirely stationed in the Caroline Islands, only being deployed in response to aircraft carrier raids against Japanese Islands scattered across the Pacific. She was part of the Battles of the Philippine Sea and Leyte Gulf in 1944, successfully sinking enemy vessels in the latter. Her ultimate fate was at the hands of a US Submarine (USS Sealion) whilst crossing the Formosa Strait on 21 November 1944. She has the unfortunate distinction of being the sole Japanese battleship sunk by submarine in WW2.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Zuikaku
description:
Zuikaku ( 瑞鶴 “Auspicious Crane”), a Shōkaku-class aircraft carrier, along with her sister ship, were the most successful carriers operated by the Japanese Navy during WW2. The Japanese had learnt many lessons prior to her construction and as such Zuikaku was considerably larger, better armed, and had a higher aircraft capacity than previous purpose-built Japanese Carriers. Setting sail in November 1941, her complement of aircraft included 18 Mitsubushi A6M fighters, 27 Aichi D3A dive bombers and 27 Nakajima B5n torpedo bombers.

She was part of the task force whose aircraft attacked Pearl Harbor in December 1941, and was a prominent participant in many subsequent battles in the Pacific Ocean – including, Java, Ceylon, the Coral Sea, the Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz, the Philippine Seas and Leyte Gulf. It was at this last action that she was sunk, at the Battle of Cape Engano on 25 October 1944. She was the last of the six carriers that participated in the Pearl Harbor attack to be sunk.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Suzuya
description:
The heavy cruiser, Suzuya, is believed to be one of the deepest shipwrecks on record at (a yet) unconfirmed 27,600 feet. She met her fate at the Battle of Leyte Gulf when she was beset upon by carrier-based aircraft – a torpedo exploding in her own tubes set off a chain reaction of fired and damage that forced the ship’s abandonment.

Prior to her sinking, she was involved in covering the landings at Malaya, the invasion of Sarawak, raids in the Indian Ocean, The Midway invasion force, the Solomon Islands, and the Battle of the Philippine Sea.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Mikuma
description:
The second of the four Mogami class heavy cruisers, Mikuma was completed in 1935 but quickly underwent refits to replace her main turrets with twin 203 mm guns. Her former weapons, triple 155mm guns went to Yamato. Early in her career she was tasked with the occupation of Cochinchina, the invasion of Malaya and the invasion of British Borneo.

At the Battle of Sundra Strait Mikuma engaged the Allied cruisers USS Houston and HMS Perth, both of which were sunk. Mikuma then participated in the Indian Ocean Raids, before being recalled for the Midway operation. It was here she met her demise; on 5 June 1944, she was badly damaged by a friendly ship collision attempting to evade US submarine torpedo attacks. A succession of attempted airborne attacks, from B-17s to Vought SB2U Vindicators all failed. The next morning, however, SBD Dauntless dive bombers from USS Enterprise and Hornet managed to successfully inflict 5 bomb hits resulting in a cataclysmic chain reaction of explosions of the onboard AA shells and torpedoes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Yahagi
description:
'Yahagi was the third of the Agano class of light cruiser, intended to be the flagship of a destroyer flotilla. She was completed in December 1943. She participated in the Battles of the Philippine and Leyte Gulf and remained relatively unscathed despite weathering repeated attacks by enemy aircraft during these actions.

She was one of the vessels instructed to accompany Yamato on its final suicide run against the American invaders off Okinawa. On 7 April 1945, this task force was beset by 386 enemy aircraft. During the first wave of these attacks, Yahagi was struck directly in the engine room, and rendered unmovable. Subsequent waves rained more bombs and torpedoes upon her, such damage making rescue impossible.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS New Mexico
description:
USS New Mexico (BB-40) was the lead of her class of battleship and served with the United States Navy between 1918 and 1946. She was the first ship with a turbo-electric transmission, capable of a cruising speed of 10 knots. She served as an escort to President Woodrow Wilson’s voyage to Brest, France, for the signing of the Treaty of Versailles. She operated repeated exercises in Pacific and Atlantic waters in the interwar period and received major modernisation between 1931 and 1933.

Initially, in World War II, the vessel was involved in neutrality operations in the Atlantic. This soon changed after the attack on Pearl Harbor. She returned to the Atlantic and participated in shore bombardments including at Attu and Kiska, Tarawa, the Marshall Islands, the Mariana and Palau Islands Leyte, Luzon and Okinawa. She also performed escort duties, patrols and received refits during this period. USS New Mexico was subject to repeated kamikaze attacks during her WW2 service, which inflicted heavy damage and loss of life. However, she persevered and was present in Tokyo Bay for the Japanese surrender that officially ended the war.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Essex
description:
Built during World War Two, USS Essex was the lead of her class of aircraft carriers. She was commissioned in December 1942 and went on to serve in several campaigns in the Pacific Theatre of operations. For her efforts, she received the Presidential Unit Citation and 13 battle stars. She operated right until the finale of the war, participating in the final raids against the Japanese home islands between 10 July to 15 August 1945.

Though already moderately armed, the primary offensive capability of a carrier was, of course, its aircraft, known as “Sunday Punch”. This comprised up to 36 fighters, 36 dive bombers and 18 torpedo bombers. Typically, the standard fighter would be the Grumman F6F Hellcat, the dive-bomber/scout the Curtiss SB2C Helldiver and the torpedo bomber the Grumman TBF Avenger as the torpedo bomber.

At the close of the war, Essex was decommissioned but modernized and recommissioned in the 1950s, serving as an anti-Submarine carrier. During this time, she participated in the Korean War and was key in the Cuban Missile Crisis. She also has the distinction of being the primary recovery carrier for the Apollo 7 space mission.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Tanzimat: Reform & Crisis in the Ottoman Empire
description:
This historical semi-cooperative Eurogame is set in the Ottoman Empire between 1839 and 1876, at the time of the Tanzimat reforms. The Tanzimat reforms were an ambitious attempt on the part of liberally minded Ottoman sultans and politicians to modernize the aging empire and thereby keep it from disintegrating.

Players in the game represent Ottoman court factions who enlist Statesmen to use their bonuses, enact Reforms and reduce the number of Troubles in the empire. They must keep an eye on three common resources: Finances, Army and Standing. Event cards are drawn at the start of each turn that add new Troubles to the map, possibly causing Revolts.

The game consists of two Ages. At the end of each Age, a Crisis happens. (The Crisis may happen earlier if the number of Troubles and Revolts reach a critical number.) Only one player can win, but all players can lose if they let the empire crumble.

—description from the designer
The game is fully PnP!

COMPONENT LIST
1 rulebook
1 game board
40 Statesmen cards
30 Event cards
30 Reform cards
24 Sultan’s Decree cards
16 Legacy cards
9x4 buildings (Schools, Factories, Juries)
24 markers (partitions, Finances, Army, Standing, income, Loans, Revolts, game effects)
40 cubes (Troubles) - not included in the game!
5x4 cylinders (Influence, player order, VP, offices, Reform stage) - not included in the game!

name: Great Minds
description:
Great Minds is an easy party game where players must solve the puzzle to escape the mind maze.

The mind maze grid board is laid out with 25 clue cards. Each of the clue cards is a different word. Players then take a set of mind cards numbered 1 to 5 and a 2 matching coloured mind tokens, these tokens represent them in the game. The mind maze board also contains a score tracker, and one of the player tokens is added to this tracker.

At the beginning of the game, there will be 25 cards on the mind maze board with different words. Each card has a grid reference letter and number attached to it. The center card of the mind maze grid (C3) is removed and becomes the first clue.

Starting with the top row, player secretly select and play, face down, a numbered mind card relating to a word on the grip and the initial clue. Once all players have played a card, the card are all turned over and players place their mind token on their chosen word. Players get a point if they have successfully picked the same word as another player. The word(or words) with the most votes, becomes the clue for the next row. Once a row is complete, the words on that row are flipped over to reveal new words. Play continues down the mind grid, once player reach the bottom, they go back to the top of the grid, but now the words are different and there are less of them.

When all words have been eliminated from the mind maze, the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Onetop Football
description:
ONETOP FOOTBALL is a football card game that anyone can easily enjoy with real football rules.

How to play
① They are divided into home team and away team.
② Out of 10 tactical cards, choose 5 cards to use as your tactics, mix them well with 23 player cards, and place them as shown in the picture. (Set aside tactical cards that are not used.)
③ Each player draws 5 cards from the top of the deck and holds them invisible to the other party.

Game progress
① Each player turns one player card over and places them in the midfield area.
② In the midfield area, the number of passes of player cards is compared.
③ The winning player compares the player cards in the opponent's penalty area when comparing the next player cards.
④ In the penalty area, place 1 player card face down invisibly.
⑤ Compare the attack number of the attacking player card with the defending number of the defending player.
⑥ If you win by comparing player cards in the opponent's penalty area, you will score 1 point.
⑦ If you lose in the penalty area, return to the midfield area and compare the player cards.
⑧ If the number of player cards to be compared is the same, compare again with other player cards on the spot.
⑨ The used cards are stacked in the used card deck, and the number of cards used in the new card deck is taken from the top, and the play continues while maintaining 5 cards.
⑩ Place the scored player card in front of you to make it easier to calculate the score after the game.
⑪ Only one tactical card can be used.
(Tactical cards that are used with player cards are turned over so that the opponent cannot see them and placed next to the compared player cards.)
⑫ If one of the players has no more player cards to compare, the match ends. The player with the highest total score is the winner.
⑬ If the score is the same, each player selects 5 player cards randomly and compares the attack numbers one by one. The player with the highest number of cards won is the final winner.

name: Puerta Grande
description:
Puerta Grande is a trivia game about the world of bullfighting where two, three or four players can play.

Questions cover the following categories:

Bullfighting Dictionary
Bullfighters and proxies
Bullfighting concepts
Livestock and Ranchers
History of Bullfighting
Bullring and Businessmen


A game for bullfighting fans of any age.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Test of Magic Power
description:
Preparation
All(5) Magic stone cards (Hereafter "Ms") to common deck.

All(10) Level 1 and all(10) Level 2 Magic cards(Hereafter “Mg”) each to common deck.

“First Exam”
The “First Exam” will consist of five rounds

1. determination of the starting player (hereafter “SP”)
The player who rolls the die and rolls the lowest number becomes SP. After that, The player who draws a Ms card is the SP.

2. what you can do on your turn
2-1. SP's turn

(1) SP rolls three dice and draw an Mg card(*).

(2) Changing of Turn : The players take turns in a clockwise direction. During the turn change, any one die may be rolled once to interfere with the next player.
In addition, if you have 1 or more Mg cards in your hand, you may stock (set aside) 1 Mg card in your hand. The stocked Mg cards cannot be used during that round, but are added to your hand at the start of the next round. Only one Mg card may be stocked at the end of your turn, and you may stock up to two (no Ms cards can be stocked).

2-2. non-SP turns

(1) Dice Action (see "3. Choosing a Dice Action")

(2) Use of Mg cards (see "4. Use of Mg cards")

Turn change: Same as in the case of SP's turn.

3. Choosing a die action
Choose one of the following three actions

A. Roll two dice. Draw an card corresponding to the result (*). After that, you may use the Mg cards in your hand. However, you cannot draw an Mg card after you have used the Mg card. (You can still draw Ms cards(*).

B. Roll a die. After that, you may use any Mg cards in your hand. However, you cannot draw an Mg card until the next turn (but you can draw Ms cards(*)).

C. Do not roll a die. After that, you may draw an card (*). However, you may not use an Mg card until your next turn.


: When drawing a card, the roll of the die must meet the following conditions, depending on the type of card (see the lower left corner of the card).


Ms Card→Every die roll must be the same (identical)

Level 1 Mg cards -> two dice with the same roll (e.g. “1, 1, 4” , “3, 3, 6” etc.)

Level 2 Mg cards → 3 consecutive die rolls (e.g. “1, 2, 3”, “3, 4, 5” etc.)

4. Use of Mg cards
Mg cards can also be used before a die action(even if you choose die action C, you can still use Mg cards before the die action).
And that time, you can draw Ms card if you can make every die roll to the same.

5. End of the round
When any player draws a Ms card, the round ends. When the round is over, all players return their Mg cards to each deck and shuffle them. At the start of the next round, each player adds his or her stock of Mg cards to his or her hand. If the number of cards in the hand is 4 (3 in 2 players) or more, the player discards the Mg cards so that the number of cards in his hand is 3(2 in 2 players).

When all Ms cards have been drawn (after five rounds), the “Final Exam” begins.

6. “Final Exam”
No Mg cards will be used in the “Final Exam”. If a player fails to take any Ms cards at the “First Exam”, he or she will be disqualified at this point.

(1) All players who take the “Final Exam” must reveal the Ms cards in their hands. If the player with the lowest total points has 1 point Ms card(Ms has 1 to 3 points), he or she becomes the “Summoner”, and an errand boy is summoned.

The Ms card of the player with the highest Ms card total is shuffled by adding 1 point Ms card to the Ms card of the player with the highest Ms card total points. The “Summoner” draws one card from the cards and makes it his or her own hand.

(2) Magic value calculation
Each player multiply the total points of Ms cards in their hand with the numbers of players. And that is each player's magic value.

Start the “Magic value amplification” with the player who has the highest magic value starts.

(3) Magic value amplification
The player who rolls three dice and multiplies the total points of the dice by the magic value to determine the “Final magic value”. The player with a “Final magic value” of 80 points or more passes the exam.

—description from the publisher

name: Hockey Mania
description:
The object of the game is for the player to obtain a numerical advantage over the opponent while preventing the opponent from scoring goals. When this happens, the player is entitled to a card which authorizes him to move one of his forwards in a given direction and specific number of spaces. A forward may only score a goal from a certain specific spaces. Each period ends when the ten "penalty" cards have been used.

The forwards move according to a tricolor dice which plays a double role based on both numerical and value and its color. Thus, the die allows a man to advance the number of spaces corresponding tot he number thrown or, depending on its color, to send a man into the game (WHITE), win a face-off (RED) or scorer a goal (BLUE). The defensemen move one space at a time, in the dircestion determined by the players.

name: Bushrangers
description:
Bushrangers is a game named after the Australian term for Highwaymen or Outlaws. They were mostly sons of Australian born convicts and became legendary during the Australian Gold Rush of the 1850s and 1860s, robbing banks and coach services. Many became folk heros, such as Ned Kelly rebelling against authority and remain popular in Australian culture

The game has at least one player taking the Mail coach playing piece, starting at either end of the Mail coach road. Other players are Bushrangers beginning at the other end of the board at the Bushrangers lair.

The Mail coach follows the road by rolling a dice and it's objective is to get to the other end. The Bushrangers follow the black spots by rolling the dice and try to intercept the Mail coach. If they land on the Mail coach they have held up the coach and won the come. If he overshoots the Mail coach he cannot go backwards and must follow the track to meet the coach again.

The game can have two Mail coaches in play and several Bushrangers. The coaches can also carry counters representing money.

—user summary

name: Bananopolis: The Monkey Sanctuary
description:
Learn about conservation and the reintroduction of endangered species back into their natural habitats in this fun and simple to play board game for 2-4 players.

The aim is simple, to release all of your monkeys back into the wild first. To achieve this, you will need to help them find food, work together, and out-compete their rivals.

Use dice to determine what options you have to place your fruit, and your monkey's movement, then position your monkeys to make sure you can pick it up first. As your monkeys are released you have fewer options making it harder to stay on ahead of your rivals.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play

name: Getting In
description:
Every year, hundreds of thousands of high school students apply for college, competing for spaces in colleges and universities all over the world. Applying for college is a process and can be overwhelming. This exciting card game introduces players to the various components of the admissions application process. The goal is to simulate the process in a general way by providing insight on the various parts of a college application file.

After all players receive two schools to "apply" to, players take turns, drawing cards, and adding various requirements cards to their school's portfolios. There are also action cards you can play on other player's applications to "lose" specific documents or otherwise cause them extra work in their application.

The winner is the first person to complete successful applications to two schools.

This game is endorsed by the Michigan College Access Network (MCAN).

name: Sicherman's War
description: In this take on traditional war, teams divide troops (a standard 52 card deck) into units for battles. There are also reinforcements. Battles are played using similar principles from the traditional war card game, but with a twist! Each player will command a pair of Sicherman dice, as well as a single standard d6, to aid his troops in battle, strategically affecting the outcomes to overwhelm their opponent. The game relies on luck, risk, probability, and strategy. Points are accumulated as spoils to see who wins the war! Sicherman's War has both a 2 player and a 4 player variant.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play

name: Three Blind Dice
description: Three blind Dice is a game that includes rolling 4 total dice: 1 standard pair of 6-sided dice, and 1 pair of Sicherman dice. One dice is revealed and three are hidden. Using your logic and reasoning, deduce what the three hidden dice are by asking the right questions. Each dice guessed is points in your favor. Be the player to earn the most points and you win! Three Blind Dice is a free pdf rulesheet game that implements Sicherman Dice.

name: Sichy
description: Sichy is a dice game that features 1 pair of standard 6-sided dice and 1 pair of Sicherman dice. Before the dice are rolled, players each need to write down their guesses- guessing the results of the dice. Guesses are based on the logic of probabilities, and the fun of different dice. Successful guesses grant different points, based on the difficulty of the successful prediction.

name: Christmas Trees for Sail
description:
Winter, 1904: Christmas settles on the shores of Lake Michigan like snow on a Fraser fir, and with it arrives the glorious Christmas Tree Ship.

Every year, the Christmas Tree Ship sailed North from Chicago to purchase trees from farmers in Michigan and Wisconsin, then returned to sell them in the big city.

In Christmas Trees for Sail, players become holiday mirth merchants, sailing to and fro buying trees, selling them for profit, then using those profits to bring Christmas Cheer to Chicago’s needy children.

Press your luck as you brave the wind and waves, sailing North to find cheaper trees while hoping to avoid the nasty weather. Good luck... and Merry Christmas!

—description from the publisher

name: Travelers
description:
Travelers is a lightweight abstract strategy game for 2 players, designed for ultra-portability. This pocketable game can be played on tiny cafe tables or on the banks of a river!

Players each control four pieces and vie to control the four hexagonal tiles that make up the board.
