On your turn, you take one of three actions: Move one of your tokens, rotate one of the hexagonal tiles, or move a tile to match the colors of a face-up domino.

Win by having one of your pieces on all four hexagonal tiles OR by collecting more dominos than your opponent.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Ownership, Zone of Control

name: Jocul Autostrazilor
description:
A Romanian strategy game for 2-6 players. You need to build as many highways as you can but be careful! Your opponents will sabotage you with unexpected incidents: a broken viaduct, an appeal to the public auction, blocking the works and see if you can repel the attack of opponents with negotiations, allocation of funds, any new builder or with some electoral promises.
It is recommended for 14+ years old players.

How to play:

Cards with cities will be shuffled and equally distributed for all players. If any cards remain undistributed, you need to put them in a separate stack on the table.
Cards with vignette will be stacked on the table.
Cards with sabotage actions will be shuffled and given 10 to every player (if there are 6 players, any of them will be given 8 cards). The rest are placed on the table.


All players start from Bucharest and roll the dice. They need to move their pawn an equal number of points as corresponding on the dice (but he can't step twice on the same point in a turn). If the pawn is placed on a highway point, the player can ask for the related card, by initiating an act of sabotage against the player who owns that card.

What is sabotage:
Sabotage cards have a number of points (e.g.: 1 / 2 / 8 / 0.1 or -3 / -5 etc). A player who wants a card for a highway, needs to put down a sabotage card of negative value (e.g.: -3). The opponent must repel the attack with 1 or more cards with positive value until their sum is greater than the opponent's card (-1 equals +1 or overcome with +2). In case of equality, challenged player can keep his card. Otherwise, if the challenged player overcomes the attack, he can choose a card with cities from the player who initiated the attack. If the challenged player is defeated, the player who initiated the attack receives his requested card.

Vignette cards:
Can be used only at border crossing points in order to obtain 3 sabotage cards OR to ask for any of highway city cards.
Every route has a specific number of points. The player with most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Constrained Bidding, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Thesë Go to Eleven
description:
A game of pushing your limits, and then some.


Inspired on the cult film This Is Spinal Tap.

Front is pure black. Tribute to fictional Spinal Tap's Black Album, who, in the classic 1984 movie This Is Spinal Tap, were forced to put out their album "Smell the Glove" with an all-black cover after their label refused to release the original, sexually offensive artwork.


Released in the November 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Be the first player to make the numbers 1 through 11 in order using die rolls and card play.

SETUP
Sort the cards by suit, then give each player A-2-3-4-5-6-7 cards of a suit. This is their Hand. The other cards aren't used.

GAMEPLAY
On your turn, choose to roll one or two dice. You will then use the sum of one or more cards to make one addition or subtraction by combining the sum of the card(s) from your hand with the die roll.

If the exact target number is rolled
You may choose to either:

Stop rolling and draw one card from the center pool.
Discard cards to the table face up to combine with your die roll to equal the desired number.


If the target number is not rolled
You must either:

discard cards to the table face up to make your die roll equal the desired number.
Choose to end your turn.


After a number is made (via the combination of dice and cards) you will choose to either:

Continue to the next consecutive number.
Pass your turn, and draw two cards from the center pool.


If a number cannot be made, you bust. Your turn ends and you draw no cards.

On every subsequent turn, you will begin by choosing 1 card from the common pool and achieve the same target number you failed at your last turn.

END OF GAME
When a player reaches 11, the game will end once all players have taken their turn. The first player to get a value of 11 is the winner, and if tied, the player with the largest sum of values in their hand wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: You're Tearing Me Apart
description:
A legacy game where you throw cards, not footballs.

Inspired on the cult film The Room.


Released in the September 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


INITIAL SETUP
Separate the deck into red/black cards & remove the jokers; give one set to each player. Each player shuffles their deck and draws 5 cards.

GOAL
Earn the most points. Points accrue over games with the same deck.

TURN
You must choose one action:

Draw: Draw from 1-5 cards from your deck, then discard that many cards. Discarded cards will not be available to you again this game.
Play: Play one card from your hand to your tableau, then draw one card from your deck.
Tear: Tear apart one card from a set in your tableau and throw half of it at your opponent's tableau.
Replace: Replace a card matching the number of one of your previously destroyed cards with half of your destroyed card from your reserve, then throw that half at your opponent's tableau. Shuffle the whole card back into your deck, then draw one card.
Score: Tear apart one card from a set, discard the rest of that set from your tableau, then add that set's value to your score (points according to a table). Add both halves to your reserve (instead of throwing that torn card).


TEARING APART & THROWING
You may tear apart any card in a set from your tableau to throw half at your opponent's tableau. If it touches any of your opponent's cards, you may choose one and any in its set to discard from the game. You earn half the points that your opponent would have earned from scoring that set. You determine which cards are in that set.

Once you have thrown half of a card, you cannot throw it again during that game.

SETS
A set is a grouping of paired and sequential cards played to the tableau. It must meet all of the following three conditions:
1) To start a set, there must be a matching pair of numbers.
2) A set can be extended +1/-1 from any pair in the set. Aces wrap.
3) Sets must be touching each other in the tableau.

END OF GAME
When a player needs to draw but cannot, their opponent gets one final turn and the game ends.

SETUP FOR SUBSEQUENT GAMES
All torn cards are placed in your reserve at the start of the game.The starting player is the player with the current lower score.

END OF ALL GAMES
When the game ends without either player scoring any points, the game is all torn apart. The player with the highest total score wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Democracy: The Cards Game
description:
In Democracy: The Cards Game, become the president of the Banana Island Republic, the country where defending the indefensible will lead you to be the president of a nation.

What does washing dishes with a loaf of bread have to do with promoting the country's industry? Get your rhetoric and creativity to make your speech the most voted to achieve your goal, become a president.

How to play:

In Democracy: The Cards Game the players have to argue in a 60 second speech using the cards they have chosen, 2 cards from the matter deck and 1 card from the industry sector deck. After the argument, the players vote for the best speech. The speech of the player with the most votes wins the round. At the end of 5 rounds the player with the most votes wins.

2 Players:

The player who draws the victory symbol (^) when rolling the Supreme Court die begins.

Two subject cards and one sector card are handed out to be able to elaborate your speech. You have one minute to present your speech.

The first player makes his speech and both vote for the best, in case of a draw, the dice is rolled to decide who wins the round.

In case of a tie with the dice, the round ends and 2 cards per player are drawn again to start a new round.
If there is a winner, the winning player scores a point for each round won. At the end of 5 rounds the player with the most points wins

—description from the designer

name: Meta Olympia: The Board Game
description:
In Meta Olympia, you play a Martian colony 'football' club in the not-too-distant future, playing rules that resemble soccer on Earth. The objective of the game is to be the most bad-ass team on the planet by achieving the most combined point. Player's teams are made up of athlete cards, each offensive, defensive or special abilities.

There are two different stages played over 4 rounds. In the Pre-Season phases, players take turns moving their miniatures forward along modular tiles. Each tile either helps players improve their team (via recruiting and trading athlete cards) or collecting resources that improve players tactical options.

In the tournament round, players get to to go head-to-head against each other in player vs player matches. Matches are played in 3 rounds where each player uses one athlete card and a die role per round. Players can also play tactics cards, resources earned from the pre-season phase, to buff or nerf.

Each round determines goals, saves, and potential injuries; with the final match result based on the final score of all 3 rounds.
As players move into the following stages, they have the resources to continually strengthen their team by adding higher-value players.

In tournament in stage 4 is the final championship. For 2 players, it is a best of 5 matches. For 3 or more players, it is a round robin. Players go all out to either defend their lead or challenge the leaders.

The final winner is determined by tallying up all the points collected, either through wins, game currency, or special resource cards.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Modular Board

name: The Handbook for the Recently Deceased
description:
A game of hiding, seeking and spooking.

Inspired on the cult film Beetlejuice.


Released in the December 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


A lovely couple has died, and in a panic to save their home from the living family that's moved in and ruined everything, accidentally unleashed a dangerous ghost promising to rid the house of the living.

SETUP
Choose one player to be the Bio-Exorcist. You are a ghost, and you are trying to scare the living residents of this haunted house out, by moving items spookily around their house.

The other players leave the room to split up 2+ roles: 1 Occultist, 1 Goth, and 0-3 Folks.

While they're gone, the Bio-Exorcist moves as many objects as the number of living players, and hides a spook (represented by a card or a coin) under each one:

One spook is the postcard, The Handbook for the Recently Deceased.
One spook (the joker or the largest coin) is Scared to Death.
The rest of the spooks are the love of the ghost couple.


SPOOKING OBJECTS
An object you spook must be noticeable moved from where it started. To mess with their heads, the Bio-Exorcist may also move 3 more objects without hiding any spooks under them.

It's important that the Bio-Exorcist remembers where they put each card/coin. Record this info, if needed.

Finally, the Bio-Exorcist calls back the living and the game can begin.

PLAYING THE GAME
Each living player may ask one question of the Bio-Exorcist and may peek under one object. They may do this in any order, at any time; there are no turns.

The Bio-Exorcist must answer questions truthfully, but may interpret ambiguous wording as they please. They cannot speak, they answer only with knocks: once for "yes", don't knock for "no", in numbers knocking that many times.

When a living player peeks and finds a spook, they reveal it and earn another question and another peek.

WINNING AND LOSING
Anyone who reveals Scared to Death loses the game immediately.

If the Goth reveals the Handbook for the Recently Deceased, they get to fulfill their dream of becoming a ghost. The Goth and the Bio-Exorcist win.

If the Occultist reveals the Handbook for the Recently Deceased, they exorcise the Bio-Exorcist and the ghost couple. The Occultist and the Folks win.

If all of the love spooks are revealed, the ghost couple and the living become friends, and get rid of the Bio-Exorcist. All of the living players win.

If no one has any peeks left and there are love spooks unfound, the living have been driven from the house. The Bio-Exorcist wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Box Quiz: Julehygge
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Julehygge - Christmasspirit'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the Danish Julehygge (Spirit of Christmas). It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Dansk Byer
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Denmark's Cities'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the cities of Denmark. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Danske Øer
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Denmark's Islands'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about islands of Denmark. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Verdens Historie
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'History of the World'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the history of the world. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Box Quiz: Højskole
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Højskole'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about højskoler. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Trick or Repeat
description:
A time-travelling trick taking card game.

Inspired on the cult film Donnie Darko.


Released in the October 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


SETUP
Deal 5 cards to each player face down. Form the Rabbit by dealing 5 cards face up in the center of the table, stacked bottom to top with all cards visible. The face up cards in the Rabbit set the trump suit in the five tricks to be played, in order from top to bottom.

RULES

1. Form timelines. Choose a card from your hand, place it face down in front of you. Then pass the remaining cards to the left, and repeat, placing later cards closer to the Rabbit to form a line extending from yourself, until all cards have been placed, in the order labeled Form Timeline. Do not look at the last card passed to you.

2. Predict the future. At the count of three, bid simultaneously on the number of tricks the player to your left will win.

3. Resolve tricks. In the order labeled Resolve Tricks, everyone reveals the next card in their timelines, and evaluate the trick. In the first trick, the player to the left of the dealer leads, and thereafter the player who won the previous trick leads. A trick is won by the highest card matching the lead player's suit, unless cards matching the suit of the current Rabbit card have been played, in which case the highest card in the Rabbit suit wins.

4. Score points. After all 5 tricks have been played, score points: 1 point for each won trick, and an additional 2 points for having correctly bid the number of tricks won by the player to your left.

TIME TRAVEL
After scoring once, the game "goes back in time". Pick up the last card in your timeline, labeled Time Travel. Then, moving towards the Rabbit, pick up 1 card at a time and place it on top of the others in your hand. Keep the cards face up when collecting and passing. Finally, starting with yourself, take the top card and pass the remaining cards to your right. Repeat until each player has 5 cards, the same cards they had at the beginning of the game.

WINNING
Add up scores from the two rounds to determine a winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Europaeisches Reisespiel
description:
"European travel game" published by Ernst Kuhn, Switzerland, 1892.
Typical roll and move game. First player, who completes the route wins the game.

—user summary

name: Mitos y Leyendas: Guerrero Jaguar
description:
"The Jaguar moves slowly, but its claws do not know mercy. Whoever moves through the jungle is the true master of life, the holder of the keys of death; the creator of a new tomorrow."

Guerrero Jaguar introduces the exciting stories of Mesoamerican mythology to the world of Myths and Legends. Discover exciting new strategies with this 236-card edition fully compatible with all previous Second Era editions.

This deck contains 50 tactical cards (5 Royals, 15 Courtesans, 15 Vassals and 15 Golds), mixed randomly, to enhance the highest Mythological strategies. Includes instructions for updated Rules. Recommended product for high level players.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

"El Jaguar se mueve despacio, pero sus garras no conocen la piedad. Quien se mueve entre la selva, es el verdadero amo de la vida, el poseedor de las llaves de la muerte; el creador de un nuevo mañana".

Guerrero Jaguar introduce al mundo de Mitos y Leyendas las emocionantes historias de la mitología Mesoamericana. Descubre nuevas y emocionantes estrategias con esta edición de 236 cartas totalmente compatibles con todas las ediciones anteriores de Segunda Era.

Este mazo contiene 50 cartas tácticas (5 Reales, 15 Cortesanas, 15 Vasallos y 15 Oros), mezcladas aleatoriamente, para potenciar las más altas estrategias Mitológicas. Incluye instructivo de Reglas actualizadas. Producto recomendado para jugadores de Alto Nivel.

—description from the back of the box

name: Mitos y Leyendas: Guerrero Jaguar – Punta de Lanza
description:
"The attack is the most effective defense, this is how we will attack constantly, until we break the tips of our spears, there will be no glory if there is no victory."

Guerrero Jaguar introduces the exciting stories of Mesoamerican mythology to the world of Myths and Legends. Discover exciting new strategies with this 236-card edition fully compatible with all previous Second Era editions.

This pre-built deck contains 50 tactical cards (4 Royals, 15 Courtiers, 16 Vassals, and 15 Golds) that power your Myths and Legends strategy. A rule book is included. The actual cards included in this deck do not appear in the improvement packs. Deck specially designed for Myths and Legends players who wish to perfect and learn new strategies.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

"El ataque es la defensa más efectiva, es así como atacaremos constantemente, hasta romper las puntas de nuestras lanzas, no habrá gloria si no hay victoria".

Guerrero Jaguar introduce al mundo de Mitos y Leyendas las emocionantes historias de la mitología Mesoamericana. Descubre nuevas y emocionantes estrategias con esta edición de 236 cartas totalmente compatibles con todas las ediciones anteriores de Segunda Era.

Este mazo preconstruido contiene 50 cartas tácticas (4 Reales, 15 Cortesanos, 16 Vasallos y 15 Oros) que potencian tu estrategia de Mitos y Leyendas. Se incluye un libro de reglas. Las cartas reales incluidas en este mazo no aparecen en los sobres de superación. Mazo especialmente diseñado para jugadores de Mitos y Leyendas que deseen perfeccionar y conocer nuevas estrategias.

—description from the back of the box

name: Jumping to Conclusions
description:
A game about questions, answers and wild guesses.

Inspired on the cult film Office Space.


Postcard released in the June 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.


SETUP
Remove the Jokers and split the deck into 4 suits.

Each player separates their J-Q-K and then makes a hand consisting of Ace through 10.

GAMEPLAY
The starting player makes a personal statement that involves a two-digit number. The number can include zero to make it single digits.

Each player must then make a claim using two face down cards from their hand to represent the digits.

After each player chooses their cards, all player will reveal their claims.

After the claims are revealed, players will use their J-Q-K to bet on the factual nature of any or all other player's claims:

Jack: must be Joking. None of the digits are correct.
Queen: not Quite right. One of the digits is correct and one is not.
King: 100% Korrect. The entire number is correct.


At the end of the round, players will state whether their digits were true, false, or both. Points are tallied and play passes to the left.

POINTS
2 points - A correct judgement.
1 point - For each player that you fooled.

JUMPING TO CONCLUSIONS
After a player has chosen their claim, but before the claim is revealed, you can say "Jump to Conclusions!" out loud and point to a player that you think you know their exact answer.

You will say the answer outloud and they will give a yes or no on whether it is 100% correct. If it is, you will gain 5 points. If you are wrong, you gain no points for the entire round and they will gain 1 point for fooling you.

END OF GAME
The game ends when any player reaches 15 points.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ekofiskspillet
description:
With a board formed as the Ekofisk platforms in the North Sea, the objective of Ekofiskspillet ("The Ekofisk Game") is to get to the other side of the platforms by rolling dice and answer trivia questions from question cards along the way.

The board has color codes that tell you what type of questions to answer, much like Trivial Pursuit and other trivia types of games. To make the game family-friendly, one category is marked "C" for "children".

The questions are mostly pop-cultural, with some relating to the oil industry.

For each right answer, you get one point that is written down on the scoreboard. The winner is the player with the most points when the first person has reached the other end of the platforms.

The game is both in English and Norwegian.

name: Oljespill: 48 spørsmål om olje
description:
Trivia card game.

Answer questions about the oil industry. To win the game you carefully select the right answers from the illustrated cards to get a series of 6 cards complete and win the game.

name: Dungeons & Detentions
description:
Overview
Take on the role of new students at the College of Crawlwell and prepare for an enchanted education full of excitement. Students will face typical school challenges such as rivalries, exams and homework, but add in a magical school full of animated objects, traps, and the lure of the many secrets waiting to be discovered. To graduate they will need to keep their head on straight or at least keep it on all together.

Objective:
The objective of the game is to improve your skills, collect resources, and prepare for the final challenge at the end of the game.

Winning Condition:
The player that scores the most points in the final challenge wins.

How the game works:
The game board features a map with many locations. A deck of encounter cards is shuffled and 9 cards are revealed. Players will spend their turn moving around the board to either collect or resolve these encounters, perform special location actions, or attempt to sabotage the other players.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a Major which is a deck of cards the players will use to improve their character throughout the game as players earn experience for resolving encounters.

The game is divided into 15 rounds which involve each player taking a turn. At the end of round 15, players will attempt to defeat a series of Dungeon challenges representing the final exam. Players are scored on how well they perform and the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Relative Movement

name: Misfit Card Game
description: The Concept - of the game is to play a card value equal to or higher (or according to the rule) than the previous card. If you can't play, you pick up the discard pile. When you run out of cards, you are considered "out". Last person out is the Misfit. The game is based off of a traditional card game call "Sh!thead", among other names. To make it simple, we've created a 1-10 number system for the hierarchy of cards, as well as a few "Power Cards" that can be played on anything. To give Misfit a story and personality, we've chosen a "Warriors" theme for the first available edition. The beauty of Misfit Card Game is we will make many different editions tailored for any person's interests!

name: 7 Sectors
description:
A board game for 2 to 6 players where you are one of a crew of astronauts who must collect the Intergalactic Space Biscuit and escape from the Intergalactic Space Pickles to win. Along the way, you must collect colored keys to open colored doors and avoid the Pickles who will try to interfere with your progress.
The game is a race to the finish that utilizes both dice and a spinner. Collect character cards to purchase the colored keys, teleport around your current Sector, and make your way deeper into the center of the ship to gain the ultimate McGuffin: the Intergalactic Space Biscuit!
Want a longer game? Make your way back out of the ship and to the escape pod to freedom!
Feeling competitive? Bonus spins give you an advantage over other players by taking away their hard-earned cards and keys or even swapping the door colors to foil their strategy!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Duke of York
description:
Laid down in 1937 and commissioned in 1941, HMS Duke of York was a King George V-class of battleship. She had the distinction of transporting Winston Churchill across the Atlantic to meet Franklin D. Roosevelt in the Winter of 1941. Churchill wrote of his experience, “Being in a ship in weather such as this is like being in a prison, with the extra chance of being drowned”. Between March and September of the next year she was involved mainly in convoy escort duties, but in October was dispatched to Gibraltar to become the flagship of Task Force H.

She saw little action during this period, her main role being protection of the task force’s aircraft carriers, but nevertheless assisted the Allied invasion of North Africa. She subsequently participated in operations to divert Axis attentions away from Sicily in Operation Husky, and Operation Leander in an attempt to disrupt German merchant shipping of the coast of Norway.

On December 26th 1943 HMS Duke of York encountered the German battleship Scharnhorst. Exchanging fire, HMS Duke of York suffered some hits with little effect, but for her part landed several hits upon Scharnhorst, silencing a turret and hitting a boiler room. This forced Scharnhorst on the defensive, and she was sunk by torpedoes as well as further heavy fire from Duke of York.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Eagle
description:
An early aircraft carrier of the Royal Navy, HMS Eagle was originally a super-dreadnought of the Chilean Navy (named Almirante Cochrane), laid down in 1913, but was purchased by the Royal Navy for conversion to a carrier in 1918. This work was not finished until 1924.

Initially deployed in the Indian Ocean against the threat of German commerce raiders, Eagle also saw service in Mediterranean and the China station. At the outset of war, the Fleet Air Arm was severely lacking fighters, so her complement of aircraft was limited to solely Fairey Swordfish Torpedo bombers until late 1940.

Upon the Italian entry into the war on the side of the Axis, HMS Eagle was the only Royal Navy carrier available to the British in the Mediterranean, but performed sterling service in ferrying fighters to the island of Malta. It was whilst performing this latter duty that she was sunk in August 1942, when torpedoed by the German Submarine U-73.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Type 1936A Destroyers
description:
The Type 1936 was a large and very powerful design mounting 5.9-inch guns, based on the general layout of the Type 1934. The intended twin turrets were not available in time, so planned armament was reduced to single mounts in some positions. As with the preceding class, an enlarged version, designated Type 1936A, was developed from the original.
The Type 1936A was more seaworthy, with much more reliable machinery. These vessels were known to the Allies as the Narvik-class.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Admiral Hipper
description:
Admiral Franz von Hipper was commander of the German battlecruiser squadron of the Battle of Jutland in 1916 and subsequently became commander-in-chief of the German high seas fleet. It was for him that Admiral Hipper was named, the lead ship of her class.

Admiral Hipper saw significant action over the course of the war, with a heavy emphasis on the Battle of the Atlantic. She also led the assault on Trondberg during Germany’s invasion of Norway, sinking the British destroyer HMS Glowworm in the process. In December of 1940, she successfully broke out to the Atlantic in an effort to disrupt Allied Merchant convoys, but failed to achieve much success. Her next sortie in February 1941 saw much more success when she sank several merchant vessels, before being transferred back to Norway to raid convoys to the Soviet Union. ON New Year’s Eve 1942, at the Battle of the Barents Sea, after sinking a destroyer and a minesweeper she was forced to withdraw due to the efforts of HMS Sheffield and HMS Jamaica. Following the failure to destroy any merchant vessels in this battle, Hitler ordered the majority of surface warships scrapped. Admiral Hipper returned to Germany and was never restored to operational status after being bombed by the Royal Air Force in May 1945.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Köln
description:
Köln was the third of the Königsberg-class of light cruiser, operating between 1929 and 1945, initially under the Reichsmarine and subsequently the Kriegsmarine. In the 1930s she served as a training vessel for cadets, but the outbreak of World War Two saw her conducting operations in the North Sea, though she didn’t encounter any British warships at this time.

She was present at the attack of Bergen during the German invasion of Norway and was the only member of the Königsberg-class to survive the operation (codenamed Weserübung). Later, in 1942, she was experimentally modified to carry a Flettner FI 282 helicopter, and returned to Norway, though she failed to see action. Remaining there until 1945, she eventually returned to Germany only to be sunk in March by American bombers over Wilhelmshaven. However, she remained on an even keel, and with her gun turrets above the waterline, was able to provide fire support to the defenders of the city until war’s end in May 1945.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Blücher
description:
Blüche was named for Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher, who lead the Prussians to victory at Waterloo. She was the second of the Admiral Hipper-class of heavy cruisers, completed shortly after the outbreak of World War II. She was assigned to the task force supporting the invasion of Norway in April 1940, serving as the flagship of Konteradmiral Oskar Kummetz, leading the flotilla of ships to capture Oslo, she was struck by numerous coastal defences including outdated 28cm coastal guns at close range, and two torpedoes fired from land-based batteries.

These hits resulted in a major fire breaking out aboard the vessel which spread first to the ship’s magazines, and then to her fuel bunkers, resulting in further major explosions that could not be contained. Her wreck still sits at the bottom of Oslofjord and was recently designated as a war memorial to protect it from looters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Königsberg
description:
The lead ship of her class, Königsberg had a similar operational history to that of her sister ships like Köln (see above), operating as a training vessel until the outset of World War Two.
She spent the early part of the war laying defensive minefields in the North Sea before participating in the invasion of Norway as part of Operation Weserübung.
It was here that she met her demise, whilst attacking the city of Bergen. Here she was struck by a Norwegian coastal artillery battery, and whilst languishing in the harbour the following day was sunk by British bombers.

Her wreck was raised in 1942 and broken up for scrap.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Scharnhorst
description:
The German capital ship Scharnhorst was the lead of her two ship class, launching in October 1936. She was armed with a main battery of nine 28cm C/34 guns in three triple turrets. Though plans were drawn up to 38cm guns, these plans were never enacted.

Through the early war, Scharnhorst, operated in tandem with her sister ship, Gneisenau, in raiding British merchant shipping in the Atlantic. An early victory was the sinking of HMS Rawalpindiin November 1939. She subsequently participated in the invasion of Norway and sank HMS Renown, a battlecruiser, and HMS Glorious, an aircraft carrier, as well as their escort destroyers – in the course of these battle achieving one of the longest range gunfire-hits in military naval history.

In early 1943, the Scharnhorst joined the Tirpitz in Norway, hoping to interdict Allied convoys to the Soviet Union, but were intercepted by Royal Navy patrols. During the Battle of the North Cape, Scharnhorst was sunk by HMS Duke of York and her escorts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Clemson-class destroyers
description:
The Clemson-class was a redesign of the Wickes-class and was the last pre- World War Two class of flush-decker destroyers to be built for the United States.

In all, 156 of these destroyers served with the US Navy from after World War One and on into World War Two.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Portland
description:
USS Portland, the lead ship of the Portland class of cruiser, launched in 1932. She completed a number of training and goodwill cruises in the interwar period before seeing extensive service during World War II. Her first wartime action was at the Battle of the Coral Sea in 1942, escorting the carrier Yorktown and rescuing survivors from the carrier Lexington. She repeated this escort assignment for Yorktown for the Battle of Midway.

For the Guadalcanal campaign, she initially supported the carrier Enterprise, but was torpedoed and put out of action for 6 months during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal. IN mid-1943, she returned to combat – performing shore bombardment s at the Aleutian Islands, Gilbert and Marshall Islands, Mariana Islands and New Guinea. She was at the Battle of Leyte Gulf in October 1944, engaging Japanese vessels at Surigao Strait. In 1945 she supported landings during the Battle of Okinawa until the close of the war.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Chester
description:
USS Chester supported the landing on Samoa (18-24 January 1942), and after repairs joined TF 17 for the Guadalcanal-Tulagi raid, the attack on Misima Island and the Battle of the Coral Sea, defending the carriers with anti-aircraft fire.

She thereafter provided fire support at Tarawa, the lead ship of the operation, and covered other landings in the Island-Hopping campaign of the USMC. Later in the war, she conducted patrols off Okinawa and was assigned to the force providing air cover for the Coats Striking Group off the Yangtze River Delta.

Surviving the war, she embarked homeward-bound troops at Iwo Jima and sailed for San Francisco. One final voyage to Guam brought home further servicemen. She arrived at Philadelphia on 30 January 1946, and later that year was placed out of commission in reserve.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Houston
description:
Originally conceived as a light cruiser, USS Houston (second of her name) was reclassified as a heavy cruiser early in her life, serving in the 1930s to protect American interest in the China-Japan war of 1931 and later transporting President Roosevelt on special ‘cruises’.

On the night of the Pearl Harbour attack, Houston departed Panay Island for Australia joining the American-British-Dutch-Australian naval force at Surabaya. She participated in the Battle of Makassar Strait, shooting don four Japanese aircraft. Thereafter she was part of the Timor Convoy, shooting down 7 out of 44 aircraft in the second of two attacks. As a result, she was absent from the attack on Darwin of 19 February 1942. Her next major action was at the Battle of the Java Sea, the largest surface engagement since the Battle of Jutland in World War One. 5 cruisers and 10 destroyers of the Allies met a Japanese force of 4 cruisers and 13 destroyers on 27 February 1942. The ABDA naval force lost 2 cruisers and 3 destroyers.

It was the at the Battle of Sundra Strait that Houston would meet her eventual fate, in which she and HMAS Perth were sunk by torpedoes from a destroyer squadron. The route had been thought free of enemy vessels, but this proved false with the two ships surrounded by multiple Japanese Warships. The story of her demise was not known fully until the liberation of the 368 survivors of Houston, from Japanese prison camps at the close of war.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Spillet om Norsk Olje og Gass
description:
Players take the part of oil investors, buying oilfields, oil companies, and insurance. Drill for oil, administer finds and evaluate what pays, based on the oil price in force.

Roll dice and move that number of spaces around the board. When you pass start, the bank pays income on the fields you own. A high oil price gives a high income and vica verca. A low oil price can turn your income into loss.

The goal of the game is to be the player remaining with any money.

—user summary
mechanics: Negotiation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Trading

name: Chaud Patate
description:
Chaud Patate is a card game by Yannick Robert, illustrated by Olivier Fagnere, where you'll play a chef in search of ingredients to make the best dishes.

On your turn, you take a card from the kitchen or from one of the two pantries. The kitchen permits to recruit kitchen helps or to collect “special” cards, while the pantries make it possible to collect ingredients.

However, each place has a certain number of “Hot Potato” cards that will send one of your kitchen help to the emergency, if you draw one of these cards. Be careful, if you haven't more clerks, your chef will be in danger and you'll risk elimination.

The last chef in the competition will win the golden chef's hat and earn points based on the number of ingredients harvested.

—description from the publisher

name: Le Jeu des Oursins
description:
Don't play the next urchin ! Here is a party game where you try to survive the next round by not playing a card with an urchin. You can exchange your cards with one of your opponent. You may also try to offer some gifts ton the other players (more cards!) If you are the first play to have no card in your hand, then you win the round!

—description from the publisher

name: Summ oder brumm
description:
Each player has five pawns and an own section of the game board (A, B, C, D) to move his pawns. The pawns start on the spaces with the numbers 1-5 beneath. The goal of the game is to move all five pawns to the spaces marked with 1-5 in the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die.

The pawns move strictly in their own column along the spaces marked with one to six eyes into the numbered destination space. The special marked spaces hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published in the 1920's. The box cover reads in old German script: "Frohe Stunden ... summ oder brumm. Das neue lustige Volksspiel"

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Raketenflug durch das Weltall
description:
The players start at space 1 (Earth). The first to reach space 50 (Moon) wins the game. This is not as short a trip as it seems, because the players have to pass Mars and Saturn. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was printed on a chocolate box including 24 bars (Riquet-Schokolade ABC) to serve as prizes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Riquet & Co. A. G., Verlag Cawar Halle

name: Combustible Penguin
description:
A quick card game of Wit, War, and Waddle. Protect your clan of penguins from others and the world at large. Start by drafting your penguin clan, then spend your turns either adding to your population or destroying others. The game includes 80 Penguin cards and 20 Event Cards. Each turn is a simple as drawing a card and playing a card.

The game ends when only one player remains or if the deck runs out of cards, whoever has the strongest penguins is the winner.

Can you navigate a living landmine to become the future ruler of Icetasia?

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Fighting, Party Game

name: This That & Everything: Merry X-Mas Edition
description:
This That & Everything: Merry X-Mas Edition is a rapid-fire team based guess game. The cards include all things Christmas that teams try to guess based on descriptions or clues. Players race to describe a wide variety of holiday related things for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less!

CONTENTS: 100 cards, score pad, 30 second timer and instructions

name: Sawagashii Dai-Toshokan (騒がしい大図書館)
description:
Make spell cards with the help of the inhabitants of Gensokyo!

Sawagashii Dai-Toshokan is a party-style card game.
The game is based on the idea of "making spell cards for Patchouli" in the Great Library with original gameplay rules.
Players, as fairy maids who usually help Patchouli, have to make spell cards in order not to lose to other maids.
The first maid to make the specified number of spell cards wins the game.

Spell cards can be completed by accumulating attributes belonging to the Five Elements to fulfil their requirements. Fairy maids can seek the help of passers-by, who can lend their abilities, but with so many people within the Great Library, situations may change at any moment, so that the fairy maids must be quick to adapt if they want to show their worth.

Who will be able to impress Patche the most?

name: Pie Rats of the Carob Bean Farm: Charisma Promo Card
description: May be used once to help prevent a crew member from being lured away. (Or at least make it more difficult).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Nazrin Enigmatic Wonder Search
description:
Nazrin Enigmatic Wonder Search (NEWS) is a party-type card game distributed by Hinafuda Production Committee at the 9th Hakurei Shrine Festival.

In this game, players entrust Nazrin with the search to find the "something" that Yukari inadvertently let enter the fantasy world. Using Myouren-ji cards to carry out the search, Shinrei-byou cards to hinder your opponents, and the help of the occasionally useful Toramaru Shou, find the "something" before anyone else!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: 30 Secondes Chrono
description:
You play with three sandtimers of 30 seconds each. Your goal is to coordinate your attacks on the 9 banks of this game. Your opponent may call the Police and you'll spend two rounds of 30 seconds each in jail. This game is quick to understand and you feel the pressure of real gangsters. When four banks are empty, then the players with the more amount of gold and diamonds wins ! Do you want to take risk ? Some banks offers only one gold bar. Others offer much more precious jewels! Surprise!

—description from the publisher

name: Une sacrée année de m****
description:
2020 was such a year ! Worldwide pandemic and lots of pressure. To ensure to spend a better time in 2021, here is a party game with lots of fun inside.

At your round, you play a card from your personal drawing pile and you must announce the lockdown period and then count from "1 week" to "52 weeks". When that's a pultiple of 4, you don't say "4 weeks" for example, you say "January...such a f*****g year!".

There are some special effects when some cards are discarded like : change the way the round is played (the player on your right is the next player) and if there is a virus card, then all the players have to put their hand on it. The last one loses and takes all the cards from the central discard pile.

When a player has no more card in his hands, he wins a token.
At the end of the game, the player with the greatest number of tokens wins !

—description from the publisher

name: Father Brown Investigations: The Death of Sir Percy Coldwell
description:
In this card game, based on the beloved priest-detective character created by G. K. Chesterton, 2-6 players take the role of the Investigators and try to create a case against a suspect. The game will be issued in a base game, comprised of all the cards (nearly 200), as well as a deluxe edition with a board showing locations for investigation. The deluxe game can be played with the base rule set, or a separate rule set for a different mode of play.

In either version of the game, first a crime scene is established using the Crime, Suspect, and Evidence decks. Then, players will use the Investigation Resources deck to try to acquire their own Evidence cards in order to try to match them to the requisites of the Crime and Suspects' dossier. Evidence is acquired in rounds of a "bidding"-type action against the other players.

Apart from competing to acquire evidence, however, players can also interfere with one another's investigations by deploying Special cards, or by utilizing a special action allowed to their Investigator type. There may also be a traitor in the game, playing as Father Brown's nemesis Flambeau, whose goal is to masquerade as a detective and stop anyone from solving the crime.

There are also risks in some investigations: a player's Investigator might be killed in the line of duty, forcing that player to draw a new Investigator role and start out again back-footed in his or her investigation!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles, Induction, Matching

name: Top Tale: The O.G – Volume 2
description:
Top Tale is a family-friendly party game for 2-10 players, ages 14+, and a typical game can last 30+ minutes, taking less than two minutes to learn. The whole premise of the Top Tale O.G. series is to help humans get to know each other. During gameplay, players will share stories relating to the topic cards, and even if you've known the other players your whole life, you're likely going to learn much more about them during game play. As such, the game can be used as a team builder, an ice breaker, as a filler, or as a gateway game.

Top Tale: The Original Game - Volume 2, is the second volume in the Top Tale series, designed and published by the Indie Game Alliance studio, Yub Nub Games.

Top Tale: The O.G Vol 2 is a stand alone companion to all other Top Tale volumes, and includes topic cards that expand on the topics from the first volume without compromising on the quality of play testing each card topic has gone through.

-description from publisher

name: Top Tale: Tall Tale
description:
Top Tale: Tall Tale is a spin off of Top Tale: The Original Game (O.G.), where the twist is that for each topic a fantastical element must be added into the players' responses. Similar to The O.G. series, the game can be played with 2-10 players, ages 10+, and a typical game lasts 30+ minutes, taking less than two minutes to learn.

In Top Tale: Tall Tale, players will still get to know each other, however the stories aren't expected to be based solely on the truth. The stories are expected to be exaggerated and unbelievable, which makes the best story often times the most entertaining story.

Top Tale: Tall Tale can be integrated with other Top Tale volumes during gameplay, where the Tall Tale cards are clearly marked to cue players to stretch the truth. The other game play mechanics are all the same as the rest of the Top Tale series.

-description from publisher

name: Escape Box: Espion
description:
Can you escape in time?

You have 60 minutes to solve the puzzles!

A mad scientist has sent a weapon capable of destroying entire cities into orbit. Trapped in the computer room of an underground base, you must find the code that will deactivate the dangerous satellite.

The countdown has started: the gun will fire in 60 minutes ...

This escape box contains:
. 1 32-page booklet with the rules of the game, the scenario and the solutions.
. 40 cards to hide everywhere.
. 1 60-minute soundtrack.
. 1 poster.

name: Pays de Guérande et Saint-Nazaire: Le Jeu
description:
Pays de Guérande et Saint-Nazaire is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography going from Guérande to Saint-Etienne-de-Montluc via Pontchateau, the Sillon de Bretagne, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Guérande, Saint-Nazaire...
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hexagone
description:
The aim of the game is to gain as many French regions as possible by answering questions.

The board is comprised of bottom side serving as a wheel indicator, and a top side representing the map of France in the shape of a hexagon.

On each turn, the player turns the HEXAGON board and rolls the dice; the number indicates on the board either a region, a Chance card, or a Question card.

On a "Region" space, the player wins it if he correctly gives his name; he then scores as many points as the number on the dice. He gains additional points if he gives the capital, the departments.

On the "Chance" boxes the player can gain or lose points then play again, can play with the islands (Corsica, DOM) and gain points in the same way as on a "Region" box.

On the "Questions" boxes, the player answers as many questions as there are points achieved by rolling the dice; each correct answer is worth as many points as those of the dice. Certain boxes allow the points obtained to be multiplied by 2. In addition, the possession of all departments of a region earns bonus points, as well as possession of regions of the same color.

The best total wins the game.

name: Jeu de la Caisse d'épargne
description:
The number of players is not limited in the big game "CAISSE D'EPARGNE" but we recommend a maximum of 5 people. (One of the players will have the title of Cashier and will be at the same time the agent of the Caisse d'Epargne, the real estate agent and the seller of household appliances).

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: La Belgique infernale
description:
2000 questions for the transition to the 2000 year.
18000 classic questions on Belgium (geography, history, sciences, politics, gastronomy, sports, various facts, folklore, culture) and 200 infernal questions.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Spiel dich schlau!: Piraten-Paul auf Schatzsuche
description: An educational game collection for 2-4 kids to learn colours, forms and numbers. It consists of a jump and run game, a treasure hunt and a fast reaction game. Some of the games can also be played in a cooperative manner.

name: Creata
description:
Creata is an educational game which helps children to develop thinking, creativity and visual skills. Does the construction represent a series of trougs for water to flow or is it a tower for a king to deliver his speech to his kingdom?
The child who is the first one to recognize what the construction is wins.

name: Mały Lechita
description:
A game that increases knowledge about the Lech Poznań team, the rules of football, and encourages physical activity!

The work of a footballer is associated with great responsibility and great prestige.
Do you know what it is?
How to behave on the pitch and what is the history of the club you love so much?
Test your knowledge, fitness and become a Little Lechita!

Contents:
- a board
- a shield with arrows
- 60 cards with questions / tasks
- Little Lechity certificates
- 4 pawns
- instruction
- a dice

name: Dizzy Letters
description: A funny word game where the fastest kid wins! The game consists of a timer which stops showing two letters. The kids need to find a word now containing both of the letters. The fastest kid wins and starts the timer again for the next round.

name: Wortmeister
description: Kids can play this card game to learn more about prefixes for the various verb forms. They get a verb and need to find all the possible prefixes.

name: Jet-Flug-Reise
description: This is a cool trick taking game where the players try to get travelling routes for their planes.

name: Verflixter Turm
description: This is a kind of a ladder game within a damn tower. Kids can learn to calculate with adding and subtracting until 30. The kid which is the first one at the top of tower wins.

name: Kleiner Schlepper, Ship ahoi
description: This new card game reflects the fascinating world of river shipping. The winner is the first player to collect a complete set of tug-boat and barges, complemented with a skipper.

name: Gleich & Gleich gesellt sich gern
description:
A funny card game for fast players. Each of the 60 cards show a face of a man or a woman with one very distinct feature (eyes, mouth, nose, bart, glaces). All players play at the same time and discard their cards while looking at the same time for the second part of the pair which shows the same feature.

—user summary

name: Point Point
description: This is an exciting game of skill and calculation for 2 to 4 people. It is played with black and white counters and the winner is the first player to finish up with counters of one colour only. Counters are exchanged according to instructions printed on cards drawn from the deck.

name: So fängt es an
description: So fängt es an an educational game for kids to learn to write: The first letter is given and they need to find the others. The picture on the first letter card might help therefore.

name: Zahl und Anzahl
description: A children's game to learn numbers. There are some cards with digits from 1-10 and cards with a matching number of animals. With these cards, kids can play passing the buck, memory, building rows, calculating,etc.

name: Plapperschnabel
description:
There is a huge festival in the zoo today. There is free popcorn and ice cream for visitors and many delicacies for the animals. The children are allowed to stroke some of the young animals, and they can even ride others.

But the best thing about the festival is the guessing game with the talking parrots. Because if the parrot repeats the spoken word, you win the corresponding object.

Who will guess and who will win the most things?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Vulcano
description: The volcano in the land of the dragons is spitting out fireballs! Who will be clever enough to imagine in which part the ball might land after the fire cloud has been spun? The dragons are waiting impatiently in their part for the next eruption. Who will collect the biggest amount of fireballs in her crater? Of course the fireballs of the player's colour are much more precious!

name: Der Zwölferclub
description: This is a card game where every kid gets 3 cards and tries to discard cards whoch sum up to 12. The kid who created the most sets of cards with the sum of 12 wins.

name: Rechenstar
description: The youngest player starts on his way to become a calculating star! He rolls two dice and needs to create a story with the sum of the dice and his cards. If he calculates wrongly, he will not get the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Kolonne on Tour
description:
Each player has 3 trucks and wants to transport material (card board chips) to construction sites. Movement is on a board with a street net by one chosen die out of 5. Next player must choose out of 4 dice and so on. A construction site will be scored if all necessary materials are brought or even earlier, if the lead for the majority is unchangeable. First and second player get points.

This was produced and published as a commercial game by Günter Rux GmbH which produces scaffoldings.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Isabel y Diego
description:
The legend of the lovers of Teruel has multiple literary and theatrical versions, as well as a reflection in other artistic manifestations. It is a story about an impossible and chaste love with a tragic ending, possibly originating in the 15th century but whose plot is set in the 13th century, starring the lady Isabel de Segura and the gentleman Juan Martínez de Marcilla (better known as Diego from the theatrical performances of the seventeenth century). Today it is an unavoidable part of the culture of Teruel.

With Isabel y Diego, will you be able to change the legend?
In this game 3 to 7 players are divided into two teams.
The first team will be friends of Isabel and Diego who want to change the disastrous ending of the legend and get the couple to reunite and grow old together. To do this, they will help Diego to achieve the necessary wealth to marry her to Isabel, and will prevent her from giving in to the pressure she receives from her to marry Don Rodrigo de Azagra.
The other team will be enemies of the couple who will try by all means that Diego falls in combat and that Isabel collapses and agrees to marry the Lord of Albarracín.

Isabel y Diego is a strategy game in which you have to coordinate with your team to achieve your objectives while trying to disrupt those of the opponents.
Play cunning, decide wisely how to use the cards in your hands, and lead your team to victory.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: CHOAM
description:
A free PnP asymmetrical Monopoly game inspired by the classic Dune board game.

Unlike traditional Monopoly, players can choose between five different factions, each with unique abilities and win conditions. Each player will have four fighters they can use to attack others and lay claim to the enemy's strongholds but it will always be at a cost.

Players should also be careful of the very planet itself, as Arrakis is a harsh place and to survive it will take its toll. Luckily, if a player owns certain territories they either gain by force or are naturally given it from the start, they can receive riches in the form of the spice melange.

With the spice, players can bribe and trade with each other and afford to survive in the hostile deserts of Arrakis. But players should be cautious, as deals can be broken and players can lie their way to getting spice. Calling them out on not following through on a deal or catching them in a lie can cause them to lose a turn but a player falsely accusing someone of lying can have harsher consequences.

The game ends when any of the unique faction specific winning conditions are met.
categories: Dice, Economic, Fighting, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Bribery, Income, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Þingspilið: Með þingmenn í vasanum
description:
In the Þingspilið (The Congress Game) card game players compete to get the most congressmen as possible. Players draw party leaders and start with 5 congressmen. Then they resolve issues, events and scandals (in a last in, first out order) to gain more congressmen. Wheeling and dealing is very much encouraged in this game.

—user summary

name: Gioca Livorno
description:
Gioca Livorno
The aim of the game, inspired by the history of Livorno, is to become the master of the city (sindaco, padrone, capo della città) by acquiring powers along the board.

Gioca Livorno includes:

objective cards with winning conditions
a board that covers all the districts of the city with their historical shields. They are arranged as in the Palio Marinaro: Ovosodo, Borgo Cappuccini, Colline-Coteto, Venice, Antignano, Fabbricotti, Shanghai, Ardenza, Magenta / Origine, Quercianella, Pontino San Marco, Montenero, Salviano, Stazione, Sorgenti, San Jacopo
25 cards Laws of Livorno, about the history of the city
pawns
dice
Talleri the game currency
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 曇天／斬合 Tactics (Donten no Kiriai Tactics)
description:
曇天／斬合 Tactics (どんてんのきりあい Tactics) Donten no Kiriai Tactics is a Japanese game for two players. It is a simpler game than the original 曇天／斬合 Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend) to let players learn the basic game before progressing to the full edition. The designer includes solitaire rules.

Two Samurais duel, using basic movement and attack cards.

Measure the distance with your opponent and decide on a blow! As a samurai, all you can do is change your stance, advance or retreat, and slash. The duel continues hot and fast, round after round, until one of the Samurai succumbs to their wounds.

The players take a basic deck of six cards. Players set up the duelling positions, with the Samurai initially being two steps apart, and then each secretly chooses a hand card face-down. When they are ready, the cards are turned up.

The basic cards involve the Samurai advancing or retreating, and adopting different stances. If the Samurai move close enough together, and onto the same spot, then a strike can happen.

Basic attacks can be made repeatedly, the card goes back to the player's hand when used.

A round ends when a successful strike is made, and damage is shown on the attacking card. The player struck loses hit points.

The first player to lose all their health loses the duel.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game

name: Agitation und Propaganda
description:
Agitation and Propaganda (short: agitprop) is a strategic Card game that deals with the history of left-wing groups and movements in Germany.
The game tells the story of the developments and conflicts of the left movement from 1945 until today. The groups and actors are characterized enough to have enough potential for hostility, know-it-all and of course to give divisions.
The aim of the game is to create a network of allied left-wing groups to cope with the social challenges in the course of mercilessly advancing history.
With the successful unlocking of history cards and the achieving of special organizational goals, the players collect revolution points. These are used to get to the top of the Revolution by the end and win the game!

name: Victory at Sea: Gneisenau
description:
While serving as commerce raiders, the Scharnhorst-class Battleships (or battlecruisers), Scharnhorst and Gneisenau were responsible for sinking over 105,000 tons of allied shipping in a single cruise.

The two ships operated together for much of the early portion of the war, including sorties into the Atlantic, the sinking of British cruiser HMS Rawalpindi and Operation Weserübung, the German invasion of Norway. In these operations off Norway, Gneisenau along with Scharnhorst, engaged and sank the aircraft carrier HMS Glorious, but in turn Gneisenau was damaged in action against HMS Renown and was subsequently struck by torpedoes.

After further actions in the Atlantic in 1941, the two ships put in at Brest, and were subject to repeated Allied bombing raids. Despite suffering damage, Gneisenau was repaired in good time and in early 1942, the two battle cruisers participated in a daylight dash up the English Channel, sailing for Germany. Gneisenau reached Kiel in early February and went into drydock. On the night of 26 February, the British launched an air attack on the ship, with an explosion in the forward ammunition section causing such heavy damage that it was deemed that the ship's weapons would be refit (as had been originally planned), necessitating a rebuild for her to accommodate larger 38cm guns (her original 28 cm became shore batteries). These plans were abandoned on Hitler's order in 1943.
On 27 March 1945, Gneisenau was sunk as a block-ship in German occupied Poland. Eventually, she was broken up for scrap in 1951.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Graf Zeppelin
description:
Though laid down and launched before the start of the war, the Graf Zeppelin was never completed or commissioned, and it never saw action.

Whilst four aircraft of the class had originally been planned, constant in-fighting between the Kriegsmarine and Luftwaffe, as well as a priority on the building of U-Boats hampered their construction, with the planned four carriers quickly reduced to two. Construction on the ship that would eventually be christened Graf Zeppelin was eventually halted in 1940.

However, with the role of the carrier proving itself in the Battle of Taranto, in the sinking of the Bismarck and at Pearl Harbour and Midway prompted construction to briefly continue. The Graf Zeppelin was almost completed in 1943 but Hitler, disappointed with the Kriegsmarine, halted all surface fleet construction. The Carrier was captured by the Soviet Union at the end of the war, and was sunk as a target ship in 1947.

Though obviously never seeing action in reality, Kriegsmarine players are afforded new tactical options in Victory at Sea with the opportunity to include this carrier in their fleet.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Boots Blesse
description:
Frederick Corbin "Boots" Blesse (August 22, 1921 – October 31, 2012) was a United States Air Force major general and flying ace. Graduating from the United States Military Academy in 1945, he subsequently flew two combat tours during the Korean War, completing 67 missions in P-51s, 35 missions in F-80s and 121 missions in F-86s.

For the first tour he was assigned to Fighter-Bomber Squadrons. The latter tour, in which he piloted the F-86, is where he was officially credited with shooting down nine MiG-15s and one La-9. This earned him the accolade, at the time of the conclusion of his tour, in 1952, of being America's top jet ace.

During the second tour in F-86s, as part of the 334th Fighter-Interceptor squadron he was officially credited with shooting down nine MiG-15s and one La-9, as well as (unofficially) an additional probable kill, and three more enemy aircraft damaged. At the time of his return to the United States in October 1952, he was America's leading jet ace.

Contains 1 Resin Lockheed F-80C Shooting Star Aircraft and game cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Royce Williams
description:
On 18 November 1952, piloting a Grumman Panther, Lt Royce Williams of VF-781 destroyed four MiGs in a single encounter that lasted no more than 35 minutes. During a series of air strikes against the North Korean port of Hoeryong, the four MiGs were intercepted as a result of intelligence provided by the US National Security Agency. Williams lost contact with his wingman and found himself in a 6-on-1 confrontation against the fearsome MiG 15. Nevertheless, he downed four of the enemy jets and upon returning to the USS Oriskany, his Panther was found to have sustained 263 hits from cannon shells and was beyond repair.

What makes this feat all the more remarkable is that the four MiGs downed were confirmed to have been flown by Soviet Naval Aviation Pilots. This was only confirmed by Russian sources 40 years later - with all Soviet involvement vehemently denied, during and for many years after, the Korean War.

Contains 1 Resin Grumman F9F Panther and game cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Battle Royale: Flick to the Death – Lone Wolf Promo Cards
description:
With this promo, you can add a 6th player to the game.

Setup: Shuffle the Lone Wolf character card with the other characters. A player may choose to play as the Lone Wolf instead of a normal 4 character team.

Shuffle the weapon card into the loot deck.

Lone Wolf's ability has 3 effects:
- May perform an extra move or attack action each turn.
- Is always considered to have a Melee weapon and may choose to use it instead of a weapon he has equipped.
- Starts with armor. Draw an armor icon on his card at the beginning of the game.

Lone Wolf Legendary Weapon:
The character wielding this may attack in either of 2 ways:
- Make a single short ranged attack
- Give up their move action to use their attack action to make 3 short ranged attacks.
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Note: This card was delivered in 2020 while the base game is scheduled for 2021.

name: Gra w Wojnę
description: A game of War illustrated by Andrzej Mleczko. Rules for Kuku and 3-5-8 are inluded in the box.

name: Gra w Pana
description: A game of Pan illustrated by Andrzej Mleczko. Rules for Oszust and Makao are inluded in the box.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Number

name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2020
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2020'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2020. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

name: Kami Climb!
description:
カミクライム! (Kami Climb!) is a dexterity game from Japan, exhibited for the first time at Tokyo Game Market Autumn 2019. Before playing, the paper mountain is constructed by hand using the paper materials supplied. Through paper folding, a large column with angular sides is built, standing in a solid base unit. The shape resembles the artificial climbing walls found in modern sports centres.

Once the piece of paper is transformed into a steep rocky mountain, the players operate their climber with one finger, to aim for the top of the mountain. The player first pushes their climber up with their finger and hooks it on the anchor to proceed. The anchors match the climbers' colours.

There are two phases, plan and climb. Reach the anchors on the 3D board in turn order. When climbing, if the climber reaches an anchor in their colour, they take another move.

Players can win by reaching the summit faster than the others. But a player can still win if they take the harder routes. Players must choose between easier, faster routes, and harder, more technical routes. If a player can conquer the hardest route in three turns, they win.
user summary

name: Cupcake
description: Roll the three coloured dice, and be the first to find the corresponding cupcake. Whoever gets the most cupcakes wind the game.

name: det fantastiske hæklespil
description: A game about crochet, whether you are new to crochet or have experience in crochet. Start your work, do your stitches, swap works with your opponents, change colour. Games with simple stitches, games with advanced stitches.

name: det suveræne strikkespil
description: A game about knitting, whether you are new to knitting or have experience in knitting. Start your work, do your stitches, swap works with your opponents, change colour. Games with simple stitches, games with advanced stitches.

name: Box Quiz: Drinks
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Drinks'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about drinks. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

name: Box Quiz: Ferie
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Vacation'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about vacation. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: SCP – Bite Size
description:
This bite-size edition of the well-known game TRIVIAL PURSUIT is exclusively dedicated to Sporting Clube de Portugal.

This is the travel edition of the Sporting Clube de Portugal Trivial Pursuit with about 600 questions about the history of this Centenary Club.

Test your knowledge of the Club and its history!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Traversez les Pyrénées à vélo ou en parapente
description:
Traversez les Pyrénées à vélo ou en parapente , a journey full of pitfalls and challenges!

2 levels of difficulty, child and adult version
5 types of games: foldable main board of the Pyrenees chain (90 cm)
a small board Look for the differences with the drawing of the game box
and on the front Find the Pyrenean flora and fauna ...
200 thematic cards printed on both sides: 400 questions on fauna, flora, the Pyrenees, Pyrenean specialties, local vocabulary, unforeseen events and challenges
Family friendly and educational game from 3 to 103 years old, 2 to 6 players or more in teams
~90 min if you play the bicycle version (65 stages)
~45 min if you play the paragliding version (45 stages)
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Me-MO Island
description:
A 2-4 player tile laying family game of pitting adorable me-MO against each other. But be careful, all those creatures are just ready to POP!

Setup the island differently each game with obstacles like balloon tiles, healing wells, and giant boulders. Then players draw a hand of 3 Me-MO and take turns placing them onto the island. Activating special abilities and knocking some health off opposing Me-MO as they enter play.

Watch out for Me-MO with low health though, once they POP they'll deal damage to every Me-MO around them, even friendly ones! Causing a chain reaction that could end the game.

First one to POP five of their opponents Me-MO win the game!

With Basic and Advanced rules, the game is suitable for all ages and skill levels. The basic rules focus on spatial awareness and simple math with no reading required, while advanced mode introduces special abilities and more strategic play.

-description from designer

name: Sex Gedächtnisspiel
description:
The Miko sex memory game is played just like the popular memory game. All cards are shuffled face down on the table. As many pairs as possible should be found. But beware! There are also 24 crazy tasks in this game. The tasks are divided into two halves, which in turn are on different cards. If you happened to turn the left and right halves of an order while playing this memory game, then you will have to complete this order on the spot, to the glee of all players.

—user summary

name: Soirée Escape Game: Panique à Tchernobyl
description:
A complete kit to organize an incredible escape game evening with friends, in one of the most oppressive worlds: the Chernobyl power station, in Ukraine, transformed into a death trap.
An unprecedented catastrophe will shake your life when, following hazardous handling, Reactor No. 4 melts.

Try to escape, find iodine pills, the right combination, a vehicle and… get out of the disaster scene as soon as possible!

—description from the publisher

name: ATS Pork Chop Hill 2016
description:
‘IRON TRIANGLE’ OUTPOST PORK CHOP HILL, KOREA 6 July 1953: At 1025 hours on the night of July 6th a massive artillery and mortar barrage preceded an onslaught by 700 soldiers from the CCF 200th Regiment, 67th Division. The sounds from the crashing shells concealed the oncoming Chinese, until they burst forward in what was described as “a moving carpet of yelling, howling men--whistles and bugles blowing, their officers screaming like women driving their men uphill.” In a bunker CP just beneath the crest of the hill Corporal Dale W. Cain heard his radio come alive with reports of “enemy in large numbers”. Company A reported hand-to-hand fighting in the trenches. The battle was fought in a driving monsoon rain, making evacuation of the wounded difficult, as well as re-supply. As the battle swayed back and forth, the Chinese made repeated pushes to take the hill while both sides unleashed a storm of artillery fire upon the struggling soldiers. During the course of two days, parts of four companies defended Pork Chop. At dawn on July 8th, the rain ended for a time and the initial defenders were withdrawn. The defenders counted nine enemy assaults during the night of July 6-7. By 11 July General Taylor reluctantly decided to abandon Pork Chop Hill. As had been the case on Old Baldy, Taylor could not justify risking more lives for a hill that was of minimal strategic significance. The armistice was finally just around the corner.
