Newly remastered - really NEW as the terrain has changed in some instances, not to mention the retro art and then some > AND THE MAP IS about 120% ENLARGED! It makes for an amazing battlefield! You receive a 'lucky 7' set of scenarios that ALL play on the new map, covering a good 100+ hours plus of gaming.

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook 2014 and small + large system markers is required. ALL THE COMBAT COUNTERS NEEDED TO PLAY ARE INCLUDED.> is required.

Components:
4 mapsheets (18.5" x 12.5")
2 countersheets (identical, with TT-sized counters)
7 scenarios (4 sheets - 1 bonus scenario using the Toktong Ridge map is also included)
2 sheet (4 page) battlefield walkaround
1 ziploc insert (with LOS examples printed on the inside)

-description from publisher's website

name: Benidorm: The Game
description:
Roll the dice to move around the board starting your life as a tourist, get a job maybe as a prop or become an extra on Benidorm and work your way up to being a TV celebrity. Make it through the holiday and you can start buying bars and restaurants building up to your own hotel chain. Will you end up living the dream or sleeping on the Levante beach.

Take a stroll around the market or maybe get lost in the old town, will you get scammed by the potato men or call house at bingo, spend all night singing karaoke or dancing on the square. Rent a mobility scooter speeding round the board or crash the hire car ending up in Levante Hospital. Avoid paying your taxes, get done by the sound police, lose your wallet skinny dipping in the sea, win big at the bookies, this game has it all. Win the game by becoming a Benidorm tycoon but just hope French air traffic control strikes don't hit your pocket

Only the brave live here and the lucky survive


Over 100 life and risk cards bringing you the daily ups and downs of life in Benidorm



All your favourite businesses, pay for food & drink to the property owner, collect rents off your friends



Will you get a caravan, live in a villa by the sea, shop at the market or can you afford luxury items



How will you play this game of skill & chance – fun for all the family


—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Humor, Travel

name: U.S.S. Sus
description:
The survey ship U.S.S. Sus has just a few more tweaks, checks, and tests to undergo before it can begin its mission in deep space. However, not everyone wants to see the ship succeed at exploring far planets. Intruders have boarded the ship and are disguised as part of the astronaut crew. Can the astronauts find the intruders and expel them from the ship before it is too late?

U.S.S. Sus is a hidden role game where 5-11 players take on the roles of the astronauts or intruders and then try to figure out who they can trust and who is suspicious.

The game is played in rounds and each round has three phases. In the first phase all players secretly choose a location in the ship to work in. In the second phase players will find out who else is working in the same room, and then the intruder players can attempt to kill a player in the same or adjacent room. In the final phase the players discuss who is an intruder and decide if someone is going out an airlock.

—description from the designer

name: Одесская Мафия (Odessa Mafia)
description:
Одесская мафия, Odessa Mafia

Odessa, pearl by the sea! This beautiful and creative city is famous not only for its works of art, masterpieces of cinematography and pearls of humor, but also for the legends of the gangster world. Become a member of the All-Union Bolshevik Party, up to 15 people can play.

Gameplay:
Before the start of the game, all its participants receive party tickets, which indicate their role for the current game. Looked at the ticket - close it immediately and do not tell anyone who you are.

The game consists of "Night" and "Day" phases.
The mafia rampages at night, and during the day, civilians hunt down the Odessa bandits.
Each of the players is obliged to nominate his own candidate on suspicion of involvement in gangster circles, you can vote once, you cannot abstain. The one who gets the most votes is eliminated from the game, but does not reveal his/her role.

Win conditions:
Civilians can win if they figure out the whole mafia,
the mafia wins when its number equals the one of the law-abiding citizen.
Additional cards give a special charm to the game.

–User description
mechanics: Action Timer, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Paper-and-Pencil, Voting

name: Magnetic Baseball Pocket Travel Game
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 20 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magnetic American Football Pocket Travel Game
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 19 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magnetic Volleyball Pocket Travel Game
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 24 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cards Against IT: Series 3
description:
Extra deck of cards for Cards Against IT with Security based cards.
Pomotion item from Varonis, an IT security company

name: Magnetic Hideout Pocket Travel Game
description: There is a starting space for each player. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach the hideout wins the game. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magnetic Search Pocket Travel Game
description: The players start at the starting space. The first to reach the space with the treasure trunk wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on an occupied space, the other player has to go back to the next car of his color. On the blue spaces the players may change direction.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magnetic Voyage Game Pocket Travel Game
description:
The players start at the starting space. The first to reach the finish wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Punsanity: Food Fighters vs. Party Animals
description:
Punsanity is a quick, fun, and easy to learn card game that is both silly and full of strategy. Players take turns fighting each other and defending themselves until someone destroys his enemy's commander and wins the game. Each player's deck is made up of many cards. Some cards - called puns or inside jokes - have powerful, one time use effects (just like the look your friends get the first time you say a corny line). Others are fighters who act both as your offensive and defensive line. They are super important and can even be upgraded with items, a third type of card.

The game gets more and more intense each turn because the more turns that go by, the more resources that gather in your resource pile. The more resources that gather in your resource pile, the more cards that will be played, and the more cards that will be played, the more destruction that will occur. Finally, the more destruction that will occur, the sooner the game will end.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Line of Sight, Worker Placement

name: Punsanity: Mech Dwellers vs. Battle Mages
description:
Punsanity is a quick, fun, and easy to learn card game that is both silly and full of strategy. Players take turns fighting each other and defending themselves until someone destroys his enemy's commander and wins the game. Each player's deck is made up of many cards. Some cards - called puns[ or inside jokes - have powerful, one time use effects (just like the look your friends get the first time you say a corny line). Others are fighters who act both as your offensive and defensive line. They are super important and can even be upgraded with items, a third type of card.

The game gets more and more intense each turn because the more turns that go by, the more resources that gather in your resource pile. The more resources that gather in your resource pile, the more cards that will be played, and the more cards that will be played, the more destruction that will occur. Finally, the more destruction that will occur, the sooner the game will end.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Line of Sight, Worker Placement

name: Pays de Redon et Vallons de Vilaine: le Jeu !
description:
Pays de Redon et Vallons de Vilaine: le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Redon, Allaire, Avessac, Bains-sur-Oust, Béganne ...
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Money Mad
description:
There are cards in 4 suits in a different number and with different values. All players start with £30.
Each player has 3 cards on his hand and has 1 turn to exchange one of it by drawing one of the draw pile or the last discarded one of a specific suit. Then each player passes one card to his neighbor. All cards are revealed and compared. The player with the lowest score pays the difference to the highest score into the pot. The player with the highest score takes the difference to the second highest score from the pot. Several rounds are played, eliminating all players who went broke. Last player in the game gets the whole pot and wins.
Mechanism, game weight and feeling is somewhat similar to Swim.
Released in a style like Cheapass Games, probably in the 70s.

name: This is America
description:
A fantastic and dynamic board game about our great country's history and culture: the objective of the game is to conquer the White House and become President of the United States of America.

The game's objective consists of one of the players becoming the President of the United States of America. Our game is not as challenging to achieve this as in real life. To win this game, you need to know a variety of information about this country. Therefore, to become the President, you must conquer the states on the map. How do you win a state? Well, simply answering the questions correctly!

Each State Card has a number. This signifies the number of questions that need to be answered to win that state. who can win the states by answering either 2,3,4 or 5 questions; this depends on each state's size and population. Similar to what happens in the electoral college).

Next, the player will spin the roulette wheel, and the arrow will indicate the category of the first question to answer. Another player will take the question and read it out loud. If the player who answers the questions gives the correct response, then they will continue answering questions.

When the necessary questions to win the state are all answered, the state will have been conquered. The player will take one of their chips and will place it in the corresponding state on the board.

In order to win, you must be the first player to conquer 8 States. All the pieces of the white house have been turned over, and you'll be the President of the United States of America.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Voting

name: Unsinkable
description:
Unsinkable consists of a single laminated card depicting a blurry image of a naval ship. In the game, the players prepare a certain number of dice, and aim to balance the dice on the ship.

However, for setup, the card is placed floating in water (such as a tub, sink, etc.) On a turn, a player rolls a die and places it in the corresponding section of the ship. If the players are able to place all of the dice on the card without any of the die becoming fully submerged, the players win!
user summary

カード（不沈艦）を水に浮かべ、サイコロ（被弾）を乗せていくゲームです。船を沈めてしまったプレイヤーの負けです。用意したサイコロを全て置けたなら、全員が勝利を分かち合います。
This is a game to float the Unsinkable Ship card on the water and place dice (shots) on them. The player who sinks the ship loses. If all the dice to place can be placed, everyone shares the victory.
publisher's summary

name: Pays de Vannes-Auray: le Jeu !
description:
Pays de Vannes-Auray: le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 1000 questions, written questions and photos with also charades and riddles as well as "junior" questions.
Subjects covered as are as varied as history or geography going from Saint-Dolay to Camors, Belle-Ile, Carnac, Étel or Pleucadeuc, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Vannes...

Content:

game board,
6 pawns,
1 dice,
650 "adult" questions,
100 "junior" questions,
140 visual questions
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Liquid Squid
description:
In 2088 only monolithic cities of trans-humanistic worship protrude from the crust of the earth. Between these cities lies The Expanse, where all opposed were banished. The first to stabilize an economy was Neo Tokyo. The 3 foundational levels that stabilized the economy are as follows:

THE UNDERBELLY
The Underbelly is at street level and is home to the augmentation junkies looking to merge with machines as much and as fast as possible. This is a wild jungle with extremes in morals and values. The Underbelly is a powerful economy completely driven by tech advances.

THE PEN
The Pen, home to the sheeple. The Pen is completely self contained ecosystem above the Underbelly. It is a stable economy but possesses a docile culture which needs protection provided by corporate security called "The Regulators". Now that The Pen faces a new threat from the villains henchmen, their fear needs to be managed because if the The Pen falls, so does the city.

THE QUANTUM
Above it all sits The Quantum, the home of the Corporate Elite. Completely sealed off and secured, these are the lever pullers. Their key to success was helping to facilitate a social contract with the citizens and their representatives. This unwritten understanding is what made Neo Tokyo possible and has yet to be displayed, defined or quantified.

When word got around about the quality of Aug's/Mods and the success rate, many, including Natalia Burtolla (an accomplished hacker known as Liquid Squid) rushed to Neo Tokyo. Born without legs, she came for the best money could buy. She quickly fell in love with the city and the feeling was mutual. She finally feels at home and will do anything to protect Neo Tokyo.

With great decadents comes greater corruption and the stench of that sludge attracts the greatest of villains.

When the villains henchmen hit the streets many were caught off guard. Liquid Squid was well aware and prepared for this threat. To The Underbelly, this was only a matter of time.

OBJECTIVE
A Super Villain is hell bent on terrorizing Neo Tokyo into his control. If he takes out 3 Landmarks he gains the levers of power over the entire city. When the 3rd Landmark has been targeted for attack the Super Villain himself and his elite army descend to make sure the job gets done right. Try to foil the attacks on Landmarks until you can assemble an army of allies powerful enough to defeat him and end the chaos.

DEFEND NEO TOKYO
Neo Tokyo is rife with the Villains Henchmen and natural enemy factions that will destroy anyone and anything in their path. You must protect the citizens from these threats. At the same time you must try to foil attacks on Landmarks until you are prepared to face the Super Villain.

BUILD AN ARMY
Build rep with powerful city influencers by completing missions, assemble your army of allies and temper public fear.

END THE CHAOS
When the third Landmark is triggered you go toe-to-toe with the Super Villain and his army with only one option for an ending. Explosive.

THE STREETS
The streets are the underbelly of Neo Tokyo and have 3 stand-alone districts which hold 36 key locations. The Villains henchmen are causing chaos across the city. It has become a monstrous jungle war between the treacherous and the savage. The Villain needs to destroy three landmarks to throw the city into proper chaos and take control of the primary levers. You must defend the streets while building an ally army and when you’re ready, end the chaos.

PUBLIC FEAR
During play the Villain will trigger events that spook the general public. The higher the Public Fear meter rises the more carnage the Villain will rain down on the city. Gain reputation with influencers and they will use their platforms to try and calm the public.

MISSIONS
There are 126 missions offering reputation and gadget rewards. When visiting locations around the city you can access Mission Control to see what missions are available and select at least one.

ENEMY AND ALLY POOLS
The enemy pool builds randomly during play, these forces are inserted into a scenario when they are triggered. A Landmark is triggered when 3 enemies appear on it. You build the ally pool and those are the forces you use when a Landmark is triggered.

LANDMARKS
There are 12 Landmarks across the city. Each has a unique one-shot combat scenario. When a Landmark is triggered place the scenario on the board, try to defuse the situation and exit with as much loot as possible. If an ally does not reach an exit they are removed from your forces.

POINTS of INTEREST (POI)
In order to hack from the streets Liquid Squid must enter a POI. POI's can be destroyed as well but do not count as Landmarks. Most missions involve POI locations and NPC's from those locations.

HACKING
HACK INTO THE ENVIRONMENT AND ENEMIES
Liquid Squid is a balanced dance between physical combat and hacking. If you have an angry mob on the other side of the city, not a problem. Hack in and set-off a Regulator Alarm, that will make ‘em scatter. Facing an overpowered enemy? No problem. Hack into his system, overload it and watch the fire works. The synergy between problem solving, physical combat and hacking is what makes Liquid Squid so enjoyable.

In order to hack there has to be a Mobile Hub in the district. You will always have a 50% chance that there is a Mobile Hub in the district. But you can gain control of Mobile Hubs and dedicate them to certain districts granting 100% hacking as long as you maintain control of the Mobile Hub.
In order to hack the streets, Liquid Squid must launch the hack from a Point of Interest. In a scenario she must launch a hack from a Hack Entry Point. Hacking consists of O-Hack/D-Hack gadgets, Offensive/Defensive Programs (Oprog/Dprog) and NODES.

FACTIONS
The Syndicate (Ally)
The Syndicate are a network of gangs in the Tokyo Underbelly lead by Robert Crisp. Attain Ally status with Crisp and they will join you in your fight.

Regulators (Ally)
The Regulators are corporate security and the law in Neo Tokyo. Attain Ally Status with Chief Yamasaki and they will join you in battle.

The Coda (Enemy)
The Coda are the Villains henchmen. They are a mixed bag of characters with a wide range of mod limits. They are exceedingly loyal to their boss, relentless terrorists and your sworn enemy.

Outliers (Enemy)
Outliers are the Villains Praetorian Guard. They have taken exceptionally well to merging with machines and poses a fervor to watch the world burn.

Mercs (Ally)
Mercs are deadly mercenaries for hire. They have a natural disdain for oppressors and Outliers in particular. Mercs further modify their Mods for optimum carnage. Mercs will join Liquid Squid free of charge.

Drones (Enemy)
These nasty machines are the Super Villains master assassins. They have destroyed the competition, even Regulator Drones. Now they only exist to hunt you and your ilk.

Block Rockers (Enemy)
Block Rockers are massive mechs with on board sentient AI. They will cut off passage through the block and are chock full of Gank Rating. Each of the three types of Block Rocker requires a specific gadget to engage them.

The Chimera (Enemy)
The Chimera are mutants who suffered grotesque side effects from merging with machines. Chimera can be found in the Underbelly and below. Besides general carnage they also maintain coordinated attacks of "The Pen" above.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Breizhit
description:
Breizhit is a game of questions and humor with very simple rules.

The adult cards offer 5 themes per card:

general culture
trivia on Brittany
mimes
Breton language (or nature for the kids version)
"light" theme


You have to rebuild the Brittany puzzles (1 per team) by answering questions randomly selected.

3 ways to play:

one against one
per team
all players against the game!
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Prehistorica
description:
With the light of a new dawn, a clan of Neanderthals wake by a smouldering fire. They’re hungry and tired of eating berries and small game. Excitement soon spreads like wildfire as they peer from their cave, across the vast grasslands and forests to the clear mountain peaks beyond. The clouds have lifted, and a warm sun softens the snow around them. Winter has passed and soon to follow are the giants of fur and bone; the mighty Mammoths!

Prehistorica is a two-player asymmetric deck-deconstruction board game in which one player managers a tribe of Neanderthals and the other migrates a herd of Mammoths.

As the Neanderthals, you’ll have to gather resources, build traps, and craft weaponry to succeed in hunting the Mammoths. As the Mammoths, you’ll have to fend off attacks and migrate through three different territories; the grasslands, forests, and mountains – grazing and eating plenty of berries along the way – until you are safe from the Neanderthals’ hunting party.

The Neanderthals win if they successfully hunt all four Mammoths, and the Mammoths win if they successfully migrate across the board with at least one surviving member of the herd.

For the Neanderthals, this is the most prosperous time of year… but for the Mammoths, it’s the most dangerous leg of their journey.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: La Boîte: Quelle est votre destination ?
description:
Find the Routard (famous French backpacker guide) atmosphere in this unique question-answer game that will take you on a journey from your living room!
Choose a destination number, answer questions on monuments, countries, culinary art or even films and books, use flash codes to guess a place on a photo, act out a situation to make yourself understood ...
With each correct answer you gain a clue to find the destination to discover!
The first to find his unknown destination wins!


6 categories:
Around the world
Triporteur
Flash-code
Travel
G'palémo (signs/drawings to make yourself understood in any language)
Unknown destinations



And bonus: 1 guide to the Routard favorites

name: El Gran Golpe
description:
El Gran Golpe (The Big Heist) is a game that simulates a robbery in 3 different rooms (rounds). By using cards and unique abilities depending on the character, you will have to be the player with the most money to accumulate.

You choose a character at random, start the player who has visited a mansion most recently and deal 5 cards to each player. The maximum number of cards changes depending on the round you are in, but the minimum is always 3.

The game starts, in each turn you can:

1- Roll the dice and use your unique ability and/or use as many cards as you want, although "Looting", "Decoy", "Mirror", "Duplicate" and "Secret Passage" can only be used once until your next turn.
2- Show a card. You put a card face up.
3- Draw a card. Choose the card face up or draw the next card in the deck face down.

These are the actions that each one of you can do, thanks to the cards you can get money or steal it from your rivals. With the skills you can gain an advantage by drawing cards from the rest of the opponents or from the deck.

Shifts run clockwise. The winner is decided in 3 rounds. A round is finished when the "Art Gallery/Vault" card appears, at this time all players discard their hand and the money is counted. The money that you are getting can be stolen by your enemies, but once a round is finished, the money that you have obtained in it will be insured. You will play the third round until the cards in the deck are used up.

—description from publisher


El Gran Golpe es un juego que simula un robo en 3 habitaciones diferentes (rondas). Mediante el uso de cartas y habilidades únicas según el personaje, tendréis que lograr ser el jugador que más dinero logre acumular.

Elegís personaje al azar, empieza el jugador que haya visitado una mansión más recientemente y repartís 5 cartas a cada jugador. El número máximo de cartas cambia según la ronda en la que estéis, pero el mínimo siempre es 3.

Empieza el juego, en cada turno podéis:

1- Lanzar el/los dados y usar vuestra habilidad única y/o utilizar tantas cartas como queráis, aunque “Saqueo”, “Señuelo”, “Espejo”, “Duplicar” y “Pasadizo Secreto” solo se pueden utilizar una vez hasta vuestro siguiente turno.
2- Pintar una carta. Ponéis una carta boca arriba para que todos la vean.
3- Robar una carta. Elegid la carta boca arriba o robad boca abajo la siguiente carta del mazo.

Estas son las acciones que podéis hacer cada uno, gracias a las cartas podéis conseguir dinero o robárselo a vuestros rivales. Con las habilidades podéis ganar ventaja robando cartas del resto de contrincantes o del mazo.

Los turnos transcurren en sentido horario. El ganador se decide en 3 rondas. Una ronda se termina cuando aparece la carta "Galería de Arte/Cámara acorazada", en este momento todos los jugadores desechan su mano y se hace el recuento de dinero. El dinero que vais consiguiendo puede ser robado por vuestros enemigos, pero una vez se termina una ronda, el dinero que habéis conseguido en ella quedará asegurado. La tercera ronda la jugaréis hasta que se agoten las cartas que hay en el mazo. (Spanish)
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: CLIMB!
description:
CLIMB! is a card game from Japan, for one or two players. The solitaire game pits the climber against the mountain, having to ascend and descend safely in order to win.

The two player game has the climber contending with the Mountain God too, trying to prevent the climber from ascending. This game can be played with the payers taking alternate roles, first the climber, then the mountain god, affecting how each will play their role.

The designer re-implemented this as the solo game TOZAN.
user summary

name: Pink Panther & Sons Race Game
description: A colorful children's game akin to Candy Land, featuring the panther kids from the cartoon show Pink Panther & Sons from the 1980s. Players take turns moving their rainbow panther kid up the mountain by rolling the colored die and advancing to the corresponding space while trying to avoid the Howl Angel spaces that can send you back.

name: Scrabble Sensor
description: Predecessor to the Scrabble Lexor, Scrabble Sensor was touted as the hot new electronic word game to spice up game night or to bring Scrabble on the go. Gameplay is more like mastermind and hangman as opposed to traditional Scrabble play. Featuring solitaire, singles, doubles, and scoring variations of play. Players use the keyboard to enter and guess at hidden words through the console with the aid of lights and beeps to give hints.

name: Steal This Election!
description:
A political satire card game for two players. One game takes 15-225 minutes. Players collect, modify, and steal voter population cards from each other, using action cards based on popular conspiracy theories from the 2020 U.S. Presidential election, as well as conspiracy theories from other areas of pop culture.

Steal This Election! should be equally fun/offensive to game enthusiasts of any political persuasion.

Once all population cards are accounted for, the voting is over -- but not the election! If the loser refuses to concede, the game moves into a brief "Litigation and Recount" phase. More population cards are distributed, and more dirty tricks are played before a last count finally brings closure to the election.

name: Le Jeu de la chouette: Connaissez-vous Dijon ?
description:
Le Jeu de la chouette (The game of the Owl) is a mix between Trivial Pursuit and the Goose Game.

300 questions to (re)discover Dijon and its history…
Le Jeu de la chouette is conceived as a walk in the city center of Dijon.
To win, correctly answer questions on:

history,
heritage,
gastronomy,
famous people,
arts and literature,
sport.


For each question, a detailed answer lets you to learn while having fun.
Conquer the 6 large city squares on the board!

The Owl is Dijon mascot.

name: Rap Battles Of Rhymania
description:
Drop the beat and get ready to throw down the best rhymes you can create in this fast-paced card game where only one rapper can come out on top—because here in Rhymania, every dispute is settled with a rap battle!

At the beginning of each round, each player draws 5 cards. Then, they are able to discard and redraw as many cards as they want. Then, by strategically matching cards with rhymes ending in the same sound, they deal damage to their opponent.

Slightly asymmetric characters (rappers) provide abilities that can be used at various times throughout the round.

Continue playing rounds until one player is dealt 20 points of damage, this player is the loser.

name: One In the Middle
description:
Game for 2 players on a 3x3 board, each player has 2 pieces that are located in the corners of the board, the player moves one of his pieces on each turn, the pieces move one square in any direction.
wins the first player to get 3 pieces in a row, alternately leaving an own piece in the middle of the opponent's or vice versa.

—user summary

name: Esels-Rennen
description:
With the roll of a special die, the players decide if they play for win (green track) or place (red track). Movement is determined by a number die and the special die to specify the direction (win or place). According to the result of the special die, the donkey moves forward or backward. The first donkey to reach "Sieg" wins the game and the prize. A donkey reaching "Platz" wins half the prize and starts again.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ボムゴルフ (Bomb Golf)
description:
ボムゴルフ (Bomb Golf) is a quick flicking game from Japan. The players lay out a simple obstacle course and use markers to mark their steps as they knock the bomb around.

The game comes packed in a plastic round black bomb with a red fuse. Inside the bomb is a small bag containing six small coloured discs, one for each player, a standard die, and two small stars. The bomb is not perfectly round, it has a flat base on which it stands easily.

After removing the contents, the bomb is re-assembled. Players build a simple obstacle course on a large enough flat surface like a table, using household objects that players navigate around. One of the stars is used for the goal. The other star can be put back into the bomb to add weight and a little eccentricity (or similar can be used such as a small coin).

The six-sided die is used to count rounds. If nobody reaches the goal after six rounds, the bomb explodes, and the player closest to the goal wins.

Players take turns to hit the bomb towards the goal, avoiding the obstacles as they go. The rules say to use an open hand, or the back of your hand, or a chopping hand, to strike the bomb, instead of flicking with your fingers. In this way, the gameplay is meant to resemble golf.

After a hit, the player uses their marker disc to show where the bomb got to, and the next player retrieves the bomb to the start and does the same. Once all the players have all had one turn, the die is turned to show the second round. The starting player then puts the bomb on their marker and continues.

If the bomb should go off the table, that player doesn't advance their marker and continues next turn in the same place.

The winner is the player or players who reaches the goal in the shortest number of turns.

The graphic design was by ASOBI.dept.
user summary

name: Le grand jeu du FC Metz
description:
The winner is the first player (or team) to collect the 4 colored footballs on the board.
Each player moves on its own path on the board and answers questions to progress.

Categories:

French league
History of the FC Metz
Players and managers
Cups


Contents:

2 pawns
1 dice
200 cards (questions/answers and stages)
1 board (23 spaces)
1 ruleset
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Schacher
description:
The players buy properties in Hamburg, Flensburg, Kiel and other cities to gain income. To help them along, they may get credit at the pawn shop or declare a loss at the war damage office. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

The game was published in the 1940's.

name: Expedition
description:
One night at sea, in the galley of a run-down pirate vessel, a group of grizzled sailors huddles around a mysterious sheet of parchment: the only known map to the lost treasure of legendary pirate captain Broadsides Bullion.

Captain Bullion made the map in a near-incomprehensible cipher, but whoever can piece the clues together stands to gain his vast fortune, a truly epic hoard that sailors at any port speak of with hushed reverence. You and your mates seized the ciphered map during a recent voyage, and are convinced it is the genuine article. You have agreed to put your heads together, unlock the map’s secrets, and share the treasure... But of course, the one who finds the key first may end up keeping the entire trove...

Expedition is a printable deduction game for 2 to 6 players, in which you take the role of a pirate crew and attempt to decode a treasure map. The first player who correctly guesses the map’s true contents leads the expedition to unearth the treasure and wins the game!

-description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Dokter Li
description:
Doctor Li Wenliang tried to warn us of the danger of a new virus. Sadly, he died of COVID-19 himself before the world realized he was sounding the alarm of an impending pandemic.


In the card game Doctor Li, the corona virus is spreading at a threatening pace all over the world. Two to five players do everything they can to keep the curve of their land flat with good preparations and thus avoid a high death toll.


To do this, they collect sufficient hospital capacity, effective leadership and social distance. But beware, while there are some benefits to be gained from a creative and benevolent population, there are also numerous aggravating circumstances lurking. Hoarding behavior and a new wave are never far away, while government leaders of all kinds are looking for ways to deal with this crisis.


Each player starts with 4 category cards in his hand. The player with a date of birth closest to November 17 (when the first case of Corona was discovered) gets to start.

Goal of the game
The last round of the game is played when 1 player has completed all three categories. All other players may then play 1 more turn.

A player can discard a category when he has at least 3 unique cards of 1 specific category that the player can put down in 1 turn. This can be a category of 3 or 4 unique cards. The missing unique card in a category of 3 cannot be added later in the game.

After the last round is played, the points are counted:

1 point for each 3-card category discarded,
2 points for each category of 4 cards discarded
1 bonus point for the player who is the first to complete all three categories.


The player with the highest score wins. If there is a tie, the player who finished first wins.

How does a round go
1. The player takes the top card from the category pile or the top card from the category discard pile and takes it into his / her hand without showing the others the card.

2. The player then takes the top card from the action card pile and places it face up on the discard pile, visible to all players.

If the card has a logo in the top left corner, the player picks up the card in his / her hand and may play during this or subsequent turns.
If the card is an 'aggravating circumstance' or 'a boost', the consequences will apply immediately and only to the player who turned the card.
If the card is a "hamster" card or "a new wave", the card applies to all players and all players must react immediately so as not to be affected by the card (see chart types overview).


3. A player now has the chance to play the remaining cards from his / her hand, or to discard categories.
When the player tries to discard a category, any other player can now play a 'Trump' card that forces the active player to discard any card of the hand played and take the remaining cards back into hand. Unless the active player can supplement the category with other cards from his / her hand OR plays another 'Trump' card that destroys the previous card.

4. If there are no more players who wish to play additional 'Trump' cards and the category is still complete, then the category is now considered 'discarded' and cannot be removed for the remainder of the game unless there is an 'I don't think so' card is played. The next player can now start his / her turn.

name: Inspopoly
description:
For those that love Old Television, this game is just for you. The properties are from The Waltons, The Virginian, Matlock, The High Chaparral, Dr Quinn Medicine Woman, Little House on the Prairie, Happy Days, The Brady Bunch, Bonanza, and The Big Valley.

Probably a Monopoly clone.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Hexasperation
description:
The first player to make 4 coloured connections across a board with hexagonal tiles wins.

All the tile in play are shared between both players and once a connection is made all the tiles making up that connection are removed from play and replaced

Each tile has 3 coloured connections on the top and a feature on the underside that can help or hinder play when flipped over

There are three types of move dictated by a D20 dice. Rotate any tile one click (60 Degrees), Replace any tile with the next tile on a players stack or Turn any tile over revealing its feature or taking a feature out of play

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid, Memory, Pattern Building

name: Vaccinatie!
description:
There is a pandemic! Fortunately there is a vaccin that can help, but a few do everything they can to prevent people from getting vaccinations...
—description from the publisher (translated)

The games takes place during the Covid pandemic. One player is "Lange Frans" (a Dutch rapper and TV presenter who believes in conspiracy theories) and tries to prevent the other players from achieving group immunity. The other players are common people who try to get everyone vaccinated at least once to achieve group immunity. There is also a game master who controls the flow of the game. The players together decide who will be "Jaap van Dissel" (the Dutch equivalent of Anthony Fauci), whose vote breaks ties.

Each round of the game has three phases: the conspiracy, the surge and the vaccination. In the conspiracy phase, the common people are anesthetized (have their eyes closed) and Lange Frans secretly guesses who will get the vaccine this round.
During the surge, everyone wakes up and rolls a special die to determine how to deal with this, which may help or hinder the player. In the vaccination phase, the group discusses and votes who should be vaccinated (gets a vaccination card), keeping in mind that three vaccinations for one person constitutes an overdose. If Lange Frans guessed right, the vaccin is not given but destroyed!

In total there are 12 vaccinations available. There is also an untested Russian vaccine. If this is used on a common person, all people lose all their vaccines, but if Lange Frans is vaccinated with it, he loses the game. He also looses if he gets an overdose. Lange Frans wins when the people cannot be vaccinated in time anymore.
—user summary

Er heerst een pandemie! Gelukkig kan een vaccin uitkomst bieden, maar een enkeling doet er alles aan om te voorkomen dat mensen vaccinaties krijgen...
—description from the publisher (Dutch)

name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Essonne
description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in Essonne

From Evry-Courcouronnes to Massy, via Corbeil-Essonnes, Athis-Mons, Méréville etc ... 36 municipalities of the "91" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Weiß Schwarz: BanG Dream! Trial Deck
description:
Trial Deck+ BanG Dream!

Are you ready for a Poppin’Party?

The members of Poppin’Party debuts in the English edition of Weiss Schwarz!

—description from the publisher

name: Weiß Schwarz: KanColle Trial Deck
description:
Trial Deck Kancolle

5 types of exclusive RRR Foil cards are randomly inserted into decks!

Climax cards drawn by popular illustrators are included in this set!

10 Exclusive Trial-Deck only cards (5 types) are included in this product!


50 cards per deck
6 decks per display
8 displays per carton
Rule sheet, deck manual, playbook, and playmat included.

name: Operations Picket, Result and Grog: Force H to Genoa, 9th February 1941
description:
Operations Picket, Result and Grog is the first in an occasional series of operational campaign and scenario packs for Find, Fix and Strike.

This pack covers the Royal Navy's raid on Genoa in February 1941, including a variant campaign system for more fidelity and additional aircraft stats to cover the types in use in the campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Pays de Langres: Le jeu
description:
Pays de Langres is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography of Grand Langres & Auberive, Vingeanne and Montsaugeonnais, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Langres...
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Weiß Schwarz: Love Live! Trial Deck
description:
Weiß Schwarz is a CCG produced in collaboration with some of the most popular animation/ video game works in Japan. Players separate the "Weiß" side which features mainly pretty characters from the "Schwarz" side featuring cool characters.

Though the title consists of various kinds of card sets, a carefully planned system and rules make it possible for players to mix any of them on each side and enjoy the game.

---

This Series includes characters from Love Live!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fistful of Lead: Snowbrawl!
description:
Fistful of Lead: Snowbrawl!

It's a snowball fight mixed with dodgeball!
Have a little holiday competition with this fun little addition to Fistful of Lead.

This game can be played with any miniatures you
have and for the most part use the standard Fistful of Lead Core rules.
You can have fights between evil snowmen and elves, Vikings and trolls, anything you can think of!

The game can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players.
Four player games can by 2 versus 2 or 4 way brawls.

THIS IS NOT A STAND ALONE GAME! You will need a copy of the Fistful of Lead Core rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Salt & Iron: Rules for Naval Battles During the American Civil War
description:
You're standing lookout on the deck of the Union warship USS Cumberland anchored in Hampton Roads. The cold morning air bites through your coat. Through the fog laying over the bay you see a shape moving, you take it as nothing, seeing things from a late watch. You take a swig of coffee from your canteen to clear your head. Suddenly you see the shape move out of the fog. A great lumbering beast low in the water, black smoke billowing from its smokestack, flying the flag of the Confederacy. You sound the alarm, and watch as this beast begins to make its way towards your ship. You hear your shipmates start to bark orders, and the guns open up.
FDOOM! FDOOM! FDOOM! The cannonballs fly through the air at an incredible speed,
CLANG! CLANG! You stare in horror as the shots bounce off the shape, as if it were made of iron! Suddenly your ship lurches underneath you, throwing you to the deck. You regain your footing and see the nose of the beast buried in the hull of your ship. It reverses its engines and slowly pulls itself out opening the hole to the sea.

In Salt & Iron you can reenact famous naval battles from the American Civil War right on your tabletop!
These fast play rules are great for playing out any size battles in the matter of a couple hours.
These can be casual games amongst friends or historical scenarios to see if history can be rewritten.
What would have happened had Virginia destroyed Monitor, or if Monitor had even failed to arrive?

Every Civil War historian is very familiar with the great commanders such as David Farragut, Samuel Francis Du Pont, Franklin Buchanan, and Raphael Semmes.
With Salt & Iron, you can put yourself on the deck with them commanding some of their famous ships, along with many others.
There are many ships represented in Salt & Iron, plenty to take action in almost any scenario one can think up.

Now is the time Captain, prepare your fleet and lead daring actions against the enemy!

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Work From Home
description:
WORK FROM HOME is a fast-paced, competitive card game that is full of distractions. The purpose of the game is to make the most money by completing your assigned work tasks; however, text messages, crying babies, and many other distractions make it tough to focus. WORK FROM HOME takes only 3 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play, and is family-friendly fun for everyone.

Coming to Kickstarter March 2021.

name: Fort mit Schaden!
description:
The players start on space 1 and have to get to space 120 to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. One some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Players who can recite the matching verse about damage prevention avoid the penalty and get a reward instead.

The game was published in accordance with the "Reichsarbeitsgemeinschaft Schadensverhütung" between 1936 and 1944.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Banco Imobiliário: Rio De Janeiro
description:
The classic game Banco Imobiliário from Estrela with the sights of Rio de Janeiro!

The objective of the Game Banco Imobiliário is to become the richest player and the only one to not go bankrupt.

To start the Game, roll the dice and start the first round.
Play the dice and advance.
When you land on an free property you can buy it and start your fortune.
Each time you roll the dice, you must fulfill which indicates the board.
Watch out! You might go to prison if you fall on Go to detention and you will only leave there on bail.
When you finish building houses and hotels, you must wait for a player to go bankrupt in order to buy his properties.
To avoid bankruptcy , you can sell your properties to the Bank for half the price.

The big winner will be the only player who does not go bankrupt.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Brocken
description:
Brocken is the second of a trilogy of games from the Japanese group ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia), which centre around the Witches' Sabbath, Walpurgis Night. Brocken is the highest peak in the Harz mountains in northern Germany. In folklore, it was the gathering place for witches to celebrate their rites (Goethe writes of it in his work Faust).

In this game, three witches must travel to Brocken to join their coven. Having already prepared their flying potions in the previous game, they now fly using a chair, a broomstick and a goat to carry them. They must pass through the perilous woodlands and swamps, and avoid the spiders.

The game is for three players only. Each player has a deck of cards, each showing a rune. There is a set of three dice, also with the runes. One player throws the dice, and the players must try to match the runes thrown with their hand cards. This allows them to move across the forest, as the cards each have special actions (such as move three places, or bring other witches to you).

The first player to successful get to the peak at Brocken is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management
publishers: ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia)

name: Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht
description:
Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht is the first of a trilogy of witchcraft games from the Japanese coterie circle ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia). The game is for three players only, and has the three witches concocting their flying potions, to be used in the successive game Brocken, when they fly for Walpurgisnacht.

The original game has a trifold game board of thick card, with different sections to complete the potions. There is a large deck of cards for the ingredients (frogs, Nightshade, Wormwood and so on). There are also some coloured minerals used as markers, and the game was delivered in a cloth pouch.

The later edition is boxed and upgraded to a wooden board and a d4 die is added, along with an ingredients card.

Players use the cards from their hand to collect the ingredients and brew their potion. The first witch to succeed wins the game and takes flight to Brocken...
user summary
publishers: ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia)

name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Yvelines
description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Yvelines

From Versailles à Sartrouville, via Rambouillet, Trappes, Chambourcy etc ... 36 municipalities of the "78" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia
description:
In Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia you get to buy the most popular streets and squares in the city, then increase their value by building houses, churches and towers.

You can graduate by passing through the University, thus gaining unique powers to change the tide of the game.

The event cards are comparable to those of Monopoly and represent historical commercial activities and monuments.

The pawns are personalized: Bonarda, salami, barcè, fog and mosquitoes.

Instead of Euros, the currency is "franchises".

The primary purpose of the game is the enhancement of the city of Pavia.

This game was also created to fight gambling; in 2013 Pavia was described by the New York Times as the capital of gambling.

name: Design By Committee
description:
Design by Committee is a competitive/cooperative game of product development. Every player will work to achieve both their own, individual Requirements as well as the Requirements of the product as a whole.

Gameplay advances over the course of multiple games. You earn or lose points each game depending on the outcome of the product and your overall success in simultaneously achieving your own personal goals. The first player to earn 50 or more total points (as an ongoing score across multiple games) is the winner. There is no minimum score, players can freely go into negative numbers.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Prisoner's Dilemma, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game
description: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game is a baseball game in which the batter uses a spring-loaded flipper to toss a magnet from behind home plate and onto the metal board to determine the results of a pitch. The board has marked areas to show hits and outs while landing on a line is a strike and between marked areas is a ball. If the batter gets a hit, they can flip a switch to vibrate the board and their batter will start to run the bases. They can stop when they reach base — but when a hit occurs, the fielder uses their flipper from behind the outfield to try to throw out runners as they head for the next base.

name: Puppy Trek
description:
Players race puppies through a Pacific Northwest inspired whimsical gameboard.

In this D6 roll-to-move, players weigh tradeoffs between pausing to pick up more resource cards and pushing through, racing to reach home first. Cards allow additional movement or setting rivals back on the path, at limited opportunities. Cards and special board spaces involve the players performing simple no-stakes in-the-real-world physical (e.g., hop like a frog) and mental (e.g., answer a question or spell a word) activities.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949
description:
The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949, is a print-and-play solitaire educational board game that teaches you the history of professional football from the inception of the American Professional Football Association in 1920 through the National Football League’s 1949 gridiron season.

Your goal is to help professional football survive and thrive by spending Moxie points and attempting to activate inactive teams, stabilize unstable teams, hire and move players and other contributors to teams, lobby for new stadiums, and scout out new independent professional teams. You must also play exhibition games to help those independent professional teams earn the Bona Fide status and to earn more Moxie points.

—description from the designer

name: Hardwar: Advanced Warfare – World Introduction
description:
This is the introduction to the world of Hardwar.

Hardwar is a fast-paced tactical combat game set in plausible future of dawning 22nd century - a blend of dystopia and utopia in which nations are squeezed by the pressure of super-powerful corporations, and yet space travel beyond the borders of our solar system lies tentatively within our grasp. Many challenges of disease and poverty seem to have been overcome, yet the megawealthy continue to treat the world as a playground that bends to their whim.

In such an environment, full-blown war is rare. But small, secretive conflicts of fierce intensity are commonplace and corporations employ “security forces” with access to top-level military hardware in numbers that would put many smaller nations’ militaries to shame.

—description from the publisher

name: Raus aus'm Loch!
description:
Each player gets ten tokens (white or black) and two dice. The two players move in opposite directions. White beginns to roll the dice and the players set their tokens on spaces one to six (two tokens for each roll, first the lower number, than the higher one). If all tokens are placed in section I the tokens are moved into section II and III according to the roll of the dice. From now on only one token may be placed on a space. Only when the lower number may be used the higher number may be used too. If doubles are rolled, the upper numbers are used first, then the numbers on the bottom of the dice. The goal is to move all tokens through section IV. Spaces 19 to 24 may only be occupied by two tokens at the same time, when empty.

The first player who manages to occupy three spaces in section IV with at least two tokens each, wins half the contents of the cash box.

The first player to get all his tokens out of the game (beyond space 24) wins the game and the rest of the contents of the cash box.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jeu de l'Oie: Les Salamandres de Beauvais
description:
The Salamanders of Beauvais is a trivia-goose game that lets you discover the city of Beauvais in northern France.
As in the goose game there is chance, a maze, traps, a prison...
but also, as in Trivial Pursuit, questions, 330 that allow players to progress in the game on sport, history, cinema ...
It contains 62 boxes illustrated with old photos of the streets and monuments of Beauvais or of its outstanding personalities.

However, you can count on the help of the magic Salamander to progress in the game...
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ひつじの国のアリス (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice)
description:
ひつじの国のアリス (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice) is a game from Japan, where Alice causes trouble in the Land Of Sheep.

Alice suddenly appears in the Land Of Sheep, which is ruled by the Queen of Sheep. Alice behaves poorly! She enters somebody's house and eats their cookies without permission, and goes into another house and drinks without permission too! She ruins a tea party, disturbs the Queen's cricket match, and so on!

Finally, Alice promised to leave, but only if she was given lots of souvenirs to take home.

In the game, the players use white sheep to collect souvenirs for Alice. The game is a semi-co-operative game, with players working together to get Alice out, but also competing to provide the most popular souvenirs.

As Alice moves around, different souvenir tokens appear on the game board. Players place their sheep tiles adjacent to the tokens they want to collect. The highest value sheep will take the token, using a 'butting' mechanism, like Hols der Geier, with equal values cancelling out. Players also have black sheep, which can trump the white sheep of equal value.

The best souvenirs score the most points, but Alice is fickle and her tastes change as she progresses along the path. The souvenirs are ranked, but the order of their rank changes during the game.

When she finally reaches the gate, the game ends. Once the final score is determined, players turn up the ending cards, and discover what kind of end the Land Of Sheep has.
user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement

name: Friends: Draw It
description:
This fun game is your chance to show off your love for all things Friends The Television Series, and how well you can bring to life what is on the card before the time runs out.
Everything you need is supplied for you and your friends to play this fast-paced fun game. Includes a sand timer, 2x pencils, a pad of paper and 50x question cards. Draw and guess what's written on the cards.
Why not gather your friends and family at your next game night or party and bring out the Friends Draw It game. Supplied in a closed printed box for easy storage and also makes a great gift for fans of this iconic comedy series.

—description from the publisher

name: Fallen knight: Ghazhel mournhide
description: Weakest and smallest one of his kind. Once upon meeting cursed children, they begged Ghazhel to devour them to end their suffering. He accepted and devoured them all. Even tough Ghazhel mournhide accuired tremondous power from the curse , children are still suffering and crying on his back.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Sjónarspil 18+
description: An expansion for the base game, for players 18 and older. A deck of cards with adjectives which can be used to describe players, as in the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: ヒ秘 (Baboons)
description:
ヒ秘 (Baboons) is a memory game from Japan, with players leading their troops of baboons across the Savannah. In Japanaese ヒ秘 means 'secret'.

The Savannah is a 4*4 tableau of face-down tiles, which might be food or water, or hazards such as cobras, leopards, or rival baboons. The players start their baboon leader in a corner and move up to three spaces. After looking at a face-down tile, a player can mark it, and must remember what the marking was for.

Each player has a small board showing the size and health of their troop. The players are trying to get their troop to be the largest by the end of the game.

During the game, a player might turn up a sunset, which ends the round. The game ends on a fifth sunset.

There are also wildfires on the Savannah, and these cause tiles to be replaced. Players must contend with their own memories and changes to the tableau.

name: St. Augustine-opoly
description:
St. Augustine-opoly is a version of the game Monopoly about the city of St. Augustine

In this roll-and-move property trading game, properties are St Augustine favorite locations such as: Alligator Farm, Castillo de San Marcos, The Fountain of Youth, and of course, the St. Augustine Lighthouse...

Players pay money when they land on each other's properties, and the goal is to bankrupt your opponents.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Domesday (COIN)
description:
Domesday is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Norman Conquest of England. Players control the Norman, Saxon, Viking, and Scots/Welsh Factions and use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move leaders and pieces on the map to control areas, gain support, and win victory.

Edward the Confessor returned from exile in Normandy after decades of Viking rule in 1042 to become king of England. Magnus the Good of Norway also claimed the throne, and threatened war, but was dissuaded by the childless Edward, who promised to make him his heir. Edward gave the same promise to Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, William of Normandy, and Harold Godwinson. When he died in 1066 four powerful warlords claimed to be his rightful heir. It would not end well.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. Crown Events interrupt play as a King is crowned, Victory is determined, Revenue is collected, and Support is expanded.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Phase Order

name: Collapse!
description: Collapse! is a scenario for Next War: Korea included with C3i #27 that features streamlined air combat and an updated sequence of play on four pages and two double-sided play aids.

name: Sink or Swim
description:
"If we're going down, we're going down together! IN this game of doublethink, everyone contributes dice to the center, then competes for them. Use the same tactics as another player, however, you will sink!"

This simultaneous play has you rolling two dice and putting them into a pool in the center. Then you secretly set a die to what you think you want to pull from the center with each matching die equating to a point. The problem is you lose points for each matching die when another person also sets their die to that value. Set it to a value that isn't in the pool and neither gain or lose points. After 10 rounds, see who has the most points!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fnord Dice
description:
"'Everything in the universe relates to five, one way or another, given enough ingenuity on the part of the interpreter.'

- The Law of Fives, Principia Discordia"

This is played in rounds where rolling matching triples on 5 dice score points along with other matching numbers. Each player takes a turn within the round rolling and scoring. Whenever 50 points is reached the round is finished so everyone gets an equal turn and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Yea or Nay
description:
"You and other players are trying to fool the dealer in this game of truth and deception. A successful bluff scores you a point, but if the dealer can see through your nonsense, they get a point instead."

The dealer rolls two dice in the open. Everyone else keeps their roll secret. Using a combination of what looks to be derived from roman voting and the dealer declaring whether there is belief or not in the declaration, points are scored. After two rounds the games ends and the winner is the one that earned the most points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
publishers: Square the Circle Games, Steve Jackson Games

name: The Dr. Seuss 4-Game Treasury
description:
This big game treasury contains all you need to play four fun Dr. Seuss games based on his well-known books: Cat in the Hat Game, Green Eggs and Ham Game, Dr. Seuss's ABC Game, and One fish, two fish, red fish, go fish! Card Game.
Each captures Seuss's whimsical style, memorable characters, and unique sense of humor, while teaching important early reading concepts like letter-recognition, rhyming, and word association.

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel Heroes: Power Play! – Electronic Game Book
description:
Join Marvel Heroes as they battle a battery of bad guys bent on taking over the world!
If you're game, then Marvel Heroes Power Play Electronic Game Book is for you! Inside, you'll find five exciting board games that put you right in the middle of the action and make you a member of the Marvel Heroes team. Just pick your Super Hero play pieces and get ready to help Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four, X-men, Avengers, and the Hulk defeat their foes.

—description from the publisher

name: Skeet
description:
"Blast the most targets in this silly dexterity game and win!"

This is a dice flicking game aimed at collecting cards. Whoever claims the most cards when the draw deck runs out, wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Unreliable Flying Object
description:
"You and the other players are members of the same spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together as a team to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?"

Different parts of the ship have different durabilities. You will be rolling to prevent these durabilities from decreasing to zero, which will destroy the ship. If you can make it the number of required rounds without this happening, then you successfully got home.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Contest of Powers
description:
Role-play gods and goddesses of European pantheons in deadly skirmish for Heavens! Deduce who's your ally and who's your enemy, while bluffing your way out of intrigues. Fast and rules-friendly game, brimming with player interaction.

Your goal is to determine who is your 2 allied players and then, eliminate all other players before they get you. Alternatively, you may gather enough Power from Otherworld and sacrifice it on your Pantheon's altar.

Every round you take two actions, which will determine your position on Transcendency Oak, available power & artifacts (in form of cards) and your Stamina. You may engage in duels, battles and rituals - or simply just lick your wounds and plan your revenge.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Bribery, Deduction, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Participation Award
description:
"You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you're all a bit lazy and really don't feel like working too hard."

Interesting game in that if the team does well, the players that did the most work earn the least points, but if the team did poorly, then those that pulled more than their weight do get the most points.

The game plays in rounds until the target score is reached; this is calculated based on the number of players. Each player gets 4 dice per player contributing one to the monster pool in the center. Roll the monster dice and that is what you the total you need to beat the monster. Roll your 3 remaining dice and secretly choose some number of those to defeat the monster.

Then you will score based on success or failure relative to where you fall your the contribution. Once one player gets to the target the game ends with the highest score the winner.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Liquid Courage
description:
"You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!"

This game is played in rounds and you want to gain 6s per round to score points, but you need to be able to get those and 1s to keep rolling. Keep pushing your luck trying not to bust to improve your score.

When someone breaks 50 points or higher at the end of a round the game ends and the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Une saison au zoo: Le jeu du soigneur
description:
Find the animals from your favorite show A Season at the Zoo!
Test your knowledge of Zoo de la Flèche animals and the profession of healer with 1,140 questions.

Draw a map and complete both missions to go from trainee to healer. To do this, join the 2 missions that are assigned to you by answering the various questions accessible to the youngest about the animals of the zoo and about the profession of caretaker.

To have even more fun, several cards are illustrated! It's up to you to guess which animal has been blurred, who owns the coats and fingerprints, or find the solution to the rebus!

name: Battle of the Bismarck Sea
description: Battle of the Bismarck Sea is a Pacific Air campaign included with C3i #16 for the Down in Flames game series, specifically the titles Zero! and Corsairs and Hellcats.

name: A Tchi?
description:
Cooperate or compete with friends in this original card game based on Acadian tradition. See who can best remember their family tree while discovering a unique collection of Acadian names!
The first player draws a card from the stack and flips it over. They state their own name, followed by á (as in catch) and the card name. After this, the next player does the same, starting their own stack.
The challenge is to remember the family tree while only seeing the topmost card.
If a player forgets their family tree, they are out. The last player to remember their ancestors wins!

name: Howzzat
description: Rain or shine choose to play your favorite game of cricket inside the comfort of your very own home Choose your team members, become a captain and lead your team into play Make wise strategic decisions that will change the course of the game every minute and keep your opponent on the defense-always Are you ready for the most important match of your life Play " the game of cricket "

name: Purple Meeple Eater
description:
"You and the other players are all giant, radioactive monsters, smashing your way through the city, munching on local residents. Which of you is going to be the biggest, baddest monster of them all?"

Roll and score each round. You score high or low dice based on whether you get rolled a 1 or not. If your dice are all 1s, you bust scoring 0 for this turn.

You then decide whether to stop and score OR continue and roll the remaining dice. Play rounds like this until someone gets 50 or more points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: The American Experiment
description:
The Thirteen Colonies have gone from a restless bunch to a group of independent entities. Throughout the process, a number of documents and other writings have played an integral role in motivating the citizenry and justifying the need for Independence. As a publisher, your goal is collect and publish more parts of these documents than your competitors. Publish a significant portion of a document or series of writings and you will attract Advocates that will boost your score. But beware, there is a heavy price for beginning a collection and under-delivering. Or, will you take the ultimate risk and publish only Loyalist writings?

The object of the game is to gain points by playing cards to different collections of writings. A card played to a collection represents one part of a published writing. But, there is a catch - once you begin publishing to a collection your score in that collection starts negative. You must continue publishing to that collection to achieve a positive score in it. Once to have played three cards to a collection you may also play Advocates to the collection which can double, triple, or quadruple your score.

On a player's turn, a card is played either to a collection or to an appropriate discard pile. Then a card is drawn to replace the played card, either from the deck or from the top of one of the discard piles. Cards played to one of the player's collections must be in ascending order, but not necessarily consecutive. Play continues until the draw pile is exhausted at which point the players scores are tallied.

If a player decides to publish the Loyalist writings, they may only play to the Loyalist collection and no other collections, their initial score is doubly negative, and all cards in the Loyalist suit are double valued. It is a high risk, high reward option.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection

name: Knights of the Round Table
description:
After many years of campaigning, the Knights of the Round Table have returned home. Their greatest desire is to enjoy a round of their favorite game. To their dismay, while they were away marauders destroyed all their copies of the game and it is no longer in print. Out of sheer desperation, the Knights resort to re-implementing the game in their own style as an honor and tribute to the original.

Knights of the Round Table is inspired by King’s Court, the out-of-print cult classic card game issued in 1983 by Janjohn Games, Inc.

This game is a wild re-imagining of UNO with more complex draw cards, wild cards, and other special cards. Some draw cards chain together; others allow you to skip or change the direction to affect different players. Defensive cards allow you to protect yourself or even deflect an action back on the instigator. The goal of each round is to play all of your cards first while the goal of the overall game is to have the lowest score when any one player exceeds 500 points.

-description from designer

name: Unity: Solo Challenge 1 for Renegade Scout 2nd edition
description:
On the quiet mining world of Keshen III, miners and colonial militia have begun defecting and opening fire on loyal security forces. Meanwhile, unidentified military ships are descending from orbit.

Welcome to the first Solo Challenge for the Renegade Scout miniatures rules.

This offers an infantry assault scenario that can be played on your own or with a friend cooperating to "solve" the scenario. You can use any force you like, with the aim being to beat the scenario using the smallest possible points value.


You need 14 infantry figures for the enemy forces. Your own force can be as large or small as you like with 200-250 points (using the Army Builder) being a good starting point.
Mechanics for solo play are included.
3 difficulty toggles are provided to bolster the enemy forces.


The scenario is well suited to help learning the rules, experimenting with different forces and exercising your army building muscles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Celebes: The Anomalous Island
description:
You are sent to an adventurous journey to the heart of Celebes, an anomalous island of Indonesia. Wonders are everywhere. Birds, butterflies, mammals, and insects are dazzling with beauty. And you have the best mission in the world: to collect and study them all! This will definitely be your lifetime expedition.

Celebes offers games that can be enjoyed by families, which can be played by 2-4 players. The main mechanics of the game are Point to Point Movement and Set Collection. Each player will be provided with a set of logistics cards, botanical tokens and cash. The player's task is to move from one point to another to get data on flora & fauna endemic there. Each turn the players will play one logistic card, later the value printed on the card will be additional travel capital for this turn. If they want to retrieve data, they have to pay a certain amount of money to be able to put the botanist on the game board following the existing path. Players will get a flora / fauna card if they succeed in placing their botanists in a new area.
