At the beginning of the round there will be one event card that is opened, this card can change the playing conditions and change the player's tactics. The game ends when the last event card has been executed. Players will get points for having a certain set of cards. However, a new set is counted when the total is more than three cards of the same suit. If there are only one or two cards in a set, the value does not count or is considered forfeited. The player with the most Victory Points wins!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: High Society
description:
The idea of the game is to get into the Blue Book or Social Register of "High Society" in the middle of the board. Naturally, more than just money is required for admission. Players must also possess their own estate, a piece of property, four status symbols, 200 liquid asset points (money), and a formal invitation. This game is about acquiring all those items and being the first to make it into the Blue Book.

High Society is designed primarily for four players, although rules for five to eight players are also included. Players move their pawns around the track by means of dice rolls or to specific spaces specified by "strategy cards". Players acquire an estate or property by being the first to land on it. After acquiring an estate or property, they may be able to charge a trespassing fee to players who land on it. Players also acquire Status Symbols and points (money) by landing on any of the eight Status Symbols spaces.

Players gain or lose points and Strategy Cards or Status Cards as they land on spaces around the track. Any player who cannot pay their debts is eliminated. Once a player has all the requirements for admission to the Blue Book, they proceed to one of four Country Club Lane paths to the center of the board. Once a player is in one of the Country Club Lane paths, they roll the dice to advance. At the last space before the Blue Book, the player rolls one die and specific rolls determine whether they lose a turn, return to their estate, or win the game. A player in Country Club Lane may also be "Blackballed" by another player in which case they return to their estate space on the board.

name: Gruff: Twist Gaming Promo Pack
description:
The pack contains:
2 alternate art card of Gruffs: Gaptooth and Zumberg
1 promo Gruff: Mulch
2 promo Sheperds: Kringle and Krampus

Pack was one of the rewards during the Twist Gaming 2019 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Royale
description:
2-6 players compete for draconic dominance over the locals and each other. Pillage villages & castles for loot, defend your domain from opposing dragons, and hoard wealth & cards to achieve victory!

12 unique dragons each with special mechanics and base stats - Select your favorite, draft from a few, or fully randomize!

Your abilities and stats may guide your strategy but victory is never certain: React on-the-fly as the die can help or hinder at any moment.

As you conquer villages and castles your hoard will fill up. Build a juggernaut loaded with stats and passives, become a true spellslinger with a flurry of cards, or carefully construct the perfect endgame combo!

name: Hippopoly
description:
Hippopoly the first board game of Hippo Basket Salerno.

Try to score points, the winner is the first player to reach 50 Victory points.
Victory Points are earned by winning matches.
Games are won by collecting Strengths.
Strengths are obtained with training.
Each space color indicates a different action to take (pick a card, score strength point, score victory points etc...)

name: Izzat So
description:
Izzat So is subtitled on the box top as "A Family Fun Game of Witty Proverbs and Old Saws."
The object of the game is to make complete proverbial sayings from a collection of phrases which appear on small rectangular tiles. The tiles are in several colors and some include a point value. The proverbs that can be formed are listed on a scoresheet as a reference.
Each player in turn rolls two dice, draws that number of tiles from the face-down "boneyard" and attempts to form said proverbs. There are also rules for swapping and stealing tiles from other players and from the discarded tiles from previous turns.
The game continues until all 60 proverbs in the list have been formed. Scores are then tallied to determine the winner.

name: רקוז (Rikuz): Concern
description: Rikuz: Concern is a Monopoly-style game with Israeli landmarks in Hebrew and English that was originally released in the 1950s by Israeli publisher Bar Levy when Monopoly was not available in that country.
mechanics: Income, Investment, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Scrutiny: It's All About Me!
description:
How well do you know your friends and family, and how well do they know you? Find out in this hilarious all-play board game that will have you laughing out loud with every game that you play!

Scrutiny: It's All About Me! sees players taking turns to be put in a scenario where there are three possible outcomes. The player in the spotlight has to choose which of the three outcomes best relates to them. All other players have to guess the outcome they chose. Every turn sees a new challenge, and with six thousand possible scenario outcomes, it's a different game every time you play it!

—description from the publisher

name: Mako Naval
description:
Mako Naval is a game around the naval battle theme. Each player must cross the ocean with his ship and reach the other side before the others ships, while sinking and delaying the others ships thanks to mines.

On his turn, the player moves his boat forward one space in the direction of his choice and then rolls the die. The die indicates how far he can land a mine in any direction he chooses.

If the mine hits another boat, it returns to the starting point. If not, the mine stays and block the boat from others colors.
A boat can pass over a square with a mine of its own color and recover it.

The first boat to arrive on the other side of the board, facing its starting point, wins.

name: Les fous du volant
description:
This game is taking place in the universe of the "Wacky Races" cartoon. The goal is to drive first one of your car in the right colored space at the opposite of the board. It's a game without any chance, only strategy.

When a car has to move, the player choose one of the three spaces in front of him. It can't go back or on a side space. All cars, from the beginning to the end of the games should be on spaces that touch either at an angle or on a side another car.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: The Unbelievable Truth Game
description:
Based on the hit BBC Radio 4 panel game, the Unbelievable Truth Game is a game in which the truth is stranger than fiction. If you can tell fibs without batting an eyelid or you can embroider the truth like a pro, then this is the game for you.

Players take turns trying to smuggle unbelievable truths past their opponents in a series of quick fire and lecture rounds. If you can spot when a "truth" is fact or fiction, ring the bell to win a point.

name: Treasure Cats
description:
In Treasure Cats you play as an anthropomorphic cat trying to find treasure. Each round you will choose to go to the one of two Locations. The Junkyard or the Farmstead,to find Items. Each Item has a Value. At the end of each round, players reveal their Treasure Cards and see which Location yielded the highest Items value. All players who chose that Location get a Victory Point.

Objective:The first player to score 5 Victory Points wins if no other player has 5 or more Victory Points. 6 Victory Points wins if no other player has 6 or more Victory Points.7 Victory Points everyone with 7 shares the win.

Setup:Pick a starting player. At the beginning of each round, the starting player shuffles the cards and deals 2 cards face-down to each player. Then they deal 2 of the remaining cards face up in the center of the play area. Each round has 3 phases.

Phase 1: Choose Treasure Cards.
Opening with the Start Player and moving clockwise, each player will choose a card in their hand as a Treasure Card. They will place this card face up in front of them. Using the other card, hide either the top or bottom half of the shown Treasure Card so that only the Item or Location is visible. *This is very important!

Phase 2: Trigger Active Abilities
Beginning with the Start Player and continuing clockwise, each player displaying an Item with an Active (A) ability may use it.
For example, if a player is showing the Compass, they would choose another player with a revealed Item. The targeted player would have to discard their revealed Item card if they correctly guessed the targeted players location.
Note: A player can only be targeted by the Compass, Abacus, Whistle and Dog Mask once per round.

Phase 3: Award Victory Points
All players now reveal their chosen Treasure Cards unless their Treasure Card was discarded in Phase 2. Each player with a Treasure Card showing a Passive (P) ability may now use that ability.
Add up the value for each Item at each Location. The Location with the highest value of Items wins the round.
Each player with a revealed Treasure Card with the winning Location receives 1 Victory Point. If there is no winning Location, then all players with a revealed Treasure Card earn 1 Victory Point. If a player had to discard their Treasure Card, then they cannot receive Victory Points.
After Phase 3 is complete, check to see if any player has achieved the winning objective. If not, then pass the Start Player token clockwise and start a new round.

-description from publisher

name: Beint í mark
description:
A football (soccer) trivia game for the whole family, with almost 3,000 questions included. The questions are divided into four categories, but the fifth category is the penalty box, where players can get into various kinds of trouble - or score straight into the goal! Three levels of difficulty, so players of all ages and experience can compete on level ground. Be the first to complete all the questions and get to the finish line!

—user summary

name: The Shape Chomper Game
description:
One of Mattel's All-Together games, with no loose pieces. From the instructions:
"Be the first player to collect one of each of the four shapes before the SHAPE CHOMPER can gobble any of them up!"

name: Tiki-Taka: a card game
description:
In Tiki-Taka: a card game, two players take on the role of opposing football managers, using player and action cards to dominate the pitch and outscore their opponent. By carefully devising a strategy around their goalie, captain, tactical style, and players, a savvy manager can outwit and overwhelm the opposition. But every great manager must also monitor the flow of the match. Play too cautiously and you risk ceding goals before your team is at full strength; play too aggressively and you risk losing momentum just as the match reaches its climax.

Over four rounds of intense competition, players will go head-to-head, seeking to score more points than their opponent in each third of the pitch. Win a majority of these zones and you score a goal; win a majority and shut out the opposition completely, and you score two goals! The player with more goals at the end of the regulation 90' match (four rounds) is the winner.

Players win zones via points obtained by player cards and action cards. Player cards are drawn and drafted at match start and halftime, and are placed on the field for the duration of the match. Building a team with similar nationalities and complementary strengths is the foundation to success. Action cards are drawn and drafted at the start of every round and can be played only once for their points or other effects. But crucially, these cards may also be saved between rounds, forcing smart managers to carefully conserve their strength.

Just as in real football, the very best managers must blend the strengths and weaknesses of their squad, the tactical styles of both teams, and a keen sense of momentum to exploit the opposition and lead their side to victory. Are you up to the task?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Instant Iceland
description:
A trivia card game with questions related to Iceland in three categories; history, land and nature, people and culture. Players can choose two ways to play, ie. On The Road where they discard cards or Go Fish to collect cards, both times when players answer correctly.

—user summary

name: Frægð og frami
description:
Frægð og frami (Fame and Glory) is a party game where players take on the role of an influencer who competes with his opponents to be the first one to gain 20 thousand followers. Each round player roll a die to move their pawn around the board and act as the spaces indicate, if needed. This gives the players the chance to add fame and glory cards to their hands, defend from attacks, add or lose followers and so on. When all players have rolled the Spotlight starts which is the task the influencers have to deal with. What does one not do to gain fame and glory?

—user summary

name: Orða
description:
Players describe the key word without using the five forbidden words on the card, in one minute. Those who guess correctly get the card (a medal) while the president (current player) gets as many cards (medals) from the back of the box. After everyone has been president the one with most medals wins the game.

—user summary

name: Incredible Voyages: Undersea Combat in the Victorian Age
description:
Enter the world of Incredible Voyages, Long Face Games’s fast play set of Victorian science fiction submarine rules. Where the undersea navies of the world’s Great Powers fight amongst themselves – and with anarchists, criminal gangs and evil arch-scientists for supremacy in a secret undersea war.

The rules are based on David Manley’s popular and successful “Stingray” game adapted and greatly expanded to cover the Victorian era.
The rules use a hex movement system, but “free movement” rules are also included for those that don’t like hexes.

Use whatever models you want, go wild with your scratchbuilding, or download free 3D printing files online.

—description from the publisher

name: Pigskin Pantheon
description:
Hello and welcome, owners, to the genesis of a new league. An exciting and surprising evolution of football awaits. You will all take part in the making of great sports franchises over many seasons. Compete with other owners by drafting, trading, equipping, and improving your team. Who will rise to the top of the pantheon? Only time will tell!

Pigskin Pantheon is a 1-4 player football management card game. Sign players ranging from chicken men, werewolves, sentient shovels, and even a dog on a skateboard. Combine players with gear and accolades to dominate on game day. If you're into it, sabotage opposing teams with scandals, gruesome injuries, and poaching rival players!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Humor, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Market, Matching, Memory, Move Through Deck, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Passed Action Token, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Food Truck Champion: Crabs! Promos
description:
Five new promo cards for Food Truck Champion originally included with the Crabs! Kickstarter Edition.

These crab themed cards are shuffled with the 95 game cards from the base game to augment that deck. The cards play by the same rules as those from the base game, providing some new combinations of roles, recipes, and ingredients.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Follow, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Memory Kings: Extra Seasons Expansion Pack
description:
Featuring 4 entirely new sets of cards, this expansion adds the Harvest, Fishing, Hunting, and Plague Seasons to your game, allowing an even larger play grid, or different colors selection.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Grid Movement, Matching, Memory, Movement Template

name: Maxim Gorki: The Siege of Sevastopol 1942
description:
This is Critical Hit's module in ASL-compatible format for the battles in the area of the Maxim Gorki defence works at Sevastopol in 1942. The defences consisted of two 300mm twin gun turrets, together with supporting defences and an observation post all set on high ground with excellent fields of fire, and were intended to be a tough nut to crack. This is what the Germans had to attack in 1942 in order to capture Sevastopol and ultimately the whole of Crimea.

As a module, it is not a complete game in itself but requires ownership of the Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) rulebook and Beyond Valor module as a minimum. However, it is a very distinctive module with rules for previously-omitted areas such as fighting in the underground bunker complexes and with a map that makes you understand the size of the challenge to take on a well-prepared defence - these go beyond what is normally seen in ASL.

There are 12 scenarios ranging from small engagements to larger battles which will enable players to experience the struggle whilst attempting to capture (or defend) a significant fortification.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Bliss
description:
A worker placement and engine building-game about living a good life, with fully customizable personalities (more than 100,000 possible combinations).

This card-based worker placement game starts with you creating your own unique personality. Your personality consists of:

Nature: A long-term ability you have for the entire game
Nurture: A change to your character's starting stats
Habit: A special ability you can use once per round
Goals: A list of tasks that give you victory points each round if you achieve them


Each of these cards is double-sided, so after being dealt four of them randomly, you choose which sides of each card to use in order to mix and match them to create your own unique personality. For example, with one set of four cards you could be:

An ignorant wealthy narcissist who has a habit of taking mental health days
A wise, but heavily in debt, narcoleptic who enjoys working with close friends
Or any combination of the above


Once the game begins, players simultaneously choose actions using time as a resource, carefully selecting which opportunities will benefit them the most. Using these opportunities, players will influence their wealth, future opportunities, or emotional state, to build an engine that will result in the most Bliss by the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Astrocracy
description:
Astrocracy is a socio-political sci-fi game for 3-6 players. It is a competitive, deck building, worker placement, resource management game, where players act as the leader of a galactic nation, seeking to guide humanity in a common direction. Players draft from Ideological Stances that represent the culture of their nation. The combination of Stances selected determines a player’s starting Draw deck. Once the game begins, players will assign their Population to work their planets, yielding the planet’s resources. Players will then Draw their cards and take their actions, such as constructing androids, trading with other players, patronizing Great People, discovering Technologies, Surveying new worlds. Other phases include feeding your people, voting on galactic policies, tracking the happiness of your people, and much more.

—Rick Wolford, game's designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Civilization, Space Exploration

name: Metsutake
description:
滅茸 (Metsutake) is a bluffing card game from Japan about growing mushrooms.

Players try to grow and eat the best mushroom, but people risk falling ill if they eat the wrong kind of mushrooms. The players are encouraged to eat wild mushrooms over those grown in farms. If they happen to feed poisonous mushrooms to other players, well accidents happen.
user summary

name: Pot Smugglin' Blues
description:
POT SMUGGLIN' BLUES consists of a board map of the Caribbean, a spinner that drives the game, four HOT WHEELS that locate weather conditions and police hot spots, and four sets of CARDS that determine weather conditions, mechanical difficulties and other fortunes & (Mis)Fortunes. Your goal is to sail your load of marijuana to a North American port and payola.

Except when you are safely in a North American port, every move begins by spinning the spinner. Each number on the spinner also contains 6 colors.

When a player spins, the number and color landed on not only select the load amount offered and country of origin, they also rotate one of the Hot Wheels. The number spun tells you how far to move your sailboat or determines when you've encountered Mechanical Difficulties or a (Mis)Fortune. The compass direction you've spun sets the wind direction.

>- Decide who goes first and have each player select a colored boat stand.
>- Everyone's first spin determines their load's quantity, quality, and country origin. The number spun is the number of thousands of pounds you are smuggling (2 on the spinner means 2,000 pounds). When you decide to take a load, borrow your stake, and place the appropriate sail, depicting the country of origin and the quantity of pot, onto your boat.

You will face challenges with rough weather, mechanical difficulties, avoiding the US Coast Guard, getting through US Customs, and the Bermuda Triangle.

The Pot Smugglin' Blues board game is drawn from true-life experiences of a bygone era. Will Berger’s true-life experiences. Practically everything that can happen playing the game actually did happen to Will Berger while sailing the Caribbean back in the 1980's. In those precartel, pre-terrorist days, smuggling marijuana was considered romantic adventure, not to mention a fantastic way to create great stacks of fast cash, and in the process encounter informers and snitches, get busted, lose all your money and go to jail with the blues. All of which conspires to make the Pot Smugglin' Blues game suspenseful, emotion-filled escapism.

So what are you waiting for? Load your sailboat with the good herb, plot your course north for a safe passage, hoist sails and find your wind, get out the star charts and see the Southern Cross for the first time, deliver the weed to the promised land and reap millions of dollars for your success. Do it now-- when they legalize pot, the thrill will be gone. Smooth sailing!

name: Zombie Circus Goats
description:
Zombie Circus Goats is a 2-4 player game. In it players start with three cards and then, in turn order, draw a single card. Players may play talent cards and then roll dice to collect gold, brains, blood or guts cards based on their talent and roll.

The game includes a trading mechanism where players can trade talent cards with one another. The winner is the first player to amass 5 zombie circus goat cards.

—user summary

Zombie Circus Goats is the strategic new card game about everyone's favorite things: Zombies, Goblins, Goats, and Shouting.

Build your troupe. Steal your friends' Goats. Howl in victory!

WARNING: Contains Hellephants, Two-Headed Boys, Robotic Bees, Weregartners, Ma'ampires, Rabbits w/ lightsabers, Meerkats, Tiny Sasquatch, Arrogant Octopuses...and a whole bunch of Zombies.

Get Paid in Body Parts.

Shout in Bad Accents.

Cast Weird Spells at Your Friends.

Make Felicia Fetch You a Drink.

For 2-6 live players. 30-90 minutes adjustable playtime. Host nights of howling infamy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Zombie Circus Goats: +2 Players Expansion Pack
description:
+2 Players Expansion Pack is a family-safe expansion for Zombie Circus Goats to support up to 6 players.

It includes:
7 more ornery Goats.
7 Rabbits doing things from movies.
7 Goblins frowning at things.
7 Meerkats in dangerous situations.
22 more Filthy Lucre cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Zombie Circus Goats: NSFW 1 – The Offendening Expansion Pack
description:
NSFW 1: The Offendening Expansion Pack expands Zombie Circus Goats with 13 new NSFW cards.

Horrify your friends. 13 NSFW cards to make you argue, shout, and snort wine out your nose.

This expansion is included in:

Zombie Circus Goats 3000: The Everything Box
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Race, Take That, Trading

name: Zombie Circus Goats: NSFW 2 – Fine, I'm Leaving Expansion Pack
description:
NSFW 2: Fine, I'm Leaving Expansion Pack expands Zombie Circus Goats with 13 new NSFW cards.

Offend your father-in-law. 13 more cards to make you tear out your hair and light things on fire.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Zombie Circus Goats: RWC 1 – Real World Consequences Expansion Pack
description: RWC 1: Real World Consequences Expansion Pack expands Zombie Circus Goats with 13 new, family-safe cards. Make your friends sing, cry, and Dance Monkey Dance.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Zombie Circus Goats: Warning – There are Goblins Expansion Pack
description: Warning: There are Goblins Expansion Pack expands Zombie Circus Goats with 13 new, family-safe Goblins. Make your friends sing, cry, and Dance Monkey Dance.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Zombie Circus Goats: Zombies Invade the Moon Expansion Pack
description:
Zombies Invade the Moon Expansion Pack expands Zombie Circus Goats with 13 new, family-safe characters.

Family safe. 13 ZCG characters with space helmets, aliens, and laser beams!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Zombie Circus Goats: The Family Box
description:
Zombie Circus Goats is a 2-4 player game. In it players start with three cards and then, in turn order, draw a single card. Players may play talent cards and then roll dice to collect gold, brains, blood or guts cards based on their talent and roll.

The game includes a trading mechanism where players can trade talent cards with one another. The winner is the first player to amass 5 zombie circus goat cards.

ZCG: The Family Box is a compilation which includes everything in the base game and the following items:

+ 2 Players Pack

RCW 1: Real World Consequences
Warning: There are Goblins
Zombies Invade the Moon
The Zombie Pizza! Token

name: All Sheeps and Sizes
description:
You are an award-winning shepherd getting ready to win the annual Wool and Fleece competition. And this year, you are hunting for the best and shiniest sheep - but so are your fellow competitors. Be prepared to use all sheeps and sizes to claim victory.

All Sheeps and Sizes is a strategic card game about sheep. You want to get high scoring sheep into your sheep pen to give you points. The game ends when all the cards in the deck run out. If you have the most points at the end of the game, you win!

Your sheep pen is like your hand because it is where you keep and play all your cards from. But all the cards in your sheep pen are placed face down and you can't look at them so you will have to remember which card is which so that you can play the right cards.

Some of the cards in the game give you points. But the Wolf card reduces your points, so you want to make sure you don't have the wolf at the end of the game. The other cards have special effects to be used during the game, like viewing, swapping, stealing and destroying other cards. Use your cards effectively to win!

—description from the designer

name: The Grand Opening
description:
You’ve worked towards this moment for so long. You’ve spent countless hours on the menu, perfected the decor and spread the word far and wide… now it’s time to fling the doors open and welcome the first customers to your new cafe. But can you get the right food to the right customers at the right time? Or will unserved dishes pile up while fussy customers get increasingly hangry?

Play is simultaneous. On each round, one player rolls both dice. All players choose how to use the dice rolls on their own scoresheet. Each round represents a different time slot in the restaurant. There are three actions you may take on any turn:
1) Seat Customers, 2) Make Food, 3) Serve Food.

If you seat a '6' customer, you need to try to serve them a '6' meal, but you'll need a '6' waiter to serve the dish. Lower numbered customers give you fewer points but are easier to keep happy.

Serve breakfast food to breakfast customers before the brunch sitting starts. Score negative points for unfed customers and wasted food. Score double points for feeding special guests.

The player who has the highest score at the end of the game wins.

You just need 2 dice and a pen. To play, you write directly onto the placemat.

Any number of players can play the game. The Grand Opening is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the designer

name: Archimedes
description:
2 player game:
Each turn the players put 1 token on the game board. When the players have placed 4 tokens each the moving phase begins. The players move in turns 1 of their tokens 1 space along the drawn lines. The first player to complete 1 of 36 possible winning figures wins the game.

4 player game:
The players play in teams with 2 tokens each. Communication limits may be agreed on.

3 player game:
Each player has 3 tokens and there are winning figures for 3 tokens.
Solo game:
There are 16 tokens marked with a letter and some problems to solve with as few moves as possible.

This game was probably published about 1920.

—user summary
mechanics: Communication Limits, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Verbagame Babilonia
description:
Verbagame is a fun game of changing words for 2-8 players. You can also play in different languages and their kindreds.

Played in two or more languages simultaneously.
(ITALIAN; ENGLISH; FRENCH; SPANISH; PORTOGUESE; DEUTCH)

Create a different word every turn at the centre of the table, using the most cards possible to be the first player to run out of cards.

name: Gloria-Viktoria
description:
Each player places 16 tokens in his starting zone and holds 2 reserve tokens to place later in the game. Each token represents a special unit (e. g. tanks or planes) with it's movement and capture options printed on top.

The goal of the game ist to eliminate all opponent units or to enclose the units of the opponent till they aren't able to move.

The game was published in a paper envelope.

—user summary

name: Charley Horse Derby
description:
Charley Horse Derby is a strategic horse-racing game.

Players choose their jockey card and are dealt two strategy cards. The players race around the around the track for 1 1/4 mile. You can play strategy cards on your turn. You can also pick up cards off the track by landing on a "charley" which are played right away. Use the tools the track gives you to send other opponents back or propel yourself forward.

Ride the rails on the bends for a shorter race or take the longer outside tracks to grab cards to jeopardize your opponent.

During the race players will encounter bears, deer, goats, snakes, and murder hornets while dealing with collusion, elbowing, impeding and broken legs. Then there's those nasty "trade places" which you have to use before someone crosses the finish line.

You collect cards by rolling doubles or by landing on an opponent and some cards allow you to steal a card from a player. If you can steal an opponent's jockey card, they can't cross the finish line without one. Crossing first doesn't guarantee a win since all players get to finish their turn. Horses unfortunately die on the track so we added one death card. You have be careful using it because if the opponent neighs it, you're dead. Neigh cards are used to block actions of an opponent or have them miss a turn or to save your own hide.

The cards coupled with the track makes for a hilarious game where the horses are all over the place. You won't know who wins until the last player goes.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Racing, Sports

name: El juego de Vitoria-Gasteiz
description:
El juego de Vitoria-Gasteiz, a Monopoly-like game that invites you to walk the streets of the capital of Alava, buy and invest in some of its 57 local businesses.

In this game, the winner is the first player who acquires seven venues.

name: Practice Board Game
description:
The board is a track from Square 1 to Square 63. First to reach the last square wins. Movement is governed by a die roll. Throwing a 6 entitles you to another throw. When you land on the special squares you must follow the instructions. Most of these tell you to play a certain tune on your recorder. If played correctly you get another throw. To win you must throw the exact number to land first on the final square.

—user summary

name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Druuf
description:
Klappentext:
Thema des ersten Ergänzungsbandes ist die Raumflotte der Druuf. Ein von Insekten abstammendes Intelligenzvolk, unterwarfen sie ihr eigenes Universum, bis sie durch ein Naturereignis in die Lage versetzt wurden, in die heimatliche Milchstraße einzudringen. An der Überlappungszone beider Universen kommt es zu den größten Raumschlachten seit dem Methankrieg. Eine Gefahr für die Galaxis: Zehntausende von Raumschiffen; ausgestattet mit modernster Technik - dem Lineartriebwerk - warten auf ihren Einsatz.
Auch dieser Band bietet wieder alles über Stärke und Zusammensetzung, Logistik und Organisation, Technik und Personal.

This expansion adds the faction "Druuf" to the game. This includes new units and background informations.

name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Arkon's Robotflotte
description:
Klappentext:
Groß war der Schock im Jahre 1984, als die Ganymed mit Thora und Crest an Bord nach Hause ins Arkonsystem vorstieß. Die degenerierten Arkonidenherrscher waren abgesetzt und der Robotregent von Arkon war an ihre Stelle getreten. Vor tausenden von Jahren gebaut und programmiert, setzt er nun alles daran, an die große Zeit der Alt-Arkoniden anzuknüpfen. Die Raumflotte - lange vernachlässigt - wird wieder auf den neusten Stand gebracht und die Rüstungsindustrie wird wieder zum wichtigsten Industriezweig.
Neben den üblichen Hintergrundinformationen werden in diesem Ergänzungsband mehrere Hilfsvölker der Arkoniden vorgestellt (Zaliter, Ekhoniden und Zekloner).

This expansion including new units and background information for Arkons Robotflotte.

name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Terraner II
description:
Klappentext:
Mehr als 50 Jahre lang hatte Terra Zeit seine Raumflotte aufzubauen, immer mit der Angst im Rücken, daß eines Tages der Robotregent Terra entdeckt und in sein Imperium einverleiben will. Noch ist die Zahl der terranischen Großraumer sehr gering, aber die Anzahl an Kleinstraumern (Jäger und Zerstörer) und das bekanntermaßen exzellente Personal der terranischen Raumflotte können das zum Teil ausgleichen.
Dieser Ergänzungsband zeigt den Aufbau der terranischen Flotte von einigen zusammengeklauten Schiffen hin zu einer modernen und schlagkräftigen Flotte; abgerundet wird das Bild von den Werften auf dem Mond und den Verteidigungsanlagen auf den anderern Planeten des Sonnensystems.

This expansion adds new units and background to the terran faction.

name: Popcorn Poppin'
description:
Don't be left holding the Popcorn when it Pops! Popcorn Poppin' is a fast and fun game where players must pass the popcorn bucket before the popcorn pops. While the time counts down, players follow the instructions from the die and pass the popcorn as quickly as they can before the popcorn pops!
-Manufacturer's description

In "Popcorn Poppin'", not to be confused with "Poppin' Popocorn", one player fills the plastic popcorn bucket with plastic popcorn pieces, start the time by pulling the cord on the back, and then press down the cardboard-and-plastic "die", which when released pops up and will roll onto a face showing what the player must do to pass the bucket of popcorn. Players keep doing this until the timer ends and the popcorn pieces are launched out from the bucket, making the player holding the bucket when this happens out for the round. It plays much like a game of Hot Potato with a jack-in-the-box from hell. The game continues until only one player is left. The last player left is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time

name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: An der Überlappungsfront
description:
Klapptentext:
Die Auseinandersetzung zwischen den Druuf un den arkonidischen Robotraumern bilden den Hintergrund des ersten Szenariobandes. Hier werden die Gefechte und Auseinandersetzungen, die 17 Monate lang an der Überlappungszone zwischen den beiden Universenandauerten, aufgearbeitet. Neben einer Reihe von Szenarien wird in diesem Band auch auf den Verlauf der Kämpfe und die Verluste auf beiden Seiten eingegangen.

This expansion adds new scenarios to the game.

name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Maahks I
description:
Klappentext:
Dieser Hintergrundband zur Perry Rhodan Serie stellt ausführlich die Raumflotte der Maahks zu Beginn des Methankrieges vor. Das Aufeinandertreffen zwischen den Arkoniden und den Methanatmern führte zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen, die mehr als 300 Jahre dauern sollten. Auf Grund ihrer enormen Vermehrungsrate waren die Maahks in der Lage, ihre Verluste schnell auszugleichen - ganz im Gegensatz zu den Arkoniden, deren exzellente Besatzungen allmählich dezimiert wurden. Doch trotz ihrer zahlenmäßigen Überlegenheit mußten schließlich die Maahks das Schlachtfeld räumen. Ihre wenigen Überlebenden konnten sich durch den Sonnentransmitter retten und wurden von den Meister der Insel (Mdi) in der Zwergengalaxis Andro-Alpha angesiedelt.
In diesem Hintergrundband, der reichhaltig illustriert ist, werden folgenden Themen ausführlich behandelt:

Allgemeines. Wie kam es eigentlich zum Aufeinandertreffen zwischen Arkoniden und Methanatmern? Ausführungen über das Aussehen und Körperbau, Atmung und Körperchemie sowie ihrer Geschichte runden das Kapitel ab.

Aufgabenstellung. Nach dem ersten Gefecht mit den Arkoniden änderte sich auch die Aufgabenstellung in ihrer Flotte.

Stärke und Zusammensetzung. Jedes Jahr bekam der Imperator einen Tobsuchtsanfall, wenn die immensen Zahlen noch um einige Prozentpunkte nach oben kletterten.

Logistik. Werften Stützpunkte und andere Einrichtungen im Herrschaftsgebiet der Methanatmer werden vorgestellt. Nicht zu vergessen die Weltraumbahnhöfe zwischen den Galaxien.

Führung, Struktur und Organisation. Wie waren die Flotten aufgebaut, die sich mehrere Jarhunderte blutige Gefechte mit den Arkoniden liefern konnten.

Technik. Wie waren die Raumschiffe ausgerüstet, mit den die Maahks die Galaxies unsicher machten.

Personal. Selbst bei den Methanatmern gibt es einige Persönlichkeiten.

Datenblätter. Einzeln vorgestellt und mit Datenblättern versehen, werden die Raumer der Flotte aufgeführt.

Darüberhinaus bietet Ihnen dieser Band mehrere Szenarien für das Raumkampfsystem der Perry Rhodan-Simulation und für das Brettspiel "Der Methankrieg".

This expansion adds the race Maahks to the game. Including units, background information and a scenario.

name: Rioolratten
description:
Rioolratten is an education game that helps children with reading comprehension.

In the game, players have to try to get out of the sewer. How do they do that? The player takes a card and has to give the right answer to the question. To respond to the question he has to look threw the flyers, catalogue... If the player gives the right answer he needs to look on the back of the card how many steps he may go forward.

If the player doesn't give the right answer than he stays on is place. To win the game the player has to get to number 55.

—description from the publisher

name: (TA)ALIENS
description:
(TA)ALIENS, is an educational game that helps children with spelling, vocabulary and French.

In the game, players(the aliens) must get on a new planet because a comet is coming closer and endangering the planet. To be allowed to enter the new planet they need to collect 4 stars.

How to collect stars?
Players need to walk over the stars to reach the small planets.

On each star they need to practice a word. If this word is written correctly the player can stay and the turn is over.
When a player arrives on a planet he needs to write two words correctly. When the two words are correct the player receives a star.

In the pile of words are several cards stating the player can play another turn, the player has to move the comet forward or gets a chance to practice a word three times before writing it.

-description from publisher

name: Mierzoet
description:
Mierzoet, is an educational game that helps children of all ages to learn more about healthy food, the food triangle and the nutrient code.

In the game, the player(the ants)needs to go to one of the piles, to collect 5 cards at the end of the game. Each turn, the active player will roll the die, and move his ant forward. When one of the players gets to the pile, he may pick a card. The goal is to select a card with as less sugars as possible. The player can take the card home and the ant flies back to the start circle in his own color.

Once each player collected 5 cards, they may turn the cards to compare which player has the healthiest cards. The player with the healthiest cards wins this round and gets a piece of fruit. The players can play as many rounds as they want. The ant colony which has the most pieces of fruit in the end wins the game.

Afterwards they can also see how healthy their food is with the food triangle or the nutrient code.

—description from the publisher

name: Streifzüge durchs Salzburger Land
description:
With Streifzüge durchs Salzburger Land (Forays through the regionof Salzburg), you get to discover or re-discover Salzburg, the heart of Austria, its districts and villages.
Get to know historical details, unknown sagas and stories about the state of Salzburg.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Great Airplane Race
description:
The Great Airplane Race is a short family-style game for 2-50 players.

Each round, players fold planes on their airplane templates, then throw towards the finish line! If no one crosses that line, players re-fold and try again. Players choose which color lines to fold based on where their airplane lands compared to the color disc. They usually have three color lines from which to choose, but if a player lands their airplane on the color disc, they can choose any single color line to fold.

If your plane crosses the finish line, you win instantly; otherwise whoever has gotten closest to the finish line after five rounds wins.

name: BelloLudi Rifles: Skirmish Game 1860-1914
description:
BelloLudi Rifles rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games.
BelloLudi designed these rules especially for team building purposes. It is therefore easy to learn, quick to play, yet difficult to master! Suitable for two to forty players!

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. It is possible to start with only 20-odd miniatures, but that can easily be expanded. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies. Similarly, the distances are given in inches for use with 28mm scale soldiers. Feel free to adapt to centimetres should you not have the space or when you use a smaller scale of miniatures.

This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1860 to roughly 1914, the age in which European countries forged empires all over the world and combated each other and the various indigenous people. The rules will work for skirmishes in colonial settings, the Franco-Prussian War and other Wars of German Unification, the Balkan Wars, the Spanish-American War, the Boer Wars, the Boxer Rebellion and other clashes. It will also work for the early clashes of WW1.

Designed for the beginner with a minimum of miniatures, it also allows you to field large armies on the table top and play to a conclusion in two to three hours.

The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and be removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry charges and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a unit, but also between units and as such, the whole army.

This product come with two commander dice. Markers can be downloaded.
Cards are available separately.

—description from the publisher FB page
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Three Indoor Games: Tank Attack
description:
Tank Attack is a simple roll and move game where the aim is to navigate a path from the combat base to the final objective. Along the way obstacles such as tank traps, anti tank guns and enemy bombers will impede a players progress, The first to reach the objective (square 100) is the winner.

The game can be found as part of a 3 game set in an envelope packaging titled, Three Indoor Games, the other games being Snakes and Ladders and Ludo. Published by Ace Games in Australia during the Second World War.

—user summary

name: Treasure Island
description:
Treasure Island is a roll and move game first published during the 1920s in Australia. Players follow a path of 41 squares through the sea passing various ports along the way until you reach Treasure Island. There you roll specific numbers in order to collect treasure and acquire a ship to take you on a course of 31 squares for home.

Along the way contrary winds can detour your journey, you can drift off course, hit rocks and get wrecked, all of which make returning to home more difficult. First home is the winner.

At least 2 versions exist. A version resides in the Australian National Martime Museum, Sydney, with somewhat simpler graphics and classified as first edition

—user summary

name: UNO: Iron Man 2
description:
Plays like standard Uno with red, green, blue, and yellow cards (25 each color) numbered 0-9, with skip, draw, reverse, wild and wild draw four cards. In addition, there are four additional "War Machine" cards for a total of 112 cards for this version. War Machine cards count 50 points in scoring and make you impervious to the effects of draw 2 and draw 4 cards by making your opponent draw those cards.

The Iron Man 2 version of Uno is listed in the main Uno Wikipedia page under "Theme packs". The Iron Man character is prominent on the bulk of the cards, with other characters from the movie used on the skip, draw, reverse, etc... cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Tramwer
description:
Tramwer is a “game of routes” around the two lines of the Montpellier tramway.

After having drawn a route card, designating the starting point and the destination station to be reached, you must be the first to reach the destination.
There are many pitfalls in the smooth running of the game, such as the “strike days” boxes

It contains: a board, cards, pawns and a dice.

name: Senet e Tablan
description: Tablan + Senat - two games in one box.

name: Jetzt schlägt's 13
description:
The super fun game to freak out.
The electronic pinball action game is brought to the board as a clever dice game. Whoever manages to collect 88 points first in this crazy game has won. Everyone pushes his disc into the action area and collects points. And can also score points if he plays against the group in the subsequent action game and wins.

name: Cosmic Lorry
description:
In Cosmic Lorry you are cosmic merchants who are trying to build a big commercial network. You establish trade routes by connecting different planets. The more trade routes you create and the further apart the connected planets are, the more points you will score. The player who connects the planets most skilfully wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Rungholt
description:
Rungholt, the legendary Atlantis of the North Sea, was an island with a commercial town on the North Frisian coast, which was destroyed by a storm surge in the 14th century. In this game, you try to save the island and its residents from flooding. The water masses will engross the island relentlessly – are you able to secure the town, its residents and resources to make the most points from it? Use the dice wisely and leave the island as the heroic winner!

—description from the publisher

name: PixPlain
description:
In PixPlain, you invent creative stories about why your picture card, which is actually not suitable, goes particularly well with the word on display. For example, describe what a snail has to do with speed and why a lemon is cute. Select one of your picture cards that does not match the word at all, with which you want to challenge the other players. The selected cards are shuffled and dealt again. Now you have 30 seconds to argue why your assigned picture card does match the word. Vote on which story you liked best. The winner keeps his card. The first person to have 3 cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

name: Mazecraft: Finde den Weg
description:
You have found the entrance to a dungeon maze, but unfortunately you don't have a map. You know that you have to find the sword and defeat the dragon to get to its treasure. But be careful, your fellow player is trying to do the same in your dungeon. Play with the pre-build dungeons or build your own. Decide in which direction you want to go on your map, if you go the wrong way or step into a trap, it's your opponent's turn. Whoever finds the sword and the dragon first wins the game.

-description from publisher

name: Teelepathie: Das abgebrühte Teamspiel
description:
You invite your friends for tea Time and want to enjoy an intimate conversation – while the other guests at the table are listening unintentionally. How do you manage to transmit the secret word without revealing yourself and the word category? Tealepathy is a word and association game. Choose a secret category with your changing team partner. Now it's up to you to convey a secret word within this category to him or her by giving clues. But be careful, the other players will try to find out which category it is. Depending on the vote of the audience, points are distributed to all players. Whoever has the most points after a round wins Tealepathy.

-description from publisher
categories: Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Mind Map AI
description:
The INC Corporation has developed an artificial intelligence that  is indistinguishable from the humanoid. An international hacker  organization called HaXs 4 has hacked into the corporate network, aiming to destroy the AI. As the firewall of the INC Co. you are trying to create an impenetrable network over the coding so that the HaXs 4 have no chance to realize their plans. You have to work as a team to create a big firewall network. But everyone works on their own and just share little information. Roll the dice and establish fragments into your own Mind Map to build connections between the scripts to safe the coding of the AI. Every valid connection will score points to your team. The HaXs 4 get points by deleting connections. You win the game if you have more points as the HaXs at the end.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Das Festung Baues Spiel
description:
Das Festung Baues Spiel, an early 18th century military fortifications board game, comprises 52 engraved playing cards numbered sequentially. The cards use the French suits — with the suit being an image of a fortification, many rather intricate and some quite attractive — along with a paragraph of explanatory text. Along the top of the sheet additional panels list the game's rules, and a panel along the left edge contains an index of important terms. A central panel bear the "Peter Schencken" imprint against an architectural backdrop adorned with military hardware.

The sheet could be dissected for use as a traditional deck of cards or left intact for use as a board game, using the rules printed at the top. These rules appear to be fairly straightforward, involving the rolling of dice to determine one's moves, the victor being the first to land on panel number 53, the Complete Vestung ("Complete Fortification"). Additional rules add spice to the game; for example, anyone landing on panel number 16 — the Aussenwercke ("Outworks") — must sit out two turns. By progressing through all the panels, players are exposed in sequence to the various elements of fortification, from basic geometry through the digging of counter approaches.

name: Europa-Wettflug
description:
The players start in Hamburg. Movement is determined by a die. The first player back in Hamburg wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
On the game board, some cities are equipped with a hidden metal strip whereas the planes are outfitted with a magnet. If a plane lands at such a city the magnet aligns with the metal strip and the nose of the plane points in the direction of the detour, marked in green on the board.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Krazy Maze
description:
Krazy Maze was a 1940s board game published in Australia under licence by G. N. Raymond. National Archives Australia verifies the author being an Alan Joseph Howell and John Allan who registered the game in 1943

The game was a simple spin and move mechanism where two separate paths wind through a densely illustrated picturesque landscape. When two players play each takes a separate path. The game came with a spinner, called a "spino", which displayed numbers from 1 to 8. Players take turns spinning and moving their counter the corresponding number of squares.

Some squares on each track are marked with a letter of the alphabet and a player must follow an instruction that corresponds to that letter. For example, landing on the "A" square of the left track results in the instruction "Forgotten lunch. Back to start"; landing on the B square results in "Tiger snake on road. Extra spin to get past."

The two tracks diverge at square one and rejoin at square 89. Square 90 is the last square. A player must spin the exact number to land on square 90. The first player to do this wins.

—user summary

name: Lese-Piraten
description: On a lonely island, the pirates found the treasure of the famous pirate Lautikus. Unfortunately, the treasure is locked! In order to open it, the kids can solve some tricky vocabulary games.

name: Piraten-ABC mini
description: The famous pirate Lautikus is searching for a successor. But only the strongest pirates can win. Therefore, Lautikus invented 3 games where kids should be good in remembering, be very fast and knows what to do with words. The fastest and smartest kid wins.

name: Rechen-Piraten mini
description: The pirates are looking for a treasure - a calculation treasures! Join in and find the two gold coins which will show the correct mathematical answer of addition, subtraction or multiplication. The arithmetic calculation disk shows, which anser is correct and which kid wins.

name: Hoppelhopp
description: Who is faster? The bird Flips or the rabbits? Flips just learned to fly and therefore challenges the rabbits. The 5 rabbits of course need to help each other to be faster than Flips. The first one to be on the final tree wins.

name: Pass auf Pinguin!
description:
It's spring and the ice begins to melt. The little penguins waddle from one ice floe to the other. Some floes melt too much so that the penguin has to jump into the water and start from the beginning again.
The player who manages to take all his penguins to the end of the ice floes wins.

name: Ninety Minutes
description:
A turn based football tactics game in which you control your team of players in combination with using custom formations, team tactics and your hand of highlight cards, to defeat your opponent before the end of ninety minutes.

This game is intended to replicate the excitement of match day in a turn based board game as you attempt to outscore your opponent. With numerous formations, tactics and highlight card abilities to choose from, you will need to ensure your tactics are up to the task, and hope that luck is on your side to achieve the required dice rolls to execute them effectively.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Mini RatzFatz: Buchstaben und Wörter
description: The players draw cards with letters and tell a short story with as many words starting with this letter as possible. But caveat, the letter monster might come at every moment and catch some of the letters, before you can finish your story.

name: Mini RatzFatz: Erstes Englisch
description: All cards are put face up on the table so that the players can see the images. One player reads an English story and the other players try to take as fast as possible the corresponding cards. A very nice game to learn a little bit of English!

name: Mini RatzFatz: Sicher im Straßenverkehr
description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story about traffic rules, signs and lights which are visible on some of the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the correct card and knows the rule, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
description:
Based on the Star Trek TNG First Contact movie. Five Rings Publishing Group released the game in a Federation and Borg starter pack.

This is the USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
This Federation set contains all one player needs to explore and defend Starfleet
25 assorted 20mm polyhedral dice; three 6-sided, five 8-sided, six 10-sided, seven 12-sided and four 20-sided dice
The dice control your ship's warp core, reserve power, shield strength, phasers, quantum torpedos, damage control, impulse power and sensors
A full-color ship Bridge/control panel from which you command ship systems and personnel
A full color ship shield and icon chart, and a 24 page Basic Training(TM) instruction book and rules.

—user summary
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Is It Me? Is It You?
description:
Is It Me? Is It You? is a social game for two players (best with BFFs or partners) to determine how much you have been paying attention to the other player's quirks.

Players take turns reading out one of 100 questions (example: "Which of us is more likely to lock themselves out of the house?"). Both players then simultaneously hold up their paddles--marked on opposite sides with "Me" and "You"--to indicate which of them they feel is the best answer to the question. Point are awarded accordingly.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Predictive Bid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Le jeu du Maine-et-Loire
description:
Le Jeu du Maine-et-Loire is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Maine-et-Loire, Angers, Saumur, Cholet...

Rules:
Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Le jeu du Grand Quercy
description:
Le Jeu du Grand Quercy is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Grand Quercy region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Willow
description:
Willow is a climbing game, in the style of Tichu, Tien Len, Haggis, Chimera, Fight the Landlord, The Great Dalmuti, and many others. If you’ve ever played trick-taking games like Spades or Hearts, climbing games are a little bit like that, but with poker hands instead of singles cards, and the tricks can go around the circle multiple times.

The big difference between Willow and other climbing games is that most combos stay on the table after they are played and can be
added to (like in German Rummy). This makes it a lot easier for more players to play in more Tricks.

name: The Big Game: Explore Bhutan Wilderness
description:
With The Big Game: Explore Bhutan Wilderness meet six different kinds of jungle cats, and more wild animals, all from Bhutan!
Asiatic Golden cat, Pallas cat,Fishing cat...even a Leopard cat!
And of course, Takin, Bhutans national animal.
All of them waiting for you to be discovered in this beautiful board game.

Bhutan is a paradise for wildlife lovers.
It has such a range of small and large animals, starting with the Raven and ending with the One-horned Rhino! It is a safari experience that you would want to come back to. And even plan a real one.

All of these and more are waiting for you to be discovered. They get you points and make you the winner.
Catch the glimpse of a Snow Leopard on the hunt and take 25 points!
Yes, and that Golden Cat is worth 20 points!
Keep adding up the points - it even helps your Math!

—description from the publisher

name: Animal Buddy: Bhutan Wild Trail
description:
An eye-catching, colourful game board for the tiny ones, designed for small spaces

Get your own safari jeep in bright yellow or blue,
55 game cards, including
45 wild animals waiting to be your buddies,
2 alert cards and
5 cards with game instructions



Bhutan has steep, rugged mountains and deep valleys in the North to sub-tropical forest and bamboo jungles in the South. 72% of Bhutan is dense, virgin forest. Find your buddies from those lovely wild animals who live there!

A simple game for the parent-at-home and the young one. Set out on a fun trek through the dense jungles and mountains of Bhutan!. On the way, you meet all sorts of animals.
They will tell you where to go next: they want you to meet their friends and also leave the forest unharmed.
Splash mud on any animal and it becomes your buddy on you jungle trail !
Make friends with more animals as you explore the jungle.
In every round, you find new buddies - and they find you too! Tell your friends who you met on your trek !!

—description from the publisher

name: Babacadabra
description:
The witch Babacadabra needs your help to find all the ingredients necessary to make her spells.
Babacadabra is a game of skill, precision and concentration, for 2-5 players aged 6 and up: a game to stimulate collaboration between the players, sorcerer’s apprentices, while developing their observation and descriptive skills. A quick and fun game, to do anywhere in minutes!

How to play
Players must cooperate and collaborate with each other in order to get hold of all the ingredients necessary for witch Babacadabra’s spell.
Taking turns, each player plays the role of the witch Babacadabra and describes to her helpers the 9 ingredients listed on her “Enchantment” card.
The other players, who play the sorcerer’s apprentices, must find the 9 ingredients in the given amount of time by looking for them among the “Ingredient” cards scattered on the table.
But beware: finding the ingredients is not an easy task because the images depict very similar objects and can therefore be confused and mixed up.

name: I Love Hamilton: Trivia Game
description:
750 questions and answers about Hamilton, Ontario.

Contents:

1 gameboard
2 dice
150 tokens
6 score cards
6 pawns
1 Q&A book

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour du pays Basque
description:
The Tour of the Basque Country is a cycle stage race held in the Autonomous Community of the Basque Country.

5 profiles adapted to Magnytour

name: Arena PvP
description:
Arena PvP is a fantasy themed card game in wich you are going to embody a hero, equip items, conjure blessings, casts curses and control game events that will lead you to defeat your opponents.

In Arena PvP you will choose a pre-constructed hero's deck to quickly start playing. Each deck has it's own strategies and synergies. Then, if you want more complex gameplays, just create your own deck by combining any card.

Arena PvP is designed to bring you the Trading Card Game experience within a cheap box.

—description from the designer

name: In Deo Veritas: Captain General – Wargaming the Age of Marlborough and the Great Northern War
description:
In Europe, the first two decades of the eighteenth century were characterised by almost constant warfare. Western and Central Europe had been involved in the Nine Years’ War that ended in 1697. The peace was shortlived and by 1701 Western Europe was once again plunged into a new conflict, the War of Spanish Succession. Elsewhere, Denmark, Russia, Saxony and eventually Prussia all sought to dismember the Swedish Empire and share it amongst themselves. This conflict, known as the Great Northern War, was to last over twenty years.

Designed to refight the battles of the period, In Deo Veritas: Captain General is an expansion book for the popular rule set In Deo Veritas. The rules focus on the command decisions needed to maintain the motivation of the army. The battle scenarios offer the player a series of different challenges from the wars of the early eighteenth century.

Battles are played at the brigade level with all major elements on 75mm/3" wide bases. Using smaller scale figures (6-15mm) lets players give their units a realistic feel. The ground scale of 1" = 40yds means the typical 6ft x 4 ft table is large enough to accommodate most battles of the period.

Most players will already have everything needed to play (d6, tape measure and a deck of cards). More scenarios and game support will become available in the future.

To learn the rules will take 2 hours or so using some of the smaller battles. Once you have become familiar with the core elements then your games will flow more quickly and a larger battle such as Blenheim should last for 3-4 hours depending on the arrival of the reinforcements.

Nothing is certain, but generals that hone their skills are more likely to be victorious.

You will need a copy of In Deo Veritas: Fast Play Rules for Exciting Seventeenth Century Battles in Smaller Scales to use this book.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Open Wide!
description: Some happy hippos need your help pulling their big rotten teeth. In this children's game players take turns spinning the spinner onto one of the 6 hippos and pulling 1 of their 4 teeth if they have any. If a player spins a hippo without any teeth, that player must help the hippo by giving it 4 new teeth. Players spin until their corner holds 6, 8, or 13 of the 24 teeth depending on number of players.

name: Hi Ho Mother Goose VCR Game
description:
A children's game in the Hi Ho series alongside Hi Ho Cherry-O, Hi Ho Cherry-O VCR Game, Hi Ho Alphabet, and Hi Ho Color Go Round.

A VCR game about nursery rhymes with 3 different play sessions on the tape and random elements to ensure the game plays different even during the same section of the tape. Hi Ho Mother Goose contains 13 favorite nursery rhymes portrayed via puppets and cartoons. Players watch the nursery rhyme segments and listen for Mother Goose's instructions on matching cards to the rhymes and then spinning the spinner to take or give matching cards, with the player holding Mother Goose's card at the end of the session wins.

name: nickname party!
description:
Playing Games, You can call your opponet in many diffrent ways, and get close to them.
"nickname" was born out of the thoughts of middle school girl "Nanana Kudo". and We're back to the "nickname party!"

"Alien Paul, Give me the UFO!"
"PRINCESS Jack, Please give me some GLASS SHOES."

That's how each of you call each other in different ways during the game.
And the player with the most nickname groups wins.

The card set in the nickname consists of one nickname card and four item cards.

The nickname card is placed in the middle of the table, and all the item cards in the nickname category used in this game are shuffled and divided into equal.

The player should request an item card at least once to anyone on his or her turn, that is currently the same nickname category not in hands.

Through this, the information that player has at least one item card in the some nickname category is exposed to others.
However, bluffing is prohibited for requesting an item card in the player's hand.

If the request is successful, that player can decide whether to continue the request or pass.

It doesn't matter if the player changes the opponent to someone else when they keep requesting.

During the game, if the player has all four item cards of the same nickname category in their hand, they will immediately declare their achievement and bring the nickname card that the player put in the center of the table. And the nickname item cards are piled up together.

The game ends when all the nickname cards placed in the center of the table are seated in front of someone.

The person who has the most nickname sets in front of him wins.

name: Albion's Legacy: Character pack
description: 12 extra characters, including: Ivanhoe, Peter Pan, Robyn Hood, Blackbeard. 12 extra artifacts and 4 terrains related to the new characters. No additional rules.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Horseman's Chess
description:
Horseman's Chess is a chess variant in which a piece’s movement capabilities can change during play. The primary actors are the familiar chess pieces (Pawn, Rook, Knight, Bishop, Queen, and King) with their traditional movement capabilities except that none of them can move more than two spaces nor jump spaces without assistance.

Pieces augment their movement by using mounts. The Charger mount allows a piece to move an unlimited number of spaces, while the Jumper mount allows a piece to jump over an intermediate space when moving two spaces.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Wero Mai
description:
Wero Mai is a Māori board game intended for students and those at a beginner level in Te Reo Māori.

It involves four different categories (New Zealand Places, Māori Culture, Flora & Fauna, Everyday knowledge) to test the player's Māori knowledge and will extend their learning so they can apply that knowledge in their everyday life.

The game aims to answer three cards per category correctly in Māori. Players can change the aim from one to three cards depending on their level or time restriction.

Wero Mai's game includes challenges which are the Taniwha and the Niho Taniwha. When the participants land on the Niho Taniwha, they must go to the nearest Taniwha. To escape the Taniwha and continue their Wero Mai journey, they need to roll an even number.

—description from the publisher

name: Sunrise Safari
description:
Includes 16 animal dice, 20 large challenge cards, 4 safari cruiser dice holder cards, Meeka Meerkat squeaker, and multilingual instructional guide
Flip a challenge card. Then all players roll their animal dice in a race to match the 4 animals on the challenge card
The first to make the matches grabs the meerkat squeezer and collects the challenge card. Collect the most challenge cards to win!
Based on the best-selling even-steven's odd game

name: Val de Loire Nivernais: Le jeu
description:
Val de Loire Nivernais: Le jeu is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Val de Loire Nivernais region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among the 110 present on the board, from Cosne-sur-Loire to Decize via Nevers.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Franche-Comté
description:
(Re)Discover the region Franche-Comté in 1800 questions.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 1940: Méfiez-vous de vos voisins
description:
Immerse yourself in the hidden role game and relive the most dangerous dinner of the Occupation as a Resistant or a Collabo.
Identify your allies, gather clues to win the game before being spotted by the Gestapo.

Betrayals, turnarounds, last-minute alliances; you won't look at your friends the same way again

At the start of the game, each player is assigned a “secret role” card and a “character card”. The character card indicates the specific power of the character during the game. The role card determines which team the player is on. Either the “Collabos” team or the “Resistance” team. The "Resistance" team is always outnumbered regardless of the number of players, but its members know each other at the start of the game unlike the Collabos.
An additional character is present on the board, the German officer. It is not played by anyone and cannot move.

Winning condition:
In order to win the game, the Resistance must accumulate in the same hand a significant number of Resistance clues without being exposed by the Collabos. At any time of the game, even if it is not his turn, a Resident with the required number of Resistance clues, cuts his hand and wins the game with his team.
In order to win the game, the Collabos must succeed in passing five Collabos clues to the German before the Resistance wins.

- Translation from KKBB presentation
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, World War II
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Historical Conquest: The Card Game – Wentworth Cheswell
description:
Not playable on their own as you need two starter decks to play the game.

In Historical Conquest, a CCG, there exists five main decks (named decks A thru E) each illustrated with a historical figure on its cover. Each box contains 50 unique illustrated cards.
Use either the standard deck or build your own deck.
Box B has on it's cover Wentworth Cheswell
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading

name: Roll and Rock
description:
Game currently under testing

Roll and Rock is a 2-4 player game where players control a rock band competing to record the best album.

Roll and Rock is a worker placement game played over 12 rounds.
On each round players send their band-mates to different locations whether to learn some instrument, busking or hire new band-mates.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Farbenkampf-Spiel
description:
Each player has 9 pawns of 5 colors. The game board consists of squares of the same 5 colors and white squares. Each color has a strength value between 1 and 5 points. On white spaces the strength of the pawns matches their own value, on all other spaces the strength of the pawns take on the point value of the space.

Movement and capture is 1 space in any direction but not diagonally. A pawn may capture any pawn of lesser strength.

A player wins the game by eliminating all pawns of his opponent. If both players have only one pawn left, the player with the stronger pawn wins.

—user summary

name: A Haunting by the Shadow
description:
A Haunting by the Shadow is a cooperative game in which 2-4 players investigate a house overrun by dark and sinister spirits. The spirits are led by a greater evil known as the Shadow. Players must discover items within the house to help them eliminate the ominous spirits. But time is against them. With each passing moment, the Shadow's power grows. If the players take too long in their search, the spirits could unleash an untold terror into the world.

Players will take actions to move, search, or vanquish spirits that are haunting the Harris House. Players will gather items that will allow them to vanquish the spirits. Before the players get the items, they must avoid interacting with the spirits and must avoid the Shadow at all costs.

If the players vanquish the 4 spirits, the players collectively win and the Shadow is defeated.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points

name: Dribble, Shoot, Roll!
description:
Dribble, Shoot, Roll! is a 2-player basketball card game in which players take on the role of a Head Coach, draft a team, and roll dice to score points.

Players begin the game by having a Draft. During the Draft, players will take turns drawing and drafting basketball players to form their basketball team. Each basketball player has a skill level (1-6) for each of the shot attempt skills. The higher the skill number, the higher the chance of that player scoring on their shot attempt.
