Once their teams are established, players will begin play. Players will shuffle their player decks and draw the top 5 basketball player cards to form their lineup. They then will choose one player from their lineup to put into the scoring position.

Next, one player will reveal the Shot Attempt Card and reveal what shot the players will attempt. Both players will roll their basketball die and compare the number rolled with their basketball player's skill number of the shot that is being attempted. If the player's skill number is equal to or exceeds the number the player rolled on his/her die, then the scoring attempt is successful. The player gains the number of points the shot attempt awards (1,2, or 3 points). Players then move their scoring marker on their player scoreboard.

Players will repeat this process until the Shot Attempt Deck is depleted. This completes a quarter. The game consists of 4 quarters. After all 4 quarters, the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer

name: You Don't Know Jack: TV Expansion Pack
description: This add-on set for the tabletop YOU DON'T KNOW JACK game includes 113 cards with 450 additional questions about you favorite TV shows of the past & present. Like the original, each question has that wacky YDKJ twist to make it that much more interesting and challenging!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Airship Admirals
description:
Pick one of the 6 unique factions and lead them to victory in 2-4 player death-match. If you are unsure you can do it on your own create a temporary alliance.

You will move your Airship on a hexagon tile map and give orders to your crew in pursuit of victory. In total there are 4 unit classes with distinct capabilities in 6 stations. Every Airship and a unit in a class are unique! Weather elements change each turn and affect game dynamics. Turn based play with different phases for different types of actions. You will need swift movement and decisive attacks if you plan to survive. And one more thing, make sure to know your crew special abilities.

Your crew is on deck, eager to hear your first order Admiral!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Bias, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Variable Player Powers

name: Tempo!
description:
How do you survive on a desert island? How to become a millionaire without working? In Tempo! you'll have to find answers to these and many more tricky questions and share them with your friends! But remember: you have only 1 minute and 6 words. Not challenging enough? Take a condition card from the special pile and follow the terms on it to get maximal score. For example, build the sentence using as many words starting with letter “O” as possible and mentioning one name of a sport.
To win the game, follow the conditions and make up the ideas your friends will like.

-description from designer

name: Le Jeu du Potager
description:
In this game inspired by the French equivalent to Snakes & Ladders ("jeu de l'oie"), curious youngsters will learn how to grow plants. Weather effects are accounted for and players will have to take care of their vegetable patch through their progression in the game.
This is an educative game for young kids.

Description from the French editor website:

"À vos graines, prêts, plantez !

Prendre soin de son potager au fil des saisons pour récolter les plus beaux légumes ?

C’est facile avec le jeu du potager ! Dans ce jeu de plateau, les joueurs doivent faire pousser leurs légumes en évitant les embûches pour devenir de vrais jardiniers en herbe. Le jeu idéal pour petits et grands afin de découvrir de manière ludique les secrets du potager au naturel."

Box contents:
1 board
98 cards
6 wooden pawns
1 wooden die
1 rulebook

Players take turns rolling a die to progress on the board. Each progress will grant them access to a card (weather/animals/bonus) helping them towards or impeding the growing of their vegetable garden. The game ends whenver a player reaches the end. The player with the most beautiful vegetable patch (most points) wins.

name: Super Polio: con las Calles de Caracas
description:
A Monopoly-like game.

Become the richest player in Caracas through the purchase, rental and sale of properties.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopolio... de las calles de Caracas
description:
Become the richest player in Caracas through the purchase, rental and sale of properties.

Around the board the properties are:

Start in purple with San Agustín del Sur and urbanización El Conde, followed in sky blue by Avenida Atlántico, Plaza Catia and Avenida Sucre.
In violet Los Chaguaramos, Santa Mónica, Bello Monte and in yellow-ocre Avenida Victoria, Avenida Roosevelt and Avenida Nueva Granada.
In red, Avenida La Paz, Urbanización El Paraíso and Avenida San Martín, in yellow Avenida Andrés Bello, Parque Los Caobos and Plaza Venezuela.
In green: Sabana Grande , Francisco de avenida Miranda and Plaza Altamira and finally in royal blue, avenida Urdaneta, Avenida Bolívar.


Includes:
Board,
regulations,
a dice,
4 pawns of different colors,
32 houses and 12 hotels to build,
2 sets of cards for the Chance box and Communal Ark,
a sheet with property titles and banknotes.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kooba
description:
Kooba is a revolutionary new targetgame that performs like a sport challenge. Every game, every round your skills are tested in the pursuit of the perfect KOOBA shot!

A Kooba game has 4 main components. 3 darts called Aeros that somewhat resemble fidget spinners, 5 round discs that magnetically attach to the gameboard, 2 sticks, and the game board itself.

The Aeros have a large hole in the center. The two sticks are stuck through this hole and made to form an X. The shot is then taken by quickly pulling apart your hands so that the Aero is forced to fly forward. Depending on where you land on the board you can score or knock your opponents back.

The game is won by scoring enough times to advance your marker to the end of it's track and then tagging the KOOBA in the center.

name: According 2 Hip Hop: The Trivia Game – OG Pack #01
description:
According 2 Hip Hop is a trivia card game where all the questions and answers come directly from the lyrics of hip hop and rap songs. Players challenge one another with questions from their hand ranging over 40 years worth of music. Players can answer, get hints, share and win points directly or indirectly. The winner has the most points at the end of the round.

Contents: 72 cards (216 questions total), rules, and box.

name: Centre Ouest Bretagne: Le Jeu
description:
Centre Ouest Bretagne, Le Jeu is a local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 500 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, 60 "junior" questions, which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Centre Ouest Bretagne region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among the 108 of the region, from Mûr de Bretagne to Pleyben, Callac to Faouët via Carhaix, Rostrenen and Gourin.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Code België
description:
Code België (Code Belgium), is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: important people, counties, rivers...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

name: Code Europa
description:
Code Europa (Code Europe) is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: important people, counties, rivers...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Travel, Word Game

name: WO I & WO II
description:
Code WO I & WO II (World War I & World War II) is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: countries, events, important people...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Educational, World War I, World War II

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Return of Ripsnarl
description:
A new scenario for Battle for Greyport.

The Scenario comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

This scenario comes in two flavours of difficulty so both introductory and seasoned players should find a good time.

The Return of Ripsnarl! (For new players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl has 20, 30, 35 or 45 HP for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players, respectively.
- Recommended rest healing: 2

The Return of Ripsnarl! (Advanced players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat does not counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl is Ranged (Use this card as a reminder.)
- Recommended rest healing: 1
RANGED
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Tea Time
description:
Tea Time is an educational game to help children to collect ingredients to make their recipe.

How to play this game? The meaning of this game is to collect as first all the ingredients for your dessert. Each player receives a dessert and 5 ingredients in their hands at the start. The dessert is placed on the table in front of you. The remaining cards form the pile, the top card is turned over as the discard pile.

The player takes a card from the pile or puts it on the discard pile if he doesn't need it for his dessert. The player can also play an action card (bulbs) or put the ingredient next to their dessert if they match. Pick a new card until you have 5 cards in your hands.

The player who first collects all the ingredients for their dessert wins the game.

-description from publisher

name: Ogres Eleven: The Fantasy Heist Game
description:
The crew is getting back together, Frank Ogre has one final grudge to settle and this time it's personal.

Play as one of eleven characters in this "Dungeons and Dragons"- inspired heist game.

Co-operatively plan your heist, utilising Fantasy Con-Artists, Lockpickers, Hired Muscle and Masterminds. Plant distractions, hack alarms and solicit bribes before attempting the job. Only the most devious players will stand any chance against the Central Bank and its monstrous Chairman!

Plan your heist carefully in the first phase of the game, marking out secret objectives to complete throughout the game to earn skill points and extra cash.

Be careful not to raise your "heat" too much- or the vault will be sealed and the heist will end dismally. Players win only when the vault is emptied and their character has successfully pulled off a secret win condition.

Ogre's Eleven uses a "legacy play" system that changes the heist each time you attempt it. With eleven playable characters, dozens of different skills/items, new patrol routes and changing security systems- even veteran players will come back over and over again to set new high scores and compete against their friends.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: HeartSwitch Wizard Combo Pack
description:
A compilation edition of two card games - Wizard and HeartSwitch.

This exciting new combo pack combines two of your favorite trick-taking card games into one convenient gift pack. The set includes two complete decks and instructions for two different card games.

In the award-winning Wizard Card Game, players try to win the exact number of tricks they bid.

The Wizard deck is similar to a regular deck of playing cards with the addition of four Wizards and four Jesters. Jesters always lose and Wizards always win. When you make your exact bid, you earn points. If you take too many or too few tricks, you lose points. The special, custom Wizard Score Sheet helps players keep track of bids and points. Wizard Card Game can be played with 2-6 players.

HeartSwitch is a completely new card game inspired by “Hearts”. The addition of special cards and unique concepts creates challenging situations that require Innovative strategies.

The object of the game is to have the lowest score at the end of the game.

The 60-card includes 2 good Witches and 2 bad Witches—they can help you or destroy you. Just when you are about to throw in the cards, the 4 Magicians come to your rescue!

HeartSwitch Wizard Combo Includes:

HeartSwitch Card Game
• Deck of 60 Cards
• Instructions
• Custom Score Sheets

Wizard Card Game
• Deck of 60 Cards
• Instructions
• Custom Score Sheets

-description from publisher's website

name: Vis mon camp! en Bourgogne - Franche-Comté
description:
Vis mon camp ! en Bourgogne - Franche-Comté is a navigation game.

Each player starts from an EEDF (Eclaireurs & Eclaireuses de France) group in the region and has to go find other groups to make a camp on a field.
This allows the player to cross the region to get to the groups they need to camp with, then make a second trip to the camp location, finding out about the various local groups and their locations.
When a player reaches a location he scores points (shown on the "camp" cards).

First player to reach 100pts wins the game.

name: Wild State: The Game of American Power Grab
description:
OVERVIEW: This is an election theme board game, but make no mistake about it. This isn't a political game. It is a territorial game where opponents fight for majority of votes on the states, and win General Elections. There is a luck component that is easily tamed with plenty of strategies. Strategies get pretty sophisticated as players develop their skills overtime. In a way it resembles a weird mix of poker and chess without following any of their rules. In other words, it is not a twisted version of either. The goal of the game is to win majority in the states, thereby winning Super PACs to fund your campaigns, and ultimately win 3 General Elections.

AUDIENCE: Simple enough for casual players and advanced for professional gamers.

UNIQUE: This game is played continuously. After every game, you can save the setup with its unique challenges for the next time you play. Simply snap a picture of the board. Probably, this is the only "competitive" game where really it is almost impossible to eliminate an opponent from the game (no player elimination).

IMPORTANT..!
Manufacturer strongly recommends you limit a game to 3 General Elections wins rather than 5 as stated in the rules, for a better game experience.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Math, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Events, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Income, Investment, Ladder Climbing, Matching, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ownership, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting

name: Clash of Spears: Fields of Blood
description:
Fields of Blood is an expansion to CLASH of Spears

This expansion currently includes:

Rules for designing solo scenarios and two ready to play solo scenarios
Rules for fighting assaults on fortifications
Rules for fighting engagements in urban areas
Two new scenarios including an assault scenario
New rules to add special skills to your characters


This is a living document and as we add new material you will be able to simply download the updated version.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Le Pays de Lorient Par le Jeu
description:
While playing, discover the 19 municipalities of the Pays de Lorient through 30 remarkable tourist sites!

The board represents the 19 municipalities of the region of Lorient.
The players move and visit the various tourist sites in the region.
Rolling the dice they can use roads, by bus or taxi,
In each municipality, there are 1 to 3 sites that are deliberately different and remarkable, leisure activities, exceptional places, museums, heritage and some history.

Goal
The first player who collect 10 sites in 10 different communes is the winner.

Gameplay
Use a combination of dice and "transportation" cards to race around the board.
Each player starts with a hand of 4 cards.
To visit a site a player needs to stop exactly on the red space representing it and own the corresponding card in his / her hand. It is then put face-up as a proof of the visit.
At the beginning of its turn, a player refills her/his hand to 4 cards first before rolling the dice (only once per turn).
Special cards allow special movement bonuses, or penalties to delay other players.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Twisting Chess
description:
Twisting Chess adds 2 new characters to the original chess game with different abilities for a new game balance. Twisting Chess is a game for all ages and levels of competency in the original game. Fun for new as well as experienced chess players!

The classic Chess game is a fantastic game for young and old. It's fairly easy to learn, but super hard to master. This is often considered a reason not to play the game. Especially nowadays with mobile devices, the barrier to master this versatile game is quite high. Twisting Chess aims to break down that barrier and make it fun and challenging to play for experienced as well as new players.

When you play twisting chess, we assume a basic knowledge of the original game. That means that we expect you to understand the basic abilities of the pieces, but that's all. Of course you may have a competitive advantage when you know some basic strategies, but don't be fooled, because the two new characters we introduce can ruin your intentions in the blink of an eye.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: SINS: Spheres of Torment – Trilogy Box
description:
SINS is a deck-destructor and a highly competitive game. It’s built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Both attacking and defending will cost you deeply and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage. Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit and fight
back when your opponent is exhausted.

Each battle pack of cards has a specific sin and each sin has a unique set of principles, which can either form or change your strategy as you play through the game.

SINS: Spheres of Torment introduces 3 different themed battle packs focus around the sins of wrath, greed and gluttony which supports 2-6 players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Likely To . . . A Game About Personalities
description:
In this 3-5 player game, each player is assigned a color. During each round, a card reader reads a descriptive card that describes a certain type of personality (ex. Likely To Run For Political Office, Likely To Wear Gym Shorts In A Blizzard, Likely To Cook Like A Chef). Players race to be the first to match another player's personality to the one described on the card. However, if they say the wrong color, or are too slow, another player can steal their point. Whoever reaches 10 points first wins!

—description from the designer

name: Victory at Sea: HMS Ark Royal
description:
One of the most famous carriers of the war, the HMS Ark Royal received many battle honours in its service.
The first enemy aircraft shot down by the Fleet Air Arm was with one of her Blackburn Skuas, while her bombers sank the German cruiser Königsberg, the first example of a capital ship being sunk by an attack from the air.

Better remembered is the Ark Royal’s role in the sinking of the Bismarck, where her Fairey Swordfish launched a torpedo attack that damaged its rudder, leaving it vulnerable to the rest of the fleet.

Other notable actions included convoys to Malta, the Norwegian campaign and involvement in the first U-boat kill of the war.

In 1941 she was struck by a torpedo and sank while under tow.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Tirpitz
description:
Sister ship to the Bismarck, the Tirpitz was 2,000 tons heavier and thus the heaviest warship to have ever been produced by a European navy.
She served in Norway and the Baltic Fleet acting as a potent deterrent. The Tirpitz became an obsession for the British. After the sinking of the Bismarck, the Tirpitz, as Germany’s most powerful warship, was destined to spend much of the war in port.

After the daring St Nazaire raid by the British, it was deemed unfeasible to use Tirpitz against the Atlantic convoys of the Allies. Instead, she was used sparingly, as a deterrent against Allied invasion in Norway and to intercept Allied convoys to the Soviet Union. In September 1943, along with the battleship Scharnhorst, she bombarded Allied positions on Spitzbergen. This was the only occasion the mighty battleship fired her main battery in anger.

The relentless attacks of the British, would prove to be the end of the mighty vessel. They launched many raids on her; from mini-submarines and two full scale air raids. She was eventually  sunk in 1944 by Lancaster bombers armed with 12,000 lb Tallboy bombs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Sprichst Du Englisch?
description:
A Tiptoi game to learn English

Explore the town with Amy, Susan, Mike, and Fred.

The Tiptoi pen names objects or phrases common sentences in English and the players find these either on the town map or on picture/Word cards.

The player who gets the most correct answers wins.

There are three different difficulty settings and a Tiptoi pen is required for the game
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Word Game

name: Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Gard
description:
Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Gard lets you become the best guide in the "Gard" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

Take a coach trip through the Gard department and answer questions,
For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
The winner is the first guide to be back
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 盤上決戦 (SSSS.GRIDMAN)
description:
Board game based on the hit 2018 anime SSSS.GRIDMAN. Players play as Yuta Hibiki and the Gridman Alliance fighting against the kaiju created by Akane Shinjo in this cooperative dice game.

Players select a character from the show (Yuta, Utsumi, Rikka, Samurai Caliber, Max, Borr, or Vit) to move around the city and fight the kaiju that appear. However, you can't fend off against stronger kaiju alone. Ask a friend to join you in combat for a huge power boost. Work together to take down the final boss, Alexis Kerib!

Event cards in the game feature scenes from the source material, such as the dinner with Alexis and the meeting with the kaiju girl, and whenever Akane happens to move to the same space Yuto is on, his HP will immediately suffer. Guaranteed laughs for fans of the show.

Supports up to 4 players, including a solo mode where you control 4 characters.


2018年秋にアニメ化されて以来、いまだ根強い人気のアニメ『SSSS.GRIDMAN』（グリッドマン）がボードゲームで登場。
本商品は、プレイヤーが響裕太たち「グリッドマン同盟」の一員となり、新条アカネの生み出す怪獣たちと戦う、ダイスを使った協力型ゲームです。

プレイヤーはTVアニメの登場人物（裕太、内海、六花、サムライ・キャリバー、マックス、ボラー、ヴィット）から選び、街に現れる怪獣と戦います。しかし強力な怪獣は1人だけでは倒せません。他のプレイヤーと一致団結して戦うことで攻撃力は大きくアップします。仲間たちと話し合い、協力して最終ボス・アレクシスを倒しましょう！

ゲーム中のイベントでは、アニメの作中で話題となったエピソードを元にした「アレクシスと遭遇」や、「怪獣少女と遭遇」があったり、アカネの駒が裕太の駒と同じ場所に移動すると裕太のHPが減ったりなど、アニメを観ていた人なら思わず笑ってしまう内容が盛りだくさんです。

プレイ人数は4人までですが、1人だけでプレイすることも可能です（その場合は1人で4キャラクターを操ります）。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: This Game Is... Beyond Words
description: A competitive Scrabble-esque word game for two players or teams. Players take turns being the "forming" and "defending" side over four rounds. Each round the forming player randomly draws letter tiles one at a time and places them on the grid starting from the center. Each new letter played must either form a complete word, or marked with one of ten pawns as an incomplete word. Each incomplete word must have a possible word declared for the unused letters. After every five letters played the defending player has a blocking tile available to prevent progress of the forming team. Each forming phase ends when the forming player either plays a complete word that uses a corner space, or gets three strikes. Strikes are accumulated for being unable to play a tile, declaring a word that would not fit in the area, or playing an illegal or false word. After each phase, players score points for each letter used in complete words only, and possibly double their score if they end on a corner that corresponds to the round being played.

name: L'Éducation au fil de l'eau
description:
L’Éducation au fil de l’eau educates young and old alike about water, land, biodiversity and life skills through its educational booklet.

Goals:

Be the first to finish the course
Enrich your knowledge
Open oneself to the world


Players progress on the board by rolling the dice and answering questions on Four themes, different issues:

WATER
Become aware of the importance of drinking clean water, understand where the water comes from, how and why it is made drinkable
Informing about inequalities in access to water in the world
Learn more about the water cycle and the physical states of water

EARTH
Discover the world geography and the city of Nantes, its history and its monuments
Become aware of the distribution of the world population,
Become aware of global warming and its impact

BIODIVERSITY
Discover permaculture, how it works and its benefits
Explain the importance of trees in the balance of our ecosystem, understand the need to reforest the planet
Become aware of the main causes of pollution

KNOW-BEING
Acquire good gestures to respect the environment (selective sorting, recycling, renewable energies, energy savings)
Discover emotions, become aware of the important values ​​for relationships with others
Raise awareness of the rights of the child and abuse



—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon: Battle Scenarios Volume #1
description:
Scenarios and corresponding army lists for Warfare in the Age of Napoleon

Scenarios are:

Fleuros 1794.
Haslach 1805.
Saafeld 1806.
Hoff 1807.
Raab 1809.
Busaco 1810.
Albura 1811.
Borodino 1812 (4):
Shevardino Redoubt.
Davout's infantry attack on the fleches.
Cavalry attack on the fletches.
Great Redoubt.



Color battlefield maps.

—description from the publisher


With the success of Tod Kershner's Warfare in the Age of Napoleon rules, it has been requested that more be added to the basic game. As you know the basic game is the core of the system which deals with the armies of the Waterloo campaign. To use these scenarios, it is recommended that Warfare in the Age of Napoleon be used. The scenarios will be more adaptable to other battalion level rule systems, too. This supplement will encompass more areas of the Napoleonic period and include new unit types, special rules, and army lists. It will be formatted in a similar fashion as the AOM rulebook scenarios.

The Napoleonic era spans a stretch of time of continuous warfare from 1789 to 1825 (if including the wars of liberation in South America). The scenarios will be battles or parts of battles of selected years of the period.

Let's take a scenario/battle from the 1806 campaign of the French invasion of Prussia: Battle of Saalfeld, where a fast-moving French force runs into a Prussian/Saxon rearguard. The scenario will have a short description of the battle, a color map with deployment, and an order of battle. Included with be army lists specific to the battle and any special rules needed for the scenario. In addition, the army list will often include additional troop types not needed in the scenario so one has the means to do other battles of that campaign.

Many of the battles will be familiar to readers and gamers. The ordes of battle will be as accurate as possible, but note that some 'artistic license' is used in some situations. Many sources are available to the reader and the author does not attempt to be an authority on each battle. A bibliography of sources will be included.

With the addition of this supplement, it is hoped you can enjoy this period and its many fascinating campaigns and battle from the Age of Napoleon. Special thanks to Maurizio Bragaglia and David Webster.

—Description from Dale Wood, 2010
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
publishers: On Military Matters, Tod Kershner's Games

name: Read Between The Wines!
description:
Forget what the bottle says, Read Between The Wines inspires players to write their own creative descriptions with the help of 54 theme cards like, "If this wine had a job, what would it do?" or "Compare this wine to a celebrity." No formal wine knowledge needed - it's full-bodied fun for everyone, from the seasoned connoisseur to the unripened amateur. Your next party or wine-tasting will be ABUZZ with laughter.

RBTW is best played with 4+ people and a 4 different wine samples. Each round introduces a new wine and a new theme card. Players sample the wine & write down their answer to the theme. The wine waiter of the round then reads them all aloud (with Shakesperean drama!) and each player gets one vote for their favorite answer. Each vote equals a point for the player who wrote it!

Play until the wine or creative juices run out... the player wtih the most points at the end of the game is deemed winner and MASTER CONNOISSEUR!

—description from the publisher

name: Jeu de la Mayenne
description:
Jeu de la Mayenne is a board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos also with charades and riddles, which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the department of Mayenne.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among many, La Gravelle, Vaiges, Argentré, Changé, Saint-Jean-sur-Erve...
Travel through the territory and answer questions on different themes.
If the answer is correct, you can play again.

To win, collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 9DKP: Series 1
description:
9DKP is a Trading Card Game (TCG). It has three starter deck options for players new to the game: Zombie, Kat, and Survivor. Each deck plays differently than the others and is composed mostly of the deck's cover faction.

Starter decks also include a paper play-mat that makes learning the game easier, a paper counter to track Health Points and DKP, a custom 6-sided die used by some cards in the game, and a quick start rule book that will tech players the game and provide examples.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Number, Zombies
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Trading

name: Défi Frise: Laval
description:
Défi Frise: Laval, Frieze Challenge: Laval contains 42 cards representing 42 jewels of the city of Laval heritage.

Players take turns placing a card from their hand (of 7 cards) on the table (date face up) trying to reproduce a chronological frieze with the heritage sites cards.
On each card, architectural information and chronological indices are indicated.
The first player who manages to discard all his cards is the winner.

name: Keep An Eye Out
description: Keep an Eye Out is a Living Game with various ways to play. The basic play is a reinvigoration of the classic parlour game “Winking Murder”. One Villain, and three Inspectors. The villain’s goal is to eliminate all other players by winking deliberately without being caught. The inspectors’ goal is to catch the villain in the act, and save everyone else from certain death.

name: Aldira
description:
Aldira is a competitive, strategic card game, which combines a bidding mechanic with deck building. The game is designed by Jakob Emmerling and Benjamin Steiger. It features more than 40 illustrations, of the beautiful jungle and its plants, by Ary Lieberwith.

In this game you are a native of a tiny village deep in the jungle. At this time of the year there is a competition, where you have to get and cultivate special plants and harvest their fruits.

Before each round, the players have to decide which actions they want to take and how much value they give these actions. To do so, each player secretly bid with their hand cards, for the actions.

For harvesting fruits, you get victory points. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jeu de l'Automobile
description:
Jeu de l'Automobile is an antique and simple blast-racing game.

After assembling the models, the paper sheet is placed flat on a table and the characters arranged on the track at the discretion of the players.
By blowing lightly on the wing of the car the player has to drive the automobile to the garage, without overturning the figures and especially the car.
The winner will therefore be the one who knocks down the fewest characters.
A player who causes the car to fall, skips his turn, if it falls into the river that's the end of the game for him/her.

The rule can be changed at the discretion of the players.

name: This That & Everything: America
description:
This That & Everything: America is about all things related to the United States of America. Players race to describe people, places, and things related to America for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less! Be prepared to guess things from Norman Rockwell to North Dakota! Yeehaw!

Contents: 100 Double-Sided Cards, Score Pad, 30-Second Sand Timer, Instructions
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bases, Armies and Decks: Fantasy
description:
Bases, Armies and Decks – Fantasy (also known as “BAD Fantasy”) is a table-top wargame which takes place in a fantasy setting. The game incorporates elements of base building, army roster creation and deck building.

Pregame
Prior to the initiation of a game players must make several strategic decisions. First, the player must choose an allegiance. There are four factions within BAD Fantasy each with their own unique playstyle or specialization: The Order (healing, defense), Infernal Legion (damage, offense), Mortis Cults (undeath, auras) or The Warband (effigies and luck). The player must then choose a Lord to lead their army. Lords are powerful heroes with unique abilities. Depending on the scenario or board size players are given a resource pool to recruit additional units. They must also create a deck of 30 cards which is supplemented by a Mastery system of an additional 10 cards.

Setup
Players roll for first placement. They highest roll goes first placing 5 units or “cubes” (cubes are terrain pieces). They players then alternate back and forth until all the starter cubes and armies are fielded. A second roll then occurs to determine who makes the first move.

Turns
Turns are structured in the following manner for each player:
1. Card Phase 1
a. Rotation of existing cards (cards may have vary durations…the corners of the cards determine the turn length that the effects will remain active)
b. Playing of cards from the hand
2. Board Phase
a. Movement/Building
b. Melee Resolution
3. Card Phase 2
a. Playing of cards from the hand
b. Drawing or holding to end the turn.

The Goal of the Game
A win condition is typically generated by killing the opposing Lord however there are other scenarios available.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Il Gioco del Gran Premio
description:
Il Gioco del Gran Premio, the Game of the Grand Prix is an accurate philological reconstruction of how this type of game was made eighty years ago, respecting materials and techniques of the time.
No plastic ! The cars are made of aluminum alloy, the nuts in enameled wood; paper and cardboard are deliberately opaque and with that slightly rough look of the old print.

Imagine being together with mythical drivers Nuvolari, Varzi, Rosemeyer, Caracciola and Chiron.
The fast Alfa Romeos, the powerful Mercedes and the elegant Bugattis are lined up on the starting grid.

Choose your car, put on a cap, gloves, goggles and get ready for the race.

The game can be customized for clubs and associations (with logo both on the box and on the board)

Content:
The game consists of a board with 34 squares representing the grand prix circuit, two decks of cards, 6 colored cars (inspired by the lines of the 1936 Alfa Romeo 12C) and a die.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Just Add Dice: Cannon Corps
description:
Order your cannoneers to take aim at enemy forces, use your ammo strategically, and avoid incoming cannonballs to claim victory in Cannon Corps.

Each player uses their favorite set of seven standard role-playing dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d10%, d12, d20) on a 4-by-3 battlefield grid, obscuring enemies' view of their area. To start, they secretly place four dice on their highest face as platoons on any of their twelve grid spaces.

Players take turns choosing one of their platoons to fire with and one of the twelve grid spaces to aim at. Any enemy die that's hit suffers subtractive damage equal to the value shown on the firing die, and then has the option to move to any adjacent space. If a die fires with a value of 1, everything it hits is reduced to 0. After a die fires it is reduced by half, rounding down.

A die is removed from the battlefield when it is reduced to 0, and its commander replaces it with one of their three initially unused dice. Players are eliminated when their fourth die is reduced to 0, until just one triumphant commander remains!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid

name: Dansers
description:
Dansers is a connection game where black tries to connect the north and south edge, and white tries to connect the east and west edge.

Players take turns placing two balls of each colour on the board, which must touch at the end of placement.

—description from the designer

name: Sabermetrics
description:
Sabermetrics is a 2-player baseball game, utilizing dice-rolls and mathematics to simulate pitching and hitting, with built in events for stealing bases, picking runners off, and double- and triple-plays. Baseball is a numbers game - and so is Sabermetrics! Battle it out with your opponent over 9 innings in this race for the pennant. Still hungry for more? Why not make it a double-header!

In Sabermetrics, player 1 starts on the mound, pitching three six-sided dice (two white, one green). Multiply the two white dice together, and then determine if you want to add the green value (for a fastball), or subtract the green value (for a change-up). That's your pitch number!

Player 2 next rolls the three dice, and uses standard PMDAS (parentheses, multiplication, division, addition, subtraction) to mathematically match the pitch number. If they can match exactly, that's a single! Calculate exactly twice the pitch number, and that's a double. Exactly three times - a triple. Within 1 - well, that's a ball (good-eye). Within 2 - that's a strike. Not even within 2?! That's an out! Not even half is a double-play, and not even a third is a triple play (assuming you have baserunners). Three outs ends the top of the first, and players switch roles (as well as rolls), to start the bottom of the inning. Roll three-of-a-kind as a pitcher, pick a runner off. Roll three-of-a-kind as a hitter, steal a base.

After nine innings, the player with the most runs wins -- still tied? Head to extra innings! Ever winning by 10 or more at the bottom of an inning? That's a slaughter rule, take the win, hit the showers early.

There are cubes to track the score, the pitch count, the innings, and the outs. This game can also be tracked with a standard baseball scorecard sheet as well -- but it's much more fun to use meeple baserunners!

-description from designer

name: Nume
description:
Nume is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons with sides alternating in length between n and n + 2 cells. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color and a pen to write on them.



DefinitionsA group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color.

The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

The price of a group is the highest number obtainable by selecting, from that group, a stone that has a number written on it and computing the absolute value of the difference between that number and the size of that group.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell. If this stone creates a new group, write a whole number on it.

The game ends when the board is full. The player with the lower score in the final position wins. Your score is the sum of the prices of all your groups on the board, plus a komi when applicable.



KomiThe komi is the number of points which is added to the score of one of the players to offset turn order advantage. To avoid ties, the value of komi must be of the form n + 0.5, where n is a whole number.

Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi and which side will receive it, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value and recipient side for all games. A half-point komi for Black is suggested as a default value.



VariantsSquare: Played on the intersections of a square grid. In the definition of group, "adjacent" means only "orthogonally adjacent". To avoid mirror play, either use an odd-sized board or always give a komi to Black.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Predictive Bid, Tile Placement

name: Departo 44: Devenez le meilleur guide de Loire-Atlantique
description:
Departo 44: Devenez le meilleur guide de Loire-Atlantique lets you become the best guide in the "Loire-Atlantique" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

Take a coach trip through the Loire-Atlantique department and answer questions,
For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
The winner is the first guide to be back


Contents:

1 game board
500 question cards
36 Stages cards
4 wooden coaches with 6 passenger spaces.
24 pins representing the passengers.
1 wooden dice
1 ruleset
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Departo 49: Devenez le meilleur guide du Maine-et-Loire
description:
Departo 30: Devenez le meilleur guide du Maine-et-Loire lets you become the best guide in the "Maine-et-Loire" department through questions about history, geography, culture...

Gameplay:

Take a coach trip through the Maine-et-Loire department and answer questions,
For every correct answer a passenger gets in the bus,
Collect 9 "Stage" cards,
Once the bus is full of tourists and the 9 "Stage" cards are gathered, the player-guide must go back to its start
The winner is the first guide to be back


Contents:

1 game board
500 question cards
36 Stages cards
4 wooden coaches with 6 passenger spaces.
24 pins representing the passengers.
1 wooden dice
1 ruleset
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Suits: Cthulhu
description:
Medieval knights clashed to prove their bravery, courage and to impress rich and (sometimes) beautiful women. The Middle Ages are a relict of the past, but men are still men afterall and they still want to prove their superiority. So, what is the most reliable and effective way to distinguish a nobleman from a peasant? Oh yes! Duel! Instead of wearing full plate armor they wear equally charming elegant suits. Instead of fighting on the tournament arena, they meet in the underground of secret club called The Suits. Join this elite society and fight for your prestige and ...........*


) Enter your deepest and darkest desire that you want to fight for (or die for, but it wasn't in the agreement)


And remember that the first and last rule of The Suits Club is - you do not talk about The Suits Club.

This season is different. Why? Because this time female characters are entering to the club.

This is the 5th season of the Suits. This time memmers of the club will face dark cultist, creatures from the deepest nightmares and Cthulhu himself. For the first time players will have option to play multiplayer game. Three against one. In the box players will find three new characters that can be mixed with those from other seasons and Ancients Ones from the H.P. Lovecraft's novels.

Each character has his own unique deck of cards. By using your wits, tactics, strategies and of course, a little bit of luck you can show your enemies who is the real gentleman. The Suits is a fast-paced, two-person card game steaming with atmosphere and tactical depth.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Battle of Bunker Hill: June 17th 1775
description:
This is a battle that has fascinated players over the years and this game is a real challenge for them. It shows the bravery and doggedness of the British against the abilities of the fledgling Americans Rebels. In their leaders, Howe must attempt to overwhelm the enemy, while Prescott had to organise a defence against them out of nothing. To achieve this, we have written a set of rules to showpiece the distinctive way this battle was fought.
Each side has a unique set of circumstances and using miniature forces on hexes, manoeuvreing, dice rolls, fire and melee the players must face the problems the leaders of the actual battle had to overcome. In this particular case, the Regular British Line must overpower the semi trained Revolutionary Militia of 1775 in their defensive terrain.
The core of the game is aimed at the players, this means that all players should be involved throughout the game. Not having to wait until one player has finished all their moves and firing. The action should be continuous for all players. Just because you have the best soldiers you should not automatically win. The game should be enjoyable and everyone should have a chance to win.

A set of rules that showpieces the distinctive way this battle was fought and highlights the bravery and doggedness of the British against the emerging abilities of the fledgling American Rebels. Lead the American Militia to defend the works on Breeds Hill or send your doughty British Regulars into attack again and again! The fate of a nation is your hands, its your choice.

Game Inventory:
Orders of Battle
Playsheet
10.5" x 7.5" Map
Battle Briefing
11 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Battle of Cropredy Bridge: June 29th 1644
description:
This is a classic English Civil War battle with the Parliamentarians trying to seize an opportunity by catching the Royalist army on the march towards Oxford. Led by the King the Royalist army responded quickly with the ensuing battle playing out over a large area, in three phases and with a similar amount of Horse and Foot.

Presented as a “mini-campaign” using a multiple boards approach used in the original Little Bighorn game.

Cavalry charges, infantry stands and desperate defences are hallmarks of this battle.

Game Inventory:
Orders of Battle
Playsheet
10.5” x 7.5” map
Battle Briefing
11 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Fire and Move: Armour
description:
Fire and Move is a game about “tanks” – it’s that simple. It’s fun to play and easy to set up with uncomplicated systems. This game is fast and involves everyone.

To us, Rules for Playing Battles are aimed at players, this means that all players should be involved throughout the game. The action should be continuous for all players and everyone should have the chance to win. Just because you have the best tank, with the best armour and a bigger gun, you shouldn’t automatically win.

We chose to focus on the things that can happen quickly in combat and by speeding these elements up we moved the game along at pace. The concept for this game is to play the game in quite small areas (12 x 12 hexes) and be quick to play.

It is about Troops and Platoons of tanks working together in games with Companies and Platoons, Squadrons or Troops.

Game Inventory:
Map Notes
Tank Table
Playsheet
Scenario
16 page rules booklet

Printed and downloadable versions available.

-description from publisher's website

name: Blarney Stones
description:
Blarney Stones is a betting game. The board has 10 spaces with a 3 letter word on each. The words all begin with P, end with either T or N, and have vowels as middle letters. 3 D6 letter dice are thrown to make one of the words on the board. One die has all Ps, but includes a different number on each face. The second has either an N or a T. The third has the five vowels and a blank. Before the dice are thrown, players bet on which word will come up. They may bet multiple chips on one word or more. (The chips are all one color, so players need to note how many they played on each word.) The dice thrower is the banker who does not bet. The banker pays the winner(s) the chips they bet multiplied by the number showing on the P die, but collects the chips from the non-winning spaces. Should a blank be thrown on the vowel die, the banker pays all players, but only chip for chip. When this occurs, the banker position rotates to the player on the left.

Interestingly, no win condition is stated, though one, such as last man standing, can easily be made up.

name: SINS: Spawn of Minions – Trilogy Box
description:
SINS is a deck-destructor and a highly competitive game. It’s built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Both attacking and defending will cost you deeply and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage.
Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit and fight back when your opponent is exhausted.
Each battle pack of cards has a specific sin and each sin has a unique set of principles, which can either form or change your strategy as you play through the game.

SINS: Spawn of Minions introduces 3 different themed battle packs focus around the sins of envy, sloth and lust which supports 2-6 players.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: King's Eye
description:
You have languished for what feels like an eternity in the prison of an unjust king, but today your sentence has been adjusted to fit his fancy. He has demanded your participation in a grueling set of trials against the foulest creatures in the kingdom. The deal is simple: Survive the test and the king will grant your freedom. In order to maximize the king's enjoyment, you will not be alone and you will be allowed time to prepare.

King's Eye is a cooperative, drafting battle simulator for 2-4 players. Choose a character, draft a deck full of upgrades and equipment, and battle through 7 waves of mobs.

King's Eye is played in 2 major phases. In phase 1, players draft upgrade decks in a traditional pass drafting format using 3 "packs" of 9 cards per player from the 120 included upgrade cards. These cards improve character stats and add new abilities/actions that players will be able to utilize in phase 2. At the end of the draft, players have a 27 card deck full of exciting enhancements with which to power-up their character.

Phase 2 is a cooperative battle through 7 waves of mobs. Each round a number of mobs equal to the number of players joins the battle, players take their turns, and then any remaining mobs take their turns. The 7 waves are split into 3 waves each of basic and intermediate mobs, followed by a boss mob wave at the end. Throughout the wave battle, players are becoming stronger and stronger as they seek to stay alive and dispatch the enemies. Once the boss mobs arrive, players have 3 rounds to clear all enemies. Any player that is still alive after all of the enemies have been defeated shares the victory, earning their freedom and the joy that comes from seeing the shock in the King's Eye.

On your turn, you draw a card from your upgrade deck and choose a card in your hand to play. Then you can choose 2 actions to perform from you list of available actions. Everyone has certain action options: draw a card, play a card, perform a basic attack. Each character, and many upgrade cards offer additional action options for players to utilize.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: Candidate
description:
Candidate is a two-player loosely-themed abstract game played on a 5 x 5 grid. Each player has a set of the same 5 pieces in their own color. There are 3 types of pieces; 1 candidate, 2 party, 2 media. These pieces are square, with numbers along each edge. The game begins with each player's set against that player's side of the board with the orientation and placement of each piece as described in the instructions. In the course of the game, the players try to move all their pieces to the opposite side of the board with the first one doing so winning the game. In a turn, one piece is moved one space or rotated 90° during each move. When a piece from one player is moved adjacent to one of the other, an Overpowering Move occurs, where the piece having the higher number on the touching side allowing that player to push the opponent's piece one space in any direction.

—user summary

name: Potato Kingdom Saga: Hot Crown
description:
Times are tough in Potato Kingdom. Kings of the Tater realm are in the midst of a terrible uprising. The one true Crown now only brings cursed existence to its bearer whilst the starch is still spilled on the slightly acidic PH battlefields.

In Hot Kings up to 5 players are vying for control of the Potato Kingdom. The Crown deals damage to those who wear it, and as each player draws cards which can alter not only their own stature in the realm with a growing Keep of loyal subjects and siege weapons to defend and attack, but also control the Crown and use diplomacy and politics to overcome their opposing Kings.

Will you attempt to build a strong wall of Tater people and hope your adversaries destroy each other, or will you play the unpredictable manic King and warp the battlefield turn by turn in this frantic, push your luck game of potato elimination.

Games are quick and easy to learn, and fit into any family or friend gathering as a party game to see who is really on your side.

It's hot potato like you've never played!

—description from the designer

name: The Colonisationing
description:
We've harnessed the power to travel through space and visit other planets. We've started building small civilisations on them, and harvesting their sciences and resources. Oh, and we can all strap giant rockets to them and blast them into different galaxies.

It's up to you as the mogul of your star-colonising enterprise to build the most powerful star system humankind has ever seen. In The Colonisationing up to 4 players try and shift high scoring planets into their own system against each other's own huge rockets and strategic buildings to get their secret objectives completed.

You can increase the stats of planets by building huge structures on them to grant yourself bonuses. You want to be the next big science mojo? build labaratoriums. Do you want your planets to be the most habitable planets ever discovered and become huge tourist destinations? Go for it.

Be ever mindful though that at any point your nemesis space entrepreneurs can steal those planets right from under your nose by the power of Whopping Great Rockets™

The game features an unknown end game so players are always on their feet not knowing when the last turn will be, as well as hidden objectives to grant potentially game altering winners.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Exploration, Space Exploration
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Slide/Push

name: Mosaic Quo
description:
Mosaic Quo is a Mosaic set exclusively for four players. It's played the same as the base game, but it has four sets of distinctly colored pieces on the same 7x7 board.


Starting with the first player, place your pieces one by one in the empty hole of the game board.
If four pieces are lined up in the smallest square shape adjacent to each other, pieces can be placed on them.
If four frames are arranged in a square, and three or four of the four are occupied by the same color, the frame of that color is automatically placed on it (apart from the turn).
The piece fixed from the beginning to the center of the game board becomes a neutral piece which is not that of either player. When a square containing neutral frames is created, frames are automatically placed on top of the square only if the remaining three frames have the same color.
Automatically placed pieces will create new squares, and if 3 or 4 of the squares are occupied with the same color, pieces will be placed automatically as well. In this way, pieces are stacked in a chain reaction. The pieces to be stacked may not only be the pieces of the active player, but also the pieces of the opposing player.
In this way, the person who put the piece in turn alternately and who finished all his pieces first wins.


—description from publisher

name: Mosaic Mini
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Mosaic Mini is a non-authorized version of Upper Hand.




Mosaic Mini has a 5x5 board and fewer pieces, but it is otherwise the same as the larger 7x7 edition Mosaic.

The game is functionally identical to Margalith Akavya's Upper Hand.

name: Choose Happiness @ Work
description:
Choose Happiness @ Work is a fun way to learn about the science of happiness and each other. Get your team talking, laughing and solving real-world workplace problems. Learn science-based strategies to use again and again, to boost happiness, increase productivity, and encourage a culture of collaboration and innovation.

Here's how it works:

Players take turns being the Executive, who picks a common workplace problem.
Others advocate for the best science-based solution from their hand, making informative, creative or humorous pitches.
The Executive awards points for both the best solution and the most creative or funniest.
mechanics: Player Judge, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fray: Into the Tassradan Trail
description:
Journey into the Tassradan Trail is the first expansion for Fray (Smunchy Games). With it, we’re adding three new suits featuring new abilities that can damage and move units. We’re incredibly excited about movement in particular—which opens up new combos and opportunities at every stage in the game. The Tassradan Trail keeps the basic rules of Fray, but the way it’s played is wholly changed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Zone of Control

name: Pays de Brocéliande: Le jeu !
description:
Pays de Brocéliande: Le jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Pays de Brocéliande.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice, from Bécherel to Plélan-le-Grand via Montauban-de-Bretagne, Montfort-sur-Meu, Saint-Méen-le-Grand or many more.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

name: SaintCards: Doctors of the Church Expansion
description:
SaintCards: Doctors of the Church Expansion adds 28 new cards to the SaintCards base game of and completes the collection of all 36 Doctors proclaimed in the Latin Rite of the Catholic Church.

This expansion adds a fun twist with three new strategic choices: When you play a Doctor of the Church, you collect your Treasures as normal. You then may immediately take the top card from the deck and either keep it, give it to another player, or place the card back on tope of the deck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Religious, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Move Through Deck, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Shockwave
description: Up to four players compete to shoot white marbles up plastic ramps into a central square compartment. The box has nine red marbles in the center in a 3x3 grid. This grid is surrounded by three spaces on each of the four sides (forming a 4x4 grid with pillars for the corner spaces to hold the top of the compartment) for each player to shoot their marbles into. The red marbles in the center function as a shock transmitter to push other player's marbles from their spaces. The first player to get all their three marbles into the spaces wins.

name: Calimala: Конклав
description: When contribuing resources to a church you can spend one extra cube to bribe a cardinal in Rome. When churches score during the game the player with most cardinals receives an extra point.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Just Add Dice: Roll & Fight
description:
The tensions have boiled over at this televised baking competition after the trash talk went too far. Now it's time to put down the whisk and put up your dukes. No one insults your cinnamon rolls. No one!

2-4 players each grab their favorite set of seven standard role-playing dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d10%, d12, d20) and start by rolling all of them. Those seven dice are their bakery crew, from which they will secretly pick one chef to throw a cinnamon roll (Roll) or throw a punch (Fight) each round.

Everybody reveals their choices, then the players who chose Roll get to pick one chef to be rerolled. But beware; chefs on Fight can get a bonus reroll if picked! The highest result wins and claims all of the round's chefs as points.

However, if everyone chose to Roll, each chef is rerolled once instead. Or if everyone chose to Fight, then the bravest and lowest result wins outright. After seven rounds of flying fists and pastries the bakery with the most points wins!

-description from designer

name: Pocket Quiz: Unnützes Wissen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions about bizarre facts that are as useless as they are entertaining.

The title translates to "Useless Knowledge".

name: Black Stories Junior: True Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: True Stories are exciting and true stories full of secrets and riddles. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

name: Star Meeples
description:
You did it, you finally got command of your very own starship. Sure it’s not one of the new hyper-advanced shiny ships, and yes your crew is mostly new recruits straight out of the academy, but it’s all yours!

In Star Meeples you compete against the other players to become the best captain and score the most points at the end of 6 rounds.

The core of Star Meeples is the Crew Queue, that’s a twist on traditional deck/bag building games. You can always see all the meeples in your queue, all neatly arranged in a vertical line.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Clearing
description:
In “Clearing”, you play face-up face cards, your characters, next to each other while using the number cards in your hand, your resources, to remove the enemy cards that try to surround them. If your continuous group of face cards, your crew, is completely surrounded by enemy cards, the game ends in a loss. After the entire deck is drawn and the final enemy cards are placed, if your crew is not completely surrounded, you win. To succeed in “Clearing”, you’ll need to strategically extend your crew with additional characters while using your resources to keep them from being overwhelmed.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Enclosure, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Die Reise nach Jerusalem!
description: The players start their journey on 4 different locations. Movement is determined by a die. The players have three tries to roll the number indicated on the next space to advance to this space. If a player rolls a 1 he may not move at all, all other players may advance 1 step. The first player to reach Jerusalem wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cover Your Asps
description:
In Cover Your Asps, players navigate the newly discovered Egyptian temple of Ombi Quadi to collect the treasures hidden within its inner chamber.

Cobra-like snakes called asps are the guardians of the temple. Asps are ready to attack from myriad snake pits. These pits are surrounded by quicksand, which is impenetrable by foot.

Use planks to build platforms to cover the quicksand and pits and get to the inner chamber. Navigate your pathways around granite slabs that raise and lower to block your path.

Reach the center of the temple and escape with a valuable treasure, but beware of the scorpion which your opponent will unleash. Play in rounds until all treasures have been recovered. Each round has three phases:
Build, Collect, Escape.

Four antechambers allow up to four players to compete against each other.

Configurable game board for a variety of challenge levels.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Самара Монополия
description:
Самара Монополия, Monopoly Samara is a local version of Monopoly set in the city of Samara.
Players acquire cultural, industrial, entertainment and sports facilities and raise rents through upgrades.
Own the Progress RKC, the Zhigulevsky brewery, the Rossiya confectionery, the Skat shopping and entertainment center and even the Kirovsky market.
It includes 60 bonus and penalty cards (lottery, bank, authorities) ironically reflecting the city explicit and hidden economic processes.
Try not to go bankrupt while fixing all the roads!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Universal Elements
description:
In Universal Elements, two or more players race against each other to forge our solar system by combining the five basic elements (Water, Air, Fire, Earth, and Dark). The first player(s) to forge all celestial bodies on a Star Map wins.

After each round of forging, players are affected by a new Chaos card. There's no telling what's out there! Often helping players that are behind, these Chaos cards keep the game interesting for beginners and experienced players alike.

This game is good for sharpening memory and dynamic math skills. The space theme is consistent throughout, and conveys a wealth of space knowledge through play.

—description from the publisher

name: Господин Великого Новгорода
description:
Господин Великого Новгорода ("Lord Veliky Novgorod"), is a monopoly-type board game played on a map of Veliky Novgorod, divided into the main areas of the cities, with local businesses.

The goal of the game is to purchase land, then build and finally earn money from the rent.

The winner is the player who avoids bankruptcy.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kingdom of Italy
description:
RECREATE ITALY’S SOCIAL REVOLUTION (1861 - 1945)

As a powerful leader during Italy's tumultuous social revolution (1861-1946) wisely choose leaders, causes, and adapt to your opponent's tactics to win. Support Italy's King, Pope, and Prime Minister to gain control of a newly unified Italy. Devise clever strategies for creating your political, economic, and military power base. Grow your power by adding cities and their resources, appointing political leaders, and leading military attacks.

BUT BEWARE!

Enemies may implement their own military, political, or economic strategies to exploit your weaknesses. Allies may turn into enemies, deposing your leaders, instigating revolts in your cities, taking your income and might.

Kingdom of Italy realistically reenacts the turmoil and tactics from Italy’s past - bringing a totally new level of competitiveness to card games. Diplomacy, risk-taking, military planning, deception, and a sudden turn of fortune are all viable approaches for gaining the upper hand.

COURSE OF PLAY

Players seek to become the dominant faction in Italian politics and society through building and managing a tableau of allied Cities with attached Leaders, Military Forces, Spies, and Resources, represented by cards. Players are each dealt a hand of cards and take turns playing Cities and attaching other cards to them as allowed, drawing additional cards at the end of each turn. Players can potentially switch Cities' alliances through the influence of Leaders or seize them by force through military campaigns resolved through a combination of card and dice play. The game ends once all cards are drawn. The winner is determined based on total points scored in their tableau with different cards having different values.

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Doomwolf
description:
A new monster card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

Damage: 1
Title: Doomwolf
Hit Points: 10
Text Box: When Doomwolf deals damage to a player, each player also discards a card.
Threat: 2
Faction: Beasts
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Dragon Breath Ale
description:
A new item card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

Damage: White die
Title: Dragon Breath Ale
Type: Physical
Text Box:
Combat ability: Splash yellow die
Cleanup icon: Retire Dragon Breath Ale.
Recuitment Cost: Copper Coin
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Монополия: Казань
description:
Монополия: Казань, Monopoly Kazan is a local version of Monopoly set in the city of Kazan in the Russian Republic of Tatarstan.

To win in Tatarstan, like anywhere else, do not get bankrupted!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Vulture Capital
description:
In Vulture Capital, you try to dump your junk assets into the open market. Taking cards is usually bad, so the object is to take as few cards as you can.

Players play several rounds, making blind bids that capture other cards, whether you want them or not! Each card you capture is one negative point (regardless of its rank) — unless you capture a full set (all the cards in one rank) in which case it's worth positive points equal to its rank.

The player with the highest score wins.

[Vulture Capital originally appeared as the "Venture" variant in PAIRS: Professor Elemental. Rights reverted back to the designer Daniel Solis.]
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Delayed Purchase, Turn Order: Auction

name: Mixamino
description:
In this game of logic, the players position the ants side by side, but beware... it isn't always easy to find your way around this ants' nest...

The aim of the game is to get as many ants on the 9x9 garden board as possible.

The game:
The player on his/her turn places one card adhering to the following rules:
- The card must connect to an already played card, the ants must connect.
- The card should not cover an anthill.
- The card must fit within the 9x9 board.

Then it's the next player's turn.

If one player is unable to place a card, the other player can continue until none of the players can play a card.

At the end of the round the players count the squares of the cards in front of them that have not been played. The player with the lowest number of squares wins a "points won" card.

The first player to have won 3 "points won" cards wins the game.

name: Mackinaw
description:
Mackinaw is a perfect information two-player abstract game where players stack and trap tokens while they try to move their pieces to the other side of the board. It is a variable board size game, the most accessible sizes being a 3x6 grid (9 pieces per side) or a 4x8 grid (16 pieces per side). Its closely related to checkers/draughts and can be played with flat tokens.

The object of the game is to move your pieces to the the other player's starting position (one piece in each square on the other side of the board). Players take turns moving one piece one space at a time, either forwards, left, or right, but not backwards or diagonal. You cannot undo a move you did on your last turn. Your piece may move on top of other pieces. The pieces underneath are trapped and cannot move until freed when the piece above moves off. If you have an available move you must take it, you cannot pass your turn. If you cannot move, your opponent may keep moving until a move becomes available. Once a piece passes the mid-line and lands in the opposite side of the board with no pieces beneath it, it is 'home' and cannot be moved again. The first player to get all their pieces 'home' wins the game.

Mackinaw was invented in 2019 by Tom Sutton, a Canadian animator and artist. It's name comes from the Ontario slang word for a checkered flannel coat; the first versions of the game were played with dark and light wooden blocks and often resembled the same pattern.

name: Pocket Pixel Artist
description:
Welcome to Retro Game Jam. The annual pixel platformer design competition. Do you and your team have what it takes to design a retro game in under half an hour? well let's see you put your skills to the test!

In Pocket Pixel Artist, teams will compete against each other through a series of design challenges to see who can design and assemble the best pixel art graphics they can for a game jam submission!
