Against the clock, and only using small colored cubes, you must arrange them into 1 of 4 various game assets found on each card. (220 in total) if your team can correctly identify your creation you will gain points!

—description from the designer

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile
description:
Trivial Pursuit: Édition Protection Civile: is a French edition published on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the French Civil Protection (FNPC), a French humanitarian and first aid voluntary association.

Goal: be the first player to fill his pie-collector and go back to start position
Gameplay: move around (dice) and score points (cards)
Good/bad answers: if a player answers correctly, he/she gets to roll the dice again, if not, guess what...

Small size edition containing 330 questions / answers in 6 categories:

Paris
PSC1 (prévention et secours civiques de niveau 1 basic first aid training
Histoire - FNPC (Fédération Ntionale de Protection Civile) - French Civil Protection
PSE Certified First Responder
Mystery
Protection Civile de Paris, the association for Paris, Seine-Saint-Denis and Val-de-Marne
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Don't Judge Me
description:
How well do your friends really know you? Read a question and see if other players can guess how YOU would answer. Questions range from provocative to ridiculous topics that will guarantee to lead to revealing stories.
Hilarious way to find out how much you know and don't know about other players. #dontjudgeme #safespace
Loaded with over 275 questions...play a card, have a conversation!

name: The Game of Rescue
description:
The Game of Rescue is one of a trio of games from Chad Valley's Kompactum Edition, circa 1910.

A simple roll and move sees up to 4 players race from the sea shore to reach a floundering masted boat in rough sea. Along the way the rescue team can be hampered or favoured by landing on specific squares. First to reach the sinking vessel on square 30 is the winner.

The game probably came boxed with two other Chad Valley games being 'Aerial Derby' and 'Loco' as the long narrow board dimension is identical to Aerial Derby and exactly half that of Loco. The other two games are listed separate.

—user summary

name: Loco
description:
The Game of Loco is one of a trio of games from Chad Valley's Kompactum Edition, circa 1910.

A simple roll and move sees players leave one of three railway stations in London and race through the English towns and countryside to finish in Edinburgh. Along the way the players can be hampered or favoured by landing on specific squares. First to reach Edinburgh is the winner.

The Kompactum Edition version of this game probably came boxed with two other Chad Valley games being 'Aerial Derby' and 'Rescue' as the board dimension is exactly double that of 'Aerial Derby' and 'Rescue. The other two games are listed separate.

—user summary

name: Kreuz und quer
description:
The players place their meeples on the starting spaces of their color (or colors). The goal of the game is to reach the starting spaces across the board. Friendly players move in opposite directions, while the opponents move sideways. Movement is one space straight ahead. Opponent meeples may be thrown out and then have to start anew. Friendly meeples may be simply jumped over. The first player to get all his meeples on the destination spaces wins the game.

—user summary

name: Svago Mania: Campioni d'Europa – La Finale
description:
Campioni d'Europa: La Finale is a football simulation with magnetic players and metallic balls.

Flick to move, push to shoot !

Attackers can move, pass or shoot.
Defenders can move, attempt to tackle, or, for the goalie, try to save goals.

name: BushPoo
description:
Play the third most popular locally created game in Darwin Australia!
You and your group of fellow travelers have spent a glorious day of climbing together, but now that you have reached the halfway point to the top of Mt Magnificent you have a huge problem.

That Big Breakfast you all enjoyed before setting out? Well the beans were a bit dodgy, and now everybody in the group needs to do a poo urgently.

Luckily there is a public toilet at the top of the mountain, but now you and your friends are going to have race to the top because if you don’t make it to the toilet in time you’re going to have to do a ...BushPoo!

In Bush Poo you and up to three of your friends will compete to be the first to the Golden throne at the top of the mountain.
Each turn you will be able to choose between moving one space, or moving two spaces, but be careful. When you move two spaces you must discard two cards from the deck of poo cards, and this can cause the game to end before anyone gets to the top!

When the Poo deck is down to the last five cards the game can end at any moment, because hidden in those last five cards is the poo explosion card! When the poo Explosion card is drawn the game ends, and the player that drew that card looses 5 points!
However, If you’re the first to make it to the golden toilet, and nobody draws the poo explosion card the Game ends and you get 10 points!

But that’s not the only way to get points and win the game. Look out for the leaf collection spaces. Whenever you move your pawn to a leaf collection spot you can draw the indicated number of leaf tokens from the token bag.

But Watch out, because you might draw a poo token! That means you must take a card from the poo card deck. Many of these cards are bad luck. some of the cards are helpful, and some of them are just fun.

-description from designer
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Track Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Conference
description:
Like the famous Kalah or bean game, Conference is a game for two. The game is played in the box with a casino made of velvet-covered plastic. The "beans" consist of 36 wooden discs that are embossed on one side with a coat of arms.

—user summary

name: Jet + Boccia
description:
The two games of skill "Jet" and "Boccia" are included. "Boccia" is the famous French national game "Boule" brought to the gaming table. The game is played with a plastic figure, one arm of which is movably attached to roll the ball across the fairway to the target ball. With "Jet" it is important to roll your balls with the throwing figure into fields with as many points as possible.

—user summary

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Gnome Gunner
description:
A new item card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

Damage: 0
Title: Gnome Gunner
Type: Physical
Text Box:
Now ability: Snipe green die
Anytime ability: + Hero
Recruitment Cost: Silver Coin
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Elbűvölő Magyarország Junior
description:
A version of the famous Glamorous Hungary quiz game for younger children! We recommend the game from the age of 7

How well do you know your homeland? Lots of little things are subconsciously built from our culture into our personalities, but there are even more things worth knowing about our home with a thousand faces! Here is a great opportunity to discover Hungary and stand out from the others with your knowledge, gaining the glorious victory! Test yourself on 6 different topics, answer correctly and pocket the points! Quiz up!

Sit down with the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

name: Trumpopoly: The Geopolitical Board Game
description:
An exciting new game in which you collect electors, buy states and collect electoral votes to win the White House.

The game features intelligently designed board squares along with two types of cards. VOTE cards are pulled at every turn, resulting in gain or loss of electors. MAGA cards have various social and political circumstances which affect your candidate.

The game rules intelligently integrate the game elements in a way that creates levels of decision making. This includes buy no buy decisions for states, strategy for dice rolls and decisions about swing states

The game includes funny plot twists like getting a “Rudy” card to avoid an indictment and creatively designed elector dollars festooned with electoral colleges members. Future plans include expansion packs for each election, including cards designed around the political social climate and events of that time.

—description from the publisher

name: Hats On
description:
This is a simple children's dice game. Move around a board to acquire clothes and be the first person to dress a figure.

Players select an underwear clad male or female two dimensional figure and must add six pieces of clothing: shirt; trousers/skirt/shorts; sock; shoes; sweater; and a hat.

The game comes with multiple clothing variants, as well as a blank template for users to create their own.

—user summary

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Cherbourg & St. Lô, Normandy part II
description:
Firestorm: Cherbourg & St. Lô covers the US Sector of the Normandy campaign.

Firestorm campaigns give players the opportunity to play Flames Of War games in a larger context and give every game a greater meaning.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Közlekedj biztonságosan!
description: The game draws attention to the facts, that for your safety on the streets, you need to be patient, advised, attentive and make the right decisions.

name: Diceberg Alley
description:
Diceberg Alley is a route building, “push your luck” strategy game.

Theme:

Canada’s famous “iceberg alley” is now partly frozen. Form an expedition to navigate among icebergs and safely collect newly discovered, valuable “dicecubes”.

Roll dice, make paths from frozen ice sheets, avoid dangerous denizens and climb icebergs to collect "dicecubes". Gather the most “dicecube” points to win.

Lasercut Components:

• 30 interlocking wooden game boards
• 30 icebergs (wooden or acrylic)
• Four sets of 30 polyomino ice sheets (wooden or acrylic)
• 30 acrylic “dicecubes”
• Four explorer meeples
• 30 destination cards
• 20 action cards
• Two polar bears, one narwhal, one giant walrus
• pair of dice.

Setup

• shuffle the game boards
• interlock all or most of the game boards in any interesting combination
• take turns randomly inserting all of the icebergs
• give each player a set of coloured ice sheet tiles and their matching explorer meeple
• players place their explorer on the iceberg nearest them numbered 1-9
• shuffle all of the destination cards and action cards
• optionally take five destination cards and remove their respective icebergs from the gameboard
• give each player three to five primary destination cards in secret
• give each player one action card
• each player places any one of their ice sheets adjacent to their explorer
• with the dicecubes upside down, randomly place one on each unoccupied island

Game Play

Basically, you will roll dice, build routes and collect dicecubes. Roll two dice to build your route or roll one die to either move or collect. Otherwise play your action card.

When building your route:
• roll both dice
• grab an ice sheet that has the same number as on one of the dice
• lay the ice sheet next to an existing ice sheet with the other die roll number such that both numbers are adjacent
• if you rolled doubles, see double roll rules below
• stack ice sheet segments as necessary to be at the same level as the top of an iceberg.

When moving your explorer:
• roll a single die and move your explorer
• keep rolling until the explorer can reach an iceberg
• when adjacent to an iceberg and on the same level, flip over its dicecube
• an explorer cannot move within range of any animal

Using your action card:
• played to thwart your opponent. An example is move the walrus to the nearest [die roll] ice sheet
• maintain one action card at all times - can be exchanged in lieu of a turn.

Ending the Game

Upon the last dicecube being obtained, everyone reveals their cards and counts their treasure points. The person with the most points wins. The youngest wins any tie.

Climbing Icebergs

In order to collect the dicecube, the explorer must stack one or more ice sheet segments in steps to be level with the top of the iceberg. Your explorer can then step onto the iceberg to collect its dicecube. To stack, roll both dice - one number on the ice sheet segment must match the number on the ice sheet segment beneath. The tallest iceberg needs two staggered steps to be level with its top.
 
-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Immer fleißig nach der "30"
description:
Each player has his own game board. If there are more than 6 players, two may play on each game board as a team. The players have to move their cover piece from space 1 to space 30. Movement is determined by a die. The first to reach space 30 wins the game an the first prize, be it money, bear or cigars.
There are six variants to play the game.

In 1919 this game was promoted as the best parlor dice game ever!

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Clash of the Genres
description:
Clash of the Genres is a 2-4 Player versus Player arena battle board game where you fight to achieve a HIGH SCORE. Players will use a shared deck of cards while moving and positioning their pawns on a square grid-based battlefield. Players share the same starting life total and hand size, taking turns until one player has achieved the HIGH SCORE victory point value. There are a wide variety of options to take during a Player's turn; Taking attack actions, adding Equipment, summoning a helpful Ally, or affecting the board with area-of-effect Zones.

The "Genres" represent classic references from media and pop culture. Action, Horror, Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and more are all represented in this tactical Battle Royale. Choose your Player Pawn and jump into the fray to become the Clash Champion!

—description from the publisher
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Grid Movement, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Square Grid

name: Glücks-Würfel + Würfel-Bingo
description:
Glücks-Würfel (2 players)
The game is played on the black and white game board. Each player (black and red) has 4 meeples. The players roll two black dices and a red die. The eyes of the black dice are added and multiplied with the eyes of the red die. If the result is a number printed on the bottom row of the game board, the player places a meeple on this number (red: 4, 6, 9,12; black: 5, 7, 8, 10). If a meeple sits on the bottom row it may be moved to the next row, if a corresponding number is rolled and so on. Each meeple on the 4th (last) row gets the player an extra dice roll per turn. The first player with all 4 meeples on the last row wins the game.

Würfel-Bingo (2-12 players)
Each player may buy 1 or more bingo cards. The players roll two black dice and a red one. The results are determined like in the first game. If a player has the result on his bingo card, he covers the number with a token. The first player to cover 5 numbers in a row shouts "bingo" and wins the game.

—user summary

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Caen: Operation Overlord
description:
Firestorm: Caen focuses on the British and Canadian landings on Gold, Juno and Sword beaches right up to Operation Goodwood. It is a full-sized campaign but has special rules for smaller groups or even a two-player option. There are five turns in all, each named after the major operations for each time period; Neptune, Perch, Epsom, Charnwood and Goodwood. Covering the period between 6 June to 20 July 1944.

Firestorm campaigns give players the opportunity to play Flames Of War games in a larger context and give every game a greater meaning.

Firestorm: Caen is best suited for standard 1000-1500 point games.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Au fil d'une conquête
description:
Discover the Bayeux Tapestry;
Learn about the adventures of Edward the Confessor and Harold, the last Anglo-saxon kings of England but also William, Duke of Normandy, Odon, Bishop of Bayeux and more;
Reconstruct scenes from the tapestry.

'Gameplay

Reach the key places of a medieval conquest, moving through a labyrinth;
To win, you must collect a maximum of cards by defeating the traps and attacks of your opponents;
You will become the hero if you are the first to unite 4 episodes


Discover the Bayeux Tapestry and learn of the adventures of William, Duke of Normandy, and Harold, King of England, as they reconstruct scenes from the tapestry in this game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tribal Souls
description:
Strategic game inspired by Native American legends.
Beautiful mechanics for a game balance that goes beyond even randomness.

1-6 players.
1 hour of play.

The goal will be to dispel the Anamaqkiu and become the most popular tribe of the descendants of Honiahaka (Little Wolf). To do this you will have to find artifacts or get help from the souls of the dead that your tribe will suffer, and invoke so powerful spirits. An "Area Movement" strategic game but with an advanced "Set Collection" heart thanks to multifunctional cards, combined with a "Pattern Building".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Battles For Athelon
description:
Battles for Athelon is an RTS-type game, it takes place in a fantastic world called Athelon where many races coexist, and each one has its own attributes and abilities. Each player must use their actions (which are the workers) to improve their settlement, having to build different buildings that will give them types of units, additional skills and powers to achieve victory, each game has a goal to meet, once it is reached. For this objective the game ends and the point count begins, each building, unit, battle, resource, and other things that are done in the game have a point value; the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Events, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Wild Geese: Living on the Front Line
description:
Wild Geese: living on the front line, Mercenary Units In Action Around The World, 1960’s To The 1990’s.

The life of a mercenary depends upon the accounts you read or your approach to the topic. On one level, mercenary life can seem romantic, an adventure, where often noble Soldiers of Fortune venture forth to save lives, right wrongs and vanquish the evil within our world. On another, mercenary life can appear fraught with danger, hardship and eventual death, with little or no support from uncaring employers. The truth is, the reality can be seen as a blend of these and many other factors. What is known is that mercenaries in one form or another have been instrumental in toppling governments, creating nations and preserving peace / ensuring war across the globe, especially during the post-1945 period and up until the modern day.

The information and rules within this book are designed to reflect the life of a mercenary unit during this tumultuous period within many regions and countries. It blends fact and fiction to create a simple, workable framework within which tabletop units and battles can be created in a range of circumstances.
It is designed to be a skirmish level game using suitable miniatures from 15 to 28mm size, plus buildings, vehicles and other items that are scaled to fit.
Games can represent one-off encounters or be a part of a series of battles, perhaps even a narrative campaign where the units you and your fellow gamers come up with develop over time.

Remember: Get in, get out, get paid -
where the Wild Geese roam, lesser men fear to tread…

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Wargaming the Sugar Islands Campaign: A Guide to the British Expedition to Martinique and Guadeloupe in 1759
description:
Wargaming the Sugar Islands Campaign is a guide to the British Invasion of Martinique and Guadeloupe.

It contains a detailed summary of the events on both islands, the leaders, the forces involved and the islands themselves.

There is information on suitable figures, scenery and rule sets to use and loads of period maps detailing the landing areas and land fought over.

The book also contains 6 scenarios each with a detailed colour layout and with special rules including a simple campaign and special events.

Contents:

Background to the Campaign
The voyage to the Islands
Martinique
Scenarios for Martinique
Guadeloupe
The Actions on Guadeloupe
The End of the Campaign
Aftermath
Scenarios for Guadeloupe
Notes for Wargames
Bibliography


—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dada's Cup
description:
Win the Dada's Cup with your horse racing team consisting of one horse or more horses by competing in the different racing programs (from one to nine depending on the chosen program, flat, obstacle, trot).

During each competition, points are awarded according to the difficulty of the race and the horse's rankings at the finish.

Whichever player obtains the most points accumulated at the end of the last race wins the "Dada's Cup" Trophy.

Contents:

1 board for the racecourse with its track.
12 horse pieces and 12 colored bases.
12 Owner cards representing the horses.
108 Acceleration cards.
2x 6-faced dice.
1 blue Mode dice.
1 red Points dice.

name: UpLinks
description:
UpLinks is a simple polyominoes stacking game for 2 to 4 players plus a solo mode. Sort of like 3D dominoes with dice.

Players roll dice, match, stack and balance polyomino-shaped wooden pieces. Pieces can be linked adjacently or laid on top of another matching piece.

Two pieces must match the die roll. For example, rolling 3-4 means you must align an existing piece with a 3 to a piece with a 4. The two numbers must be either adjacently next to each other or on top of one another.

The challenge is to get rid of all or most of your pieces to win. The player with the lowest value of unplayable pieces wins.

Configurable modes for easy to difficult challenges.
You can play with a 3x3 stack or 5x5 base.

Colourful, precision-lasercut wooden pieces.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Bet Your Word
description:
Bet Your Word is a poker-like word game where you try to make the best-scoring words.

Using letters in your hand and the central one showing, form your best word and bet to see if it is better than that of your opponent(s).

SETUP:
1. Shuffle the cards and place into a draw pile.
2. Give each player an equal number of coins.
3. Give each player five cards to hold in secret.
 
GAME PLAY:
On each turn:
• A player flips over the next card from the draw pile
• Each player antes one “cent”
• Each player attempts to visualize a word using a combination of the central card any number of letters in their hand
• Any player can then bet a coin
• All players who wish to bet their word, must match the bet and can raise their bet as well
• When betting stops, the players reveal their words
• The player with the highest point value gathers all the letters played, all the coins and the central card
• Players can then replace up to five cards from the draw pile
• Players must maintain exactly five cards in their hands

Play continues with the next player on the left.

The game ends when no more cards can be drawn. At this point players add up their coin values and letter values to determine the winner. If there is a tie, the youngest player wins.

Two additional modes are possible.
Solo mode and "Multiple Choice" betting mode.

The game comes with
• 90 A-Z letter and bigram fragment cards
• 50 coins in various cent denominations

The game has two sizes"
2 inch cards in a 2x2x2 box or
full sized deck of 104 cards.

-description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Spelling

name: Count Me In
description:
Welcome to Count Me In, the fast-paced card game for the whole family. Between game-changing rules, cards disappearing, and other players out to get you, you’ll never play the same way twice.

Players compete in a steampunk-style game to get rid of their hand of cards. Cards available are number cards (used to increase or decrease the current count piles), direction cards (used to change the direction of the count), and jump cards (used to change the increase or decrease limit of the count).

On their turn, players will play a card onto one of two count piles in play based on the current limitations of that pile. If a player cannot play a card from their hand, they must draw a card and either play the card drawn or remove a non-starter card in play.

At the end of each round, players gain points based on the cards left in their hand. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points; the player with the lowest score wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Монополия: Курск
description: A revisited version of the classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Kursk in Russia
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: 9DKP: Series 2
description: Series 2 for 9DKP.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Number, Zombies
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Trading

name: 9DKP: Series 3
description:
Series 3 for 9DKP Starter Deck Includes:

1. 40 9DKP cards
2. Dice
3. Counter
4. Paper play mat
5. Instruction Booklet
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Number, Zombies
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Trading

name: 9DKP: Dungeon Series
description: The Dungeon Series for 9DPKP.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Number, Zombies
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Trading

name: Ice Pack
description:
Ice Pack is a dice stacking game where you try to match a pattern and score points in a limited time frame. Each turn you will roll the dice, choose a die and a column to place that die. That die will then push the stack down and alter the alignment of each row. Using the score sheet, you will choose a matching pattern and score accordingly.

For the solo game, the goal is to beat your highest score. In the two player game, whoever has the highest score, wins!

—description from the designer

name: Wieża imprezowa
description: It's the new face of classic Jenga, specially for parties. Rules are very alike - you move wooden blocks out of the tower. Each block contains short task you need to perform. The player who knocks off the tower is the loser and everyone else wins. The losing player has to do the task everyone agreed on before playing the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Contracts
description:
Contracts is a 2-4 player card game where you take on the role of a top international hitman. Your mission is to complete more hits than your competitors to become the most Infamous.

Every hitman has a unique skill so be sure to pick a hitman that compliments your playing style.

Each player has a turn drawing a card, playing an action and potentially attempting an assassination.

Contracts takes around 15-25 minutes to play. Rules are simple to pick up and fun for more advanced board/card game players.

—description from the designer

name: Lille Storm says Hello and Goodbye
description:
Little Storm says Hello and Goodbye is a memory game for the youngest kids in which you can also talk about saying hello or goodbye to various things.

The game comes with 6 themed player boards, so you can just play it as a memory game, or you can also talk with your kids about for example saying hello to a new baby, saying goodbye and hello when moving or even saying goodbye to life itself at a funeral.

Children get the opportunity to put their own words on the game's boards and cards, which deal with situations the children can relate to or prepares children for events or circumstances that may be difficult.

The box contains 6 game boards, 24 cards and game rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: UpTower
description:
UpTower is a block-based tower-building roll-and-write game for any number of players (minimum of two). Play is simultaneous and quick, so there's very little down-time. Because it's a free print-and-play roll-and-write, it's easy for distant players to print their own play sheets and play over video chat.

If you're familiar with the classic Russian block-stacking video game or the board game Coppenhagen, you have a good grasp of how UpTower plays. the goal of the game is to build a tower with the highest, largest floor before the end of the game.

At the start of each turn, one player rolls a die. This die tells all players what piece they must “drop” onto their playfield.

After the die roll, play is simultaneous - You place the rolled piece on your playfield at the same time as all other players. To do this, you’ll mark off one of the four “uses” of that piece on the reference side of your play sheet, then you’ll fill in the spaces where they piece “landed” after you “dropped” onto your playfield from the top edge.

Every turn - before or ater you place the rolled piece - you may place one “at will“ piece. If you do, mark off the “at will” dot for the piece you want to place, then drop it on your board like a rolled piece. You may do this once for each of the six pieces. Note that you get a score bonus (up to 21 points) for your unused “at will” pieces at the end of the game, so choose wisely!

Once everyone’s placed their rolled and at will pieces, roll the die and start a new turn. The game ends when a player reaches the top of the board (the 15th floor) or if you roll the die and that piece has already been used four times.

Your score is your single highest-scoring floor. A floor scores points equal to its level, multiplied by the number of filled spaces on that level – if your 7th floor has 9 filled spaces, it scores (7*9) 63 points. You also score a small-to-moderate bonus for unused "at-will" pieces: 6=21; 5=15; 4=10; 3=6; 2=3; 1=1. High score wins; play another turn if tied.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Puzzle, Video Game Theme

name: Territory the Card Game
description:
Territory is a high fantasy strategy card game where players battle against one another using Champions to help secure their Territories while vanquishing their opponents’ Territories and Champions. Territory is set in a classical fantasy landscape where there are several tribes exploring the surrounding realms they find themselves in: magnificent and ancient landscapes from a past that is long forgotten. Champions will explore realms, seek out Relics, and cast Spells to combat other tribes in their quest to uncover the mysteries of the realm.

Players play the game with a deck consisting of Champion cards, Relic Cards, and Spell cards. Players also have a small separate deck called a 'Territory Deck'. The object of the game is to be the first person to get 18 points. Players get points when they destroy an opponent’s Territory, Relic, or Champion from play.

Territory is a turn-based game where players place champions on their Territories and Relics in between their Territories during their turns. Players also may play Spell cards during their turns which help improve gameplay conditions. During a player’s turn, in a distinct phase called the ‘Combat Phase’, Champions attack their opponents' Territories and Relics.
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Menschlicher Körper
description:
In this trivia card game about the human body, the 3 assistants Kara Körper, Käpt'n Quizzo, and Anett Quartett guide through 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about the human body with 26 different cards.

Trivia game: All players answer questions and score victory points. The player with the most points wins the game.

Card Game

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required. The cards can be combined with any of other Game of the "Tiptoi: Wissen & Quizzen" series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Speedy Party
description:
It's a last-minute costume party among friends, and everyone is rushing to the nearest costume shop. Each person is trying to gather the pieces of their choice before ducking into the fitting room. Let the party begin!

GOAL OF THE GAME

Find all parts for the most costumes in order to accumulate the most points (buttons) after four rounds. A complete costume comprises three cards (costume + headdress + accessory) or a single card for the bumblebee, bunny, and sumo.

HOW TO PLAY

The players count together, "1,2,3" and simultaneously reveal the top card from their stacks, and place it face-up on the table.

If there are no complete costumes visible amongst all the cards, everyone count "1,2,3" and flips a new card, placing it beside the cards already visible. Thus, the number of cards visible gradually increases.

As soon you see a complete costume, tap the bell, and announce the name of the costume you saw. If your answer is correct, you take the three cards that compose this costume, and place them face-up in front of you.

At the end of each round, you earn one button per costume you collected.

Whoever has the most buttons at the end of the fourth round wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: La regata della Repubbliche Marinare
description:
La regata della Repubbliche Marinare is a classic Italian game about the Regatta of the Historical Maritime Republics; a historical race established in 1955 between Amalfi, Pisa, Genoa and Venice.
4 rowing crews from each of the Republic compete against each other.

name: Snehvide Brætspil
description:
A dice racing game. For 42 squares the dwarfs have to get behind to reach Snow White and dodge dangers.

A small kids board game.

A dice is rolled in succession and moved forward accordingly.
If you land on a square that ends in 2, you go back 2 squares. If it ends in 6, you go back 6 spaces.
On the 10, the witch field, is suspended.
On a field, only one dwarf may stand. If it is occupied, you cannot move and remain standing. The goal is to roll the dice exactly on the target field. Whoever succeeds in such a roll, wins.

Scope of play:
1 game board with the forest.
4 game cones
1 dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Catalogne
description:
The Tour of Catalonia is a multi-stage road cycling race held in Catalonia (Spain) .

If the leader is not a climber (Red), it will be a feat to win the Tour of Catalonia.

Profiles adapted to Magnytour

name: Schnellfeur und Stosstaktik: Fast Play Rules for the European Wars of Late 19th Century Europe
description:
Fast play rules for any figure scale or basing system.

Designed to capture the unique features of the late 19th century wars in continental Europe.

New and novel mechanics for handling command and the deployment of artillery.

Includes army lists for the war of 1866.

-description from publisher's website

name: Black Stories Junior: Stadt-Land-Ferien
description:
Before each round, a letter is determined by one player saying "A" out loud and then silently continuing through the alphabet until another player shouts "Stop!". All terms from this round must start with the letter that the first player has just reached. Now the players try to fill in the individual fields of a row as quickly as possible. The first player to find all the terms for that row shouts "Stop!". Then the points for this row are scored. The player who has the most points at the end wins.

—user summary

name: Diagonale
description:
The game board is a small 5x5 square wooden board with 25 peg holes. Each player has ten pegs (red or blue) set up in two rows of five. The central row is pegless.

The objective is to try to get the stones of one color on the places of the other color and vice versa.

The rules (translated from German):

The pegs can move forward and backward
Both colors must alternate
Jumping over and removing pegs is not permitted


It is possible to complete the game in all cases.
Even in the most tricky positions there is still a step on the train.

name: Dominex
description:
Dominex tiles feature two games in one! On the Rainbow side, match spots of colour on the hexagonal dominoes to score the most points. On the Star side, match 3 stars to score. The game is simple to learn, but you can develop complex strategies... that can be thwarted by another player or the luck of the draw!

You can play other classic Domino games with the Rainbow tiles, and even create your own games with both the Rainbow and Star sides.

Dominex was created by a language arts teacher, especially for kids as young as 5 years - with rules simple enough to be taught with no spoken language. The game helps to practice colour and shape recognition, planning and strategy, and spatial reasoning.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Matching, Tile Placement

name: SINS: Celestial Energies – Expansion Box
description:
SINS is a deck-destructor and a highly competitive game. It’s built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Both attacking and defending will cost you deeply and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage. Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit, and fight
back when your opponent is exhausted.

Each battle pack of cards has a specific sin and each sin has a unique set of principles, which can either form or change your strategy as you play through the game.

SINS: Celestial Energies introduces 3 expansion packs for use with any SINS Battle Pack.

Will of Ancients
Surge of Titans
Path of Eternals


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Seitlich Games Party: A Tribute to the Classics and the 7 Variations
description:
Remembering the games from our childhood, a tribute if you may, bringing back the classics with our own spin on it.
From 6 minigames to choose from, compete in the minigame tournament and outplay your opponents. If something seems unfair to you, why not change it? But beware, a change you make at the start might come back to bite you in a later game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Math, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Deduction, Open Drafting, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Rampres Racing Simulation
description:
After qualifying second and making some changes to your car, your pulse quickens as the green flag drops! As you approach turn 1, split-second decisions must be made! You're thinking, "Should I increase Turbo-Boast?...Do I want to draft?...maybe I'll just play it safe for now and not risk spin!"
All of these options and more face a skilled race car driver many times every lap. RAMPRES Racing Simulation one of all these features and more including pit stops, setting up your own car's ability to accelerate, handle, and brake, and worst of all, crashes! Every factor of real racing can be found in this fantastic, life-like racing simulation by RAMPRES.
In this racing simulation, if your decisions and timing are the best of that race, you'll be sitting in the Winner's Circle!

A full-featured Indy-style racing simulation board game that features:

6 Accurately molded indy-type racing cars
1 High-speed racecourse on a multicolor game board (18"x24")
24 Pit Stop Cards
24 Chance Cards
2 Dice
6 Color-coded Pit Markers
1 Official RAMPRES Racing Simulation scoring pad
1 Official Rampres Racing Qualification Chart
Comprehensive Rule and Racing Guide

Preparation: Spend the allotted Factor Points on resources such as Acceleration, Handling, and Breaking.
Either roll or race for qualification. Decide the number of laps you gonna race. And fill in the information on the Scoring Pad.

Head out on the Banked oval and when the checkered flag drops, it's pedal to the metal!
The lead player goes first each round. Carefully plot out your move, with each 10mph of speed equating to one space on the board. Make sure to allow room to maneuver around traffic otherwise you crash... maybe use some advanced breaking, or turbo to zip in and out of traffic. There are 2 places on the track that offer you the option to draw "Chance" cards which are mostly biased towards good results but contain a few bad...
The system contains a rather detailed (but easy to master) drafting system that increases the more cars that are in a line drafting around the Oval.
The first one across the finish the set # of laps on the current round is the winner.
Pit stops also require careful planning and you draw a card to see what happened while you pitted.

Championship Point Series Battles, Advanced qualifications (with real calculated speed results), Turbo Boost, Hot shoes, and the ability to change the car setup in the pit round out a full-featured simulation racing game that can be played in an evening.

You are ready to race!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Resource to Move, Simulation

name: Dick Tracy
description:
The object of the game is to obtain 5,000 points, in several partial games before the opposing players, each partial game has to total exactly 1,000 points exposing cards on the table and the first to get it is the winner. Attack your opponents with "Alarm" cards and defend yourself with "Raid" cards to be able to score points. Don't forget the wild card "Dick Tracy" who will make you invulnerable against your opponents, but beware of the terrible gangster "Big Boy Caprice", who will hinder your progress and increase your score.

—description of the back of the box (translated)

El objeto del juego es la obtención de 5.000 puntos, en varias partidas parciales antes que los jugadores contrarios, cada partida parcial hay que totalizar exactamente 1.000 puntos exponiendo cartas sobre la mesa y el primero que lo consiga, es el ganador. Ataque a sus contrarios con cartas "Alarma" y defiéndase con cartas "Incursión" para poder ir sumando puntos. No olvide al comodín "Dick Tracy" que le hará invulnerable frente a sus contrarios, pero cuídese del terrible gangster "Big Boy Caprice", que dificultará su avance y el incremento de su puntuación.

—description of the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Mafia
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: {macro}Dungeon
description:
Up to 4 players take turns drawing cards and making movements through one of four caves in an attempt to outpace their competitors on the way to the treasure room. Players can advance in boring one increment moves or strategically build macro sets that can contain up to 5 moves allowing you to jump ahead of the competition.

Get Macro Dungeon today and start building macros to make your way to victory! Oh, and watch out for those dragons!

—description from the designer

name: Freedom Five: Cosmic Threats
description:
Aliens have been invading Earth for a long, long time.In the grand scheme of things, it’s no surprise really; the Thorathians, a proud race of militaristic extraterrestrials, have been conquering planets all over the galaxy for thousands of years. Earth has been a bit of a pesky one for them, however. Turns out humans are pretty resilient, and the presence of super-powered individuals has made the planet almost more trouble than it's worth for the invaders. Almost...
But the Thorathian armies aren’t the only presence in the cosmos that has its eyes set on Earth. Ineffable forces stir in the far corners of the galaxy, finding themselves drawn towards our planet’s bright and chaotic inhabitants. There have been a few shining moments in our timeline (such as the creation and inevitable destruction of the sentient A.I., Omnitron) that have earned the attention of beings far beyond our comprehension.

The Cosmic Threats Expansion is a massive addition to the total amount of content for Freedom Five, adding 2 new playable Heroes to master, 3 new terrifying Mastermind to face, and a host of Villains, Scenario Comic Books, Mystery Envelopes, extra cards, and more
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Arcane Wonders, Greater Than Games, LLC

name: Morissimo
description:
Morissimo, a board game that puts Mauritius and Mauritians in the spotlight through 1,500 questions and answers.

Published on the occasion of the country’s 50 years of independence.

Around its star-shaped tray, Morissimo gathers all family and friends for a moment full of discovery.

Have fun while answering a multitude of questions about Mauritius and deepen your knowledge in a fun way around 6 themes:

Art & culture
Sport & leisure
Economy & agriculture
History
Politics
Geography, places & nature


Goal: be the first to collect 6 stars of different colors

It is possible to buy some stars using tokens.
Answer questions correctly but also take up challenges.


2 series of cards: adults and children
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Log #31
description:
Rin Jankae sat in his command chair, his thoughts hidden behind his impenetrable black eyes and his steepled, long white fingers. He was trying to decide for himself if today was the day that the Romulans entered the war.

Released in June 2005, this Captain’s Log issue supports Star Fleet Battles and Federation & Empire. Shield of the Federation by Randy O. Green is a story of the Day of the Eagle, the day the Romulans entered the General War. Can the cruiser Groton and destroyer Genghis hold off the Romulans and be the shield of the Federation? “Lawfare” provides some humor in the issue. “Aces and Eights” takes place nearly a month after the Day of the Eagle and focuses on the destroyer Halsey.

In addition to the story, History includes deck plans for the Romulan SkyHawk, class histories for the Federation battle frigate and Klingon F6, and a history of the Federation bomber program.

As is usual, Communications informs readers about the company’s activities. The company hired two new people, thus helping spread out the workload. Captain’s Log #30 and SFB Module F1 have after-action reports. The company laid out its plans for new print releases and metal miniatures for the coming year. There are questions and answers about Starlist, which makes it easy for players to contact other players. The Input Guide has guidelines for how not to submit scenarios, ships, and fiction. Admiral Growler answers SFB questions. There is a discussion about some proposals and a call for Rangers. More “Why” questions get answered. There is an interview with Ken Burnside. There are two pages of filk songs. Finally, there are the Star Fleet Awards.

This issue includes seven scenarios for Star Fleet Battles. SL234, The Shield of the Federation, and SL235, Aces and Eights, are based on the two stories in the issue. Set during the Early Years, SL236, Web of Curiosity, involves an encounter between the Tholians and Klingons. SL237, Follies of Second-Hand Goods, pits Orions against Jindarians. An Omega scenario, SL238, An Intruding Situation, has the first covert attempt of the Andromedans to take over the Drex. SL239, Further Intrusions, has an Andromedan-controlled Drex dreadnought attacking a Drex battlecruiser and three gunboats. SL240, Riposte at Anporlax, is a classic matchup of the Federation and Klingons.

Database articles include battlegroups designed with local forces. There is an article on the moray eel. Admiral’s Game is updated to allow for ships described since 1999. There is an excerpt of a partial X-refit rule from SFB Module X1R. Rule. There are new rules for creating F&E battle groups in SFB and for advanced ground combat in SFB. There is a guide for converting captured Andromedan ships to fit in the fleets of the Galactic Powers, and vice versa. The final article is an example of how energy balancing works when the ship is damaged.

The Tactics section has primers for the Sharkhunters and Alunda. There are over two pages of term papers, along with another half-page with encore term papers.

The Venues section covers Star Fleet Command, SFB On-Line, playing by email, Galactic Conquest (with an article by Howard Bampton introducing a new Andromedan War campaign, Star Fleet Warlord, GURPS Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Battle Force.

Federation & Empire has a rule from Strategic Operations on Survey Ships. There are four pages of tactical notes. Finally, there are rules and rulings.

New ships and gunboats are added for Star Fleet Battles. The Federation gets its battle frigate carrier, battle frigate scout, battle frigate escort, and battle drone frigate; Klingons gain the F6B battle frigate, F6J penal battle frigate, F6S battle frigate scout, and F6E battle frigate escort; the Romulans get the JayHawk battle frigate; the Kzintis get their battle frigate. The Klingons and Federation each gain their fast destroyers. The new gunboats are recovery PFRs and survey PFQs. Other ships are “anarchist” ships including a Romulan Intruder, Kzinti Conquistador, and two Andromedan-captured ships: a Gorn battlecruiser and a Lyran heavy cruiser.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Coronials
description:
Play the corona crisis stress away with the Coronials board game!

Coronials is an educational action game that preventively works on the mental resilience of children and young people.
Discover more than 80 situations together and give players the opportunity to reflect on and express their opinion about the consequences of the pandemic in a playful way.

Play this relevant action game at home, at school or with your youth club!

Goal:
Complete the challenges and collect cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Spoof
description:
The objective of the game is to win the most tokens by playing balls you play and subsequently guessing the total number of balls played by all the players.

The game board is cross-shaped with four shields at its ends to cover the number of balls played. At each turn, each player simultaneously pushes or plays a ball into his/her shield. (Bluffing or "spoofing" can be done by pretending to push balls forward.) After every player has done so, they take turns in placing a scoring peg into the score holes (0-12) at the center of the game board. The player that guessed correctly wins all the tokens.

name: All Ashore!
description:
The game board is an cone-shaped island with eight balls on top of the cone. This is connected by cords to eight boats on the outer periphery of the island and located some distance away.

Each player takes three men of one color and puts them on three separate boats. At the start, there is a maximum of two men on one boat.

After determining the starting player using a dice roll, the starting player then throws a dice to decide the number of moves, clockwise or anticlockwise, any one of his men on the boat may move. During play no more than three men can be on one boat.

The player then pulls one of the balls on the island to reel the boat in. If the boat pulled to shore contains the player's own man, then he puts that man on the island and pulls the boat out again. If the place on the island contains an opponent's man, then the men are exchanged and the boat pulled out again. The rules apply for various combinations of men on the boat versus men already on the island space.

The objective of the game is to be the first player to get three men ashore.

name: Wolf in the Fold Print & Play Edition
description:
Wolf in the Fold Print & Play Edition is a PnP version of the tile-laying microgame Wolf in the Fold.

Wolf in the Fold is a game of tile placement and cooperation. The wolf pack is on the hunt, and they want your herd. Build fences and hire shepherds to protect your flock. If the wolves eat more sheep than you can round up, you lose the game!

Simple rules make Wolf in the Fold fun for younger children, but this game is not suitable for very small children who may choke on the game tiles.

The PnP edition contains everything you need to create your own Wolf in the Fold game. The 5-page PDF includes a sheet of instructions, a sheet of hex tiles front art, a sheet of hex tile back art, and two sheets to create a box for the game components. Simply print the PDF onto cardstock, cut out the components, and enjoy the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Battipillas
description:
Battipillas is a dueling game wherein players command their army of battipillas to overcome their opponents.

Use each creature's unique stats and power to win fights against the enemy!

Evolve your Caterpillar warriors into Cocoons and then again to Butterflies/Moths to unleash their full potential!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Movement, Tile Placement

name: Capitaine Flam
description: Captain Flam is a game of skill. The game board is inside the box. It consists of a starting area, 3 cavities and many holes. On his turn, the player must throw a spinning top from the starting area and take the box in his both hands. By handling it, he orients the spinning top towards the holes. Some will allow him to beat monsters that make him earn 1 to 5 points, to replay or lose his turn. If the top falls into a black hole, the player loses an already won monster. When all 9 monsters have been defeated, the player with the most points wins.

name: Д'Артаньян и три мушкетера
description:
Д’Артаньян и три мушкетера, D'Artagnan and the Three Musketeers is a team-based game for the whole family.

Relive the thrilling adventures of four friends who traveled from Paris to London to retrieve the Queen's pendants.

One against all, all against one!
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based, Pike and Shot, Renaissance

name: Jeu du chouval twa pat et Mémory: les animaux de la Martinique
description:
Le Jeu du chouval twa pat is a variation of mistigri with a Martinique touch. Play with local animals whose names are written in French and Creole.

The cards can also be used to play a Memory version.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Memory, Set Collection

name: Magnytour Profil: Critérium international
description:
The Critérium International is 3-stage race.
From 2010 to 2016, it took place around Porto-Vecchio, in Corsica.

name: Off the Line
description:
At the beginning of an operation, the commanding officer determines the point from which the operation will begin. This is referred to as the line of departure. In this game, players discover what happens once the soldiers under their command move ... Off the Line.

Off the Line is a wargame of low-to-moderate complexity that depicts man-to-man combat during World War II. Each combat unit represents a single soldier. Games are won through the completion of mission objectives such as the control of locations on the map board, exiting soldiers from the map through specific points, or the simple elimination of enemy soldiers. Although players are open to maneuver their forces as they wish, they’ll soon find that traditional tactics for units at the game’s scale are the best bet to achieve goals and to keep their forces intact.

Game play is managed through the use of a shared deck of action cards, each of which is used to determine how many soldiers might be activated during a turn, the resolution of random outcomes such as combat and morale checks, and random events. Being able to manage limited resources is a key to victory.

Each soldier is individually named and rated for morale (which determines a soldier’s effectiveness under fire), melee, weapon, and in some instances, command. Terrain is represented through the use of twelve geomorphic map panels that can create hundreds of different battlefield configurations.

This initial game includes forces for the United States and Germany facing off through twelve individual scenarios, plus instructions on how to create your own. Plans are in place to add additional nationalities, more maps, and lots more scenarios!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Command Cards, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Presidents Versus
description:
Presidents Versus is an action-packed, fun-filled, 30-minute card game for 1-4 players. America is in peril, and the presidents – from George Washington to Barack Obama – have all come back together to save us! Playable options for the “Big Bad” they’re saving us from include a pandemic, dictators, monsters, aliens and more. But while the portal to the past was open, the villains of American history – from Benedict Arnold to Bull Connor – have come back to stop the presidents and ensure America’s downfall. The battle for our country is on!

Publisher’s product page

The core of the game is 24 presidents, divided up evenly among the players. At the beginning of the game, you select a Big Bad that’s trying to destroy America. Every turn, you draw five cards out of your deck and play them. Each president has a presidential power based on that president’s actual strengths (such as popularity, party building or policy leadership). Presidents can also join forces to attack villains together, or recruit new cards into your deck. You can add to your deck cards that represent support from other presidents (hello, Millard Fillmore!), constitutional provisions that give powers to the presidency, and other forces from American history. These support cards interact with keywords on your presidents and other game factors, giving you tactical choices.

The players use their attacks to capture 12 villains from American history. Then it’s time for the Final Showdown with the Big Bad that’s trying to destroy America, represented by a set of threat cards. The rules for the Final Showdown are different for each Big Bad – fighting off a pandemic and fighting off monsters require different tactics! If the Big Bad defeats your presidents, it wins; if you defeat it first, the player with the most captured villains and Big Bad threat cards wins. So there’s pressure to be capturing villains for the whole game, but victory still hangs on that Final Showdown.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Wer kennt Magdeburg? das stadtquiz
description:
Who knows their way around Ottostadt, the beautiful city on the Elbe?
With 500 questions you can find out who is a real connoisseur, or even discover something unknown.
The authors put a lot of emphasis on questions that define the true insider. There are also topics and events that you encounter on a daily basis, but which you hardly pay attention to. Many questions take the guessing and estimation factor into account, so not only "Magdeburg children", but also newcomers and tourists can enjoy this game - or roll one of the six jokers.
A quiz blast for the whole family that illuminates all topics in six levels of difficulty.

Player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Across Australia on Barnet Glass Tyres
description:
Across Australia on Barnet Glass Tyres is a game dating from the early twentieth century. It is simple roll and move race that sees players circumnavigate the Australian continent. Starting in Perth in Western Australia players travel in an anticlockwise directions, moving their pieces by the roll of a dice and obeying instructions along the way which may hinder or help there travels. The winner is first back to Perth on space 93.

The game has some historical significance by highlighting some of Australia's racing pioneers, although mostly now forgotten.
Mentioned on the game board is a Francis Birtle, a colourful adventurer who set cycling and driving records from the 1900's to the 1920's. The game board reference is probably a 1912 epic journey from the Gulf of Carpentaria in remote northern Australia back to Melbourne.
The game board also gives reference to a Harold Parsons who held world motorcycle endurance records between 1916 and 1920

—user summary

name: Ragnarok: Rise of the Buran Clan
description:
The Rise of the Buran Clan expansion is the first expansion of the game. It introduces the main Buran Clan hero Aeria Buran as well as many of her accompanying cards.

The Buran Clan expansion has many unique great creatures and powerful spells.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Secret Society
description:
2 player deck-builder and area-control game set in the shadow world of the Illuminati and their rival secret societies.

Players take charge of historical secret societies such as:
a. The Illuminati - master puppet masters from the shadows
b. Opus Dei - Fanatical religious enforcers of Order and Divine Justice
c. The Black Dragons - Ruthless Military and Criminal Masterminds
d. Ordo Templis Orientis - Occult practitioners of Black Magic and Cabalistic Ritual

Players must build their deck with Military, Economic, Criminal, Religious, Judicial and Occult action cards - which when played, allow provide a variety of powerful effects such a launching military invasions, bribing local politicians and even summoning Elder Gods through human sacrifice.

The goal of the game is to either have more influence than your opponent in all 6 continents (the 6 areas of the Board), or knock out your opponent by exposing their nefarious schemes to the Public.

—description from the designer

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Suisse
description: The Tour de Suisse is a 6-stage race on the UCI World Tour calendar taking place annually in June

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour Down Under
description:
The Tour Down Under is a professional cycling stage race run around the Australian city of Adelaide.
Run for the first time in 1999, since 2008 it has been the first round on the UCI ProTour calendar, today the World Tour.

A race in 5 stages of 150 km each.

name: Magnytour Profil: Paris-Nice
description:
Paris-Nice is a French professional stage cycling race.

Created in 1933, it is organized by Amaury Sport Organization.

It takes place in March for eight days, making it the first major stage race of the year in Europe.

name: Magnytour Profil: Course Tirreno-Adriatico
description:
The between two seas Tirreno-Adriatico race offers some very nice playing profiles.

The stage race profile consists of 3 stage profiles, it is Magnytour-specific and is updated annually.

name: Magnytour Profil: Course Classique – Championnat du Monde
description:
The profile is specific for each race and adapted to the Magnytour game. It is updated every year. You can therefore order the new edition every year.

The 2019 edition of the UCI Road World Championships – Men's road race was help in Yorkshire.

name: Doctor! Doctor!: Man vs Meeple Season 3 Promo Card
description:
A single Promo card for Doctor! Doctor! Mix in with the rest of the cards and proceed as usual.

The card is worth 7 VP. Requirements: 2 lungs, 1 heart, 1 bone.
Blood Pressure = 6

Originally available through the Man vs Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter.

name: Heathcliff .... Munch Out Board Game Card Game
description:
Based on the comic strip by George lately. Be the first to collect a complete 10 course meal for Heathcliff to eat.


Players roll dice to move across the board
Collect 9 numbered meals or 8 and the joker-card
Use shortcuts to get to the dishes first or trade meals with adjacent players
The first player to serve all 9 dishes to Heathcliff wins
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hexa Würfel-Domino
description:
Hexa without a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. The players chose a token and set it on the corresponding space in the area with the border of their color. If a token can't be placed, it ist placed upside down beside the game board and the next player get his turn. When the central spaces are empty, the tokens beside the game board are mixed up and placed in the central area to resume play. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

Hexa with a die:
All 48 tokens are mixed up and placed upside down on the central area of the game board. When all tokens are placed, they are turned to show their nominations. Now the players roll a die ant take a corresponding token to pace in their area. If the token lay on a corresponding center space, the player gets another turn. On the roll of a 6 the player gets another turn too. If his two sixes are already covered, the 6 count as a wildcard. The first player to place 12 tokens in the area of his color wins the game.

—user summary

name: Fussball-Spiel zu Hause
description:
Each player has 11 pawns (green vs. yellow). The ball is represented by a black pawn. Playing time is 2x15 minutes.
The movement (not diagonally) of the ball and the player pawns is determined by a die. Only at the roll of a 6 the ball may move over other pawns. If the ball stops in front of a pawn of the same team or the pawn moves behind the ball, the player may roll again.
The player with the most goals wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Spellslingers X Otherworlds
description:
Spellslingers X Otherworlds is an exciting and new stand alone expansion for Spellslingers!
You don't need to have any knowledge of Spellslingers or Otherworlds to completely enjoy this game!

This new set contains 60 cards, 12 of which are characters! Every card is inspired by the Otherworlds tabletop RPG.

The other 48 cards are spells, each relating to one of the 12 characters, adding more story to the game than ever before!

name: Line-ups
description:
Line-ups is an N-in-a-row game played on a 12x12 grid. Players take turns marking one space. When a player completes one or more rows of three, four, or five spaces in a line they score it. A scored row may be extended to make a longer row, but not an overlapping row of the same size.

The winner is the first player to score eight rows of three, five rows of four, or one row of five.

To offset the first-player advantage players may optionally not count the first row of three scored by that player.

name: Prose Bowl
description:
Prose Bowl is played with a set of 21 letters; the rules suggest choosing the first 21 from some piece of written material.

A procedure is given for drafting letters from the set which results in each player having ten. The remaining letter is the "team captain" for both players.

The players then have three minutes to make words from their letters; every word must include the captain. Points are awarded based on word length and use of rare letters.

A series of three games can be played, in which case the teams are kept but the loser of a game chooses any letter as the new captain for both teams.

name: Keetoo
description:
Each player starts the game with 10 tokens, each of which has a different symbol on it. They must be kept face down. Players take turns flipping over one card in the center of the table and each card displays only 8 of the 10 symbols shown on token. Players simultaneously study the card to figure out which two symbols are missing. When a player figures one out, she places their token with the missing symbol face down in front of them. She does the same when she does the same when figure out the second one and shouts "Keetoo!"

Then she must flip her remaining 8 tokens face down while the other players keep searching for the missing symbols. When she is done flipping tokens face down, she yells, "Stop!" AT this point, she reveals her tokens showing symbols she believes are missing from the card and all players inspect them. If she is correct, she receives two points. If one or both are wrong, she receives nothing and all other other players receive one point for each correct token they have identified.

The winner is the first player to receive a designated number of points dependent on the number of players.
publishers: Stragoo Games, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Spring
description:
Spring is a cooperative game where players work together to overgrow a city. The Biological control unit is destroying any unauthorised biological growth in the city, all of our natural spaces have been destroyed. We must band together and overgrow the city.

Play cards to grow plants in your district, trade cards with your friends and purchase actions needed to accelerate growth. All while the BCU moves around the city removing our plants and gathering evidence to shut down our greenhouses.

—description from the designer

name: Fredagsslik
description:
Spice up your family's treat-time with a little healthy competition by fighting for the candy rather than giving it out to each person.

Take turns rolling the dice, moving along the board and performing various actions, like stealing candy from opponents, exchange candy bowls or give a piece of candy to an opponent.

Be careful not to get a stomach ache, for then you have to wait one round.

The player who reaches the goal area first wins the game and all the other players have to give them four pieces of candy as a prize.

name: 1,2,3: kennst du uns?
description:
1,2,3 – kennst du uns? is a game published in the DDR (East Germany before the wall came down).

A game for younger children. Pack consists of 11 groups of three. Each group has three cards and they are marked with dots, a 1, a 2 and a 3.

3 Game suggestions in the rules.

1. The cards are shuffled and dealt evenly. The beginning child looks for an animal with a one-dot from his cards, says its name and places the card face up. Who has the same animal with two dots, must place that card, the player with the third matching card (three dots) also places and may then call the next animal with a one-dot and place it, etc. The winner is whoever runs out of cards first.
2. The shuffled cards remain in a pile with their backs up and are picked up individually in turn. Everyone who gets a card with a 1 dot, puts it down after calling it out. Then the cards with two dots may also be laid out, whoever has the third matching card may take the trio. The winner is whoever has the most cards last. If you make a mistake, you have to moan or cackle etc. depending on the animal with which you did something wrong.
3. The game can also be played like a Schwarzer Peter", the black dog is then Peter, the other two dogs are removed from the game beforehand.

Each game in the order above uses slightly more complex rules.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Idoneth Deepkin
description:
From out of blackness they come, emerging from the depths of the realms’ seas upon a surging tide of magic. These merciless raiders do not seek merely to slaughter or enslave, however, for they are the Idoneth Deepkin – they have come to take their victims’ very souls. They bring with them the magic of their kingdoms, an ethersea of roiling currents and crushing pressures. In their passing, the Idoneth leave ruin, death and sleepers that will never awaken – victims whose souls have been stolen. Retreating beneath the waves, the Idoneth return to the utter isolation of the depths.

In the 136-page hardback Battletome: Idoneth Deepkin, you’ll find:


A Strange Genesis: the origins of the Idoneth Deepkin, the aelven raiders who lurk in the deepest oceans, avoiding the predations of Slaanesh and the dismal fate that hangs over their entire race;
The Great Emptiness: the story of the manner in which Idoneth Deepkin scrabble for survival – their offspring mostly born soulless, they raid above land to steal souls and keep themselves from extinction;
The Deep Places: the secluded strongholds amongst the fathomless depths which the Idoneth Deepkin call home, and the expansion of their submerged cities;
The Idoneth Deepkin At War: how this race fights, and the signs that their armies are about to rise, along with descriptions of their bond-beasts;
Underwater Empires: a timeline of significant events and battles in their history, from the Age of Myth to the Age of Sigmar – and the stirring of Slaanesh;
Descriptions of the Idoneth Enclaves, with an overview of their caste system and in-depth details of their military structure;
A guide to the Whirlways, realmgate routes from which the Idoneth Deepkin launch their raids;
Explanation and background of each character and unit available to an Idoneth Deepkin army;
A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example army and comprehensive painting advice from the experts, including stage by stage examples of painting skin, blades, sea detritus and creatures, scales, and helmet crests. Along with this are colour schemes and guides to painting 6 named Enclaves: Ionrach, Dhom-Hain, Fuethán, Mor’phann, Nautilar, and Briomdar.


Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Idoneth Deepkin army ready for the gaming table are here:


14 Warscrolls, covering every miniature in the Idoneth Deepkin faction, including a Warscroll for the Gloomtide Shipwreck scenery piece;
Allegiance Abilities representing the Idoneth Deepkin’s methods of war – including Command Traits, a Tides of Death table which introduces new abilities in each round, and 4 different types of Artefacts of Power;
Lore of the Deeps: a selection of spells usable by Idoneth Deepkin wizards;
Abilities, Warscroll Battalion rules, magic and Command Traits for the following 6 Enclaves: Ionrach, Dhom-Hain, Fuethán, Mor’phann, Nautilar, and Briomdar;
3 Battleplans , including objectives for both sides, deployment map, special rules and victory conditions;
Idoneth Deepkin tactics: advice on advanced tactics that suit this army’s play style;
Rules for creating an Idoneth Deepkin warband to use in a Path to Glory campaign, including a Followers Rewards Table, a Champion Rewards Table and a Path to Glory Battleplan;
6 Warscroll Battalions conferring advantages for fielding certain combinations of models;
Pitched Battle Profiles for all units featured in this Battletome, including unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Sons of Behemat
description:
The titanic Sons of Behemat have might enough to throttle dragons, barge down castle walls and tear elder oaks from the ground. When they attack as a tribe they become unstoppable, stamping the enemy’s infantry flat and pummelling rival monsters to death. Any who oppose their rule are battered with hurled boulders before the gargants charge in, each towering hulk roaring in savage triumph as he seizes victory through brute force and ignorance

Battletome: Sons of Behemat is your guide to Warhammer Age of Sigmar's biggest army – a force like no other where GARGANTS are your troops and EVEN BIGGER GARGANTS lead them to battle! In this tome of knowledge, you'll discover the hidden history of Gargants in the Mortal Realms, from their origins with the godbeast Behemat to their work as mercenaries with the Grand Alliances. Stunning art brings the world of the Sons of Behemat to life, helping to inspire your own collection! When you're ready to field an army of your own, stunning miniatures photography, conversion guides and painting tips are included to help you out. Meanwhile rules for a variety of gargant tribes let you customise your army, or even include a Mega-Gargant in any force, whether you owe your allegiance to Death, Destruction, Chaos or Order!

This 80-page hardback battletome contains:

A history of the Sons of Behemat, including the epic deeds of their forefather, the godbeast Behemat
Painting guidance on skin tones and colour schemes within the gargant race
Allegiance abilities for the Sons of Behemat, including additional rules for Stomper Tribes, Taker Tribes and Breaker Tribes
Includes rules of Mega-Gargant Mercenaries – enabling any Warhammer Age of Sigmar player to use Mega-Gargants in their armies
Warscrolls and Pitched Battle Profiles for every miniature in the Sons of Behemat range


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Ogor Mawtribes
description:
Ogors are rotund brutes entirely obsessed with eating and fighting. They rampage across the Mortal Realms on an endless, cyclical Mawpath, devouring everything they set their piggish eyes upon. Enemies are blasted apart by blackpowder cannons, gored by long-tusked beasts of the frozen wastes and trampled by a sweaty, bellowing mass of flesh. Only the lucky ones are dead before the ogors start to eat them.
