Inside this 120-page book you'll find overview of the Ogor Mawtribes and their two main cultures, which are united by their worship of Gorkamorka. A huge selection of rules gives you countless ways to play with your Ogor collection. Allegiance abilities bolster dedicated forces of Ogor Mawtribes, while rules for several legendary tribes allow you to tailor your army to suit your play style. Warscroll battalions reward you for fielding specific combinations of models, while Path to Glory warband creation rules and bespoke Ogor missions are perfect for your first few games. This battletome is also a great resource for collectors, featuring tips for painting details like rusted blades and ice weapons, as well as a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures to inspire your own collection.

This battletome contains:


Lore and art that explores the history of the Ogor Mawtribes, and how they battle today
A showcase of beautifully painted miniatures
Painting advice including examples of different skin, rusted blades, gut-plates, clothes, tattoos, ice weapons, banner symbols, fur and more
Allegiance abilities for Ogor Mawtribes, including a table of battle traits, four command trait tables, four artefacts of power tables, the Lore of Gutmagic and Lore of the Sun-Eater spell tables, an Everwinter Prayers table, and two mount traits tables
10 warscroll battalions for fielding different combinations of models
22 unit warscrolls and a scenery warscroll for the Great Mawpot
Pitched battle profiles for all units featured in this Battletome and the Great Mawpot, including min/max unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dans les Cordes: Santa Cross Promo Card
description:
A promo card for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
There is French text on the card but the icons make it understandable.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Dans les Cordes: Abaissement Promo Card
description:
A promo card released for the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in 2020 for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
The French text on the card says: Against a "cross" type attack.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Marching Band(-imals)
description:
Marching Band(-imals) is a tabletop, marching band-themed card game - but all the band members are animals! You are a band director, build a band for the upcoming marching band (football) season. Compete against up to 6 other opponents to build your band the fastest. Play bonus cards to make your band-building more efficient. Play penalty cards to limit the success of your opponents. Your band is complete when you have 5 players and corresponding pieces of equipment while avoiding duplication. Once your band is complete, grab a Drum Major card and hold onto it for one full round to win!

-description from publisher

name: Electric Empires
description:
A Game of Power and Intrigue in the Gilded Age

The war of the currents is raging. Thomas Edison’s direct current is safe, cheap and simple, but weak. Nikola Tesla’s alternating current is powerful, but complicated and occasionally deadly. Which technology will power New York City and then the world?

As the leader of a fledgling electric company you must hire staff, build generators and power lines, win bids, complete projects…and sabotage the competition. Build your Electric Empire and power the gilded age.

Electric Empires is an engine-building, worker placement game set in the gilded age of New York City. A unique shared reputation mechanism balances semi-cooperative strategy with cut-throat competition. Asymmetric gameplay means different power currents require different strategies and tactics providing great replayability.

Electric Empires is played over the course of 10 years (rounds) each consisting of four quarters (turns). Each turn a player may take two actions: initiating a bid on a project, hiring or assigning workers, building generators, seeking financing or playing action cards.

Each year (round) progress must be made on active projects, debt must be retired or interest paid and maintenance must be performed on in-play power generators.

Completing projects is the main way to gain victory points. Each project represents providing power to a historic location in glided age New York City. Project contracts are acquired through bidding against competing players in terms of how much money you want to complete the project, how long it will take you and the current reputation of your electrical current AC or DC.

In addition to the workers necessary to complete a project you must build generators to supply sufficient power. These generators must be either located adjacent to the project on the gameboard or connected by powerlines which you can also build. Power can be leased either from one of two public utilities or from a competing player using the same current. Projects can be lost due to a lack of progress or malfunctions. Players can sabotage competitors' projects and potentially take them over and gain the associated victory points.

Careful planning of project bidding and generator placement is necessary to build an engine that will produce enough revenue to fund your commitments and enough energy to power projects once they are complete. If power to a completed project is disrupted, victory points from that project are not counted until power is restored.

Each year (round) a new "Annual Forecast" card is drawn which sets unique conditions for all players for the duration of the year (round).

Players may choose either Thomas Edison's preferred current, Direct Current (CD) or Nikola Tesla's Alternating Current (AC). Each has its own advantages and disadvantages leading to asymmetrical gameplay. Both currents (AC and DC) also have an associated reputation or public perception shared by all players using that current. A good reputation makes winning bids and getting financing easier. A negative reputation makes succeeding more difficult.

At the end of year (round) ten, the player with the most victory points is declared the winner.

-description from designer

name: Coronavirus le jeu
description:
The game begins at the start of the coronavirus epidemic, when a few people are starting to feel the first symptoms...

When the game starts, only some players are infected, but after a few handshakes, hugs and other dinners with friends, the number of cases is likely to increase rapidly!

There are two ways you can win:

be the last to survive the outbreak or
the first to be immune.


A player is immune if he does not suffer any contamination for 3 full turns after healing.
A player dies if their viral load exceeds 5.

– translated description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Alias: lisäkorttisarja
description:
One of the early expansions to Alias - it still carries the Nelospelit logo of the early 1990's.

300 new cards with 8 words each, for a total of 2400 new words to explain.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Ragnarok: Dawn of the Heavens' Massacre CCG – Witness A Divine Comedy
description:
The Witness A Divine Comedy expansion is when the hero Dreania Reeve hero and her accompanying cards was introduced to the game.
The expansion also introduced powerful enchantments,spells and card stealing skills.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Pays du Lunévillois: Le jeu
description:
Pays du Lunévillois is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers of the Lunévillois: Blâmont, Einville, Bayon... and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

The winner will have to be the first one to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Les Trésors Arvernes
description:
Les Trésors Arvernes
A great adventure in the heart of the Auvergne volcanoes.
Search for 2 treasures: the Gallic shield and the Arverne boar, hidden in the middle of the Volcanoes.
Choose your path well.
But beware some may block your way.
Be strategic and judicious in the decisions you make.
Stay alert and don't get distracted.
May luck be with you.
Will you be the first to reach the Puy de Dôme to fly to victory?
The treasure hunt is on.


Les Trésors Arvernes is a treasure hunt in the Auvergne Volcanoes Regional Nature Park.
Goal : find the two treasures hidden under the domes.
Gameplay: players move using cards only.
Transport cards (foot, bicycle, horseback) are numbered from 1 to 4 regardless of the means of transport.
When a player arrives on a dome, he discreetly lifts it to check if there is a treasure below...

name: Duopento
description: Each player receives a set of twelve tiles. Alternately, you have to place the stones on the board in such a way that you form as large a contiguous area of a color as possible. At the same time, one should prevent the opponent from doing the same. The tactic: to define as large areas as possible, in which only your own pentominos fit. The whole thing is finished when no one is able to accommodate one of his pentominos on the board.

name: Guardiões da Terra
description:
A didactic game to make as a family and teach the planet's values to the youngest.

"Shall We Save the Planet?

Pollution is getting stronger and Planet Earth is getting sicker.
Since you can't beat it alone, the Planet has summoned the Guardians of the Earth for an urgent cleaning mission.
Guardians have to act quickly and they need you.
Join them on this adventure and find out how you can help.
Learn how to clean beaches and seas with Solis and Gotas, discover "magic" foods with Bia, protect forests with Flora and become an expert in energy savings with Chamas.

Purpose of the game:
Players must move clockwise around the board to accumulate energy points and / or special "Guardian" cards.
There are two ways to win the game:
- Be the first player to get 50 energy points.
- Be the first player to acquire 6 special "Guardian" cards (one from each).
Players who run out of energy points immediately exit the game, as do their cards."

name: Η Χιονάτη και οι 7 Νάνοι
description:
Each player has to get first to the house of the 7 Dwarfs and save the Snow White before she bites the poisoned apple!

Κάθε παίκτης πρέπει να φτάσει πρώτος με τους 7 νάνους στο τέλος (σπίτι των νάνων στο κέντρο του ταμπλό)και να σώσει τη Χιονάτη που είναι έτοιμη να φάει το δηλητηριασμένο μήλο.

name: Koala and Wine
description:
In Koala and Wine, each player starts with a secret selection of glass cards. They can see their glass cards at the beginning but then the cards will be face down.

The last players to own glass cards win the game.

During the game, players will try to steal each other glass cards but to succeed they will need to use their memory or luck as to succeed a thief they need to match the type of wine of the "wine thieves" card and the targeted glass.

Players can also use "action" koala cards that will help them during the game to reveal a glass for example or swap the position of glass cards on the table to confuse the others.

Finally, special cards will test the memory of the players and ask them to reveal a particular glass card, if they failed they will lose a glass card.

Koala and Wine is not a drinking game, it doesn't include or required alcohol.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Events, Hot Potato, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That

name: ATS Operation Uranus: Stavka Bear Trap
description:
As winter set in, the trap laid carefully by the crafty Russian Bear, vengeance to be exacted by his STAVKA Generals and those in the field ... snapped shut on hapless Axis Satellite soldiers from Romania along with Werhmacht soldiers from 4th Panzer Army and other formations. As the icy blasts swept across the Steppe, one of the greatest military calamities in history was unleashed upon the men of multiple nations. It was Operation URANUS.

This module provides comprehensive rules for waging winter war as well as some new winter-themed terrain features.

Contents:
6 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½", with new winter art
8 new scenarios
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with winter-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product AND Romanian personnel, Romanian Vehicles and early-war Soviet Vehicles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Stay TF Inside: The Game of Social Distancing
description:
A fun, fast-paced card game just for adults.

This card game is all about stocking up so that you survive the pandemic!

Trade, steal, or panic buy as many necessities as you can to reign supreme during quarantine.

The FIRST player to collect 3 full colored ESSENTIAL ITEM sets, WINS!

Quick Play
1. Deal 5 cards to each player & put the rest in the draw pile at the center.
2. The player seated to the left of the dealer starts the round & draws 2 cards.
3. Play up to 3 moves during your turn in any of the following ways:
- Put TP cards into your "stockpile" as currency
- Lay Essential Item cards face up on the board in front of you to build your sets
- Play a Pandemic card of Collect TP to F*ck over other players!

PRO TIP: Always keep a well-stocked pile of TP. You never know when sh*t will hit the fan and you'll have to pay out.

name: ATS: Freedom's Price – Poland 1
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Poland and the very beginning of Hitler's blitzkrieg. This module contains scenarios set in Sept. 1939 as brave Poles desperately attempt to stave off their relentless German attackers.

Contents:
4 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
2 half-countersheets providing Polish infantry, weapons and armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, along with standard German personnel, weapons and AFV counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Belgique
description:
The Tour de Belgique, officially Baloise Belgium Tour, is a stage race.

It is a 4 stage race.

name: Commonality
description:
Commonality is a family card game about collecting stuff you find in common. Find the commonality between things and collect sets of common images.

The compact, travel-friendly game comes with 150 cards showing a variety of images.

Setup:


Lay nine cards faceup in a 3x3 stockpile
Maintain a draw pile
Deal three secret cards to each player
Maintain a reserve area in front of each player.


Game Play:

On each player’s turn, a player can perform one of the following actions first:


Moves a card from the stockpile to their “reserve”
Discards a secret card and replaces it with a new card from the draw pile
Steals a visible card from an opponent’s reserve to their reserve


Finally, if possible …


Reveals and collects a set.


Once the draw pile has been depleted, shuffle the discard pile into a new draw pile.

Continue playing until no draw cards remain or are playable.
The winner has the most cards. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

Set Collection:

Players use one or more of their secret cards along with one or more reserve cards to make a set of at least three cards. Explain the connection between all these cards then flip upside down as a collection. Draw one or more new cards to maintain three secret cards.

We've suggested about 60 commonalities like:


round
scary
flat
mammal
wearable
on the farm
sports


—description from the publisher

name: Dragon Dreams: White Wolf Allegiance Deck
description:
Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Includes:

1 Dragon God
1 Silva the Grey
1 Angel Card
1 Quest Land
2 Quest Creatures
5 Core Lands
10 Dream Lands
10 White Spells
8 White Artefacts
4 Wolf Captuveries
4 Dragon Constructs
4 Dragon Birds
4 Life Structures
4 Artefacts
4 Atalantian Towers
4 Captuveries
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dreams: Purple Exile & Mischief Deck
description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dreams: Black Corrupt Nightmare Deck
description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dreams: Green Nature & Dream Summoning Deck
description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

name: Amino: The Ant Game
description:
Amino is an entertaining strategic tile based game for the whole family. Amino takes players on a journey into the microcosm of ants.

In Amino - The Ant Game you build a microcosm that every time looks different. In this microcosm you manage an ant colony, and to win you must be the first to collect the best resources. To do this, you lay out new paths and open up new resources and hill. With your opponent you fight for these resources and obstruct their pathways. With "Ant cards" you block paths, build bridges, lend wings to your ant, improve their fighting power or change the existing maze of paths.

The goal of the game is to quickly get the best resources for yourself. There are three different resources, which give you one to three points depending on their type. Now, some may be worth more or less to you than they are to your opponent. The first player to collect seven points wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Mém'oeufs: Mémo sonore
description:
Shake the eggs 2 by 2 to find the pairs.
An original sound memo with no shelf life!

Grab an egg, shake it and try to find the other egg which makes the same sound. A game of listening and awakening the senses with a box of 12 wooden eggs.

Winner is the player who can associate the most sounds.
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Le jeu de No
description:
Le jeu de No ,
the game of No combines luck, strategy and knowledge about the Island of Noirmoutier through questions.

A family game that can be played with children, with questions designed for the younger ones.

Go on foot, by bike, by boat for a fun island tour!

Questions on expressions in patois, activities, the coast, fauna, flora ... not to mention the traffic rules on the road and by the sea.
1,200 questions on Noirmoutier island and on each card a photo of the island.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flockade
description:
Flockade is a laid-back, party game with strategic elements about outwitting and outlasting your opposition.

Command an army of farm animals lead your flock to victory through attacking, defending, deception, and disruption, protecting your general at all costs to be the last flock standing. If your General goes down, you lose the game.

Each general offers its own powerful effect and playstyle to build your flock around. Build an army of basic recruits and powerful heroes to defend your General and attack enemy armies. Use orders to instantly take action or disrupt incoming actions and apply sanctions to other players for powerful shifts in the game if you catch them breaking a treaty!

To win, you'll have to manage your hand wisely and play your cards at the right times for the maximum effect. Shear your enemies with weapons, wolves, and wit to win and wool the world!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Wish you were here ...? Travel Edition
description:
What's in the game?
Cards for sevenczones of the world. Each zone is a different colour and has cards for ten cities (numbered 1-10), plus a Travel Cuide card for the zone. There are two Travel Insurance cards, which are 'wild' and can be used on any zone when you don't have the required zone card to play. The rest are Golden Travel cards - you need these to win the game.

Quick Summary
The players travel in different zones. They are rewarded for successful trips and penalised for unsuccessful ones. Travelling a zone is done by placing down cards of the same zone (colour), beginning with a low number and ending with a high one (up to ten). Travel Guide and Travel Insurance cards can be used to gain extra points but they must be played at the beginning of a trip. Players can go on more than one trip.

The standard game is played by two people. There are extra rules for four players (two teams).
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Guardians of the City II
description:
An educational card game meant to teach players the value of community support in protecting their communities against threats.

Two players face off against each other, drawing and playing cards from their identical decks. Their goal is to resolve the crisis they are each facing, or to have deployed the most defense cards by the time both decks run out. The resolution of a crisis requires a certain combination of defense cards to be played.

Players can also play event cards to hinder their opponent's progress. Community support cards can be played to allow the play of other cards or boost their effectiveness; they also can protect against certain event cards.

Contents:-
2 identical sets of:

2 Rules cards
12 Event cards
4 Community Support cards
5 Digital Defence cards
5 Psychological Defence cards
5 Social Defence cards
5 Economic Defence cards
5 Civil Defence cards
5 Military Defence cards
6 Crisis cards
mechanics: Bingo, Move Through Deck, Race, Take That

name: Citytrip Junior
description:
As a tour guide in Theme City you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting exciting attractions, wonderfull shops, wild animals, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Junior is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 15 starting points and 30 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest rating wins Citytrip Junior.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Bingo, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Romandie
description:
The Tour de Romandie is a Helvetian event with a mountainous route.

Switzerland offers an ideal course for the game with the Tour of Romandy.

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Pologne
description:
The Tour of Poland is a very mountainous and very nervous event.

Because it is very mountainous, the Tour of Poland gives you the opportunity to explode the peloton.

name: Le grand Tour du Monde
description:
With Le grand Tour du Monde Discover 232 destinations around the world, their must-see sites, the best season to go there, anecdotes ...

Using the dice, go around the world answering as many questions as possible.
Be careful, a trip always holds surprises!

The cards are illustrated with photos, 1000 questions divided by continent, various themes (culture and heritage, nature and landscapes, world cuisine, sports and adventures, practical advice)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Cavaletti: Le jeu des clubs houses
description:
Cavaletti is designed to review all levels thanks to its 1,100 questions and answers.


It simulates a CSO course (show jumping course).
The hexagonal boxes allow players to follow realistic curves.
All types of obstacles (oxer, wall, spa, vertical, bidet) are available.
The first direction of the obstacle is specified (16 obstacles available).
Rejections, bars and take options can happen.
It is possible to play only with the cards and the booklet as a trivia game.


Goal:

choose a course (among 6 on the board) corresponding to the length of the game you want and
be the first rider to cross the finish line.


Gameplay:
Players move in strides (with the dice) and answer questions (depending on their level, G1-G7) to re-roll or not.
Be careful, if the horse stops on the take-off square or on the obstacle, he has made a refusal or a bar. The rider can get by by answering two questions instead of just one.

name: Plunder Busters
description:
Plunder Busters is a board game for 3-4 players, where each player takes the role of a budding archaeologist trying to achieve glory in their field. They will do this by exploring new excavation sites, digging up artefacts and researching new relics.

In Phase 1 (Build your Dig Site!), players will place tiles on their Dig Site board in secret before embarking on Phase 2 (Plunder!); where players will explore each others’ Dig Sites, attempting to claim Relics and Artefacts whilst avoiding the Traps set by the other players.

Players will earn Reputation by uncovering tiles which contain Artefacts (worth 1, 2 or 3 points), or prized Relics (worth 4+ points); the locations of which are indicated by 'clue' cards that players will compete to collect. However, following false leads and uncovering a Trap tile will cause a player to lose Reputation (-5 points) at the hands of devious opponents. The adventurer with the highest Reputation when the available clue cards have been exhausted will win the game!

The game begins as a tile-laying/’build your own board’ adventure, before shifting to an exploration of your opponents’ dig sites: through the cunning use of action cards and a quest to find hidden Relics, only the most successful adventurer will prevail!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Deduction, End Game Bonuses, Map Deformation

name: Tilty
description:
The objective of the game is to add items to Tilty the clown without having him tip.

Before playing, assemble Tilty the clown and put him in the middle of the table. The first player spins the spinner and chooses an object of the color he/she spun and places it either on Tilty or one of the three trays he is balancing. Only one hand may be used to perform this action and Tilty cannot be touched.

When a player tries to place an object on Tilty and it or others fall off, that player is eliminated. The objects that fell are put back into play. The last player left is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Breakaway: The Anti-Violence Anti-Aggression Anti-Anger Anti-Abuse Game
description:
This is an educational game to teach adolescents about abuse and nonviolent ways to handle anger.

Players go around a circular track landing on either Breakaway or Aggression spaces.

The first to reach the top of the freedom path wins.

name: Fantasy Delight
description:
Two consenting adult players will compete to be the first to enter the Danger Zone... err... make that "the Delight Zone" at the center of the game board, where the roll of a dice will determine which of 11 scenarios will be enacted (with the winner in charge of the ensuing role-played action). Costumes are optional but highly recommended per the scenario booklet. Especially if you get the alien encounter scenario.

Along the way to the center, various diverting tasks must be performed as you roll the dice and land on squares that give you things to do, including a moment where you stop and "select a new first and last name" to use later during role play. I suggest using "Richard Nixon", but mileage may vary.

Bonus points - this adult board game for partners includes some screamingly bad/unintentionally funny artwork, but clearly was a labor of someone's love. Good luck finding a copy (or wanting to)!
mechanics: Finale Ending, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Generic Gangster Chase Game
description:
An independent publication from 1981, this umpired two-player game features two indoor "chases," one set in an office building and one in a warehouse.

The basic theme of each scenario is that Big Jim, a mob hitman, is seeking to rub out ace reporter Ace Wilson.

This is a refereed tactical, man-to-man scale game. In this case the game scale is literal, in that each of the two players only has one counter. The actions a player can take include listening, moving, and fighting -- although only Big Jim has a gun, which Ace tries to offset with his greater speed.

It's film noir action, in the form of seven counters and an 8.5x11 map (backprinted, as each scenario uses its own map).

—user summary
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Player Judge

name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: Orders of Battle – Fall of France
description:
Fall of France Orders of Battle'' for use with the Sitz Krieg Ohne Hass Rules.

They have been based on the many available publications on the actual fighting formations of the combatant armies for the nations involved.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Green vs Tan: Fury Farm Battleset
description:
This product is for the original Green Vs. Tan: Where Dingos Dare skirmish game, and is essentially two things.
- First, its a terrain pack to make your tabletop a bit more green, and/or a bit more tan, to aid in playing more amusingly immersive games. It serves to represent either a lovely little farmhouse in either Tanland or Greenland, complete with tractors, wells, haystacks, plenty of trees, supply crates, and what's that?
TWO NEW CHARACTERS? Why yes! After all, no Fury Farm Battleset is ever complete with a set of new characters to send into battle alongside your Green Guard and Tanzer Elite veterans!

- For the second detail of what this product is, you'll find the agreeable Sergeant “Shooty” Sean representing the Green Guard, a rather light-footed fellow who is well known for his proficiency with the submachine gun. A good chap for all the sticky, tough jobs, Sean is also quite a card-player and is known for enjoying any and all types of Green Tea. Get it? Green tea!
And for the Tanzer Elite we have the mysterious, gas-mask wearing Sergeant “Shadowy” Sylvia, one of the few Tanzer Elite soldiers who made it through the Battle of Tanky Meadows and the Retreat Through Popsy Pass with all of her bits intact! Quiet, evasive, and somewhat eerie, she is known to other Tanzer Elite troops as a bit of a lone wolf, yet commands great respect due to her distinguished military career. Oh, and despite the rumors circulating amongst the Tan forces, she is not Sergeant "Blast" Belle, who also survived both Tanky Meadows and Popsy Pass, has many of the same combat distinctions and honors, and also hails from Tanzington.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Roll Call
description:
The board for Roll Call is a 5x5 grid of dice combinations, some using four dice and some using five.

On a turn a player has three rolls of five dice to try to get a combination on any unowned space; if they manage this they claim such a space.

A player wins by claiming four squares in a row (in any direction) or any thirteen squares.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour d'Espagne – Vuelta
description:
La Vuelta is one of the main cycling races on the international calendar.
The third grand tour of the year.

This is the adaptation of the race to 10 stages Magnytour.

name: 1812: Eagles in the East
description:
1812: Eagles in the East is a game from the Eagles of France series. This module proposes to play all the major battles of the 1812 campaign and more. The full order of battle at different points of the campaign is included allowing players to play a lot of less known battles in following expansions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Zombillénium: Fear Factory
description:
Based on the eponymous comic series, this game makes you the team leader of a group of monster employees in a horror amusement park.

Each turn, choose judiciously to which ride you'll send your workers to scare the visitors most efficiently. If the fear markers on the ride, the visitor and your monster employee match, then you gain control over that ride for this round.

If you gain control over 3 rides in one and the same round, you win. If you've gained control over 13 rides over the course of the game, you win.

name: The Game of Korners
description: Players must complete as many boxes as possible by matching the four colored corners of the tiles immediately surrounding the box. The player who has the most tokens on the board when the grid is completed is the winner.

name: Bitwa o Włocławek 1920
description:
Bitwa o Włocławek 1920 focuses on the successful defense of the Polish city of Włocławek against the Bolshevik troops during the Polish-Soviet War (1919-1920).

Fought at the same time as the Battle of Warsaw it ended as a Polish victory and stopped the Soviet advance.

The game was designed for the 100'th anniversary of the battle and was released on the 14'th of August 1920.

It is a hex and counter wargame for two players. One of them will take control of the attacking Soviet troops, while the second one will be playing the Polish side, defending Włocławek at all cots.

name: Kram
description:
Tense and exciting word game.

1998 Mensa Select Winner

name: Current Assets: The Belfast Investment Game
description:
A monopoly-inspired board game showing off the businesses of the city of Belfast in Northern Ireland.

The goal is to be the last player not to go bankrupt.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: 5G
description:
A competitive, technological-style strategy game with worker placement at its core. Players take on the roles of corporate communication giants to obtain the greatest wealth. This is achieved by carrying out R&D as well as purchasing, producing, upgrading and implementing strategies which better serve the needs of 5G orders in different regions of the world.

Players use 'mouse' tokens which act as your workers to perform actions. Then produce and place 5G Stations, gaining resources, selecting 5G Order Cards, and finally launching projects based on actions taken earlier. The game ends when all players have completed 10 level 4 5G Orders, and the player with the most money wins!

name: Green Guardians
description:
Green Guardians is a strategic resource management game based on the scarcity, risk, and cost-benefit of natural resource use. Green Guardians is inspired by the precious natural world around us that is being irreparably altered through climate change and habitat destruction. The challenge for the Guardians is to find the balance of seeking prosperity without polluting the world beyond recovery.

Green Guardians is a strategic game for 2-4 players, recommended for ages 10 and up, and after a quick setup lasts 45-60 minutes. Players' choices drive the action and competition but random events provide an extra challenge.

Guardians explore the undiscovered world to gather resources. The resources can be used to build and upgrade to structures that provide additional resources and research. However their actions create waste that accumulates over time to form pollution that prevents the structures from working. In addition, the use of resources subjects the Guardians to disasters that slow down their progress. Guardians overcome these challenges by using their resources to research abilities and cleanup the pollution to keep their buildings productive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Investment, Modular Board, Prisoner's Dilemma, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Girts & Girders
description:
Roll & write game for two players in 30 minutes where you build railroad bridges. The players take turns in casting and selecting dice combinations by which they can either build new parts for bridges or create demand between cities looking to cross those bridges. The player that first finishes a given bridge gets the points for all traffic passing over it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, I Cut, You Choose, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Kabuki: A game of secret objectives
description:
In Kabuki, players try to accomplish secret objectives by playing, removing and rearranging different characters on the game board. Some of your opponents’ objectives may coincide with your own, while others will certainly work against you. Figure out your rival’s goals while keeping your own a secret long enough to win out.

While the game mechanics are simple to learn, Kabuki offers rich strategy and intense competition through a mix of subtlety, sabotage and misdirection.

—description from the publisher

name: Stock Market: The Game of the Century
description:
Self-published by Joseph E. Kochmar of East Mauch Chunk, Pennsylvania in 1937.

Board is similar in appearance to Monopoly, but with 1930s-era US companies as “properties”. Two colored areas in the middle identify “bull” or “bear” cards to be drawn.

name: Spatzen unterm Hut
description:
The players gets 12 tokens and place their hats according to the rules into the slots on the game board. Then the game board is rotated two steps.
The red player begins and points at a white hat on the game board and shouts: "Sparrow under the hat!" If this ist true, the owner of the hat has to pay 1 token into the cash box. If not, the active player has to pay 1 token to the hat owner. After this the game board is rotated one step and the white player gets his turn to accuse the black-white player to have sparrows under his hat.

If a player has lost all his tokens he is out of the game. The last player with any tokens left wins the game and the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

name: Honey Hunt
description:
Lead your bees in this race to get more honey than your opponent. Will you be the first to get 10 honey drops?

You will control two worker bees to collect the pollen and drop it into the honeycomb. Then, use your two drones to collect the honey and prevent other workers from crossing. Also, don't miss the queen: she can either help you or your opponent.

Honey Hunt is a game for two players where each player will try to reach first the honey to win the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: No-Go for Juniors
description:
The game board is a Mexican street track with a start and finish line and a 4x10 grid for a maximum of four players and a track length of 10 spaces. Players take turns shaking two custom dice in a dice cup.

If the dice spell GO, all players try to grab the dice showing a G. The player who grabs it first gets to move his car token one space forward. If the dice spell NO, the dice must not be touched. Any player who touched either dice backs up one car length.

The first player whose car token crosses the finish line is the winner.

name: Forest Adventure
description:
Forest Adventure is a new game what take you to new level of gaming.
The game has multiple difficulty levels, from child mode to strategic mode.

Two playing way!

1.Movement by Dice:

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.

If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.

Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.

2.Movements cards:

On strategic mode you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
This will give you connection between board game and card game with new oportunity of gameplay.


You went on a trip with friends. After setting up the camp, it turned out that on the way you lost a basket with provisions.
Additionally, one of the backpacks was torn and protective equipment against insects and other items helpful during the trip fell out of it.
You decide to find the lost basket with food in order to play by the camp fire in the evening.

The forest is full of surprises. You can stand face to face with a dangerous bear or meet poisonous snakes on your way.
However, not all obstacles are dangerous, be careful not to get distracted and get lost while listening to the beautiful voice of singing birds.
During the journey, you will also meet harmless animals, observing them and not disturbing them can help you find your way faster.
You will also have to cross dangerous canyons and swamps.

Some facts about the game, I think you should love it :

Game rules

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.
If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.
Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.
To complete the game, in the last move you need to roll as many stitches as you have left to the basket.

Difficulty level

With this game you can play on several difficult levels what make game more interested and tageted to everyone.
You can play with your yungest child 3+ or play with advanced players in strategic, coop or rivalry mode using standard dice or movement card.
The game can take 10 minutes on child mode or even couple hour on maximum difficulty level.

Normal level - Variant 1

In the basic variant of the game, the difficulty level is on the normal level - 5/10.

You play in classic style:
throw the dice -> move -> get the card if you stand on field with chest -> follow the instruction -> end turn

The length of the game oscillating about 15-30 minutes but depends on the player's luck and skill in throwing the dice, meetings with forest inhabitants and the collected equipment.

Some of example other level in game:

Child mode

Difficulty level - 1/10
This is the fastest game timeand can take 10 minute or less. This level is for everyone who want fast end or have children who can't sit on place more than 10 minute
The goal of the game is to reach the finish line as quickly as possible. You don't use any cards, all action spaces are neutral and nothing happens on them. The crossroads are also neutral, and you choose your own direction of travel. If your move ends in a space that has been occupied by another player, you occupy the next empty space.

Meeting mode

Difficulty level - 6/10
You win only when collect all animals you will meet - 15 animals - one card per each. You take adventure cards from the pile of cards only after you have finished moving on the field with the box.
But be careful, if you lose on action fields - ants, bees, swamp, rock pillar, suspension bridge and ponds, you lose all collected card.
When you end your move on basket with food, next turn you will begin on camp and lose all equipment cards and map card.
All your lost cards you need to return the bottom of the pile of cards.

Card mode - strategic

Difficulty level – 9/10
This mode offers the possibility of strategic thinking and planning, but the game time increases significantly, so it is recommended for players who like the highest level of difficulty in games.
In this mode, you play the base game.
During the game, you only use the dice when you encounter animals. In this mode, you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
At the beginning of the game, shuffle the movement cards and deal 5 cards to all players so that the other players cannot see them. Leave the rest of the cards on the pile.

During your turn, you may use one of your cards to move and reveal it to the players. However, if neither card meets your strategic plans, you choose the first move card in the pile, which ultimately determines your move.
Each used movement card is returned to the bottom of the movement deck.
After you have used all your movement cards, on the next turn, you take the first 5 cards from the pile and continue the game.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Action/Event, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Auntie Foodies
description:
Auntie Foodies is a fun game about local Singapore food with aunties combined. Compete against one another over a pot luck dinner setting and engage in a food combat! Use special cards to either benefit yourself or sabotage other players.

Players take their turn by contributing food on the play area and let other people consume it. But be careful, some players may sabotage you with the food that you taken. Special cards and condiments are there to make your stomach miserable so make sure to check before you take!

Players will have to consume a total of 20 points worth of food to win the game. If you go over, you exploded and lose the game.

—description from publisher

name: Color Addict Drinks
description:
Do bright colors make you dizzy? Here's the "Drinks" version of the fast-paced discard game Color Addict. Play your cards as fast as you can by matching drinks backgrounds, names, both, or vice versa.... There is no order, because everyone plays at the same time. So not only speed is needed, but also a good eye. With 10 different drinks, such as Mojito, Cuba Libre or Bloody Mary and motifs, the possibilities are almost endless. Ideal for the very late evening or the very early morning... or both! But beware. You want to have a good time, so don't drink too much or you'll get sick! Cheers!

—description from the publisher

name: The Cardistry Game
description: The Cardistry Game is a last man standing card game where players must perform cardistry in order to keep on playing. If you fail a cut, you lose cards from the deck you're performing with. If you don't have any more cards, you're out of the game. Last player at the table wins.

name: Melvin's Delivery Dash
description:
Melvin's Delivery Dash takes place in a large county with different areas within it. A city, lake, forest, beach, and residential neighborhoods.
There's an overabundance of packages being mailed out, but not enough people to deliver them on time. Your goal is to deliver more packages around the county than your opponents before time runs out.

When each player draws a Package card, the package size and color of the card determine where it has to be delivered. Players can move freely in almost any direction around the board as they head to the appropriate destination. When their package is delivered, they pull a new package and head to the next spot.
Landing on specially marked spaces gets you a delivery notice, which can help or hinder your progress, or of those around you.
Choosing the most efficient route, and deciding who to sabotage along the way with Delivery Notices, will influence who wins in the end.
mechanics: Action Timer, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Real-Time, Stock Holding, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Tin Pan Alley
description:
Shoot marbles at a tin target three feet away with targets ranging from 5 to 100 points. The player with the highest score wins.

Expert shooter: 500 or more points
Sharp shooter: 250 to 499 points
Marksman: 100 to 249 points

name: Burrow
description:
Burrow is a whole series of draw-free annihilation games based on the general concept of capture-templates. To begin a turn, a player takes one of his pieces and captures-via-replacement some enemy piece. Some aspect of the capture provides a template whereby the piece may perform further captures. The template can be the minimal bounding box containing the move, the directions used to achieve the capture, or even the number of friendly pieces in the line-of-sight. Burrow is meant to be a game system and the only presiding rules, aside from the objective of annihilation, are that the template informs all further captures, that the capturing piece must keep moving until it has no available capture according to its template and the mechanism of movement must allow unlimited translation in both dimensions of the board in making the initial capture. Also the game is played on an 8x8 board with a regular alternating pattern of pieces. I invite anyone to put on their designing caps and suggest their own Burrow games. Here are some of my own.

Note: as a general rule in these 4 Burrow games there is no jumping over pieces of any color. However in others jumping may be allowed.

Box Burrow: this is closest to the original. In Box Burrow the template is the minimal bounding box containing the capture with the capturing piece's initial position, and the initial piece to be captured being at opposite corners. Further conventions are that the capture is achieved by a number of orthogonal steps and the horizontal and vertical values of the bounding box cannot be interchanged. Further captures can be made, as long as for each, movement is entirely within a bounding box of equivalent dimension and as with the first capture the next piece to be captured is at its opposite corner.

Path Burrow: In Path Burrow the template is the exact orthogonal path the piece takes to make the first capture. Further conventions are that the path must only involve movement in no more than two directions, one horizontal and one vertical and that the path can be rotated or flipped in any orientation but its ends (initial and terminating) cannot be interchanged.

Sweep Burrow: By far the easiest of the variants so far, Sweep Burrow's template is simply the two orthogonal directions involved in making the initial capture. The only further convention here is that if the capture was made with just movement in one direction, you cannot employ a second direction.

Tumburrow: Tumburrow has the most distinctive template of these. The template is to count the number of friendly pieces (aside from the capturing piece itself) a queen's move away from the first capture. The other convention is that every capture must only involve movement in no more than two directions (orthogonal and diagonal) however these directions do not provide template data.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Space Infantry Above and Beyond
description:
In a time far from now, the 115th Space Infantry Company of the Empire’s Colonial Guards are under attack on colony world Tau 17 in the deep periphery. An alien race is known only as XX1120 has made planetfall and has begun consuming the colony’s population. Added to this, the forces of the Mercenaries have come to bury the 115th, blaming it on this new alien threat. Particle Beams flare and drop engines roar as each force plays for supremacy. Good luck!

Lock 'n Load Tactical Series now heads in the world of Science Fiction adding the Space Infantry Above and Beyond as an expansion game for Lock ’n Load Tactical and fought on fictional hexagon maps based on Tau 17. You will test your tactical acumen as the determined Space Infantry and Colonial Guard advisors of the Imperium, the ravenous hordes of the Flesh Eaters, or the brutal Mercenaries looking to take advantage of the chaos.

Space Infantry Above and Beyond introduces a number of new Support Weapon and Weapon Team variants to the Lock ‘n Load Tactical (LnLT) game system like the Motion Tracker, the special issue M-3 body armor, the M-40 Plasma Grenade, and a host of new vehicles and automated units. These rules will have an icon next to them and will operate in ways completely new to the LnLT system.

—description from the publisher

name: Big Monster: Promo Monster
description:
A promo monster tile distributed in 2018.

Grassland tile which can be used when the game is played in pair (2,4 or 6 players).

It gives 1 point for each rocky and desert tile of the player and its teammate.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: BoardBros, Explor8, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Opa! Games, Skellig Games

name: Wir helfen mit
description:
Educational twist on the game of Lotto. Up to 4 can play. Deal out the player boards. Each board is different and shows 12 images relating to helping around the house or working with parents and siblings.

The cards do not have matching images as in a regular Lotto game. These cards are shuffled, The top card is revealed by the parent who is 'running' the game.

Each player now checks their board to see if the named card can be used with any pictures on their board. Note that one image might relate to more than one use. For example; Woodwork Utensils could be matched with decorating the house, building a rabbit hutch or fence, and so on.

The first child to give a correct answer (in the opinion of the person in charge of the cards) is given the card to cover the picture related to their answer.

The first person to cover all the images on their card (or a preset number of images matched), wins.

The game was made in the DDR (East Germany).

name: Poker-Pool
description: The game is played by dealing each player a hand of cards from the playing cards deck. Each player shoots balls as in playing pool. The player may keep shooting if balls are being made, but creates penalties such as drawing cards for missing shots or making the cue ball. The winner is the first player to get rid of all the cards in his or her hand.

name: No Thumbs Allowed
description:
Players team up and take turns throwing the dice, moving their pawns around the board and completing various challenges without using their thumbs.
Challenges can include drawing a picture, folding a paper plane or molding an item from play dough, and must all be completed while the player wears a large plastic thumb over their real thumb.
The first player to complete exactly one circle around the board and land right on the "FINISH" space wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Game of Saskatoon
description: Its heritage moment in a blue box. Classic Saskatoon. The love child of Rich Uncle Pennybanks and a foreign manufacturer. An early ancestor of Monopoly knockoffs, if you lived, loved, or lounged in Saskatoon in the late 70's this game belongs on your shelf.

name: Holy Roller: Catholicism
description:
Holy Roller - Catholicism pits your chosen saint against the ever increasing hoards of evil washing across the earth. Cast your dice to power your saint with relics, holy water, and other objects to battle each wave. As the game progresses, the number of enemies swell so you and your team of valiant saints will have to work together to defeat the incoming hoards.

Holy Roller - Catholicism is a 1-4 player cooperative game that pits historical saints against a multitude of evil entities. Each player has a pool of dice to draft their attacks and players can find historical relics to help them on their journey. Each round increases the number of baddies based on a flood mechanic. Players will need to communicate well with each other to be able to halt the outbreak of evil.

—description from the publisher

name: Ages: The History of Mankind – Stone Age
description:
Ages: The History Of Mankind is tells the story of humanities struggles throughout the ages. Starting from the Stone Ages, players will be able to guide humanity's evolution from small tribes to thriving cities that shine as a beacon to the world. Compete with other nations for resources, technology, and conquests.

Ages: The History Of Mankind is a 1-4 player game where players build the world as they search for resources to feed their people, fund their technological growth, and prepare for war.
Each game players start with completely different goals for their tribes to accomplish and should be kept secret from the other players. Players then use their starting resources to plan out their year and grow their tribe.

Ages: The History of Mankind is a civilization builder that uses historically accurate modeling of the resources, technologies, and peoples so players can relive the excitement, mystery, and struggles humanity has faced. Stone Age is the first of many expansions that see humanity start as small tribes struggling to survive and grow into Iron Age dynasties!

Players will use their meeple scouts to find new lands (hex tiles), gather resources from the lands they occupy, and establish new colonies out in the expanding world. Colonies can grow in power through technology and send out more scouts into the wild to claim even more land and grow into a dynasty! Colonies can also produce warriors to conquer foes in distant lands. The explored land plays an integral role in travel of your meeples, resources available to grow your colony, and provides different resources depending on the season.

As players progress through the years, they will need to plan their harvests, manage the consumption of resources by their citizens, and dedicate resources for learning new technology. Each season brings new possibilities and new ways for you to conquer your opponents!

name: Remi & Catene
description:
Remi & Catene, Oars & Chains is a realistic simulation of a naval battle between galleys.

2 beautiful ships collide in the sea.
Players will have to maneuver skillfully to get into the best shooting position and then open fire with their cannons.
The damage to the rowers, the hull, the guns and the soldiers will be marked on a special sheet.

But beware, the clash doesn't just happen from a distance .
An essential phase of the fight is also ramming and boarding.

–description from the publisher
categories: Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Va a Lavurà
description:
Va a lavurà is the most Varese board game there is!

You will have to walk the streets of the city and the villages of the province buying property and managing your assets, bargaining hard with your opponents to become the richest in the land of lakes.
The game is simple and engaging, fun for adults and children and represents an original journey to rediscover all the landscape, gastronomic and cultural aspects of the province of Varese.

With this board game, you will travel through the places of the Varese area from the comfort of your living room and you will be able to make the city and villages of the Varese province more beautiful, rich and full of attractions.
The "Balabiott" and "Barlafüs" cards contain dynamics that every inhabitant of Varese knows well: popular expressions, idioms, peculiar characteristics of each place, for an exciting discovery of this fascinating area.

Test your business and bargaining skills by amassing as much money, land and assets as possible to become richer than your opponents and win.

– Translated description from publisher

name: Fighting Iron: Naval Wargame Rules for the Ironclad and Pre-Dreadnought Eras
description:
Fighting Iron is a set of wargame rules for recreating naval battles during the era of Ironclads and Pre-Dreadnought battleships covering the time period of 1860 (the launch of the first ironclad) to 1906 (the launch of the first modern big gun, steam turbine driven battleships, HMS Dreadnought) including the American Civil War.

The rules can be used with various miniature scales ranging from 1/600 to 1/3000.
Rules are included for command and control, manoeuvering in squadrons, sailing and steam vessels, gunnery, ramming, damage and morale.

Ship data for 10 navies covering the approximate period of 1860 to 1900 is also included with the rules.

More is planned to become available for free download from the Rory Crabb games website or Facebook Group.

-description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de France
description:
The queen event of cycling competition: The Tour.

Who doesn't dream of winning it one day!

Playing profile adapted to the Tour de France

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour d'Italie – Giro
description:
The Giro (Tour of Italy) is one of the 3 big tours of the year with a course that is always very attractive.

Adaptation to 9 or 10 Magnytour stages

name: Magnytour Profil: Dauphiné libéré
description:
Prepare for the Tour de France with the Dauphiné libéré race.

Beautiful preparation test in 4 stages including two in the mountains.

Short stages of 170, 180, 140 and 150 km.

name: Magnytour Profil: Binck Bank Tour
description:
Of course, there are no mountains, but the Flemish and cobbled mountains which are so dangerous in this 3 stage event.

Very nice race in the Benelux of 120, 170 and 190 km.
The first of these is difficult and very short.
Also pay attention to the third stage full of pitfalls because of the cobblestones.

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Californie
description:
Take a big leap across the Atlantic to Uncle Sam's country to run this Tour.

It has 7 stages including a 24 km time trial.
The others being 170, 150, 190, 160 and 2 of 140 km.

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour d'Angleterre
description:
This tour of Great Britain in 8 stages gives the Sprinter drivers the opportunity to have a blast.

Apart from the first 200 km stage, the others are shorter (160/170 km) interspersed with an ultra-flat time trial for the sprinters.

name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Lombardie
description:
One of the monuments of cycling with the Italian classic.

Another profile of a classic looking like a mountain stage.

name: Walt Disney's Spin und Marty
description:
The players take part in a rodeo. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 50 to win the game. Movement is determined by a die.On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The players have to stop at spaces 10, 20, 30 and 40 to do rodeo chores by rolling specific results.

The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der lustige Michel
description:
The players have to get from space 1 to space 45. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on a space with a red number, he gains 2 coins but on a black number he has to pay 1 coin into the cash box. On space 40 the player wins half the content of the cash box.

The first player to exactly reach space 45 wins the game and the content of the cash box. If a player rolls more than he need to reach space 45, he has lost and is out of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wir halten fest!
description:
The swiss army defends her county with the help of italian and french allies against german and austrian invaders. In a second scenario the swiss army allies with german and austrian troops against french and italian invaders. The swiss army (red) and the allies (green and violett) consist of one unit (meeple) each, while the invaders consist of five units (black meeples).

The swiss army may move up to three spaces in any direction per turn, whereas the allies and the invaders may only move one space. Enemy units are taken by jumping over them.

The Invaders win, if they get one unit to one of two possible destinations. The defenders win, if they manage to avert this.

name: Steel Rain
description:
Steel Rain is a free set of generic wargaming rules for sci-fi armor battles. Specifically written these for use with 1/285, 1/300, and 6mm miniatures (these terms are basically synonymous), such as GHQ’s excellent line of Micro Armor miniatures, Brigade Models’ line of Iron Cow miniatures, or Ground Zero Games’ Dirtside/Future Wars models.

These rules are basic, covering most aspects of warfare encountered in company-level engagements. Designed to support company to battalion/task force sized engagements.

Also includes a set of vehicle creation rules that are pretty straight forward.

Envisioned using on a terrain table, not a hex map. That’s why all values are given in centimeters instead of hexes. If you want to increase the scale, use inches; the values will still translate. Or, you can use a hex map and just translate all values into hexes. It’s flexible.

summary from publisher's website

name: Absolute Zero
description: The objective of the game is to combine positive and negative numbered cards to create a value of zero. Includes directions for 3 additional games that can be played.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Hunch
description: A guessing game with a side of math. Kids will have fun while improving their understanding of integers.

name: Catch a Dragon by the Tail
description:
Catch a Dragon by the Tail is a super-simple free print and play game. It's press-your-luck dice game for two to four players with a "hatching dragons" fantasy theme.

At the start of your turn you roll four custom six-sided dice (or standard dice that you cross-reference with a table), then choose to gather identical dice or different dice. After you do, you can stop rolling and score or you can roll the dice you haven't collected.

Homogenous sets of dice score the best: two dice score four points, three score nine, four score 16. Consecutive dice score second-best, with a run of two scoring four, three scoring six, and four scoring eight. "Loner" dice score one point each.

If you choose to roll again, what you roll may make you end your turn and score nothing.
• If you're collecting identical dice and you don't get at least one result that matches what you're collecting, your turn ends and you score nothing.
• If you're collecting different dice and at least one result matches a die you already have, your turn ends and you score nothing.
...Otherwise, you may collect one or more valid dice and choose to stop and score or roll the un-collected dice yet again.

The game ends after four rounds. The highest score wins. Break ties with an additional round of play.

-description from designer

name: DKT: Stadt Graz Wirtschaft
description:
DKT, "Das kaufämnnische Talent", is the Austrian equivalent of Monopoly.

This version is about the city of Graz.

Buy local businesses and be the player with the most money at end of game to win !
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Thrive
description:
Thrive is an educational board game about health. The aim of the game is to reach your own goals by good choices. The winner is the first person to have sufficient cash to pay for their fourth goal. Each player takes a goal pad and writes four goals, ranging from short to long term, in the spaces. Short term goals are worth $50,000 long term goals are worth $1,000,000. The first player to $1,000,000 wins the game.

The game board resembles a square monopoly-style board with players moving their tokens on the outer track. A player is chosen as the banker for issuing starting money, collecting fines, etc. Players keep track of their points and earns money as they go around the track. Whenever a goal is paid in full, the score peg returns to zero and the player works towards another goal.
mechanics: Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Augenmaß
description:
Augenmaß is a stacking game that consists of cones and boards. Players take turns placing cones on an A4-sized surface. Optionally, and before placing a cone, they can try to place a board on the tops of three cones. A successfully placed board gets a reward of coins - the higher the level, the higher the reward. If a player fails to place the board because it's not stable enough, they have to pay a penalty.
The game continues until no more boards can be placed. The player with the most coins is the winner.

name: Battle Dragon
description:
Battle Dragon is a print & play, turn-based card game designed to utilize the complete Dragon Stone set. Each player takes a turn by discarding a card to roll dice and then playing a card to build their dragon. The first player who can command a dragon to attack wins the game. Each game includes 17 print-and-play cards and ten dice with five colors for one player. The game supports two or more players.

However, there is a ready to play version for two player set.

The print & play version is compatible with a full dice set of AKO Dice III which was funded on Kickstarter in Jan 2021.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Ladybugs Do Math
description:
Ladybugs Do Math is a Mathematical Board Game.

In a garden full of ladybugs, use the spots on their backs to solve math equations. Add, subtract, multiply or divide the two numbers to form solutions to equations.

Two different games included. For up to six players, 6+.

LASERCUT COMPONENTS:
• 54 ladybug math cards
• 41 interlocking numbered “answer” tiles (1-81)
• 16 interlocking “pathway” tiles
• four “corner” tiles
• four lady bugs
• 60 flowers with points 1-3
• five bird cards
• two spiders
• pair of dice
• two equation “cheat” sheets.

OVERVIEW:
• Build garden pathways
• Spot answers to simple equations
• Move your ladybug to the answer
• Collect a flower
• Avoid the spider
• Win with the most flower points.

TWO MODES:
• Using Cards: with equation answers up to 81
• Die Rolls: Simpler game with numbers up to 36.

FULL SETUP (WITH CARDS):
1. Set the corner tiles aside briefly
2. Shuffle the interlocking pathway and answer tiles
3. Takes turns connecting tiles to build the board game configured into pathways through a garden
4. Distribute and connect the corner tiles, generally at the end of pathways
5. Give each player their ladybug
6. Each player places their ladybug on a corner tile
7. Shuffle the ladybug math and bird cards together
8. Place the cards face down in a draw pile
9. Distribute the flowers on top of the numbered tiles (some will get two flowers)
10. Place the spiders on any two blank pathway tiles.
 
FULL GAME PLAY:
The game is played in rounds with players taking turns being the “current” player.
At the start of a round, the current player will flip over the next ladybugs card. If a bird appears, each player removes their highest scoring flower then flips another card. Starting with the current player and continuing clockwise, each player will:
• Determine which equations can be formed from the two numbers on the ladybugs
• See where the equation answers are on the board
• Call out the answer they will use
• Move their ladybug towards that answer, not exceeding five spaces
• Collect a (highest-valued) flower if their ladybug lands on their answer number
• Optionally, move one spider forward to the next unoccupied location

At the end of the round, each spider is moved one space in the direction they are pointing. The next clockwise player becomes the current player.

ENDING THE GAME:
The game is over when there are no more flowers on the pathways to collect. Players add up all the points on the flowers they collected. The player with the most points wins. If there is a tie, the youngest player wins.

The simpler game uses a pair of dice to form equations. Game play is similar to above.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Tamagotchi: Das Kartenspiel
description: The game board has a round indicator (1-8) and a score indicator (-240 to + 240). Players each place a token at the center of the 4x17 score indicator. A token is placed on the round indicator. Each player receives five cards. Players then take turns playing cards from their hand and moving their tokens to the right (positive) or to the left (negative). After eight rounds, the game ends. The winner is the one whose scale value is furthest to the right.

name: Royal Court
description:
Royal Court is a two player game using a standard deck of poker cards with the jokers, two 6-sided dice, and 9 Favor tokens of some sort.  To set up the game, separate the face cards from the Jokers and ace through ten cards.  Then the face cards are shuffled and dealt into a 3 by 4 grid, that will make up the Royal Court, which the players will navigate using their respective player die.  The ace through ten cards are split into their four suits, and then each player takes one suit of each color for their draw deck.  After this, they shuffle their decks and draw a hand of five, and then determine where to place their Jokers.  They must place it one side of the Royal Court, next to two cards within the court, but both players are not allowed to place their’s on the same side. They finally place their player die on their Joker, with the one pip face up.  These two players take on the role of a jester who is attempting to win over the Royal court.  They will do this by playing quips on the Kings, charming the Queens to gain their favor, and utilize the Jacks of the trade to manipulate their opponents.

There are specific movement rules for each card in the Royal Court, and the Jokers. which you can simply move to either adjacent card.  Jokers are set by each player at the start, adjacent to two cards within the Royal Court, so moving from a Joker means you have two options.  From the Kings, the players can move to any adjacent card to that King, meaning it has a number of possibilities, depending on where that King lies. From a Queen, a player may move anywhere within that Queens row, which gives players three options. Moving from a Jack, players must remain in that Jack’s column.

Once a player has moved to a new card, they initiate a Jest, except when moving back to a Joker.  When a Jest takes place, each player must play a a card matching the color of the In addition to each face card having a different movement rule, they also have their own Winning Jest Scores, and Win Results. Unless the players happen to be on the same card, only the initiator (the one who moved onto the new card), may gain the Win Result for that Jest.  When moving to a King, the player who plays the highest car, wins. The initiator may gain one Quip Point for winning.  If a player moves to a Queen, the lowest card wins, and the initiator may gain a Favor Token for winning.  Finally, on a Jack, the initiating player decides whether high of low will win, before the players play their cards.  When the initiator wins on a Jack, they may take away a point of their choosing, either a Favor Token or Quip Point. If there are none to take, the initiating player gains a Favor Token instead.  The end game trigger is when a player reaches six quip points, which is indicated by them turning their die with the six pip face up. The players will then compare scores, and whoever has the most points, Quip points and Favor points, wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Glymmore
description:
Glymmore is an 18 card game for 2-3 players. Each player has a field comprising cards that have different colours and numbers on each side. Each card's value depends on the colour and number at the top. On your turn you have three actions which you can use to rotate cards and change their value and colour.

Once everyone has had one turn, the top card is revealed, which has an event to change the game. Then, whoever has the most points from their field with a matching colour wins the card. Players have to plan their cards strategically to win more jewels each round.

When there are no more cards left, players group their cards based on their colour. Each player counts up their points. Players gain extra points based on the number of cards in each group and for having the same type of jewels in one group. Who ever has the most points at the end wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, End Game Bonuses, Take That

name: WitchPig: The Midderlands Card Game
description:
Designed as a fictitious, card-based, gambling game in the roleplaying setting for The Midderlands.
—description from the publisher

WitchPig is a card game implementation of the eponymous "fictional" card game from the fantastical setting of The Midderlands. The cards bear standard suit and number markings but also have graphic elements to support the WitchPig game. The pack comes with several insert instruction cards detailing WitchPig game play. The cards are intended as a standalone card game, but also can be used as a "prop" in any roleplaying game played in The Midderlands. Too, the cards have been adapted for use in a roleplaying game - see WitchPig Deck of Many Things.
—User summary
mechanics: Open Drafting, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus
description:
Welcome in interplanetary reality show Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus! As an artifical being called Animatron your task is simple: survive in crazy doctor Morbid Bolíto’s labyrinth full of dangerous traps and savage monsters.

Goal of the game is to successfully solve the Quests you will face in the labyrinth and get the fame and popularity among the millions of fans of the Cyborg Mutant Zombie Circus arena. To achieve this you can leverage the plenty of upgrades also occuring in the labyrinth: biological implants, huge arsenal of lethal weapons and crazy Voodoo rituals.

The first player with sufficient popularity will be freed from the labyrinth and will be proclamated as a human able to vote and obligated to pay the taxes. And everybody wants that!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Race, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Gangsterburg
description:
The city of Gangsterburg was always the home of myriads of criminals and outcasts. Newly elected City Council knows the final solution! General amnesty and privatization of all city enterprises brings challenges for all mafia mob bosses to exploit the prey.

As a head of one of the families your task is to get more influence than any others and take control of the whole Gangsterburg!

In this Monopoly-like game you can buy the degustation companies (pubs), financial advisories (casinos), public services (brothels) and centres of experience (illegal drugs) and corrupt the police, judges and politicians.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Impulse Movement, Ownership, Pattern Building, Race, Relative Movement

name: Mes Premières Énigmes Animaux
description:
Guess who is hiding behind the illustrated clues!
Three amusing illustratiins are shown to all the players. Water drops, a shell, antennae... it’s a snail!
A pasture, some wool, a shepherd...

Which child will be the first to guess that it’s a sheep?
